review_body: The staff and location of The James is fantastic! But the room quality has seemed to decline. Our dead bolt was almost busted off the door, the blowdryer was a fire hazard, no bottle opener provided in mini-bar, dry cleaning tag and staples sticking out of comforter....not that any of these were major, but it all starts to add up! The food situation is also dire. The restaurant AND the Jimmy were BOTH closed down. Room service was bodega quality. Hope they can turn this property around to its former glory!

We spent a weekend at The James. Short walking distance to the best stores and restaurants, and not far from Brooklyn Bridge and One World Trade Center. Very service minded staff - Manny & co. Great weekend

Found the staff non caring , the reception desk was not informative of the $40 per day charge The rooms were poorly cleaned , the staff at the front doors (valet ) did not even offer to put our luggage’s in the car,just barely opened the door . Will not stay again

We stayed I winter time but lot of the hotel amenities were closed and the hotel still charged us the full facility fee. If I had stayed in the summer time I would have more than happy to pay the fee.
user_name:
goon611
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location, but the guest rooms are aging badly. Unpatched holes in the walls, non-functional drawers in nightstand, limescale all over the shower, etc. The walls are also thin and you can hear everything in the hallways but that’s pretty normal in nyc.

The room was comfortable, but not super clean. There were hairs all over the bathroom, and someone had written their name on the mirror, which was not appropriately cleaned (since it was still there). Staff was stellar at the desk. They text and make sure things are going well with your room. There is a happy hour (wine & cheese- free) from 6-7pm. We wandered down thinking it started an hour earlier, and the nice gentleman at the desk grabbed us glasses of wine anyway. Selection for this happy hour is Keebler similar crackers and one cheese. Wine is decent, and it’s nice that they do this despite the food selection. Good location in SoHo.

I was in NY feb 5-7 on a business trip , actually in Manhattan and did get my return flight cancelled from LaGuardia and stayed an additional night . I booked this appealing and modern style hotel and was very satisfied by how I was hosted (although the flight mishaps) , greeted with early room access and did get a very high level services at all levels . First at the concierge and then with the reception , staff communicated with me on the short stay attending to all my needs .Room was clean so was bathroom , I would recommend this hotel in Soho , lower Manhattan ...nice environment for walks , boutiques and restaurants . Less crowded and noisy than Times Square !

Nice room. Bed and bathroom very good. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Too bad we were not able to enjoy the rooftop bar for the view because of 5 month renovations which we found out on our day of arrival. A huge disappointment because it was a big reason we chose this particular hotel. We visited with a bigger group and had planned on closing the day together in the bar. This should have been mentioned during booking already because it might changed our choice. Too bad because it ruined the joy of our stay while everything else was very nice.
user_name:
Road248642
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at the hotel for one night in the Penthouse Suite. We had a few problems with the suite but the management was responsive and made it all right. The managers Alex and Mr. Roman were very cordial and helpful. The hotel is now being renovated so I imagine the problems we encountered will no longer be an issue. It's a great place for a summer getaway right in NYC.

Great Bell service, great staff and reception area,convenient location and pricing.I was traveling for leisure and business, this was my third time staying at this Hotel.They honored the AMEX amenities and services.

I came to The James hotel for a short NYC work trip. I was warmly welcomed and got a lovely room. The beds are comfortable and I had a nice view...but the best part was how accommodating everyone was...Kenny, in particular -- he helped me charge my phone and guided me to some great local spots I really enjoyed! One of the best stays I have had in a while, THANK YOU!

I was very impressed with the hotel overall. The room I had was a good size and had everything I needed to make my stay comfortable. There was a well stocked mini bar and a daily credit.The bathroom was a large walk in rain shower (no bath). I was very happy with this. There were plenty of towels and bath robes available.The bed was very comfortable.The staff were attentive and happy to offer help and advice.I did not eat in the hotel but there was 24hr room service and paid breakfast in room dinning options. There was daily scones and coffee available in the mornings.I would stay in the hotel again,

This hotel was great! Super clean, comfy bed, awesome staff, and a cool (chill) club on top floor. The lobby coffee and scones in the am, and wine and cheese in the late afternoon, were great to start and end the day with. Will def stay here again...might be my new NYC fav.

Close to shops. Hotel staff was super helpful with restaurant reservations and recommendations. Gorgeous lobby area with lots of bright sunlight and great views of city. Nice touch that they offer cookies and wine at night, scones and coffee in the am.

I have stayed at a few hotels in this area, and the James is one of the top on my list. The staff is extremely hospitable and friendly, and rooms are spacious and comfortable. Certainly a pleasant experience.

My Husband & I travel to New York several times a year & love coming back to The James Soho. The staff are the best of the best, extremely pleasant & accommodating. We love the well designed rooms & decor, cozy beds & crisp linens. Whether you are relaxing in your room, chilling in the 2nd level lobby lounge with morning coffee, or having a happy hour cocktail at the roof top bar, you can count on amazing views of the skyline & bustling streets below. Not to mention the location in Soho is where you want to be... great shopping & restaurants within walking distance.

Love waking up to the floor to ceiling view of Manhattan and the Freedom tower skyline. Bathrooms and rooms are very well designed. Lots of space for clothing and storage as well as well designed amenities, plugs everywhere.

we were surprised how little the staff tried to make our stay special even though it was new year's eve. At other hotels in NYC where we have stayed in past years they even left us a bottle of champagne for NYE for half the price room rate we paid here. We also asked if we would be able to see the fire works with the kids and we were told yes at time of reservation but then when we arrived we were told we could not even access the roof. And no we could not see the fire works from the room either as we had been told by the front desk when we checked in.

This hotel is marketed as a luxury hotel, but spend your money somewhere else that is actually luxury. The rooms are nice and the location is great but for the price that includes a sneaky 45$ "service charge", and ironically we were disappointed in the service. The service charge has "perks" that we found to be not worth it (wine and cheese for one hour which was cheap wine, cut up cheddar, and crackers as an example). The room service is overpriced as room service often is but then on top of that there is gratuity and a $10 service fee built it, making it around $32 for a BLT. If we are paying a $45 a night service charge, why do we need to pay yet more money just to actually get service in the hotel? On top of that, when the time came when we actually needed service as an incident at the hotel caused damage to our belongings, no one apologized or tried to make the situation better, only doing the bare minimum when we asked for help. I had to throw out some of my belongings and actually lost money as a result of their poor service. We followed up via e-mail and we still have not gotten a response more than a week later. Where is this service charge coming in hand now? Also the bed was uncomfortable and the room was loud. The glass windows, location, and shower were very nice and the most redeeming quality but also comparable to other places we have stayed in NYC.Bottom line, if you want luxury you won't get it from here despite paying luxury prices, and their whole concept of "service" can create a bad vibe for your NYC vacation.

I lived in NYC for 46 years and when I go back to visit friends, I choose The James for the location, well appointed & bright rooms with awesome views (hard to find in NYC) and the service.Kenny, one of the doormen, went above and beyond in every way to take care of me. One more reason I’ll be back on my next visit!
user_name:
Djeff1321
New York City, New York

review_body: Cosy hotel on nice location.Close to metrolines and many nice shops and restaurants in the neighbourhood.Excellent service and relaxed atmosphere with serviced lounge and a magnificent rooftopbar at the top.

While I do acknowledge that this is a boutique hotel, its levels of service and comfort can be improved, as it may not offer the best value for money. To begin, my online reservation, although confirmed on the website, was not found upon check-in. The receptionist was kind enough to help and sort things out, and luckily a room similar to what I reserved was available for the 7 days we were to spend in New York. The room, although advertised as a corner studio, implying some form of spaciousness, was surprisingly small, measuring at around 300 square feet. While the view from the room was pleasing, and the presence of floor-to-ceiling windows helped, the room still felt cramped, especially with two suitcases around. The hotel's day-to-day housekeeping was carried out without a hitch, however any other services beyond that were frustrating. Orders for water bottles and in-room dining took long to be brought up, sometimes requiring more than one follow-up call. Not to mention the very limited in-room dining options, which disappear after 11 PM, requiring you to order food from outside. As for the available amenities, there aren't many. The hotel lobby is relatively small, with a few couches, at which you can have complimentary thermos coffee in a paper cup and scones in the morning, and complimentary bottled wine, saltine crackers, and one kind of cheese in the evening - which feels somewhat cheap. The only redeeming factor for The James SOHO is its amazing location, which puts you at walking distance from most interesting attractions in lower Manhattan, the east village and west village, in addition to its vibrant rooftop lounge.

From Alex's very friendly response upon our arrival to our final checkout, the staff was exceptionally friendly and accommodating. Our room was ready well in advance of customary check in and we were given a room on a higher level. The James is a modest sized boutique hotel with clean lines, great natural light and a convenient location one block from the Canal Street subway entrance. While on the edge of Soho, it feels entirely connected. Like many hotels, its fitness room (a priority for us as frequent travelers is modest, but adequate); its primary restaurant (which we used once for breakfast) is fine, if not exceptional (we were there during winter, so were unable to take advantage of what appear to be terrific outdoor terrace spaces). The top floor bar has excellent views and is fun spot for a late night cocktail. We would return for a second visit and have stayed in many hotels in NYC.

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Received complimentary coffee and scones every morning, as well as wine in the evenings. Great location, walking distance from Chinatown.Michael at reception was of great service.
user_name:
jange0rgev
New York City, New York

review_body: Fabulous stay, excellent service from Paul who always went out of his way to help whenever he could, super comfortable bed and fun bar on the rooftop, excellent location for SoHo’s restaurants, bars & shopping

Spending the holidays in NYC is always a great getaway! Staying in SoHo for boutique shopping and great meals was a perfect decision. So was the selection of James SoHo this year! We will definitively return to the James SoHo.

great location with lovely amenities. modern decor with awesome window views. Daily coffee and scones downstairs. wine in evenings. excellent rooftop bar. gym and plunge pool. genuine staff that was always helpful.

Very welcoming staff. A bit of a hurdle to get from dropping off a car (parked in a garage several blocks away), to the above street level front desk. Rooms were clean, New York-typical small. No coffee in rooms. The proximity to the Holland tunnel is what directed us here. It was fine, but we’d likely not stay here again.

We thoroughly enjoyed our 7 day Xmas stay at the James. Our son lives in Manhattan and we’ve stayed in numerous hotels. Hands down James takes it. Wonderful staff, great location! We’ll be back again!!

I ended up catching a bad cold while I was in NY. The hotel staff was highly accommodating, especially LADY who was really great and really helpful with everything! What a nice hotel and what a great staff you have! Highly recommended - especially if you're sick!

Enjoyed the hotel staff friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful and the beds were very comfortable. Would recommend this to friends and family. The staff explained the subway system and helped us be able to take less cabs.

It has become a tradition in my family to stay 1 night in NYC on our way to see family for the Holidays. This year we wanted a view of the Freedom Tower. This hotel not only has the best views, it’s staff is truly world class. From the time we arrived Kenny made us feel like we were VIP’s. With great food and entertainment right at your fingertips to the high end rooms with heated bathroom floors and modern amenities this hotel has so much to offer. With out any exception though Kenny is something no other hotel can offer.

The moment we arrived we knew it would be a great visit. Upon arriving to The James we were greatest by Kris and Yami and there bright smiles. They were very welcoming and immediately made us feel welcome. Upon checking in- they wanted to make sure our visit was memorable and upgraded our room and greeted us with complimentary wine. This was by far one of the warmest and most welcoming greetings to a hotel I have experienced for as much as we travel.Thank you Kris and Yami for the great experience.

I recently stayed here on a business trip and found the hotel to be wonderful. It was clean and the staff was super friendly and helpful. The rooms weren't huge but fine and great for working from the room. The restaurant Gitano was great. Overall would definitely recommend this property.

Love it there! Only wish they had Netflix on the tv. Friendliest staff in all of NYC!! The room was always clean. Wonderful part of soho. Very accessible to all the great shopping and subway! We always recommend the james to our friends!!

Stayed for two nights for work. Staff are friendly and helpful. Room is spacious and nicely fitted out with a comfortable bed, well specced bathroom and a great shower. Gym is well equipped. Breakfast is great . All I need for a great stay. Thank you again to the team at James Hotel.

I had a trouble booking through a website and I showed up to the reception with no reservations!! I explained my situation and Yuoh and Leidy were very helpful trying to find me a good room in a peak time during the year “Christmas”.Yuoh walked me to the elevator and helped me with my bags and shakes my hands, Leidy cheered me with a nice welcoming smile. My first impression was excellent, and the room is spectacular.Thank you so much!

Staff is very helpful, but this hotel is under new management and it shows. Walls are peeling (look at the ceiling). Stains on bed linen. Location is the best, but the rooms and quality need attention. It's sad this used to be my favorite hotel in NYC. I used to only stay here. Nice coffee shop across the street. I started staying elsewhere.

Booked The James for my wife's birthday and planned a great NYC weekend. Upon arrival I was extremely disappointed in the size of the room . I booked a corner king in hopes of having more space but it was small and the only place to sit was a bench against a window, a wirey chair and the bed. To kick of the weekend festivities we headed to the bar Jimmy on the 17th floor only to find out it was closed for a private party (wait, shouldn't paying guests of the hotel have access to the only bar? Closed by outsiders?) headed to the attached restaurant for plan B only to find it too was closed for a private party. it was raining like mad and our only option was to slog down the street to Il Mulino for a drink (where they were incredibly friendly and welcoming!). When we got back to the hotel after dinner looking for an after dinner drink , everything was still closed for a private party. I complained to management and they brought a container of cranberry juice and some limes. I tried to order drinks for in room delivery but apparently they only have beer and wine. Big disappointment all around--not a cheap room--over $850 per night. I know it's NYC in December but I expected better service and acknowledgment that this was so not cool--I'm fairly certain we were not the only truly disappointed guests.

We arrived at JFK very early on a Saturday morning and headed straight to the hotel. We were several hours early for check-in, but the night manager Shefi was more than accommodating. He took our bags and stored them for us, so we could relax in the warm lobby on a couch. He offered us scones and coffee as we relaxed for a while, we were exhausted from the previous days travels. Another associate named Kenny was just awesome. He recommended several places we could eat breakfast that morning and for the rest of our trip. He gave a variety of recommendations and they were all great. Many places didn't open up for an hour or longer, but he suggested we went downstairs to a local deli that serves food 24 hours a day. In fact, he walked us downstairs, out of the hotel, and into the deli. He introduced us to the staff and said once our food was ready, to come back into the hotel and enjoy it there. The food was solid, service was great, both guys were very nice. Shefi was able to get us our room hours before we had expected. It made the trip for us, couldn't imagine if we weren't able to get that power nap in, could've made for an exhausting Saturday. Kenny was generous enough to gift us a couple of drink coupons to the rooftop bar, we used them the following evening. The room was clean, had a lovely view, and everything we could've asked or. It was a great stay overall and would highly recommend it. Thank you to the whole staff!

Currently staying at the James Soho. There are a few issues that I believe other readers need to be aware of. Overall the hotel is very well located but I don’t think this is reasonable to call it a 5 stars hotel. 1. When I checked in there was some chips on the floor. I appreciate that the cleaning ladies can do mistakes but this was very surprising and unpleasant. The room looks quite old. The bathroom seemed clean though. I am staying on the 16th floor so used stairs to go to the gym on the 17th - but the stairs are extreely dirty, with some fruits and insects. This was disgusting 2. I suffered from strong headache (not the hotel fault unfortunately) and the permanent noise during the day, in the corridor was just too much. I called the reception several times but nothing happened. For people looking for some rest or needing to sleep during the day because of the jet lag - just look for another place. I was very enthusiastic in trying this hotel but this came as very unpleasant experience. Too dirty and too noisy.

I took my wife to NYC for her first visit, and decided to stay at the James. When booking, I mentioned to Kris it was my wife’s first time to the city. When we arrived, there was a complimentary bottle of champagne and fruit and cheese tray awaiting us. The room was clean and had a typical downtown feel. At night, drinks at on the rooftop bar while looking at the skyline was a perfect end to each day. We will definitely be staying here again when visiting NYC.

Service needs to improve. This hotel is too expensive compare to the level of service provided.I will not go back until it improves.Rooms are great.Lobby is not as great as what you can expect of such a hotel.

Bobby brought us fresh baked cookies right to our room!! They were delicious. Michael was very informative when we checked in. He told us all about the James Club!! Everyone was very friendly & nice!!

The james Soho was recommended to me by a colleague about 5 years ago. I visit NYC about twice a year and since my first stay I have stayed at the James Soho. I found the staff to be very helpful and pleasant. Always accommodating when I had requests and went out of their way to make my stay happy. In fact as a regular customer they in the past recognized that and always would give upgrades to show I was appreciated. This trip the front desk staff put me in a terrible room with no view. I told the young lady I am a regular customer and always get a room with a city view. She made no attempt to accommodate my request. I had to change hotel rooms three times because the room was unsatisfactory. I eventually settled for a room with a city view but the locking mechanism because broken. The room was not cleaned properly. I was not satisfied with my stay at all and have always recommended the James Soho to friends and colleagues. I am not certain I would do the same now

I stayed here 8 years ago. The hotel seems to have lost a little polish since then, but the location is still fantastic and the staff was very helpful. My first visit I stayed on the 15th floor so we had an amazing view west over the Hudson. This time we were on the fourth floor, so no real view. That was a little disappointing, but bound to happen. Overall it was a good experience, it just seems a bit pricey now for what is offered, but to be fair, I haven't stayed at any other $400+ hotels in NYC recently. The location with the Canal Street ACE stop right on the same block as the hotel can't be beat.

First time at the James Soho and we had a wonderful trip. The James is in a great downtown location with easy access to all of Manhattan-and Brooklyn. The James has a great vibe. Hip and lovely but not too cool. Service was great and always friendly and helpful. A special thanks to Bobby and Mike at the desk for their excellent service and great recommendations. Be sure to spend some time in the rooftop bar for beautiful views of the city. Loved it! We’ll be back. Thank you!

Good Location. Medium QualityFirst night I had a corner room. Not properly cleaned. Then i moved to a normal queen room. Higher floor with a nice view. Better cleaned but the bed sheets were stained. Nothing you would expect from a 5stars hotel. I had even a problem with the heating system. I hope next time to be luckier.

Went to New for the weekend w/ another couple stayed at The James SoHo, checked in on Friday afternoon. Young man at the lobby desk was very nice offered 2 locations to eat soup dumplings. Went to one of them and had a nice time, lots of good food/ appetizers. Our rooms were nice, clean, close to the elevator. Expected lots of noise but not to bad. The fridge in the room is a mini bar so if you want to put anything in it you have rearrange things, it worked out but prefer to be able to use the fridge for our drinks and snacks as we were at several breweries and needed space for beer. Provide coffee & scones in the AM, snacks & drinks in the afternoon, we had the coffee which was good. At check out time there was a charge on our bill for the resturant, which we never went to, they took the charge off. There was another guest at the time of check in complaining about his bill, not sure of that outcome. Not sure if we would go back again, don't get me wrong it was not horrible, rather nice but there are so many hotels to stay in that it might be worth trying some other place.

I will stay in this hotel every time I go to New York now! Wonderful staff, great, clean rooms, close to SoHo shopping. Can't compliment the place enough. The only thing I might warn about is that the DJ in the bar was a little loud, we were hoping to sit in a quiet place and have a cocktail, but at the time we went up, the music was a little loud/clubby, but we enjoyed anyway.

This was my second time at The James Soho. First time was during NYFW. I knew I needed to stay there again. So I took a long weekend with friends and AGAIN, fantastic service. Will definitely be back!

Johnny helped us avoid an awkward situation upon arrival. Really appreciate his hospitality! It’s a joy to work with someone who gets it and is willing to put guest needs first. Now we can get to work!

My sister and I booked this chic hotel for a bachelorette weekend. Upon check-in, the staff couldn't have been more accommodating and kind. We may have been in the middle of NYC, but we definitely received "mom and pop" treatment. Anything we needed, they helped us with - no sign of annoyance or arrogance. Special call out to Leidy, Natalie, Yami, Kris, Kenny and Paul. Every person that worked at The James NY SoHo was pleasant, and helpful, and just amazing. They went out of their way to make everyone in our group feel special. The location is to die for - amazing views of the Freedom Tower - great rooftop pool - great food - great service - we just had an amazing time - next time we are visiting Manhattan and staying the night - we will be sure to book The James New York SoHo.

We had a good weekend stay at The James. The beds were excellent, but the hotel in general was a bit too worn down. Rooms are spacious in New York standard, and ok value for money. Fitness room has an excellent view.

Wonderful stay, the hotel was very nice and the beds were extremely comfortable. I will definitely be using again if I choose to stay in NY. There is an upstairs roof deck which gives amazing views and also there is a pool but being that it was about 32 degrees and windy, we weren't able to use it. Would be fantastic in the summer months however

Always have a good stay at this chic hotel. Breakfast could be improved with a continental type buffet breakfast.Always stay at this hotel when in New York so would be pleasing if they could tacvkle breakfast for us Europeans.

They lost my own pillow. My wife sprained her ankle, they did not offer any kind of help. He decided to leave the hotel before we should, some packages were arriving for us, and very rudely they denied information about them

Great hotel for soho area, very walkable. The staff are friendly and Jonny Houston was a very accommodating. Rooms are small but clean. Roof top bar was a great place to have drinks and views of the city.

Hi-tech room with innovative glassed-in bathroom, which makes the bedroom and the bathroom seem open. (There is a privacy screen.) Exemplary staff. Scones and coffee in the lobby in the morning, along with today's newspaper.

I adored this hotel and the location. It's just steps away from SoHo shopping and dining and there's a great coffee shop across the street. The rooms are very modern with excellent bathroom space. You can't beat the natural light from the large windows! I hope to come back soon.

When we arrived we were able to get our room promptly, we went to the restaurant onsite and couldn’t get a Bloody Mary. Our shower didn’t drain and our fridge didn’t close. We tried to call down to the front desk and we got put on hold for 20 min. They removed a resort fee but I paid too much money for that type or service. Never was greeted by any door man. Not even a good evening or good morning!

All around one of my favorite hotels. Fresh coffee and scones in the morning. A friendly staff and everything in Soho is a quick walk from the hotel. I have stayed at the James on many occasions and I believe it has even changed ownership but that hasn’t stopped it from being oneOf the best in NYC.

I found this hotel by chance when the Airbnb was not as described. I LOVE this hotel and will stay here again and again. Staff was always helpful and present. This hotel is perfectly placed to get just about anywhere in NYC. I wish I could have extended my stay.

Good location, clean, friendly staff and overall a pleasant stay. One disadvantage is the closet and drawer space in the room. Two adults with their respective luggage and clothes do not fit. Other than that it was enjoyable.

Had what appeared to be mold stains on one of the sheets which were not seen until late night tore sheet off bed and dealt with it...restaurant has its own issues and needs to work on it to keep up with the facility

The James is in a prime location with access to all in SoHo, Tribeca, and the Village. Very comfortable stay, and Jimmy (rooftop bar) has some of the best views in the city! Family friendly as well. I look forward to staying here again.

Many thanks to Mike the bellman who gave us an excellent NY Pizza recommendation!Walkable neighborhood filled with great restaurants. Gitano’s restaurant was much better than we expected it would be. The guacamole and carne asada we’re both great.

Perfect location for shopping and eating. The staff are super friendly and so accommodating. Rooms are quite small and a little tired but great amenities and a wonderful staff make up for it. Would definitely recommend.

Room was not ready at check in. Very expensive for the service. There is night close of curtains or open bed. Manual curtains. Reasonable good place if you want to stay in Soho. Nice rooftop. Noisy at night but didn’t bother on my room

The James is by far the best value and experience I have had .I have stayed at some other , but always end up back at The James .All the staff are so attentive and helpful .Without a doubt, the best !

Always good to be back. Great location in the heart of Soho and close to the subway station. Nice and extremely helpful staff. Modern, well equipped rooms with phantastic views. Superb roof terrace and nice lobby lounge to hang out.

Loved our stay, my wife and Iwill be back. Kris and Natalie were excellent with our check in and explaining all the hotel amenities, they were very friendly and helpful with any questions we had!!! Great experience.

We had a corner King suite the views from both rooms were fantastic! The rooms were comfortable and roomy, bathroom was large and had tub, separate shower and two sinks.Staff was pleasant and helpful We would definitely stay here again!

All king rooms are on the side of the building overlooking the Holland Tunnel exit, so particularly if you are on a lower floor, there will be a ton of honking outside at all hours. The first night we were on the 8th floor, second and third nights on the 15th, which was better (and we set up our phones to the (tinny) speaker in the room for ocean sounds which helped). I suspect the side of the building with queen beds would be noticeably quieter. The property is really cool, there are some beautiful garden/patio areas; the roof/pool deck (club) is a raging party at night, but we did not hear that from our room at all. The lobby is serene but with remarkably uncomfortable furniture (looks so cozy and then you sit down!). It was a fine stay and an excellent location, but we will choose something else next time.

I stayed at this hotel for 9 nights for a business trip and my mom tagged along and it was a stay to remember!! I highly recommend this hotel. The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of SoHo, easy to go to canal street for subway and easy to go to broadway and stores. Even though I was busy with work, the hotel personnel went above and beyond to make my stay a comfortable, elevated experience. Thank you, Natalie, Kris, Johnny and Maurice to helping surprise my mom with a warm gift and note from the hotel, she loved it! The hotel has modern luxurious decorations, the rooms are big and comfortable, the rooftop becomes a club so if you want to have some drinks and mingle it is great. The hotel is quiet, they offer complimentary coffee until 11 am and small bites for breakfast and every day from 6 pm they offered wine and cheese (delicious cheese btw). The staff of the hotel really made us feel welcomed and cared for thanks and I will for sure book this hotel again when going to NYC.

The hotel was lovely. Great room and comfy bed. Was a great location for my meeting. This is close to shopping also if you want. A little confusing with the entrance but all good. Discovered a great bar to the right!

Chek in to the hotetel was slow and not prfessonal. Location is good if you want to stay in Soho. The rooms where good size and clean. The breakfast area outside was dirty and very slow service. The coplimentary wine hour was a joke. No wine and no clases. If you do that do it well or don´t do it at all! The doormen where helpful and professonal!

Excellant, value for money, clean, and comfortable. Quiet location for relaxing, great location for shopping. Friendly staff, helpful and accommodating. Secure, nothing too much trouble.Great in every way, would recommend.

I have to admit I was pretty disappointed with The James hotel. For the significantly high price point per night, I did not get the experience I would have imagined. I will say, the staff is friendly, and that was were the positives end. I stayed here on business for 3 nights. Upon check in, our 3 rooms were not ready. When we finally were able to get into the rooms, they seem very cool from the looks of it, but functionality-wise were super inefficient. The water guage on both the shower and the sink were inconsistent - upon turning on the water would always be boiling hot and took long while to cool down. I ended up having to brush my teeth with bottled water as I did not have time to wait for the water to become a normal temperature. The light switches did not make sense and seemed to not be connected with anything. There were little outlets - only 1 surge protector/power strip on the floor (with little give). The elevators always took forever. And then to top it off, we were transporting extremely expensive equipment. When we (finally) found the bellman and asked if he can watch our cart of gear for 5 minutes while we grabbed a coffee across the street, we come back to our gear with no one around. No one watching it. We simply carted out our gear on our own, which wasnt a problem, but it could have been anyone who took the gear out of the hotel as no one was watching it. I stay in a lot of hotels that are much cheaper than this, especially in New York, and expect a higher level of service and amenities than I received. Likely will not stay again.

This was my first time staying at the James. Beautiful hotel, great check-in experience with Bobby! Will definitely stay here again. The SoHo location is really convenient to dining, shopping and clubs. The rooftop bar is really cool!

Wonderful New York experience shared with many friends. Check in was fast, pleasant, our luggage was in the room quick. The room had a wonderful city view of the 9/11 Peace Tower. Variety of snacks and beverages in the lobby throughout the morning to evening. Concierge was extremely helpfully with restaurants, directions and our group photo shoot! Roof top bar was full of energy, great music with a Soho vibe. The hotel is steps away from amazing shopping and tourist attractions. Rooms were clean and modern.

Here for work so I’m relieved to state that I had an amazing stay. The staff was extremely knowledgeable and helpful the entire stay. Kristina especially was super sweet and welcoming. Hope work sends me back soon!

really great experience at the James. The staff was very nice and attentive, we were celebrating our anniversary and it was such a nice surprise to have a note and amenity in the room. Will be back very soon for sure!

Check in with Bobby and Natalie was GREAT; warm and welcoming. Bobby was new and eagerness, commitment to customer service evident. Problem solving with Johnny the pm manager was even better. Room was little worn but clean. Check out team was less stellar, impressive.

I agree mostly with the remarks about the hotel generally but it was a shame about gitano bar and restaurant. The staff particularly one female member were quite rude and overall the service was poor. As Australian we always tip according to good service, but I don't like having to tip for no service!Also overall the area was grubby and tired and needed a bit of attention. We had a very average guacamole which was all that was on offer after 4pm but most plates seemed to be returned half finished. Can do a lot better ....

I stayed here for one night at the end of my business trip and was scarred from my last hotel room which was very small. Natalie at the front desk did a great job checking me in early and getting me a room that was perfect! She even checked in on me afterwards via text. We had consistent great service from the staff with Bobby delivering us excellent cookies and Kenny helping me with a ride to the airport early in the morning. I would recommend this hotel which is excellently located in SoHo.

My daughter and I checked in today after visiting NYU and we love the modern style,Relaxed atmosphere and friendly service.Room is open and airy. Kris at the desk was very personable and accommodating.Definitely will stay here again.
user_location: Cape May Court House, New Jersey
user_name:
Elizabeth T
Cape May Court House, New Jersey

review_body: Everything was Excellent. The staff super kind and helpers. The coffe in the lobby wass grate !!! The rooftop super cool. The view is wonderful, in the room and in the rooftop. Te decoration is nice and modern .

Our friend just moved to New York so we decided to show her a few of our favorite places on a Sunday afternoon. For our final stop we decided to head over to one of my wife’s favorite spots the Jimmy at The James. The Rooftop comes with incredible views, well crafted drinks, and a DJ who really knows how to set a vibe. After a round of drinks, we decided to book a room where we could view the skyline.I was able to book a room right from my phone in less than 5 minutes and was even able to pay with Apple Pay.We headed down from the rooftop to the front desk so we could check-in. At the front desk we were greeted by Kris & Bobby who provided exceptional service. Check-in was really smooth they even offered a glass of wine for each of us. Our room was on the 12th floor room 1203 which was top tier, had all the amenities and offered one of the best city views. There was no better setting to end the night which was only lit by the Manhattan Skyline.

Great location. Room are small. Amazing rooftop bar with amazing views. DJ spinning music. We travelled here 3 times. One waitress on the rooftop was rude. But usually the. Staff is friendly. The food at jimmy roof top really good.

Our stay at THE JAMES OF SOHO was the best of any in New York City. The staff was wonderfully helpful from the moment we arrived.The location is perfect for a lovely stay in the city. The proximity to all the super restaurants and shopping and metros makes this our go to hotel. We could walk everywhere or catch the subway at the corner.The rooms though small are wonderfully appointed with robes, slippers, big soft fabulous towels and a huge window overlooking the city. The heat and AC worked perfectly and were both quiet and dust free. The linens were always clean crisp and fresh.The bathroom was large with a super shower. I appreciated the hard wood floors and lack of carpeting as this creates a much cleaner atmosphere.We enjoyed the mini breakfast of coffee and scones and wine and cheese in the afternoon and drinks in the sky bar at night. To me and my daughter who come to the city for a holiday every year, we have now found the only place we would book for sure.

The James New York SoHo is the right blend of contemporary elogence and comfort! This is my favorite hotel when I travel for business! Great hotels and even better vibes! You will not be disappointed!

I had an amazing stay at the James NY - Soho. The staff was amazing, the rooms were comfy with great amenities & views of NYC, and the rooftop was next level. Bobby at the front desk was a huge help at making my stay a special one.

The highlight of my stay would have to be the staff. In particular, Johnny and Natalie! Not only were they both helpful and accommodating, but even after long work meetings, I could always look forward to warm or even funny greetings. The two are exemplary of what one should expect during a New York Hotel stay and I commend them both.

After 5 days in a Times Square hotel we were supposed to fly to Miami but hurricane Dorian forced us to change our plans. So we decided to stay in NYC for 5 more days but switch from busy Times Square to the calmer Soho area and we booked at the James Hotel.The hotel design wise is amazing. Lots of lights come in through huge windows at the reception area and in the rooms. From the rooftop bar you can enjoy breathtaking views on different parts of New York. We personally were on the 10th floor and therefore didn’t hear any music in our room at night. However it does get busy up there on weekends. We felt that the cocktails were over overpriced (+-22 dollars incl tax), this is even more than what we pay here in Switzerland for a cocktail. Waiters get rude when you don’t tip them.However, the big plus of this Hotel is the staff (excluding barmen). The lobby guys are fantastic. Kenny greeted us and was extremely friendly, kind, proactive and helpful. The James Hotel can be (very) lucky to have a guy like him.. hard to find such friendly people nowadays in the hospitality branch.The reception team was amazing as well and was very helpful the few times we reached out to them.All in all I would give 4 stars - but thanks to the reception team and Kenny, I have no choice than to give a solid 5 star review.See you soon James Hotel!

So far I absolutely love this hotel. Just checked into a lovely room, huge for New York standards with ceiling to floor windows. The hotel staff have all been lovely thanks to Natalie for making our check in quick and effortless and giving us a gorgeous room and to Kris for telling us which room was the best! 1008 btw! We received complimentary drinks coupons on arrival and are looking forward to the wine and cheese and cookies later. Definitely recommend if you want a big, luxurious hotel with friendly staff while staying in New York.

For this price and the amounts of hotel around, the price is too high for the services provided.You can get the same quality and services for less if you take time to check .Make sure to check also your bill, they charge me extra night by mistake....

Checked in to the hotel after a long day and Bobby hooked it up with an upgrade to ease my troubles! Lovely hotel with complimentary amenities in the morning and evening. Spacious rooms & nice products in the bathroom.

We had a great stay at a beautiful hotel. Views from our room were amazing and Bobby was fantastic. We wanted a night in the city instead of a commute home and The James was the perfect location. The Jimmy was a little loud but drinks and views were spectacular.

The hotel is cute and aesthetically pleasing. The staff was extremely kind and helpful. It was overpriced for the small sized rooms and minimal amenities provided. Also the bathroom lighting needs improvement. Lastly, the rooftop bar is amazing. The views are beautiful for sunset, and anytime really. There is a DJ at the rooftop bar at night on the weekends. My only disappointment with the hotel rooftop bar as well as the restaurant downstairs is price. The drinks are far overpriced and it takes 20 years to get a drink. The food is ok but nothing special. I’d rather pay the same amount for a high quality meal elsewhere in NYC. I understand the rooms are small because it’s NYC and space is limited so that wasn’t too much of a turn off for me. Overall, my experience at the James was very enjoyable. The location was amazing; the hotel is close to all the fun shops in soho as well as tasty restaurants. Would recommend staying here but bring a light if you are a girl because the bathrooms are dark and hard to put makeup on in.

I was checked in early, but while I waited I sat and enjoyed the beautiful view and ate the most amazing scones I have ever had. From Jimmy on the first floor to every staff member my business trip went flawlessly. I enjoyed a lunch in the Jungle Room that is connected to the hotel. It is a must stop. Perfect little vacation from the city. I will be back to this hotel again!!!

Large room with view. Very good location. Good service of the staff especially from breakfast resturant, doorman and management.Need to pay attention for housekeeping. Floor was sticky, no changing of toalet paper and soap.

A nice hotel in a nice location, but way overpriced compared to what you get, even for NY.We got a corner room with supposed skyline view. On the 8th floor. -Which is obviously not high enough for a proper skyline view. Still cost $500+ per night. Cleaning was bad. Don't check under bed or in corners. You might find things left by earlier occupants. Breakfast was mediocre. Pastries dry every morning. And you only get one cup of coffee each. Not that you necessarily want more, but at this price that should not be restricted.

Enjoyed my stay here very much. I loved the pool on the roof and the room size and decor. The location in Soho is the best in NYC. The restaurant adjacent to the hotel is excellent with beautiful decor. The only thing that is a nuisance is that the hotel charges a resort fee of $40 and then adds taxes and fees to this on a daily basis. I hate being nickled and dimed and just wish that they would have this added to the room rate for a honest idea of one's true cost.

The hotel is definitely a hidden gem in Soho, the staff is very friendly, and very customer oriented. The roof top pool/bar is a lot of fun as well. Would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to stay in Soho!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The James Hotel, the rooms were very clean and spacious. The location of the hotel is ideal for people wanting to explore the city. All staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful. Especially Bobby on the reception who helped us to organise a restaurant booking to surprise our family for a special occasion and Paul the bellboy who was always polite and welcoming. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Large windows in room give stunning views of city. Loved the rooftop pool/bar and the restaurants outside areas with lovely large potted plants and umbrellas. Little outdoor oasis in the city. Highly recommend.

Great staff, especially the front desk. Bobby checked me in and started my stay with a wonderful welcoming. I had a room on the 15th floor, with a great view! They have a great breakfast and tons of beautiful amenities. Although, I must mention, there was a cockroach in the bathroom.

Our stay at The James was one of the best experiences we have had in a long time staying at a hotel. Bobby, Kris and Terrill went over and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. Easy check-in process, delicious food, and a fun atmosphere at the rooftop bar and pool. It was so nice to feel "out in NYC" at the chic rooftop then to just take a couple floors down to our room was a perfect escape. If you like modern decor this is the place to stay! I will always stay at this hotel every time we come to New York. It won't disappoint!

Had such a fun time staying at the James! Centrally located / within walking distance to tons of shops and restaurants in Soho / Greenwich Village. Hotel staff was very pleasant and enjoyed the wine hour at the hotel!

We had an amazing time.I loved the hotel. Staff are super friendly and helpful. All the areas and the rooms are super bright. View was fabulous and service was great. We will be back next time we're traveling to NY.

We picked James instead of SOHO Grand for its modern design and rooftop pool. Hotel charges a daily "resort" fee of $40 and the pool is a useless, tiny pool with no room to walk around or enjoy peace. At 5pm thru 1am, it becomes a loud congregation of 20 year olds listening to a DJ music that can be heard 16 floors down. My wife and I flew in on different flights at end of a hard week. Her flight got in several hours before mine. Despite same list name and hotel having been paid for, hotel refused to get her in because her name was not specifically on the registration, choosing instead to rudely have her sit in lobby for a long time after 5 hours of travelling until I called the front desk.

Honesty wowed! By how beautiful it is! It has everything going for it, in walking distance from good restaurants and bars. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially Bobby he greeted us with the up most professionalism. Definitely will be staying there again.

My boyfriend and I stayed at the james over a holiday weekend and right from when we first pulled up to the hotel we were greeted by the valet who was extremely helpful. We went up to check in and Bobby and Kris were wonderful. They checked us in quickly, verified our reservation, and told us about all the amenities. The hotel room itself was gorgeous. The shower was beautiful with plenty of hot water. The robes are comfortable and the bed sheets are soft. Not to mention the view was exactly what we were hoping for when booking a hotel on Manhattan. This trip was our first time in NYC and it certainly wont be our last. 10/10 would stay at the James again next time!

The front desk ladies Natalie and Kristina made my birthday weekend memorable! They were very nice and treated us as if we were royalty! Our room had an amazing view of the One World Trade Center and SoHo. It was super clean! The rooftop pool party was a lot of fun!! The breakfast is delicious! We will be making this our go to hotel for our future New York trips!

Staff is very friendly, rooms are nice and not too small for NY, comfortable beds. Rooftop pool and terrace are a joke. The pool is more like a bathtub (ca 3x6 meters). Hotel guests have to vacate the pool area by 4pm (earlier on weekends) to allow for preprations for the bar that opens at 5.Meaning kids under 21 cannot access the rooftop or pool area after 4!When we ordered a regula coffee and an espresso in the morning we were handed a 32$ bill, admin fee, room service fee etc. We cancelled the order, which was graciously accepted.When we asked for an umbrella against the blasting sun we were told that the umbrellas are owned by the bar and that the hotel staff cannot use them fir hotel guests.Visited the bar almost every evening to check it out, never stayed more than 5 minutes. Cheap, primitive crowd.If you want to choose the hotel for its great location or decent rooms, go for it, but ignore the pool and bar section in your decision until the hotel management has figured out how to operate a hotel!

This place is amazing. Rooftop view is stunning, the room was extremely comfortable. I will definitely recommended for a nice getaway. Staff is incredibly, Front desk agents were so helpful and they explained all amenities of the hotel. Natalie and Kris greeted me with a kind smile, excellent customer service, they make me feel like I was home. 5 stars for this place!!!
user_name:
Julio P
New York City, New York

review_body: Great stay at The James, perfect location, friendly and helpful staff, spacious and clean rooms. Good on site amenities, including the roof deck with pool, lounge and restaurant. You can walk anywhere in downtown Manhattan from the hotel.

We had a wonderful stay at The James. We had a suite with amazing views. Even though the room was small the windows and view made it feel so much bigger. We requested a room that wasn’t too close to the rooftop bar - this request was accommodated. The bed was excellent! The service was great and the location was perfect. We would def recommend The James

We are at the end of our great stay in this cozy hotel. Firstly, the location is perfect! You are in Soho and feel the quality of the café’s, restaurants, bars and shops only 2 steps away from you. Canal street subway st. is at the corner of the street. Since the traffic condition is very bad in NY you will need to take subway, it’s very convenient. Everything went perfect with the hotel, the room is quite confortable and the other clients were very silent and respectful. Krisnauris, Bobby and all staff are doing their best to make clients to feel happy. So in general we are very happy to stay at the James Soho and hope to come back again in the near future.Thank youMurat Gezgin

I stayed at this property for one night. Immediately upon entry I was greeted by Kenny. Not only was he hospitable but also noticed when the front desk forgot to check me into the open rooms they had. He went out of his way to bring my bags to my room, offered me a bottle of wine on the house, and a drink ticket for the rooftop bar. Kenny made up for the front desk’s initial mistake which impressed me. Not only was Kenny a rockstar but Eric, also at the entry doors, gave great service. I was already checked in but was waiting for my Uber to head to an interview around 4:30pm on a Wednesday. I’m from out of town so once Eric knew I had to be somewhere at a specific time, he went the extra mile and hailed me a cab to make sure I was where I needed to be on time. Eric and Kenny were the MVPs of the visit however everyone at the hotel was kind and accommodating. Mistakes happen so I won’t hold that against the property or the front desk staff, just pointing out what I noticed. The hotel was clean and had a beautiful rooftop. I highly recommend the property if you’re looking to stay in SoHo!

Choose the James for a city staycation coming from long island. The hotel was in a perfect location and has a great rooftop. The best part was the staff. Everyone was super friendly and Kristina had amazing recommendations for local restaurants and midtown suggestions after our Broadway show.

My lady and I decided to take a staycation. Since I'm new in the city, both Reddit and my brother told me to go to the James because they have a cool bar and a great restaurant. As soon as I arrived, I was sold. The place is a bit hip and comfy. The beds are big and soft. And don't get me started on the service. Huge shout out to Bobby and Natalie for the extra bit of hospitality. They even saved us cookies because we missed the cookie social. Can't wait to try the yoga tomorrow morning.Thanks James Hotel. Definitely going to make this our little gem in the city.

I had an awesome experience staying at The James Soho Hotel. Kristina Perez, Executive Office Manager was extremely kind and professional, who went above and beyond to provide me the best experience with her personal touch! Kristina also did a tremendous upgrade with a corner king unit room for my 4th anniversary with my girlfriend. The view was amazing and had a very romantic night with big skyline. I would highly recommend to family and friends. Thank you Kristina for the unforgettable night with The James!
user_name:
maxH9201UN
New York City, New York

review_body: Check-in staff was very nice and accommodating. I had requested early check in, which I understood was not a guarantee. I was texted that my room was ready two hours after 3pm (the normal check in time). The service and help at the pool on Sunday was non-existent. I was not the only person who felt that way because I heard other guests complaining as well. I understand you all do the pool parties starting at 3pm but for paying hotel guests there needs to be service and help at the pool. Lastly, there was very loud construction above my room on early Sunday morning and early afternoon when I was in my room. It was almost unbearable.

We want to make a special mention of two outstanding employees that made my hotel experience amazing....Leidy and Natalie at the front desk. Best customer service I’ve ever received! This hotel is absolutely beautiful. Stunning views from the rooftop pool. Looking at the Freedom Tower was stunning! Mike at the pool was so great and courteous and always had a smile on his face. Can’t wait to come back!! Overall experience was AMAZING!

Loved my stay and was even upgraded to the amazing studio room! I fell in love with the view and the shower. Bed was quite comfortable and though the room was small but NY small. The lobby is quaint love the coffee and treats in the am and the wine in the evening.

My husband booked this hotel for my birthday and we ended up leaving, we were SO disappointed. The room was dirty, the reception desk is falling apart, the guy behind reception referred to me as 'she' and only spoke to my husband when we were checking in (will 'she' have a key to the room'). The pool, is tiny and the surrounding area stinks of spilt old booze. The lift system is ridiculously slow. Thankfully they agreed to refund us and were able to stay elsewhere to celebrate my birthday.

Natalie at the front desk was superb at our arrival, she upgraded us and was very warm and inviting, the pool arrangements could have been better, however, overall we had a nice time..Everybody in the hotel was friendly

Fantastic position in Soho - near to everything we wanted to do and see. Very quiet room and very helpful friendly staff. Quick to deal with any questions and good on the area. Didn’t eat there so not sure on food, but only because so many outside options that we wanted to try.

great location but poor standards. Badly needs a refurbishment. Serious disconnection with the restaurant. Staff were friendly. Room fittings were a big issue. Security at the entrance was adhoc. I wont be staying there again

The location is terrific and love rooftop pool. Bellboy was not available upon arrival and departure. Asked for towels and they were never received. Someone charged $200 on my room without my knowledge nor did I sign a receipt. I also received a charged for a candy bar that was never taken from the room bar. It took a while to rectify these charges and I was late for an event. They need to work on better customer service and accountability.

Great stay. Very clean, modern. Super spacious for nyc and can’t beat the area if you like downtown. One of the few cool rooftops in nyc with a pool. Bobby at the front desk was super helpful and we could text a number for any of our needs. Definitely staying there again

Impressive and Super Chic Hotel. The Rooftop Pool becomes an open Bar at 3pm- Booby at Reception was beyond helpful and friendly, one of the best customer service I have received at Any hotel. The Room was simply amazing. Highly recommended.

The James is a chic modern hotel right in SoHo and close to TriBeCa. Warmly greeted by Bobby at the front desk who upgraded me to an amazing suite with walls of windows looking over the city. Great room service too. K

I often stay at the James in Soho whenever I'm in NYC and I always enjoy my stay. I was able to receive some great help from Bobby & Kris as they were very accommodating during my most recent visit. The place is super lowkey and the location couldn't be better.

The James Soho is a terrific location on the edge of Soho, with the plus of a great rooftop bar, Jimmy's, with stunning Manhattan views of the Freedom Tower and the Hudson River. We arrived late and were thrilled to be upgraded to our corner room by Bobby. There is a small but well equipped gym with that great view and the lobby had coffee and yummy scones in the morning followed by fruit and minty water later in the day.
Hotel design with great comfort, near subway downtown or uptown,Services were good, especially the Internet connection,Friendly and competent staff,Situated in the lively district,Nearby restaurants.

Although I now live in NYC, I decided to treat us to a little get away in Soho. I was checking out hotels online and came across this little gem. Very reasonable price, modern rooms, great location and the roof top pool was a great little bonus. Upon arrival Bobby at front desk was great. Very friendly and offered us a glass of wine. The room that was given to us was the 'Stage' room. Lovely as it had views of the Hudson.When we checked out Bobby and Kris at front desk were extremely accommodating and friendly.Great stay and well worth checking this hotel out.
user_name:
brendons472
New York City, New York

review_body: Website information is misleading. There is no David Burke restaurant. The insulation is horrible. You could hear the music from the rooftop bar from the 14-17 floors. The grout at the shower door was not cleaned. I could hear slamming doors from other rooms and housekeeping closet door. This location is not classy like the one in Chicago.

I stayed here for a long weekend with my husband and two sons (Aged 18 and 20).The reasons we chose this hotel was its location (which didn’t disappoint) and the roof top pool. The general daytime atmosphere of the hotel is friendly enough and the rooms and public areas are bright and clean. The first disappointment we encountered was that the pool was closed every day at 4 so they coulld prep the area ready for evening when it became a roof top bar area for over 21s only (residents and non-residents). From 5 pm the vibe of the hotel changed completely with all these bouncers everywhere who came across as quite intimidating. This applies to the downstairs bar areas too. I don’t mind an edgy vibe but unfortunately, this was more seedy than edgy.With regards to the rest of the facilities, as I said room was nice. Housekeeping were a bit sloppy with replenishing cups and other tea/coffee supplies but towels and other guest amenities were well stocked. Room service food was simple but tasty. Gym was good and the complimentary wine available in the lobby during happy hour was most enjoyable. They could do with a better breakfast option. Coffee flasks and pastries in the lobby doesn’t really cut it. However, they did have a number of restaurants across the road and next door that was part of the hotel but again it just seemed a bit dark and nightclub like. Thankfully because of the location there were plenty of great places to eat within a few minutes walk.Eric the concierge was very friendly as were the receptionists but other staff members like some of the bar tenders were a bit to cool to be friendly.

Wow, what an amazing place, I saw Quavo from Migos on my way in, so dope! Amazing staff, and beds! Perfect location, absolute dream! Must stay! And Chris was such a delightful host, made my welcoming special :) cheers!

Best accommodations. Amazing customer service. Clean and comfortable rooms. Thank you sooooo much Natalie for being so amazing and helping to make my husbands birthday special!!!! As soon as I walked into the front entrance the warm welcome and hospitality was amazing!

The hotel is a luxury experience from start to finish. Stunning views of tribeca from the roof top pool. Rooms are chic and well maintained. Staff is 100% professional. Free wine upon arrival. Great roof bar. Very nice restaurant on 1st floor.

We switched hotels at the end of our trip and couldn’t be any more happier! The concierge Bobby, was super helpful when we arrived and offered a glass of wine or water while we waited to check in. The hotel is beautiful and we ended up with a corner room overlooking the beautiful city! We will ONLY stay at the James when we visit SOHO again. Thank you!

I found several of the components of this hotel to be excellent and others to be disappointing. The Jungle Room Restaurant is fantastic, the staff is fantastic, but the "deluxe" room was tiny (which is always a risk in NYC). The bathrooms are sufficient, but the lighting is very low and there is no makeup mirror, the shampoo and bath amenities are very masculine, and there are no extra towels. I must say that the towels are generously sized which is my usual mark of a nice bathroom. In general, I think the hotel was fine, but there is no breakfast option and it may just be too groovy for me. The other guests in the hotel did not seem like business travelers.

This is our first time at The James and we couldn’t be more pleased! The hotel is beautifully decorated, but the customer service is what sets it apart. We appreciate all Bobby has done to make our stay amazing, from checking us in to providing personalized restaurant recommendations. The hotel has great amenities including a wine and cheese hour (and cookies for my pregnant wife)! Highly recommend.

Kris was very professional at check in offered us wine definitely a great expected service. Amenities in sky lobby are very convenient specially wine hour. The rooftop view is very nice. Definitely worth it.

Very friendly and professional welcome at the check-in. @Kris: you are awesome. Thank you. The room was made available much faster than expected during my delicious lunch next door in this fantastic neighborhood.

No towels at the pool.. said they would bring one but never did, very small pool with very limited seating. Bartender not helpful or friendly but other than that the front desk staff was great and the room was great

The staff here is very friendly and knowledgeable! When we pulled up, Paul was waiting to take our luggage. He was very helpful the three days we were there. The front desk staff is awesome! Thanks again!!!

I highly recommend this hotel. Natalie and Kris were wonderful at Check In and made the process easy and efficient. I appreciated their efforts to accommodate my requests. They really went above and beyond to make sure I was happy with my experience. Traveling so much for work, you stay at a lot of luxury and mid-range properties, and not always is it a personal experience. Hence, I truly value the energy of a place where the staff seems genuinely caring and thoughtful. Even the gentlemen who helped with my suitcases where enthusiastic and kind. Great vibe from the whole staff I interacted with which is rare these days :) The property is beautiful, super modern with a design aesthetic a bit artsy and cool. The room has spectacular views, huge windows, and is a great size. Overall I was very happy with my stay and would stay here again!
user_name:
MyLifeVoyage
New York City, New York

review_body: Leidy and Yami were amazing my whole stay. They were able to answer all my questions quickly and professionally. Their customer service is fantastic and look forward to my next stay at The James SoHo.

I had an amazing experience at the James. The staff was so polite and very accommodating, especially Bobby (Thank you). The vibe and location cannot be beat, simply the best! I will definitely be staying here again very soon!

I absolutely loved my stay. It was an extremely hot weekend in NYC so I booked a room to enjoy the rooftop pool and, boy, it didn't disappoint. Lively and friendly crowd at the pool with witnesses coming around every few minutes to see if you needed anything. Most amazing views from the rooftop pool was worth every penny!Upon checking in Natalie at the front desk warmly welcomed me and took it upon herself to upgrade me to a large corner King room knowing I was there for a solo staycation. She remembered my name the next day which made my stay even more memorable. Not only the hotel was beautiful but you can't beat the location! When I'm back in town next I'll be staying at this property.

Beautiful place - quick and easy check in, large and comfortable room - a great stay! Bobby was a terrific host the entire time - so helpful and welcoming. Beautiful pool on the rooftop. Great view from the room too!

Somewhat well located, small rooms, tiny pool - always packed, rooftop bar in not such great shape, an expensive service/hotel fee. I can’t say that I can’t wait to go back. One great thing though were the pillows.

The James is located in a great neighborhood and provided excellent customer service by Leidy. The rooms were comfortable and we enjoyed a drink at the Jimmy rooftop bar as well with gorgeous views. I will definitely be back!

Nice big Corner King Studio. Close to bars and restaurants and great views. The doorman was very helpful, had a car waiting for us for the airport and when we were out and about even provided an umbrella (without me asking) when it was raining.

Love it here. The two girls at the front desk, Leidy and Kris, upgraded me to a nicer room for free- and with a smile! All the staff is accommodating and helpful, would definitely stay here again. And they have a wonderful rooftop bar and pool!
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
RandiU_13
New York, New York, United States

review_body: don't stay there on Saturday nights. they should let you know that the pool/bar area will be a loud packed dance club. it is not worth the money. they need to let the guests know that the pool will not be available on Saturday nights.

The James Hotel is an average hotel with above average prices. I would not pay that much to stay in a hotel of this standard. The initial receptionist I had on check in way rude to say the least. The only staff member who was INCREDIBLE was the man who came to give me my breakfast each morning, I must say he was a breath of fresh air :)

Refurbish your bar. Change Bellman. Sort out safe place for luggage storage. We were late to Airport because our car did not wait while your staff was Searching our stored luggage. Very unprofessional. Did cause extra costs to Order new Airport transfer!

Great hotel. Nice clean rooms. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Beautiful roof top pool with bar. Very conveniently situated right near to canal street and close to downtown shopping and amenities

I am really happy with this little hotel in SoHo. Staff are very friendly and helpful and also the valet service is good. Rooms are on the small side but perfectly formed with a small bathroom with “view” from the shower and heated floor that is really nice in the morning. After so many disappointments with NY hotels and the fact that you pay extra money for a city view and the view is utterly disappointing this time I didn’t pay extra and of course I got...an amazing city view!Location is perfect: Downtown NY and walking distance to the shopping district (Spring Street and Mercer Street and Broadway). I think that I have finally found the right place for me in NYC!

Excellent service. Clean rooms. I’ll defiantly recommend it. Rooftop was very beautiful service was amazing from Natalie and kris. Will defenetly return. Close to shopping areas amenities at the James club very convenient and perfect

I had a read a few reviews prior to coming and was apprehensive at first however my experience was amazing. We arrived really late at night just gone midnight and we were greeted by a lovely gentlemen who checked us in and wished me a happy birthday. The hotel was clean on first impressions and although when we got in the lift to go to our room there were two slightly intoxicated guys inside who had mad their way down from the rooftop bar they were swiftly escorted out by staff with no fuss at all. we were on a high floor quite close to the bar and I only heard any noise when in the lift which was to be expected. I was greeted by some wine in my room as a birthday gift and the views were AMAZING. the room was stylish and clean and the bed was so so comfy! I went to the pool next day and it was clean and the beds were lovely. I stayed there for a few hours and it didn't get overly busy! the lifts were fine to use also even in the evening, I didn't find any guests of the bar were prioritised over hotel guests, infact I found they made sure hotel guests got good use of the elevators in amongst the bar crowd. The staff were continuously helpful and very very friendly always making sure we were being well catered for. the hotel location is excellent with a metro to most places right outside. watching sunrise and sunset from my window over downtown new York was amazing. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and for the negative reviews I didn't experience any of them.

Very good experience. Thanks to very friendly and service oriented staff. This is a nicely designed hotel and comfortable rooms.The only caveat is the closing of the pool at 4pm to prepare the night activity.

Would definitely recommend The James, loved the rooftop bar although the pool is quite small and can get quite busy - the views make up for the rest. Great location in Soho, I walked most places. The complimentary cheese and wine in the afternoons in reception was a nice touch.

Amazing people working there. Great service. I booked 7 nights through booking but had to shorten stay. Was supposed to pay 300 usd cancellation fee when I read my booking conditions. But the manager Terrell just voided them and gave me vouchers for drinks on rooftop because I was engaged this week.Highly recommend to stay in this hotel.Great location.Great rooftop.

Excellent Hotel in Soho surrounded by great restaurants and shopping. The staff were so helpful and friendly especially the manager Johnny, Bobby, Eric and all the great staff at the front door. Pool was fantastic during the NYC summer and the complimentary rooftop yoga was amazing!

Top-notched customer service! Staff was amazing! View of the rooftop is beautiful. The room was nice and cozy and the bed was comfortable, couldn’t ask for a better hotel! Thank you Bobby, Lamine and the staff at James Soho for the amazing experience! :)

Shout out to Kris - Best customer service I’ve ever received! This hotel is absolutely beautiful and in an awesome location. Stunning views! Refreshing pool! Amazing staff! Convenient location! Defiantly coming back

Upon arrive the staff was wonderfully helpful, attentive and kind. They were the the highlight of our weekend stay . They cleanliness of the common areas were average especially during the nighttime club hours. Definitely hard to keep up with the youth crowd I am sure. Rooms were clean but average ... although we had an amazing view of the Freedom Tower
user_name:
Yoannie
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed at The James this past week for work and had a room overlooking 6th Ave. The floor to ceiling windows in my room and throughout the hotel made for a bright and open environment. I highly recommend this hotel for those who are traveling for work. The location of the hotel is super convenient and close to many good restaurants (shoutout to the Sola Pasta Bar thats one block over). The wifi was consistent throughout my stay here. I loved the carafe of filtered water and the shower that gets hot immediately. The entire staff at all levels were extremely friendly, warm and welcoming. Bobby and Natalie were super great at reception and texting to check in with how my stay was going. They also have rooftop yoga thursday mornings. The hotel provided mats and the view and the experience was incredible. I highly recommend and am definitely planning on coming back here again!

Really enjoyed the staff, the morning coffee, the room temp, shower, great bed. Timely room clean up and well done. Location was ideal between battery park and Central Park. Soho is delightful with everything you need!

I stay at a lot of hotels in Manhattan, and I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised by the James Soho. Natalie checked us in, she was fantastic. Even checking up on us during our stay via text to make sure everything was perfect. She was great - As was Eric at the front door.The friendliness and accommodating attitude was certainly on par with the “real” five star hotels I’ve stayed at in the past.It is a nice size hotel with a boutique feel. Great location. They do not nickel and dime. Free coffee and scones in the morning , chocolate chip cookies in the afternoon ,water and fruit all day , free morning paper - all wonderful touch’s. We even got an unsolicited bottle of wine waiting in a room for anniversary. Classy.Rooftop Pool is great. Although drinks were get up and DIY. No biggie, just for $20 a drink , i would’ve expected some wait service. Other than that, an amazing perk to have in the summer. The only tip would be - avoid the noise on the 17th floor due to the workers setting up for the club upstairs. If you are adverse to noise, skip the 17th. Corner king was amazing (1708) but I assume there is not a bad room in the house. Overall, fantastic stay, pleasantly surprised. Would definitely stay there again. James staff. Kudos!

This was my first time at The James. I usually stay elsewhere but they were booked. Presently surprised at how great my stay turned out. The staff was wonderful. There was a small error with my reservation, not the hotels fault and the manager Kristina was super accommodating. She even called me before I left to make sure everything was all squared away. Room service for a late night bite was perfect. Housekeeping was very sweet when I ran into them coming and going. All around a very welcoming place to stay. Hopefully my travels allow me to return.

I have very much enjoyed staying at the James. It’s a boutique hotel with excellent location -at the core of Soho-. The views are simply gorgeous. The hotel is very elegant and has a fantastic interior design. We have very much loved the experience, The staff has been very kind, helpful, arranging various requests for us. I want to thank Kris, Eric, the pool people. Finally, during the summer the pool and rooftop are highly recommended.

The Staff at The James is excellent, smiles, warm and welcoming - something you would expect at Disney, but not necessarily in NYC. loved it! Great location, so much to do and see. Only draw back , while it awesome there is a rooftop pool - it's very, very small with limited chairs.

Our family met here for a NYC trip and mini-reunion. We had 3 rooms. Loved the location of The JAMES, the staff was amazing, enjoyed the snacks, tea & coffee, wine & cheese they provided daily. Very comfy beds, clean rooms, great shower! Staff provided us with an early check-in & late check-out!Great amenities and helpful staff! Will definitely return!

Me and my girlfriends stayed at the hotel and only went there for the jimmy rooftop pool . We arrived after the guest pool hours however , Natalie was so amazing. She check on us at the lobby and Offered us a bottle of wine for my friends and I while we waited for the room to be ready. Once we went to our rooms she called after to make sure our stay was going well . Thank you for your amazing service.

We we’re for the I think fourth time during last 4-5 years in the James and were honestly disappointed. Location is still super and it is obviously still quite hip to be there, but I think service has deteriorated a lot and no sign of any renovation in the hotel. We had to ask every afternoon again for second blanket, as the one we got in the evening was taken by cleaning away again.
