I asked for a car to take me to Brooklyn and guys downstairs (wouldn’t call them concierges) got me one and I ended up paying 40% more then with Uber Black (which stupid me as a tourist haven’t considered in the first place) and so on...Staff is the least not well trained. It seems to me, that the hotel is managed as an asset to be worked out and more emphasis is on the evening parties on the top floor. But do you really need to sleep at a party place - we won’t do that anymore...

Hotel was in a great location. It's modern and comfortable. Staff are helpful and the rooftop bar is amazing. My only negative is that the rooms, although tidy and clean, are way too small. Ok for a professional business trip but too small for a family holiday.

The James made me feel at home from the moment I walked in. Natalie checked me and remember my name from the moment I checked out . The front desk managers and bellman was so friendly . Thank again for such an amazing experience .

Wow the James soho hotel was literally nothing like I expected . I’m a Marriott rewards member and the James hotel exceeded my expectations . I came here to celebrating my wedding anniversary with my husband and it was amazing . Natalie greeted me at check in and she was so friendly and kind offered us a bottle of wine, an upgrade to a corner king skyline view. The pool small but nice . Thanks for such an amazing ‘modern-experience.

On Monday Natalie Lazarus was really great to me she gave me a complimentary drink to go up jimmys for me and my wife’s wedding and made my stay really really sweet ! I will be back soon beautiful hotel

the jimmys has a nice rooftop bar... I recommend 21 and older...every time I came into the hotel whether it was to go to my room the front door staff was very kind... especially Natalie she smiled every time and asked if I need anything at all and made sure my stay was amazing thanks to her and to the James hotel you guys ROCK!!!

I had to book a week-long reservation the night of and Terrill, Front Office Manager, went above and beyond to make some changes to my reservation and accommodate my needs. I'd previously encountered a relatively snippy agent from the reservations department when met with my last-minute request, for which he was apologetic. Knowing the team is willing to be flexible and work with you has cemented my trust in the property. Thank you again, Terrill!

Everyone at the hotel was nice--there were no issues with hospitality from that perspective, however I got a sense of chaos from the staff because elevators were broken and there was a pool party when we arrived. Upon check-in they told us that the pool closes at 2pm and opens for a pool party to the public at 3pm--I wish this would have been communicated with us prior. We booked the hotel for the rooftop pool, and check in isn't until 3pm. That being said they did work to get us in to a room early. Their elevator situation was not handled well and there were no backups in case of emergency. I could even get down to the lobby because pool party guests were in the elevators.

This is an excellent hotel and location for us when we visit with family. This visit we did have a small issue with the TV in the room. My husband called the desk and a maintaince person was immediately dispached to our room. He was prompt and courteous quickly resolving the problem (user issue lol). We love staying here.

I checked in an was immediately greeted by an warm and friendly smile by Natalie at the front desk . She was amazing and even offered me a bottle a bottle of wine when I arrive after the wine and cheese hour. I would definitely return. Thank you Natalie for the memorable stay and offering me one of the most amazing Corner King Skyline rooms.

We stay at the hotel for the weekend .The hotel location is great the roof top fool is very nice, it was for the hotel guests only until 2pm and then was open to the public.The room had great view and it was clean.

Great Stay , very helpful, comfortable stay, great hospitality and everytomd there was kind , and friendly. Somewhere I could definitely see myself staying at once again. Beautiful view and great location.

I had the pleasure of checking in with Natalie. She was extremely accommodating and kind. She even remembered me from my first visit to The James. What a pleasure to arrive to such a warm welcome. Thank you Natalie!

Rooms were sparkling clean, staff so friendly and accommodating the food was amazing. I felt at home the minute I walked in. Was greeted when I walked in by crystal perez who advised me of all the best places to visit and things to do in the amazing NYC. Will definitely visit again in the future and highly recommend to anyone interested.

I just left The James SoHo and I have to admit, it was not my best stay in New York. First off, I reserved for two other couples and myself and got charged the first night for all three rooms, before we even left home. Even though rooms were identified by my friends names. Really nice apology by front desk person upon check in, then he proceeded to charge my friends full stay on my card! While she was standing there holding her credit card! Nice apology by manager, though. Now I have about $4,000 in charges on my credit card for 3-5 days while they reverse it. If you’re wanting your room to be cleaned around 5:00 pm, no matter what time you leave in the morning, this is the hotel for you! Oh, front desk says to ask for someone to come earlier in the day...every day! Guess there’s no guest notes or preferences. Nice coffee amenity in the morning in lobby but it’s usually empty. Nice wine amenity in lobby at 5:00 pm but there are no glasses and bottles are mostly already empty. If you want breakfast in hotel, it has to be room service because there is NO restaurant here. Pillows are like rocks. You can request down pillows but for some reason they will be removed every day so we all had to keep requesting them again. If you enjoy paying a lot for great location but zero service this is the hotel for you! And be sure you check out the pay first, stay after policy because they are the winners take all when it comes to this! So enjoy your stay! I did not, sadly.

I did like the hotel overall, all the staff we encountered were genuinely nice (except maybe the bouncer). However, for ~$500/night for a weekend night it was just not worth it, especially because we couldn't even enjoy the pool the one night we were there (we did enjoy it in the AM although the water was a little cloudy) and our room view was not that great either. We came back to the hotel late that night and wanted to go up and just enjoy the view, but the bouncer wouldn't let us up as it was 1:45am and I guess it closes at 2am. We were hoping to at least be able to sit in the restaurant/bar area to enjoy the view at night for a few minutes. Oh well. The location is nice and walking distance to some good food and shopping, but I probably wouldn't stay here again unless the price came down.

I would highly recommend going to st James hotel. I was visiting there for one night due to a very bad experience at a previous hotel the night before. My fiancé was visiting me from out of town. And kris the receptionist was beyond welcoming! She not only greeted us with a cheerful manor but instantly accommodated us to right the wrong of the other hotel. We was only staying o e night and she upgraded our room to s penthouse. This hotel interior and exterior was amazing. I will be staying again real soon . Thank you kris

Perfect check in ! Natalie a great help to me and guest, she’s awesome she makes the stay more welcoming ! Rooftop bar is amazing with nice views . Wine and cheese was delicious . Thank you for provide me with an amazing upgrade.

I thought the hotel was very pretty and in a good spot. I had a hard time making the key card work on multiple occasions. My sink didn't work and told them as I was leaving for work it was not fixed after I came back at 6pm. There were light bulbs that needed changing in my room that again were not changed and I had to call the front desk numerous times. Not my favorite place to stay because they seemed like they just didn't care about the guests at all.

Online information regarding this hotel is very misleading, rooms are extremely small, old, dirty. Pool is 3' 11" deep and the size of a larger bathtub, pool deck is extremely small and not family friendly. Little to no meeting/gathering space or food option, 1 hotel restaurant that is open limited hours without breakfast. Very odd arrangement between entry to hotel, abandoned floors, etc. Would not recommend, much better places to stay in SOHO.

Had a 2 night stay- the shower bulb was broken. We reported the issue right away but no help was provided. Requested a roll away bed - turn it had an extra surcharge of $40. Took us a while to adjust - for the amount we paid for the skyline view - we were provided a room on the 10th floor..

The James is in the PERFECT location! China Town, Little Italy, & Subway stops right around the corner. James the concierge was very helpful with directions and recommendations! Stop in the Soho Market on the corner.

Went for a three day mini trip with my 16 year old daughter.Been here before but hotel has got tired.Great location as it easy to get uptown or downtown.Also near major building..empire state, Madison sq garden etc.Had a 1 bed suite.The rooms are good size for NYC.The concierge are very efficient.We arrived and our rooms was not ready.The front desk(reception) where quite rude and almost to the point useless.So we left our luggage anyway went off.Come back same miserable check girl was there o great...Anyway got key move on.So you have a nice room and the shower are good with all normal toiletries you expect.Didn't eat in hotel.There is a small lobby with seats which supplies water and tea coffee which is ok.Like I said didn't eat in hotel so had little day to day with the staff.But I asked reception if we could check out later as we had a 10 pm flight to make the most of the day.So the reception gave me a blank no.I would pay 99 usd to stay to 4 pm. But I needed the room more to 7 pm.No.Fully booked.I checked web site.. it showed available room.All we need was to have a shower at the end of a steaming hot day. I ask if I can use a room or if they have changing area for shower.Again no.There is a toilet downstairs...Which is used for the bar area customers.So not ideal. Only sink and toilets. So I had to get changed in the foyer outside. Not great for a 16 year old.So when I left I thought never use this hotel again Terrible attitude and quite rude.Plenty hotel in nyc to use.So would definitely not recommend this hotel now days.Shame.Going NYC couple more times this year will use hotel that actually help their client's.Thanks for nothing James hotel.How to spoil 16 years first trip to New York.

Perfect location and nice area to be when you are sightseeing in New York. Close to the west side of Manhattan were you can take Morning walk and running. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Specially the door keeper.

The moment we walked in being greeted by Kenny who escorted us up to Natalia to check we felt at like we were on vacation!!! Have to check out the roof, we lounged during the day and partied at night!! ..... P.S. the coffee in the lobby save us both mornings we were there!!

People are clearly choosing the James Soho for its location and great par/ rooftop pool, and they are right. The bar is really cool and so is the rooftop during summer. Location is also very good, in the middle of Soho, near cool restaurants and shops.That being said, the service is far from being great, the internet connection was terrible, and the room was not as clean as expected, a lot of dust in the corners...So if you're looking for a hype hotel , well located go there! But dont expect great service...

Here for our dress fitting with all the girls and the start began with an amazing welcoming at front desk with Kris , great energy , so personable and so detailed going through everything there is to offer at the hotel and surrounding areas! I don’t think she missed a thing and also the front desk manager Terrilll was so welcoming and on top of everything , making sure everything was perfect for us .The hotel is absolutely beautiful and great vibe on rooftop with Dj!

I stayed for one night and was upgraded to a room with an amazing view. The hotel gets the little details right with complimentary water in the room and coffee/scones in the lobby. The staff is also great — especially Bobby who checked me in!

Employees at the check in desk were extremely rude and disrespectful. Both clearly had no idea what they were doing and were the reason that I will not be coming back/recommending this hotel to anyone.
user_name:
Hotelie2019
New York City, New York

review_body: Our corner studio had nice views of the One World and was surprisingly quiet despite us being only on the 5th floor. The set-up of the rooms are nice and I always prefer a hardwood floor over carpeting. The room itself was just showing wear and tear, bathroom sink clogged etc. The Jimmy (the rooftop) is a plus and fun to visit at night.

I had a great time! Had a great night and invited friends up to the pool for birthday festivities. Highly recommend! Drinks are expesnsive, breakfast included with my stay was not noteworthy - but I otherwise had a great time.

The James is an iconic NYC hotel I've stayed at several times, but recently I had an especially great visit. I went for a work trip and Natalie at the front desk was INCREDIBLY nice. She looked after my bags, let me order room service to the lobby when the room was taking a while to be prepared, and then upgraded me to a much nicer room on a quieter floor with striking views of NYC. Big thumbs up for service and for natalie in particular.

this place is a mess. unorganized. not clean. check in process is a nightmare. nobody has one clue as to what they're doing. they do not change the beds daily. it's overpriced. the lamp shades are falling apart.

Great atmosphere, super clean rooms, very decorative and modern and staff are very friendly. there is a pool a roof top, great breakfast. we got a full package for great price. We will be definitely coming back.

I regret not reading through other reviews outside of five-stars lucky enough to receive night-and-day service from what we felt was very absent service, and terrible value.As others have noted experiencing, our main issues were: sound, price, value, and issues with guest staff.We looked forward to having a great time at the pool and bar, especially since we paid the SoHo fee they said enabled them to provide complimentary cocktails. No one we spoke to could give us a straight answer on how to get them. One gentleman (we'll call him G, since providing names isn't one of James Hotel's strong suits) said we'd have to purchase a platter. Nothing in the booking said we had to purchase anything to receive the free welcome cocktail. In fact, the $40/night fee was paired with them saying we'd get a few things in return (that we never did).Funnily, G was standing right next to another person (manager?) after we brought it (and other items) to their intention. The manager said we were misinformed. When we noted the person standing right next to him literally just told us about the required pre-purchase, G just looked away and shrugged his shoulders.For the price, the room is very small even by NYC standards. While it notes floor to ceiling windows, they mean feet-above-the-floor-to-ceiling. Which is probably a good thing, considering they have the worst sound insulation (if any) of any place in NYC. The old surge protector on the night stand and randomly unplugged devices (lamp, iHome) were a nice touch. Do not go by what you see in the pictures.We were excited about the idea of hitting the pool. Maybe we accidentally booked on a birthday for teenagers, but it was hardly possible when even getting to our *room* was met with battling the crowds of teens / kids? on the elevators. There was a female apparently trying to operate the elevators, and she let us on eventually when the pool party attendants were set. So nice of them to let guests into their rooms!Had hoped for a more mature, fun bar pool setting versus what felt like an open pool in the middle of the day for teenagers, but that's not necessarily the hotel's fault. I understand that the pool/ bar area aren't the responsibility of the hotel (they made that abundantly clear when we addressed some of the issues with them). Ultimately, the noise became unbearable. We tolerated the first night because we checked in so late. The noise was especially intense late evening. We recorded what sounds like grinding and shifting. The second night added sounds of glasses dropping and scratching. Hoping it was just from construction or the bar and would fade, it actually woke us up the next morning.When we brought some of the issues we had in the evening, the manager said he was sorry, that they couldn't control what happened with the bar or other noise. During construction, hotels usually provide earplugs or a warning. At the James, it's apparently just not their issue. To the manager's credit, he did offer to upgrade us when we said we planned to leave (we were scheduled to stay for 3 additional days). But at that point, the noise was only one of a variety of issues. We checked out first thing the next morning (thanks, early AM noises, for making sure of that!).I almost raised the review to two-stars, because our last experience with the hotel was with a doorman we hadn't seen at that point, who was polite, prompt, and helpfully opened the doors for us and assisted with our luggage as we left. We told him that alone was night and day from everything else we'd received.The total cost for two nights was almost $1000. For that much, we could have stayed on Park Ave. with better food, better bars, no kids, no noise, and better entertainment. In fact, we got all of that at the next hotel for (much) less near Park Ave!If it weren't for the room making such a terrible first impression, and various staff (especially G) giving us the runaround, we might have stayed through our scheduled booking. Of course there will be weekends where noise and non-guests will be a factor in any hotel, especially one that's open to the public. But the cost, lack of ownership by (most, not all) of the staff, and lack of amenities just don't add up.

The hotel is very well situated but it has a big default and it was a big disppointement : the roof top and the pool close very early (2pm in the we and 4pm in the week) for "parties". When you have children and teens you have no access it's really a pity for the price and because the view is beautiful from there. No breakfast service only room service expeansive and not taken over quickly.

Not worth the money. Horrific check in process; careless front desk staff with little knowledge of who can access where (rooftop pool parties) and when (guests should have first dibs). The rooms are not well kept. The lamp shades are falling apart and they do not change the bedding despite your requests to.

Nice place, very clean, professional staff. Affordable and within walking distance of several great places to eat and shop. Roof top bar and pool are very nice. Pool is a little small but wasn’t crowded. Nice views from the roof top bar, good drinks.
user_name:
Rocky22160
New York City, New York

review_body: I checked into The James recently for an overnight business trip. During check-in, I casually mentioned that I had been having one of those travel days where nothing was going right. Kris and Bobby at the front desk immediately sprang into action offering me a complimentary upgrade of my room and a glass of wine to take the edge off. It was a very pleasant surprise. It is service like this that will have me coming back. On top of that, the bed was extremely comfortable and the location was in close proximity to everywhere I needed to be. I will definitely be returning to The James if my travels bring me back to the area. Thanks again, Kris and Bobby.

The hotel looks nice on the inside and the views from the a Penthouse are breathtaking. However, they may still be completing construction renovations, as a loud disruptive noise kept us awake. Also, the food service is slow and of poor value, if you can order at all. We received cold food after waiting over a hour and were told the next morning room service would be over a hour wait. This establishment really needs to make sure the staff and service provided matches the rates they’re asking customers to pay for rooms.

When we arrived we were immediately greeted by Johnny and Bobby. We had such a wonderful check in experience, these guys were extremely genuine and helpful, they made us feel right at home. We were given an upgrade, which was completely unexpected, but highly appreciated. Our room was a beautiful corner room with amazing views of the city. The gym was a bit small but it had everything needed for a great work out with great views of the city, I truly enjoyed my morning workouts. They provide cold water and fresh towels. The roof top has a pool with amazing views. Overall our stay was great, we were there for 6 nights and we did not want to leave.

The hotel was cool, small, quiet, chill vibe. The concierge/bellhop, Eric, truly made a difference for us. Great attitude and appropriate recommendations regarding Uber, taxi and restaurants. Very helpful

we stayed at the james,when we arrived our room´s air conditioning was leaking, the hotel made us wait 1.5 hours before we were transferred to another room, ok if they at least inform you that there might be a wait !! on arrival in the new room the sink was blocked and did not drain out water- the staff also said yes we will send somebody right away. which never happened. The rooms are run down , its not really possible to close the curtains as the tv is drilled to the concrete column in the room, the tv remote control was broken too. The hotel bikes were run down and in need of repair. The staff were rude and pretty confused, they did not know what the other was doing. in general HUGELY over priced and by the n if you pay extra for a high floor- donway that rooftop pool which is advertised is tiny and only open for hotel guest part of the day, the other part becomes a party nightclub space, so even if you pay extra for the 16th or 17th floor, don't as you won't be able to sleep. Go somewhere else - the choice in new york is huge.

In the heart of soho ultramodern and fabulous the roof top has a great lounge with little pool room are very modern clean and light The lobby are is very nicely decorated and offer computers coffe and snacks I enjoyed my stay very much

I was so blown away with my stay here. I found the room to be decent sized for NY with great views. The location is awesome with access to the subway and the greenway. I didn't get a chance to try the onsite dining but there are some great food options not far away! Great night sleep - will return! (The front desk staff were super nice - always a plus.)

Had a great time at the James the staff is beyond friendly, and super helpful. Stayed with my wife just to get out of the apartment for the weekend and sit by a pool. What better pool to sit by then one with a view like this!!
user_name:
Alex3513
New York City, New York

review_body: Angelique and Leslie were so very helpful when I stopped them to ask for information! They were kind and helpful and I was so thankful for their kindness! Even when seeing them again in passing, they made me feel so welcome and at home! What a great experience for my first time to NYC!

Had an awesome experience thanks to Bobby and Kris for making everything so much easier! ❤️❤️ The hotel has great amenities and an awesome rooftop! You have to check this place out if you’re in New York

Traveling for business but brought my wife along for evening in the city. The staff here was amazing. The bellman down stairs, I think Kenny and Wayne, could not have been friendly and helpful. We unfortunately had to drive in and they brought our car up early to prevent us from being charged another day for the extra hour we were there. Natalie at the front desk was also wonderful. We had a corner king room and the view was amazing. The room was small but typical for NYC. The shower was really nice though. The roof top pool and bar are an added bonus. The chairs up there are comfortable and it was nice for my wife to hang out there while I was working. On the weekends they have a pool party starting at 3PM. My wife and I went up and had a great time, but if you are not into that scene you may want to avoid and request a room on a lower floor. You could hear the music down the elevator shaft several floors. It didn't bother us, but I could see how some would be bothered.

The hotel is great in all the ways that count. Clean, great service but the extra touch was an awesome dude named Eric working there. Apart from just being a nice guy to talk to for a few minutes, he gave me great and most of all honest recommendations to places to eat and things to do during my 2 day stay. All in all a great place to stay but the great service from Eric made it a tad better than the competition!

Such friendly staff in NYC is almost impossible to find. What a gem! Johnny the manager is great. Super location, great rooms. Close to metro - Quiet & great amenities like roof bar, outside patio/seating under trees.

I am not sure where to begin....This place is amazing and with a professional staff and a great atmosphere. Let’s begin with the staff, a huge shoutout to Yu-On, Sasha, Mavis, Christina, Shefi, Johnni and even the pool boy, Michael. Wow what a team they have. These guys went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable even thought I was there for only 2 nights. The room was clean and pretty spacious for SoHo. This place has everything that one needs, a great rooftop bar, Jimmy’s, great staff, clean rooms and is closely located to the train. Thank you guys for a great stay and see ya soon!

As a frequent traveler to New York for business and pleasure, I've found many hotels that I love but The James is my favorite. The rooms are huge, the staff was extremely helpful and the location is ideal. I appreciated the many extras the hotel provides to make your stay comfortable like complimentary coffee, wine hour, and mini bar credit. This was my third stay at the hotel and I plan to return again this year.

Had another amazing stay at The James, SoHo! The location, views, and rooftop pool at this hotel are unbeatable. Hotel staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and we could even talk to the front desk via text message. Will definitely be back again!
user_name:
mlondon6
New York City, New York

review_body: Cool location, modern, good food, well meaning staff. But this hotel is not at the top of its game. Room was not well policed before I moved in, toilet missing a part, front entrance is not well staffed, took 2 days to notify me that I had a FedEx delivery. Staff is pleasant, but it all seems sorta of haphazard. A great hotel is about attention to the details. The James needs to sharpen up its game and focus on the details.

This hotel has a great location in Soho. Bellmen were so helpful and friendly! Beds were very comfy! They throw a pool party open to the public that starts at 3. from 3 on the pool is a mess. I would recommend this hotel for families or couples.

Great week at the hotel, staff accommodating, roof top was the extra treat with great views, music and staff. Rooms are spacious enough, some rework was done on the top floor and the gym needs some attention but overall great stay

Just back from a night at The James. The location is terrific and the hotel is the same - clean, modern, minimalist and stylish as hell, The rooms are comfortable and remarkably quite given the area. But the service is above and beyond. We had an unusually high numbers of special requests and Johnny (manager) and Natalie (reception) could not have been nicer and took care of us wonderfully. We will be back when we return to NYC. Highly recommended.

We travel to NYC with some frequency and love to stay in the SoHo area, so thought we would give The James a try. It is in an excellent location, has amazing rooftop views, the beds are very comfortable and the heated bathroom floor is a definite bonus. We had a 6th floor corner king, so, while the sunlight was great, we weren’t able to take in the views the higher floors offer. (We requested a higher floor but none were available.). The wine and cheese are a nice touch and the cookies and scones are amazing!!!! Unfortunately, this is where the greatness seems to end. For a 4-5 star hotel, they miss the mark on service. The hotel is VERY focused on the rooftop bar and almost seems to let the hotel and hotel guests take a back seat. After 5 pm it is near impossible to take an elevator to your room - especially if trying to catch one on the lobby (2nd floor). You are better to go to the ground floor to go up and hope you aren’t pushed out of the way by rooftop patrons. The hotel seems very understaffed with one person working the lobby area/registration desks, rarely a doorman or concierge to be found. The room was small, but to be expected in NYC. We had a very slow sink drain that was finally repaired after repeated requests - on the third of a four day stay. Worse, housekeeping never cleaned the residue from the slow drain. Walls are scuffed, curtain stained and a lot of dust and dirt build up on floor boards. There was a nice floor lamp - if you wanted to plug/unplug as needed. We could hear the guests above us every time they walked across the floor. tv would occasionally lose cable/satellite connection and you couldn’t access guest services etc.Unfortunately, this one did not live up to our expectations. Perhaps they were too high given the website and our past experiences with James hotels? Go for the location/views/rooftop party. Don’t stay for the attention to detail of a finer hotel or to expect top notch service.

The James Soho is a conveniently located, stylish, modern hotel. You can walk to the West Village, Greenwich village, Downtown, Lower East Side, and many subway stops. My wife and I are walkers so the location was a huge plus for us. If you want to shop till you drop, there are many many places nearby to spend $$$$. The hotel: Enjoyed the views from the rooftop. There’s a bar, indoor seating area, wading pool, and outdoor seating as well. Hallways and public areas look well maintained and clean. Large windows surround the lobby which brings in a lot of light. The design throughout the hotel is definitely modern but there are lots of warm tones that add a “homey” feeling to the spaces. Service: The door guys are really helpful. When we checked in they held our bags until our room was ready. Every time we needed a cab, they got one for us in a jiffy. Need an umbrella? They can also get those for you. Front desk staff were quick, efficient, and friendly. They gave us complimentary drink tickets so we went up to the rooftop bar and had some drinks while we waited for our room. We didn’t do room service or needed a valet so I can’t speak to those services. The room: We booked a suite with a separate living area and bedroom. It was very spacious and well appointed. The view from the 16th floor was stunning. Although we enjoyed our stay, there’s definitely room for improvement. On arrival, there were several issues with the room (housekeeping and engineering related). I won’t list them here because it was properly dealt with. I would say the room could use a refresh - couch pillows look worn, the bed was too lumpy and soft, and power strips behind the side tables are not efficient (don’t like reaching behind to plug things in!)Overall we really enjoyed our stay but we did encounter various issues with the room (which were acknowledged and resolved by the hotel staff).

amazing location! walking distance to my favorite soho streets - lots of high end shops (and low end), as well as cute brunch spots. i loved the wine, cheese and cookies the hotel provided for guests each night. it was very comforting and the hotel seems to attract cool guests
user_name:
Dream54108375082
New York City, New York

review_body: It was a short trip and unfortunately did not take advantage of all the amenities (sad). However, the room was really nice and the heated floor was an AWESOME touch. The only issue I had with the room was the lack of visible/available plugs. They were buried/invisible behind heavy curtains so you didn’t have the option of plugging it in comfortably by the bed/on both bed stands. Small thing that certainly didn’t take away from the overall experience. Most importantly, I was there for a post engagement celebration and Kris at the front desk was very accommodating to help us celebrate, she was awesome and I’m very appreciative she was able to work with me on such short notice (there was a miscommunication so we had to act quick). It really added to the whole weekend and I couldn’t have done it without her. It’s reasons like these that will bring me back to the The James Soho. Thank you!!

Check in process was ok. Lifts in the hotel extremely slow and at busy times the number of lifts isn't sufficient. Room size was ok and the bed was ok. Didn't like the glass bathroom/toilet wall. You could close this using a curtain. In room dining was a different experience. The in room dining team was too busy to answer up my phone call. Got transferred to guest relations and they would ask in room dining to call me back. After 30 minutes still no call back so called in room dining myself again. This time they did pick up. After 30 mins food was delivered but the geniuses provided me with 2 spoons and a fork. Not very handy if you want to cut your food. Called them again and after 10 minutes the knife was brought up. By that time for was cold. Upon check out the receptionist asked me whether I wanted a printed copy or an email version of the invoice. I asked for the invoice by email. Despite numerous chasers and my PA calling them, I'm still waiting for the invoice. Overall the facilities are decent, but the service levels are at the level of the hit series "Fawlty Towers". Wouldn't stay here again.

Love the James soho! It is a beautiful hotel—the amenities are great and Gitano’s is such a fab addition. Definitely recommend if you’re looking to stay in the Soho area. If you’re lucky, Bobby will be at the front desk to assist you—he’s a gem! So happy I stayed here.

Good location but difficult to get to due to one-way streets and limited parking. Room are very trendy but a little small. Bathrooms enclosed by glass and it limits privacy in room. Nice staff but you have to navigate bar patrons trying to get to rooftop.

This was my first visit to the James, and though it was a bit hard to find initially, I loved the hotel and location was great. However, the staff really made my experience there. The James provides glass bottles of filtered water instead of the usual plastic throw-aways (thank you for being green!), and housekeeping noticed that i liked to keep my water cold in the mini fridge. So when I emptied a bottle, they would make sure to put the replacements in the fridge for me. I thanked her and asked for an extra handsoap/lotion (amazing bath products there too), and she hooked me up. Whoever she was, she was my angel for the week while I was working in NYC. Oh, and did I mention they have happy hour and warm cookies for guests??? Would stay again.
user_name:
Christine W
Grosse Pointe Woods, Michigan

review_body: Dishonest pricing with initialBooking and final billing. Same goes for breakfast included? We did exactly what they said and ordered the breakfast they offered but they only comped part of it, that was not explained. The price is not worth the quality at all; the only reason we stayed was because of the pool and the pool staff was rude and inconsiderate the whole time and treating us like we were just random people not paying customers probably because we didn’t look rich enough.

I've been staying at The James about once a week for the past month or so for business. I am always warmly greeted by Natalie at the front desk. If late in the evening, she points me to a complementary glass of wine and cheese snacks in the lounge area; if in the afternoon, she reminds me about the cocktail hour, complementary late night cookie snacks and always offers tips on where to go for certain things (which I appreciate since I am not a local). The rooms are a decent size, for NYC, and always very clean. I like the minimalist design approach -- no clutter, nothing that is "too extra." Location is perfect for SoHo and that general area. The deli on the same block of the hotel has GREAT breakfast options like veggie omlettes and good coffee. They are open 24/7 if you miss room service at the hotel. Business travel isn't great -- but staying at The James makes it better!

Stayed at The James for 5 days and it was amazing. First, they had our room ready when we arrived at 8am. This was huge because we wanted to shower and start exploring. The staff was really friendly and went beyond to make you feel at home.

Excellent location, with luxury amenities, rooftop bar and pool. Staff friendly and accommodating. Complimentary coffee and snacks all day. Complimentary wine served 2 hours in the evenings nice compared to 1 hour at similar hotels
user_name:
Scenic35559981533
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This hotel is an absolute fraud. We paid 450$ for an upgraded room and at the front desk the “front office manger” wouldn’t spend more than 1 minute speaking to me. Johnny Houston (if he gave us the correct business card) the desk manager on shift Sunday June 2nd at 8pm told us we were not good enough to stay in his hotel. He was more than disrespectful, judgmental and rude acting like we weren’t trying to pay him $500 for a room here. I except to be treated with respect. Graduating with a hospitality degree myself, I know what is expected and I’m disgusted by this property and will never in my life let another person I know stay somewhere under the same ownership. I work for a hotel developer myself and Johnny would never in a million years be allowed to speak to any guest of my hotel ...He has 0 customer service skills and does not care in any way, shape, or form about what’s best for his property. Shame on you for hiring and Training your staff to have such little respect for high paying customers. Do better.

This hotel need a remodel including its staff who let the phone ring endlessly at guest services. Everyone is slow and requires multiple calls to get anything done. Everyone acts bothered when you ask for something. And don’t both getting a drink in the roof. You’ll be greeted with nothing but attitude.

Bobby was great at the front desk! Very attentive and great attitude. Also hotel is great:). The staff is very kind and friendly. The views were terrific! Gitano and jimmys are restaurants at the hotel that are very cool as well.

Great location with awesome amenities (morning scones, evening wine and cheese). Also love the rooftop bar. Stay here every time I come in for work. Service is phenomenal, they go the extra mile - Kris & Bobby are legends!

Thank you so much for the amazing hospitality and the wonderful accomodation! Super location @Gitano and @lobbythejames!Kris and Bobby are the best! We’ll be back here . Although the rain, sun is shining @thejames

We were so dissapointed by the rooms that we actually checked out after the first night and checked in to another hotel. The suite/ room was not maintained and seemed old and shabby. It was dirty in the bathroom, there was no duvet cover and stains at the duvet. The windows was bad isolated so we woke up several times during the night. We expected to pay around 900 for the room with taxes, but endes up prating 1350/ night because of all the extra they say is «complementary», invluded one breakfast. Thank god we only stayed there one night, or else the bill after five nights would be a big suprise. The staff was really nice and helpful, but the suite was just so far from the pictures and our expectations.

The service here is exceptional but the rooms need to be completely renovated. We were woken up at 8:00 by banging on the floors in the room directly above us which is ridiculous why we were put in that particular room to begin with. It was a Wednesday night so it wasn't sold out that's for sure. The location is great and they have a wonderful rooftop bar but this was the second time we tried this place and both times we were very dissatisfied.

When visiting New York you should absolutely consider Soho or The Village as your "Base Camp" The James is perfectly located in Soho very close to shopping, restaurants and everything downtown New York has to offer. A clean hotel with friendly staff and the view from #902 was spectacular. The rooftop bar was very busy and we never tried the restaurants, but this hotel is all about location, location, location. Btw, when we asked about a delayed check-out Terrill was very positive and gave an extra two hours without additional cost, thank you!!

Disappointed stay with poor service No effort to make client happyVery small gym room for such a big hotelEven no umbrella while it was raining and the personnel claiming the management knew the day before that it will be missing...Amazing and surprising way of welcoming clientsWould unfortunately never come back again

I have stayed at The James now a number of times; Chris and Tyrell at the front desk always making my stay glorious, as well as Kenny downstairs taking care of the car and my bags. 10/10 would stay againThanks guys!M

Staying at the James was truly a comfortable and pleasurable experience, the staff and the building itself are very nice! Especially to kristina! Thanks again to Kristina for helping me and my family out!
user_name:
AmazingAngela
New York City, New York

review_body: Fantastic hotel.Staff very exceptional and friendly.Check out the roof bar (Jimmy’s)Wont be disappointed.Great location.Bar food at Jimmy’s also tasty.Easy walk to local bars and restaurants.Giving a true feel of the non tourist New York.

We came to visit our family members who live in the City. This was a perfect base for shopping and sightseeing in the SoHo and Tribeca areas. Great service and clean rooms with great views over the City made it a place we will come back to soon.

Fantastic hotel, great location, excellent value for money would definitely stay here again and recommend to others. Friendly staff who couldn't do enough for you checking in process was very easy very happy with my overall stay.

Rooms are OK. The hotel overlooks a very busy road hence traffic noise in lower rooms and upper rooms have VERY loud bar . You get charged a $40 facilities fee each night which is a hidden cost and apparently to cover free coffee/wine that's offered early evening, neither of which I had but was still made to pay this ridiculous charge. There are much better hotels in the same area.

This hotel is the complete package: well-appointed rooms, excellent restaurant, fantastic rooftop bar, perfect location, good coffee in the morning and great WiFi access. But what really sets it apart is the staff. Shout out to Tyrel who gave my co-workers and I the white glove treatment - he made us feel like the James was a home away from home! I would definitely recommend to anyone traveling to NYC.

I had 3 days here for work, it was a great location, lovely rooms. Most of all the staff were incredibly helpful. Special shout out to Yu-On who helped me print stuff, and generally made me feel like nothing was too much for him. I will definitely stay here again.

Had a wonderful relaxing stay at the James New York SoHo. The front desk, valet and all the staff was very helpful. Shout out to Kris, the attention received from Kris was impeccable. Rooftop views were spectacular; picture perfect. Will be coming back soon.

Took my wife into the City for her first Mother's Day. Natalie and her team rolled out the red carpet and gave her an incredible VIP experience. It was very relaxing and such a wonderful experience. Can't wait to be back.
user_name:
samuelhchang
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff here is amazing and so welcoming. From the moment I checked in to getting extra wine during their free happy hour, their staff is SO friendly. The beds are super comfy and the rooms are nice and updated. There is even a facemask in the mini bar! They also offer free coffee and scones in the AM and free wine and cheese during happy hour. All lovely.However, it pains me to knock off stars because of the above aforementioned positives, but the walls in this hotel are so thin. I know it’s NYC, but I kept hearing random doors slamming and loud building noises all night long. Early in the morning I could hear an annoyingly loud dude screaming into his cell phone for a half hour, not even sure if he was in the room next to me or above me. You can hear every single person walking by your door at all hours. If you are a light sleeper/easily bothered by noise, this likely isn’t the hotel for you. If you love amenities, a cool location with awesome dining/rooftop bar, and can sleep through anything, you’ll be in good shape here.

We had to find a hotel room on short notice and everyone, especially Kris at reception, was very helpful and accommodating! The atmosphere in the lounge is very welcoming and relaxing, loved the wine and cheese hour. Definitely worth a visit!

The hotel and room were so nice, and the staff was incredibly friendly. I stayed for a quick work trip, and had a great time. Eric was amazing and so helpful with his restaurant recommendations as well as his help navigating the NYC subway, including walking me over to the stop so I could find it easily! Bryant at the Jimmy rooftop bar was also so friendly and awesome!! Highly recommend!

Chris & Natalie offer amazing service and great hotel with amazing roof top bar and swimming pool and great corner room at hotel. Roof top bar serves awesome cocktails with great bar snacks and service from all staff

As frequent business traveler. It feels good to stay at a hotel without being a Bon Voy member that treats its guest like Titanium members regardless. Kris, and Natalie treated me great. Will be back soon!

The best hostes! Really nice ! Will really go back.they drinks to the rooftop for me and my friends. Excellent serviceNatalie and kris were very welcoming bellman were friendly and very helpfulOverall anytime I visit New York this will be my to go place

Always love staying here, our 4th stay in NYC. Smart, well presented rooms, and great service. The front desk is ready to accommodate requests , in particular Jose Martinez. Tea coffee in the morning and Wine and cheese in the evening is a great touch in the buzzing Lobby.

We really enjoyed our weekend at The James NY in Soho. The staff was very accommodating especially Terril Kris who went out of his way to make sure we were happy. Great views, great neighborhood and great roof top bar.

I was so confused traveling from outside the city, but kris was able to direct me to the best places to eat/drink in SOHO, my trip would have been a bust without her. If i could give more stars I would.THANK YOU!!!!

had a great stay sleep with the windows open listening to the sounds of the city. The front desk staff member Kris she was very sweet. The manager Terill was very helpful when I ask to change my reservation

Ideal location, great price, exceptional hip hotel, and genuine warm welcome from a superior staff. Kris was especially charming and authentic. She checked us in at the lobby with glasses of wine, asked about our travel experience driving in, and upgraded us (as we had purchased through a hotel app). She connected with us on Mother’s Day plans that she had and we had; her mom should be as proud as her boss. Such a great person. Room: clean, bright and sunny, well arranged. Service: everything you’d want. Nothing excessive. James is a dependable hip line. Soho location adds super warm welcome to a great stay.

Whenever I come to NY for a shot holiday or a long week- end I stay at the James. The rooms and the facilities are great and the staff goes a long way to make you feel at home. Terrill and Kris have been great un taking care of me last time I was there in May.Thank you!

A very clean hosting a very friendly staff wonderful catered to all our needs and jumped to open the elevator for us when our hands were full carrying food or luggage. Nice restaurants close to the facility and downtown China town within walking distance.

Loved our stay st the James Soho. Rooms were well appointed and positioned in a great spot in soho. The rooftop bar (jimmys) was awesome aswell. The staff were always willing to assist and super friendly.

There are elements of this hotel which are great - it's in a great location, it's nicely designed, some of the staff are very friendly..However, the receptionists seem to be chosen for whether they look cool rather than how efficient they are...I was waiting for packages to be delivered which one particular lady swore blind hadn't come when they had - a simple check with the post room would have clarified this so I had to check out of the hotel without them having waited for an hour and half in reception for a courier who had already been..The same lady was actually standing next to deliveries when I arrived and also said nothing had come..The shower also smelled unpleasantly of damp ..To credit the hotel they have sent me the deliveries but since I live in another country this is not ideal..For the prices of this hotel charges I would expect a far higher level of service and I will not be back...

We were hesitant to book at a hotel that we hadn't stayed in, especially because we were traveling with our 2 year old. We were absolutely blown away by the staff and the hotel. Everyone was friendly and always willing to help or give our little one a treat. We had one very minor incident with the air conditioner and it was resolved immediately and we were even compensated for this. We will absolutely make this our go to hotel in NYC. The location is amazing too, short walks to Soho, Little Italy, Washington Square, etc. I think the one minor detail I'd suggest that they change is that their comforters aren't very thick, but we didn't even bother to try calling to see if they had something else - it was no big deal.

Kris and Terril were terrific at the front desk. Wonderful views - a must stay while in NYC. Close to Soho and great italian restaurants. The rooftop bar is lots of fun and we really appreciated the help from the staff.

Check in was quick . We were offered wine at check in. Natalie and Kris were amazing at the front desk! Views were beautiful ! Thank you Natalie and kris for making our stay memorable . We will definitely be coming back

First they couldn't find my reservation. I had to wait half an hour, though they knew I was coming around 11 PM and that I had been travelling from Europe, tired and with a kid. Then my room wasn't ready. I had requested a room for 2 adults and a kid with enough space, the extra bed wasn't there , and there was no space to circulate in the room at all, we had to jump over the beds. We had to wait till 1AM to go to sleep. then no breakfast restaurant, only in dinning poor breakfast...But no space to eat in the room, we sat on the beds...Room not even correctly cleaned...staff not helpful. Horrible experience we left after 24 hours. Do not go this is terrible place pretending to be 4 stars, must be a joke.

I have stayed at The James Soho on many occasions and it’s always a good time. The hotel is in walking distance to Tribeca, Soho and Chinatown plus it’s a short walk to the subway. So many great restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel.

Great experience and very friendly staff! The coffee was excellent and our room was very clean and simple. The location was central and felt safe. We did not get the chance to enjoy the rooftop bar but it has been highly recommended for the atmosphere and view!

If you are traveling to NYC The James is an absolute must. We travel to the City often from upstate NY, both for business, and pleasure. We used to stay at another place in town, until we found The James. We decided on a whim to give this place a try, and had no idea that we would make it our new home away from home.

It was a very enjoyable stay. The staff was great in every department. All the receptionists were super helpful and very polite. Leidy the receptionist was remarkable and super sweet. The Gyms nice too!

From check in to check out, everything was great. The property has a chic and elegant feel with lots of things to do within one building. The cafe, restaurant, and bars are all great places to hangout depending on your mood. The staff is very kind and helpful. Kris was great during my check in and stay! I will definitely come back here and encourage my NY friends to visit the rooftop and restaurant.

We book often with the James Soho for business trips to New York and we will keep going back because they always make sure they go above and beyond to make sure that we are taken care of. The staff is incredibly helpful and friendly and are always willing to address any special requests that we have in the most professional and courteous way. Special shoutout to Leidy for always making our stay so amazing.

Omar, Paul, Eric, and Kenny did a great job making us feel at home away from home.The rooms were clean as well as the bathrooms.The Room service was on time and available.Concierge services and staff did their job and were very courteous.They arranged a ride to the airport Central location to Sho and other good spots in the Area.

the james soho is gem in new york. The rooftop deck is spectacular with views of the lower end of manhattan. The rooms are clean and modern yet very comfortable I have stayed in many hotels in the soho / lower east side/ village area in New York and found the james to be one of the few I would recommend to others

Has been a great experience.The team was nice and trying to solve issues.Also a great location.Close to restaurants,Hudson jogging area,subway etc Will be our first choice if we return to NEW YORK Thanks to KRISTINA

A big shout out for the most welcoming person ( KRIS)FROM the front desk @ the James new york Soho hotel. She upgraded our room to a corner queen with an amazing view !! Infront of the freedom tower.! Complementary drinks before the wine hour . She is truley a friendly warm person . Highly recommended if you are looking for an amazing quality of service & good location!! Value for money . Book with confidence.

The James remains a fresh new option, even though it's been around for years now. The gym is outstanding, the rooms comfortable and spotless and service/courtesy very, very good. Their new coffee shop is hidden well enough that it's surprisingly quiet and provides great service. The doormen and as helpful as any in the city.

If you looking for a stylish hotel, it is the one suitable for you. It is located at the soho area where close to the canal st subway exit and easily reach by taxi. Super nice view from the room. Quiet at night and you can completely relax and fall sleep in the bed quickly

Kenny, every hotel needs a Kenny at the door but only the James has him. He made our stay so good, arriving a bit traumatised he madeus so welcome, sorted everything out and we felt like he was really looking after us. He had the weekend off and when we saw him again he remembered our names. The hotel is very good, quiet and with friendly staff. The room was comfy with nice bed, kettle inRoom, air con, decent shower room and a great view. The rooftop bar is astounding. When we return to NYC, the James will likely be our first choice. By the way, did I mention Kenny...?

Party hotel. Jimmy rooftop can be annoying when you're staying as a hotel guest. Waiting for elevators up to your room because of roof top guests coming in and out so having to ride it packed every time. We were on the 15th floor and could hear the DJ to 2am and then parties above us. Had the worst sleep here. We also found little things annoying like they didn't restock our bar fridge , we had no coffee in the room, phone didn't work and didn't have a TV remote. It was constant nuisances .

The staff at the hotel were exceptional! They went above and beyond for us at all times. Rooms are tiny but the view was great, and the rooms were very clean.We were surprised to discover there wasn’t a restaurant to eat in. Room service is available and you can eat in the lobby but the seating isn’t quite set up for eating up to a table. Rooftop was not open for children until pool season. Which we discovered was sometime at the end of May.

Excellent location. Efficient room layout. Great amenities including surprisingly spacious and well-equipped exercise room. Great friendly front desk and bell staff. Tasty morning and evening treats in lobby.

We stayed here in August 2018 and had a fantastic time in a corner suite with amazing views across to the Freedom Tower. Room was modern, moderate size, cool bathroom and good amenities all around. Very clean, friendly service, we loved the breakfast cakes, proximity to the subway and riding the hotel bikes. Didn’t really spend much time at the rooftop pool as we had expected we might, but couldn’t fault it. Thanks for a great stay, we’d certainly recommend it to friends and family

I stopped over for a conference in NYC for a few days and stayed at The James in SoHo. The complex was clean and had a great vibe to it, fitting nicely into the block and making use of a larger third(?) floor as the main lobby to service customers more fully. The rooms were nice and modern, with all that most would need and a nice set of room comforts (eg robes, mini-bar, etc).The rooftop bar was a nice place to snag a drink and hang out and overall I found the entire staff at the hotel to be attentive and friendly.

We had a good stay but on reflection this wasn’t the best hotel for a family. The bars are geared to couples and facilities are light. The location was good for Soho and Tribeca and the subway(A and C) was right outside on Canal.

We checked in at 11 am. He asked for my ID and card. And he asked for my phone number so that when the room is ready they would call since check in time is 3pm. I also told my partner to give his phone number just in case my phone dies. He didn’t explain any of the amenities of the hotel. We NEVER got a call. We came back to the hotel at 4 pm. The girl at the desk said our room was ready. I asked her “aren’t you guys suppose to call when the room is ready?” She said “ it was booked through a 3rd party so we don’t have that information.” (your phone number given at check in has nothing to do with booking with a third party or not- in my opinion and so a fact! ) she then said “I hope to see a smile on your face before you leave”.very professional. Later that night we were getting ready when the sink was not draining. I called guest services and they said they would send an engineer up after we have left the room. No one came... they also had white deuce tape on the wall to cover a hole (cover up problems instead of fixing them?) the whole time we were there we had a clogged sink and did not receive housekeeping or turn down service either (and no we did not have a DND on the door)... speaking of DND- on our full last day I came to the hotel at 2pm to take a nap and took medication that makes me drowsy For an injury that I have. Housekeeping came in when I had a DND on the door while I was sleeping naked in my bed and left towels next to the bed. I called and spoke to the manger named Jonathon or Johnny and said he would investigate and get back to me. I gave him my cell phone number. I never received a call from him. we had a great time enjoying New York City, but over all a horrible experience at the hotel. I would not stay again. The staff do not care and have a very “go with the flow care free vibe”.

Great views and generally nice accommodations in lovely SOHO. Front desk staff varied in their attitude and helpfulness. The gym was nicely equipped and had an amazing view on the 17th floor. Fabulous scones in the morning available in the lobby.

I used to stay at the James for several years but have not been back for about four years. It is not quite as good as it was before, and needs refreshing in several respects, but it is still very good. The good touches are the scones, fruit, cheese and biscuits in the lounge at different times of day; and the corner rooms are very pleasant indeed. Now the poor aspects of which there are far too many. I don't think that there are enough staff: when I arrived, the doorman was nowhere to be seen and so I had to lug my luggage up to the Reception. I was early for check in and so the desk staff told me that they would call me when my room was ready - but they didn't. One had often to ask the staff to replenish the coffee or the cheese and biscuits in the lounge area.- they tended to ignore it. The windows of my room were dirty, which spoiled one of the views. The outside terrace was not particularly inviting: they should have prepared it already for Spring. There is a roof top bar which attracts lots of younger people - not a bad thing but it meant that the lifts were irritatingly slow in the evenings. But worst of all was that I received an email on my very first evening from management inviting my comments - and despite the fact that I responded with some of the above, they never condescended either to acknowledge my email or to provide me with a substantive reply. That tells one something about the general approach in the hotel. So, a long list of irritations (above) but, fundamentally, still a very good hotel. Yet far short of how good it used to be. Will I return? Not sure.

Amazing customer service coming in, especially Kris at the front desk! Made us feel extremely welcome and comfortable as soon as we came in! Even familiarized ya with the area so much that we feel like locals already! Service with a smile really pays off! :)

From a business perspective - the internet was down. Quality and speed was very poor. Confirmed by their IT company that they had purchased the lowest speed. I lost 2 hours productivity as a result. Phone was out of order. TV was down due to HD not working. The "working area" of the room was sub-par. Only 1 plug several feet away from the desk so couldn't plug in phone and laptop. There was NO desktop lamp and as the overall lighting in the "suite" was very poor - this became a problem. I literally had to turn the desk around to get light from the bedside tables. Quite simply I would not stay here again as it is not set up to support a business professional. The biggest PLUS however is the staff. There was a significant difference in the caliber of the people and the interest, care and concern they took with you. I was very impressed by the staff across the board and cannot say enough good things about everyone -- from the engineer, to front desk, to the hotel manager.
user_name:
Adventure32018292262
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Location was key! Loved the look of the hotel! Very hip. Staff were helpful specially Kenny the bellman. Complimentary scones and coffee in the morning and , wine and cheese at 6pm was a nice touch. Lobby is just the right size.

Unprofessional management. Too many things went wrong. Size of bed of deluxe king room is not king bed, they have their own standards of sizes of beds. The whole floor did not Have a working telephone so communication with front desk or room service was not possible. Bathroom had a leakage they could not fix. Their suggestion was that I find a different hotel and they will not charge a penalty for early departure. Requested a written explanation of king bed sizes and they refused. On departure they withdrew the facility fee as compensation. Got charged for a bill at one of the hotels establishments I never set foot on.

I’ve been coming to NYC about 7 times a year and have stayed all over the city for many years.This hotel is always my first choice if I can afford it. I never get stuck in a dark room on a courtyard. I think all rooms face a street and have lots of light, and are so clean with wood floors. It’s in a great location with many little restaurants and shops. Although I don’t bring my dog, I love that you can, and it makes an atmosphere that is relaxed.

Corner room was amazing. The staff was very kind and aimed to please. The rooftop lounge was fun with great drinks. Loved the room. Very clean. Service is impeccable. Loved every moment of my stay and especially the location. Soho is just a great location. This hotel is the best hotel in the area.

Great staff and a cosy small feel. Love the coffee and scones in the morning. Wine and cheese at evening. Staff is friendly and helpful. Wonderful large towels. Housekeepers were always quick and efficient.

The staff at James Hotel SOHO outdid themselves- we had a fabulous celebration weekend staying at this Hotel- my niece turned 16 and was not permitted to view the Jimmy Rooftop, but Kris and Terrell gave us a special peek and allowed us to enjoy the fabulous view for a bit before it officially opened for the evening! On my nieces birthday, Kris, Terrill, Natalie, Julian and Johnny presented her with gorgeous balloons and cheesecake pops! This will always be our Hotel of choice- cannot find a better staff and service! Also fantastic location!
user_name:
bsohn35
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a fantastic hotel in a great location. The welcome we received was superb, the hotel is clean and modern whilst the rooms are good-sized, clean and fresh.Be careful with the $40 a night tax that they didn't mention covers the wine in reception and the mini barThe staff couldn't be more helpful and we thoroughly enjoyed our stayI'd avoid Jimmy's Bar though - the views are stunning but the prices are eye-watering
user_name:
rossrobson
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Our family enjoyed our weekend at the James. The Soho location is perfect with shopping and restaurants within walking distance. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The staff was incredibly welcoming and responsive to all our needs, especially Kris, Natalie and Terri. The hotel does become a bit of scene with The Jungle and rooftop bar. Overall this hotel met and even exceeded our expectations and we will look forward to returning.

I've stayed here in the past and remember it being cleaner, more modern and well-kept than it was. It doesn't appear to have been kept up over the last couple of years. The mattress was lumpy and the room seemed didn't seem very clean. The food options were also very limited, we had to walk to another close hotel to have breakfast.

This is a really nice hotel. The room is beautiful and the neighborhood is excellent but the staff are what make this hotel absolutely wonderful. I stayed here with my boyfriend for his birthday and they went above and beyond to make sure that we had an excellent experience. Kris, Natalie, Mavis, and Terril thank you so much for everything!! You guys rock!

The hotel is clean and stylish, conveniently located near the prime Soho shopping district. The staff is kind, attentive, efficient, willing to help, and personable. The manager on duty, Johnny, took note of my interest in a room with a view and change my room assignment to accommodate (room 1202). And the view was JUST WHAT I WANTED! My sleep felt safe, sound, and luxurious.
user_name:
Wanderer11244958610
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Kriss was amazing at the front desk. We had a late flight on the way back and she did everything possible to accommodate our late checkout. The rooms were impeccably clean, very ample bathrooms with floor warmers. Great location in Soho

We stayed at The James for 7 nights.The hotel is located in the soho area of Manhattan. Canal street, Chinatown and little Italy are all just a short walk away. There is also a couple of subway stations nearby. Which helps you to get around the city.The rooms are small but functional, with all the necessary amenities needed.There is a rooftop bar/pool area which is small but very nice, which offer great views of the city.The staff are very friendly and attentive. Special mentions must go to Erica, who provided us with excellent housekeeping service. Mavis on the front desk who organised for us to have a late check out and Kenny who organised our airport transfer with the greatest of ease.We loved staying at this hotel, it is a great base for exploring this wonderfulCity. We would definitely recommend staying here, especially if you want to escape the manic-ness of times sq.

We came here for our 1st anniversary and really loved this hotel! Upon arriving we were given an upgraded room as well as a bottle of wine and 2 complimentary drinks to celebrate our anniversary! So nice! Our room was spacious and the bathroom was big as well, great windows and view of the city. So many hotels give you a view of another brick building or a courtyard, this was a nice treat. $10 per day to use in the mini bar, that was cool too! Our first night was rainy and cold so we tried to go downstairs (w/o reservations) to Gitano, and unfortunately they were booked, it was a cool trendy place, I would have made reservations had I known. Our second night was beautiful weather, so before dinner we figured we'd head to their rooftop The Jimmy for our free drinks, before we got into the elevator we could hear loud music coming down the shaft, the elevator going up was packed, once we got up there, we realized we were at a pretty popular rooftop w/ a DJ etc. at 6:30 pm. It took a bit to get our drinks, but the view and sunset was gorgeous for our short stay before dinner. We had ordered room service breakfast and that was probably the most disappointing- waffles were too cold and rubbery for butter to melt . Not a huge deal, but for $70 just get ready and go out some place near by in soho or tribeca. Also if you want a late checkout, call early, they couldn't accommodate us because they had given out too many already that morning. Otherwise awesome stay and location!

Checked in tonight for a one night stay on the seventeenth floor. This is a true boutique hotel with a lovely, sort of hidden away-feeling entrance (you ride up a glass elevator out of what feels like a residential entry foyer) to a cozy lobby decorated with some truly spectacular art — love the Lindsey Adelman chandeliers throughout! We were exhausted and starving after a day of delayed travel; front desk employees were polite, laid back, and lightening fast (think they sensed we wanted to get up to the room as soon as possible & were very accommodating.) They made sure we were able to get onto the wifi before we headed upstairs to our room. The room itself feels classic Soho: floor to ceiling windows, very efficient use of space, industrial touches mixed with rich dark chocolate tones, very well thought out. The complimentary glass bottled water, hardwood floors, fast & efficient 24-hour room service, heavenly smelling en-shower amenities, and lack of street noise all add up to what feels like a true 5 star boutique hotel. Will be back for sure.
user_name:
frances w
New York City, New York

review_body: Nice sized rooms for lower Manhattan, the staff is great and very friendly/helpful. Definitely making will consider making this a regular home away from home when I'm working in NYC. Excellent view from the bar and pool on the roof.

Want to take a moment to thank Kris for her warm reception upon check in. Her smile was infectious and she gave us a great start to our unplanned staycation in NYC. Hope you continue sharing your enthusiasm as a guest it was much appreciated.

Great location, very near shopping area in Soho. They offer unlimited wine from 6-7pm. Loved their room, great view, very spacious and tidy. I would stay here again next time I visit New York. Thumbs up to this property!

My husband and I last minute decided to stay over at The James. We were greeted by two very friendly and helpful young ladies Natalie and Chris. Natalie had a great personality and after a 2 hour drive in traffic she immediately brought a smile and an upgraded suite to us! Great short visit ,in a great part of NYC. Would definitely come back.

I love the James. The staff is so service oriented and wonderful. Nice and so accommodating, it puts this beautiful and chic hotel above the so many chic hotels in New York. Leidy and Yami were wonderful.

Stayed here 3 nights with my wife. Great location near Canal and Sixth. There is this amazing coffeeshop across Grand Street from it. Greeting by friendly doorman Dennis - great conversation. We showed up a little bit early but they let us store our bags, and had our room ready before 3 PM. As above, a smallish type room but very comfortable and very cozy. Would have liked to have caffeinated coffee packets but that's about all I can complain about!

We had such a comfortable stay in NYC at The James New York. The staff were always more than happy to help and give advice on places to visit and eat. In particular Terrill Kris and Natalie who were so friendly and helpful. Great central location and stylish hotel.

Pleasant service, easy check in, great hospitality. They provided a room I had in the past and I enjoyed the experience. Great location for bars, gyms, and people who want to head to the meat packing district.

Offers a lot. Cool rooms great use of space. Awesome baths, rooms are awesome open modern but still private and quiet. Great views. Staff at Check-In very welcoming. 2 great restaurants and a cool rooftop bar/pool. Nice gym with views. Location is perfect centrally located downtown in soho.

Check in was exceptional! Very informative. Gave us two free drinks after we booked reservations at the Jungle restaurant downstairs. Natalie & Kris at the front desk were terrific. Great service all around. Will definitely be staying here again.

This hotel was quite a find. First stayed here b/c of a Gilt City deal. It is in a great location on Grand Street. The roms are lovely (typical NYC size, maybe a little bigger), comfortable bed and sitting area, and a view of the surrounding downtown area. You are close to Brooklyn, and itis near a subway stop. It is also centrally-located in SoHo, making it an easy walk to shopping and restaurants. The staff are very accommodating, and they are all extremely friendly. My husband and/or my husband and two daughters have now stayed here three times, and I think this is our go-to if we want to stay downtown. I've always been a Marriott girl, but The James may make me switch, at least for NYC purposes. Who can argue with a complimentary wine & cheese happy hour every evening? Cheers!

Overall a very good stay. Starting with the positives:- Rooms and bathrooms are clean, light and well appointed. House keeping did an excellent job each day. Bed was very comfy- Receptionists and those on the desk on the ground floor were all very friendly- Free wine each evening was very nice- Great location, close to main Soho and easy access to Subway- Good value for NYC- Views from Rooftop bar were stunningThe not so good:- Requested a quiet room but was told the only room available was close to lifts ( this was after check in time). I said I would take it as I didn't want to wait for another room to become available. The lift noise was fine - however the noise from Jimmys was unbelievably loud on the Saturday evening and this wasn't mentioned to me at check in.- Welcome cocktails are only given if you book dinner at the restaurant . We didn't want to eat at the hotel as we had already made reservations for our stay so we didn't get these drinks. As your welcome drinks are supposedly included in your resort fee they should be included regardless of whether you have dinner or not- There is free coffee and biscuits provided each morning. They should provide tea for any non coffee drinkers. Personally I think mini croissants or something similar would be more popular than the biscuits as there seemed to be a heap of them left over each morning- There is 10 dollars credit for the minibar each day of your stay. There was no price list in my room so I had to ask at reception. Items that I took weren't replaced - is this to make you buy the items that cost more that 10dollars?- Staff at Jimmys were not friendly at all with the exception of the girls that did table service. Overall, I would stay here again as I loved the views, the bedrooms and the location is great.

Great stay! The staff was friendly and accommodating (every evening, they serve wine and cheese in the lobby. On our second night, we went downstairs around 7:45 and sadly there was no more cheese on the serving tray. I asked a young man at the desk if there was any left and he said sadly they ran out...I said OK and went back to my room... the following night, when we got back from a play, on the table was a big platter of cheese, crackers and grapes sitting there waiting for us - how amazing!! I’m still wondering how he found out which room we were staying in!All that to say, that the room was clean and bed comfortable, lots of restaurants and shopping stores nearby, subway is within walking distance and finally, many of the streets were paved in cobblestones...Can’t wait to stay there again!

The staff was super friendly and the suite was perfect for 2 other girlfriends. The bathroom was big enough to get ready in and the decor was just right! They have a great rooftop bar called the jimmy with spectacular views of the city. It’s perfexrly located from all the great shopping on broadway. I highly recommend this hotel and would come back!
user_name:
Scenic35528645128
New York City, New York

review_body: The fact no breakfast was possible outside of rooms is an issue. The prices and quality of in-room breakfast are an issue. The few cakes and fruits served in the lobby are miserable considering we pay 47USD per day for this. No late-check out, even a paid one, except for poor 30 minutes, is an issue for a business traveler who has a late flight. Pool is not heated and only symbolic.Rooms were very clean and ok.

I had to stay at the James because of my job for a night but wow! I was really impressed with the multiple amenities (wine and cheese hour!) along with the different bars/ restaurants in the building. We had a blast! Will be booking with the James again P.S special shoutouts to Yuon for helping us make our stay extra special with the drink vouchers!

Had a great stay at the James Soho for a week - we stayed on floor 14 and the view was lovely. The location is great for a more quiet and genuine NY experience, streets away from fantastic restaurants (Carbone, Cipriani's etc) as well as shopping. Very close to canal st subway which is very well connected.
