while i typically stay at Starwood properties, i thought i'd branch out on my last trip to NYC. i've always liked The James, and it's near my friend's office - so I decided to give it a go. upon landing in the city, i went straight to my meetings - while giving the hotel a call to let them know i would be checking in around 2pm (which i was assured would be no issue). my meetings ran over, and by the time i arrived at 4pm my room still wasn't ready. although the wait wasn't longer than 10 mins, it was still frustrating. once i made it into the room, i immediately noticed deep scratches on the banquette, chipped tiles in the bathroom, and sub-par quality bathroom amenities - not to mention that there were no bathrobes. fine, still not ideal - but not worth getting bent out of shape over. the last straw came upon checkout - when i was on the airplane and got an alert for a $65 charge from the hotel. it seems that someone mistakenly charged me for use of the minibar - excusable, surely they've made a mistake. fast-forward two weeks, the hotel refuses to call me back to straighten out the charge, exclusively communicating via email and insisting that i was wrong and that Rebecca, their Director of F&B is certain that i consumed a bottle of alcohol and used a "charging kit". not gonna fly, and i very much look forward to hearing from Rebecca ASAP.

Stayed for week long work trip. Loved location and design but the place could do much more to feel like home. Pool (reason booked) is often closed for private events and hosts loud party each fri-sun.

Overall great experience with the hotel. We arrived very early our first day, many hours before our check in time. Exhausted from our flight in the day before, the team was very helpful in rushing a room for us and allowing us to check in earlier so we can sleep. The rooms themselves exceeded my expectations with room,size, comfort, views, and amenities. Located in a great part of town with great options for food and shopping. They were very helpful in checking our bags before check in and after check out since our flight was later in the day. On our way out, they offered us a car service instead of us taking an uber to the airport. We accepted and our driver was awesome and knew the side roads and shortcuts, seeing as it was raining and the highway was packed bumper to bumper, we made our flight. The rooftop pool and bar is awesome and their pool parties are something to check out. Located near canal st. Station, it was very easy to get anywhere using the subways. Highly recommended location to stay.

Firstly the good - the hotel is in a fabulous spot, being right in the middle of SoHo. All the staff were very friendly and the bars are lively and buzzy. The room was pretty small, but it had all we needed. Now the bad. The hotel charges a resort fee on top of what you have already paid. It's thirty dollars per day plus tax and is not negotiable. They do this so they can advertise a lower rate and also pay a lower tax to the city. This fee includes wifi, tea and coffee, some drinks and pool access. We stayed for seven days and the pool was unavailable for three days. Therefore we refused to pay the resort fee for these days and to be fair the hotel did take these off the overall bill. If the hotel had simply included these fees in the price, we would have not quibbled at all. The fact is that it's a bit of an underhand means of extracting more money from you as a guest, as well as them saving a small amount of tax. Shame really, as this review would been higher otherwise. Lastly for some inexplicable reason, the hotel treated our double room as a single occupancy. Consequently we had one glass, one dressing gown, one towel, etc. We complained about this twice but it was never rectified.

We had high hopes for this hotel having seen the impressive pictures on TA and their website. However, the overall experience was mixed. First of all we discovered when we arrived (and it was in the small print on our Expedia booking form) that we were going to be charged a compulsory US$30 per night plus TAX 'Resort Fee'. When we asked what this was for - we were told it was for the tea and coffee in reception (which we never used), the 2 x free drinks vouchers each upon arrival and the use of the pool (which was off limits to us for 3 days out of 7 due to private functions - to be fair they did credit us 2 x $30 back for this inconvenience). The rooftop bar Jimmys is a great pull for the hotel and was a fun place to hang out. However, no priority is given in the lifts for guests and twice over the weekend (between 7-9pm) we had to take the stairs from our 7th floor room to get to ground level as the lifts were full of young partygoers to Jimmys. The rooms themselves are tiny. The floors were quite dusty and I'd give it a 7/10 for cleanliness. We made the mistake half way through our visit to leave all our change on the table - which was taken as a tip by the cleaner (she did leave us a nice note though).Overall the location of this hotel was a winner and the staff were friendly.

We stayed for three nights in this trendy downtown hotel in New York. We had 2 rooms, a deluxe for my wife and I and a standard for ours sons (22&20). The rooms were smallish but nice and the beds very comfortable. The boys room was on a corner of the hotel with double aspect windows giving a great view. The bathrooms are separated by glass and have a vanity blind you can shut when necessary. Unfortunately our blind was broken and had been taken away. We spoke to the hotel about this and they offered to move us, we declined as we had already unpacked and after 7 previous hotels on the trip were getting fed up of packing an re-packing. I did suggest to the hotel that they could have avoided putting anyone in this room until it had been fixed!The hotel offers complimentary coffee & croissants in the morning and wine in the evening for a limited time - but not worth getting excited about.They have a roof top bar and pool which sounds great except that the pool shuts very early or is booked out for private functions!! The rooftop bar attracts a lot of young hip people which means the lifts are very slow and often full of non-residents which was a bit annoying, especially the rude, presumably drunk ones.The hotel location is excellent for touring around Manhattan.The Wifi was a bit 'iffy' - fairly low speed (considering in New York) and often unobtainable on mobile.

The rooms are tiny. I know it's New York, but for the price I would expect a little more space. The location is good and the rooftop bar has incredible views. If you're traveling for business, the workspace is pretty uncomfortable. This is ok for short stays.
user_name:
Laura V
Panama City, Panama, Panama

review_body: The lobby is on the ground level. Ron from Reservations checked us in and he was so gracious and wonderful as we checked in at midnight and he was super nice. The Rooftop is so on! Luckily we stayed on the 9th floor.The scones and coffee in the morning are a wonderful touch. Best scones EVER!!!! the rooms are super nice and the location is fantastic. David Burke's breakfast is one of the best places to have breakfast. My only feedback would be the elevators are super slow and since they're shared with the public wanting to go to the rooftop so the hotel guests have to wait forever to go up to their rooms. Hope they can figure this one out. It is a good problem for the proprietors but unfortunately, not for hotel guests with lots of shopping bags.All in all, one of the nicest hotels...

I haven't had so much fun in such a long time! Joined some besties for a bachelorette party - had a super fun time. From the time I walked in the door I was like - this is a special place! Would love to go back. A big thank you to #mimi for making it special for us gals!

I was excited upon checkin to be staying on the 17th floor. Great views, but too close to the party scene on the rooftop. Obnoxiously loud until 2 am. Staff was running between 17th and rooftop all night. GREAT staff, excellent space and restaurant. Great location in SOHO. Free, comfy bikes to use. Spacious rooms for a boutique hotel. Awesome rooftop pool (although again, I had no idea until I booked that the pool closes at 2 and then opens at 3 for 21+ non-guests- so my kids could not even enjoy the pool in the hot afternoon)

After having an underwhelming experience at the 1Hotel Brooklyn Bridge, my girlfriend and I migrated over to "Jimmy at the James" and it was simply EXCELLENT! We were warmly greeted, quickly escorted to the roof where a cool, authentically eclectic NYC atmosphere pervades, I quickly got into my swim trunks, and the food and cocktails flowed. The DJ treated patrons to a smooth mix of Old & New school Reggae as all celebrated the summer winding down. I highly recommend this SOHO gem to all who want to party with the "Cool Kids" yet not pay $1500 for a bottle of Belvedere to enter which ACTUAL cool people know is patently uncool.
user_name:
seantrader2001
New York City, New York

review_body: We enjoyed our stay. We had a family reunion and the staff was very accommodating. As a group we were quoted 1 price but as the time got closer, we got sales that were a cheaper price, so be aware that you are getting the best deal. He most disappointing was the poor and rooftop bar. Do not expect to relax and unwind. It is open to the public and is basically a "club" for 20-30 year olds. Would not take the kids up there. Otherwise all was good.

Cheers to the best, most professional staff in town. The crew made us feel like home. Cheers to #mimi and #john and #brian for exceptional service and just being super cool. Champagne, strawberries, anything we wanted before we know we needed it. The best place to be on a Saturday afternoon.

I live in nyc and recently needed a place to stay while some renovations were made in my apt. I work in Soho, so wanted a space nearby. The James is affordable with a high end vibe. Room was small but with a comfortable King size bed and nice views from the large floor to ceiling windows. Nice roof top space to hang. Front desk staff was friendly. My only complaint is that I needed to do some work and the table and chair was more for lounging. Otherwise, I'd stay there again for sure

We chose the James for a staycation last summer and it was a lovely break. We enjoyed the rooftop bar and brought our little spaniel. The hotel was dog friendly. We especially enjoyed the David Burke restaurant. The staff and food there were amazing. It was convenient and relaxing, all we were looking for. We had a terrific corner room with windows on 2 sides.The only issue is with the wicker tray placed on the table to hold minibar items, glasses, etc. I had assembled several drinks on the tray and when I lifted it, the glasses all flew out of the bottom and shattered in the room. The hotel promptly send 3 people in for a cleanup but trays (and it had handles so I was not mistaken) should not have holes in the middle.
user_name:
Am212ny
New York City, New York

review_body: Very urban, fantastic location and offers an alternative approach to a classic luxury hotel experience.Everything you need is there, but not more.Minimalist and basic, but comfortable enough and a nice place to call a temporary home.Can definitely do better in terms of having darker rooms if you don't like waking up to sunlight but it is definitely a good option when in NYC* this review is written based on my experience 2 years ago

The location of the James couldnt be better but for a 4-5**** hotel, this hotel is not up to par and is nowhere near a hotel of the same caliber (or cost) in London, Tokyo or other major cities globally. What we liked: great neighborhood, comfortable bed, helpful doorman, chic comfy lobby (as long as you avoided desk staff) with free wine/ happy hour and breakfast pastries and coffee, decent wifi. Close to shopping and cafes. nightlife, great garden bar, and a very happening (but way too noisy) rooftop pool and bar. Downsides: that happening rooftop bar makes sleeping difficult for hotel guests on weekend nights on higher floors -- a sure sign this hotel has its priorities wrong. Rooms weren't ready at check-in time, lobby staff are standoffish and unhelpful (we got more help at a Hampton Inn on our way to NYC), rooms are small, I got locked in our bathroom when the inside door handle fell off, and water dripped on us from a roof vent when sitting on the toilet. Breakfast included rate not a good bet given proximity of cafes and delis. (Usual weekend brekkie cost is $21 pp). All in all, not what we were expecting at this price point or amenity level.

The James New York Soho is very well located in Soho - our favourite area in New York. The hotel is small, but cosy and with a nice roof top bar. However, the services are rather expensive and the staff less friendly than you would expect. There is no mistake to stay here, but likely there are other and better choices in the SOHO area!

We really enjoyed our stay at The James Soho. Everyone was exceptionally nice and helpful. We used the entire facility (rooftop lounge/bar, rooftop pool, workout room, concierge services, restaurant downstairs, lobby happy hour) and had a wonderful time. Highly recommended!

The view from this hotel is priceless and to top it off the lovely rooftop pool outdoor garden I have stayed in many different hotels around the city and this one by far is one of my favorite would definitely stay again

I travel a lot to NYC, LDN and HK for work and arrived at this hotel hopeful. I was on work for 6 days in the city with a colleague who also stayed at the hotel, we had heard good things about the James. Unfortunately my expectations were missed. I guess its all about what you want out of your trip to NYC. For a person in NYC for work, this hotel misses the mark big time for me. Pros- good room, size is small but in NYC or London i think this is perfectly fine. Light - good linen, nice min-bar, and standing shower, a big plus for the downtown hotels.- nice ground floor bar/ garden terrrace - good staff here, very friendly, attentive and the food is good. (in honesty would have preferred to hang at the pool after 8hrs of meetings hitting the streets, but we'll get onto that later.- West Soho location is decent - quick to the west side promenade for running, and into tribeca for good restos. - fast wifi in roomsCons-Noise - If you are on one fo the top 2 floors (my colleague) - you can hear the gym in your bedroom. and at night - the Pool party musci is clearly audible... so dont request a top floor room. Try not to get a low floo, i had one facing 6th/Canal - it is very noisy from traffic, put the fan on high to mute the noise and that worked. THe hotel in fairness has done its best to doubel glaze the windows.The POOL - now i knew the James did Pool parties, i didnt know they did them EVERY NIGHT. Fine my fault for not checking, but I dont know if they're even in control of this are or have sub-letted it out to an operator, but guests enjoyment and consideration aren't the key stroke here, its about sellign alot of alcohol to people from other hotels. I get the whole vibe on a weekend - no ones working and guests can use the hotel pool till 2pm.. i can accept that, hey even throw in Friday i get it - its NYC and party time, But for people who work and come back at 4pm.. to find the pool is closed monday - Thursday from 4pm.. especially in sumer, it just sucks... you've been in meetings all day, it's 30 degrees outside, and all you want to do is grab a beer and sit by the pool, and you get told its closed to get ready for the pool party, so that people not staying in the hotel can come and have a party. And on Thursday it only opens at 9am... The reason i mentioned the staff at the terrace and wonder if the hotel runs the pool operation, the staff at the pool are terrible at anything, just getting a water seems an uphill task. Way more interested in their card game inside at the bar.... i mean seriously NYC city of service delivery... Way below par for this standard of hotel.- Room service - took over 90mins for my breakfast to arrive, so just left without eating it. - Check in - area.. ummmm the portable desk.. Staff at check in were great.- Front doorman - was sometimes there - sometimes he wasn't.... He was very interested in his mobile phone when he was there, and saw multiple guests hacking with their bags, while he just sat idly by. - If here for work... no work desk, there is small table in an odd place in room but it doesnt work well. As with my title its all about expectaions - if you're here to be out and party it up at that pool as party destiantion - chose this hotel. If you're travelling for work, or base to explore and chill for 5 days in the city this is not the place for you... doubt i'll return.

Booked 2 rooms here, one for me and one for my son. We had a corner king, and a suite on the upper floor. The view was spectacular from the suite. The customer service was excellent. The Jimmy rooftop bar was great - good music and atmosphere. Would stay here again, and would recommend.

If you're looking for brash, tacky & touristy....then this is NOT the hotel for you! It is easy to see why The James has been used as for many filming locations - including the gritty series Power, & rom-com The Other Woman. In fact the first day we stepped out of the hotel, we walked straight into a film set, complete with vintage cars, handsome looking actors & a touch of lights, camera, action! Already I was in love with the district! When looking for hotels in 'The Big Apple', we knew we wanted to stay somewhere that was more intimate but still had the NY 'Wow' factor - & The James didn't disapppoint. Our room which was minimalist & exceptionally spacious, had great views of the financial district, trendy Tribeca & Soho & Chelsea. Each day we were greeted by the site of The Freedom Tower - which at night lit up & was a humble reminder of how amazing and vibrant NYC is. On our first day, we were looked after by several wonderful staff - who seemed very proud to work for the hotel. Nothing was too much trouble throughout our stay. One of the most lovely little touches was the complimentary cheese and biscuits along with red wine, served in the lobby early each evening. This was a welcomed treat, especially after a long day of walking around the city. It also enabled us to have a reason to casually chat with other hotel guests & because of this we met some amazing people. The James also takes their love of art very seriously. This apparent on entry, when you are met by the most unique stairwell wall, created with pieces of a keyboard. All of the original artwork throughout the hotel is stunning, and there is always something to look at. Add this to the amazing rooftop bar, along with the famous David Burke restaurant & you have a hotel that is 'Soho' hard to beat.

Overall I loved my stay. The room decor simple, bright, very relaxing. The view was excellent. The rooftop bar was very cool and had a perfect name (Jimmy at the James - I felt honored)I loved the location - far away from the nonsense of Midtown, but a quick subway ride (15 minutes) or nice long walk (2 1/2 miles) from the Theater District. Lots of excellent restaurants in the neighborhood.I loved it - I would surely stay there again. Jim C.

Friendly staff, clean rooms, really nice hotel. The rooms are small, but we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. I loved the big windows and the bathroom is fun. You can see into it from the bedroom, but you can easily change that if you want privacy. The staff is really nice and we enjoyed the afternoon happy hour they provide. The breakfast scones are pretty amazing as well. :)

At first glance the hotel is 5* NYC premier luxury but once the shock and awe wares off, a good 7 minutes, you can see what's going on. Just like every other hotel in NYC (not the Burroughs) it is extremely over priced and the service u get is poor, to put it politely. They really know how to "cattle" there clientele at this place so everyone's in a nice organized line throwing money down the owners throat!! If you want drunk party get wasted frat girl.... this is the spot! And I would even stay at the hotel again, but I was very upset w the pool staff repeatedly for numerous reasons
user_name:
brianjayb
New York City, New York

review_body: Let me start off by saying I didn't have a reservation at the James , at least I thought I did but the receptionist was very helpful . I had came in late at night from a flight and prior to that I had asked my assistant to book me a room. When i got there I was told i wasn't in the system and that they were sold out , But the way she went about it was what had me. She attempted to find so many ways to make sure if there might of been a mistake or under a different name , she offered me a seat in the lobby and a choice of coffee , water or a glass of wine , due to how tired and frustrated I was that was just perfect for me. She then came and told me that there wasn't anything she could do at that point because I wasn't in the system and there wasn't a reservation not even under my assistants name, but she also help me find another location that did have rooms which she said was one of the James sister properties with great pleasure I want to thank her for her hospitality she was so kind ,courtesy and helpful and I look forward to having myself and company stay there very soon , I'm sorry i didn't get her name but she was tall ,African American and again extremely kind.

The hotel was stunning, staff was one of the friendliest I have encountered, and the room was remarkable. The man who did our check-in, bellhop, and room service employee were all so helpful! I really appreciated Joseph whom I had told prior to arrival that I was celebrating my anniversary. He had taken care of everything making it a stress free vacation and we had a fantastic time. The champagne and strawberries were a pleasant surprise! The room itself is magnificent- make sure to book the King Skyline room! It's hard to find a hotel in NYC with views like that and is also spacious. Waking up and going to bed in our hotel was one of our favorite take-aways. Looking forward to our next visit.
user_name:
TravelerJay26
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Just got back from a hot NYC weekend, and so happy we chose the James as our home base! There visiting our two daughters, we were able to sight see and then relax at the roof top pool in between. Wake up in the morning and have your complimentary coffee and yummy scones by the pool as you read the paper, or eat some delicious breakfast at the in hotel restaurant David Burke Kitchen. At night relax at the treehouse bar or if your up for some scene and be seen action head up to the famous Jimmy (pool deck turn night club). Beautiful room with awesome linens and great view of SoHo. All in all a perfect stay. Shout out to Mike by the pool for always being there to help out.

The hotel is very unique and beautiful. It's in a great location with some gorgeous city views from the rooftop bar, Jimmy. I stay at this hotel every year and really enjoy it; the only reason I am giving it a 4 instead of 5 stars is because I find the service ok but not great. No one is overly friendly or helpful but it certainly isn't bad service.

The location is great, the rooms and amenities are very nice and the food was fantastic. The service was outstanding! The associates of this hotel made it special. Convenient to walk to local attractions, shopping and restaurants. Highly recommended.

I enjoyed the hotel very much over a 4 night stay ..... I was on the top floor (level 17) and as much as I liked the Hotel I would never stay on that floor again - great view but extremely noisy and disruptive. There was a service area for the rood terrace near to my room and it was excessively noisy all evening until late. I complained but there was little they could do about it as it is the way the place is designed. Other than that a great stay and good location. My one comment would be that during peak hours in the evening the traffic for the tunnel clogs all the small streets in this area so don't try and get a taxi outside the hotel in peak hours or it will take forever - walk up to Broadway and catch one there

My husband and I celebrated our anniversary here, and this hotel was absolutely perfect! The building alone is a masterpiece, with different levels to lounge around in, lots of glass filling the entire hotel with light, and gorgeous views from various vantage points. We booked a Corner Queen, which had floor-to-ceiling views of the Freedom Tower. The bathroom is huge by New York standards, with a spacious rainfall shower and a window that looks outside (there's a button you can press to bring the shade down if you want more privacy).The hotel gave us so many things for free, and I'm not sure if it was because it was a slow 4th of July weekend, or because we were celebrating our anniversary. We were given complimentary drinks at the bar downstairs, complimentary breakfast at the restaurant below, as well as a free bottle of chardonnary and strawberries in our room. In the lobby there are constantly snacks for guests, from scones in the morning, fruit in the afternoon, cheese and crackers before supper, and cookies late at night.Service was exceptional, from the front desk to the doorman to the bartender. I'd especially like to thank the servers at hotel restaurant, David Burke Kitchen. I would come back just for the service alone!The rooftop pool has absolutely gorgeous views. The pool is small, but who comes to New York to swim? Come early to claim a lounge chair on the rooftop. At night it becomes a bar, open to the public.I can't recommend this hotel enough!

I stayed 3 nights, excellent room and bathroom, nice amenities. Lovely and interesting modern artworks throughout. I did not eat in hotel save for a continental breakfast before leaving. Served on time, hot toast, freshly brewed tea.For me the mattress on the bed was quite soft, and the kettle/coffee cups etc a little inaccessible. I would have liked a time out+a mapLocation is excellent for exploring, walking distance to East Village/Greenwich Village, one World Trade Center memorial and financial district

The James in Soho was the perfect hotel for my visit to Manhattan to see my daughter. The location was ideal and we walked to great restaurants, the Hudson River, Little Italy and China Town. I did yoga on the roof my first morning and it was spectacular (see pic). It was great having a swimming pool on the roof. My last night there was a party on the roof put on by Jimmy. It was a fun place to have a drink with my daughter and her friends. I will make The James in SOHO my hotel for future visits.

JoAnn J. at The James in Soho was an incredible housekeeper and beautiful human being. She was sweet, thoughtful and even left a handwritten note! Thank you to everyone at The James for making the experience a memorable one!

Other than the lack of storage in the bathroom I enjoyed this hotel. I was upgraded to a nice queen corner room. The front desk was so accommodating. This is a great part of town to stay in as well! The hotel also has a great bar and outside deck. Enjoyed a very brief stay!

The roof top is a major scene, in fact so busy that the hotel guest can't really enjoy it at all. As it turns out it's so loud that trying to sleep anywhere near it is a joke. Never had more than 2 towels in our room, day two we only had one and couldn't get another until 8 pm, when we were supposed to be at dinner.

We had great expectations of this hotel. It is fair to say that things impressed us for good. Bed was amazing, bathroom amenities, LOCATION unbeatable, rooftop bar is absolutely wonderful. However we had to ask three times to get our room done and when we came back from lunch it still hadn´t been made. My husband got the flu one night, we asked for hot water and it arrived one hour later. Lobby staff was very attentive, but couldn´t compensate for an overall bad service. Won´t be staying here in our next trips.

Great hotel. Worth the price. Rooftdeck is beautiful and depending on your age (I'm 30) you may not be into the daytime seen with sloppy kids (that's how I now refer to those in their 20s) but dj usually stays until eve on weekends and more enjoyable at night. Rooms are good. It's NY so it's not an estate but you get what you need. Spacious bathroom and comfy bed

Beautiful hotel!!! I've stayed here 3 times and will continue to book here whenever I'm in New York. The location is perfect - close to all the best shopping in SOHO and great restaurants as well. Great staff - attentive and helpful without being intrusive.

I am really torn writing this review. I love the hotel itself. The room is really comfortable and location is great. It has a fantastic bar and the ambience is always good. The bed. Soooooo good. The amenities in the bathroom are also great. But the one downside to this hotel. ROOM SERVICE. For a hotel that classifies itself as 5 star it's room service. SUCKS!It took an hour for me to get some ice. There was an evening where an event was taking place so I was advised if I ordered food it would be at least an HOUR AND A HALF! Clearly the priority is keeping the event space full rather than feeding paying guest, staying in the hotel with no way of cooking food! In the end. I ordered take out. For me if a hotel can't meet a basic human need for food. It shouldn't be charging nearly '$400 per night. Call me old fashioned. But a boy's gotta eat.

Stayed 2 nights in June with a friend. Our experience was great! The hotel is clean and the decor is very nice and modern with a retro feel. The room was quite small but fine for 2 persons. We also loved the rooftop pool, such a cool place and the view is unbeatable. The service was great. Will definitely return.

We stayed at this property last night and had a fantastic experience, from the moment we stepped out of the cab from Grand Central to the moment we stepped back into the cab at our departure. Kenny helped us out of the cab, carried our luggage up to check-in, stored our luggage since we'd arrived early, and then found our luggage - even when I'd misplaced our tag - and carried it to our room. He also pointed out all of the amenities of the hotel (free coffee and pastries in the morning, cheese & wine before dinner, fresh cookies at night) and our room (cool shade between the clear bathroom wall and our bedroom, soft robes and slippers, free wi-fi, nice shampoos and shower gels, hair-dryer and waterfall shower head). There is a glass elevator, a cool little lobby, and a rooftop small pool and cool bar. The hotel is attached to the David Burke Kitchen, and we were presented with 2 free drink coupons and 10% of a meal, and took advantage of both. We lucked out and had a nice night in NY and sat outside in the treehouse garden to have our drinks at the bar. This morning we had breakfast (before 11am, then turns to brunch on weekends) and it was great! Not only is the hotel staff friendly and accommodating, but we were able to walk to the 9/11 Memorial and the High Line -- so its also fairly central. We requested a quiet room and were placed at the end of the hall with a great view, and never heard a peep - even on a Friday night in June. Great find!

Of the hotels I've stayed in Manhattan The James was the best experience. A big thanks to Rebecca Z. for taking such good care of us, as well as all the other great staff that made our stay so pleasant including Elaine, Rebecca C., Brian, Yu-On, Morgan, Maurice, Vasylyna, Elmo, Jonathan, Ron, and the friendly bellmen Eric, John, and Jimmy.Our room had a wall-to-wall window with a fantastic view of One World Trade Center and its surrounding skyline. The room was spacious, the rain shower relaxing, and the bed very comfortable.Up at Jimmy's on the roof you get even more of a panoramic view of the city which was beautiful at night. We also enjoyed brunch at David Burke's where the staff was also friendly and accommodating, and the food was very good.

I arrived at The James to be shown to a $450 a night room - which had HUGE dead moths on the drapes near my bed. I spoke to reception who promised to move me the next night to an upgraded but discounted room, which at the end of my stay cost me over $900 a night!!! They basically doubled my room charge to a room under the penthouse roof bar where the noise went on until way after midnight!!I would NEVER recommend this flea pit of a so called 'hip' hotel. On the contrary I shall do my best to deter others from having the same unfiortunate experience as I did.I'm a seasoned traveller having stayed at many NY hotels from The Pierre, Fours Seasons and down.This is undoubtedly the worst.

Terrible experience and bad service. I have to switch room twice: first room has heat/AC issue. They cannot fix it, so i have been asked to move to another room; So I have to pack and move and no one apologized for the inconvenience! The second room basically can hear everything from the neighboring room. When I reported this, the front desk and front desk manager first denied it until they hear the clear sound from my room and have to admit. However, she claims no room and ask me to wait until later - said if might quiet down. When it is almost 11pm, it is the same thing. She suddenly found a room and ask me to move again. So pack and move again so late. Again, no apology at all! The third room smelled strong detergent and I am too tired to even complain! Never again!

I took my Son and his Cousin shopping for the weekend and from Check in to Check out it was a wonderful experience. We were upgraded to a wonderful Penthouse Suite which made the stay even more wonderful. Will definitely stay there again.

Second time we stay at the James:Location is perfect if you want to be in the heart of Soho.Great roof terrace bar called Jimmy with outdoor mini pool included.VERY trendy.Almost too much as the hotel guests share the same lifts with the bar cool on goers and sometimes there is a bit of queue / wait.The hotel is now some 7-8 years old and you can feel the difference versus when we stayed here 2-3 years ago.Super friendly staff.Go for a corner room - definitely worth the views.Good news for all:All rooms are generally larger than the average NY room - especially compared to the trendy Soho Grand hotel next door.Beds are super comfy - including the pillows.Large, powerful and functional shower.Good mini bar.

Excellent location right in the heart of Chicago, beautiful room with an awful view of a parking lot. Very friendly stuff, excellent food although there were a couple of bad happenings with the room service. No buffet breakfast... Awesome extras in the room ( video projector and Bose sound system ) but lucking any instructions on how to use it....

In town with a group of friends. Location is excellent especially if you're flying in from Newark. Lots of restaurants and shops within walking distance. Roof top bar is awesome. Would stay recommend.

We truly enjoyed our stay. The only negative was that we did not get from the beginning a room at a high floor, which I highly recommend. The flooring is wood and the interior is modern. They soon need to renovate but it is still ok. We enjoyed the corner room a lot. The life fitness machines in the fitness a partly broken and because there are so few this is a shame. Also they have no Nespresso machines in the rooms.

Fabulous SOHO location & very walkable accessible to some of lower Manhattan. The service from almost all the staff was excellent, very professional, welcoming & responsive (which is not the norm necessarily for a lower Manhattan hip hotel).

Hotels in New York as we know always expensive. The James is an ideal option, Well located and easily accessible this quirky contemporary hotel has all you need. The reception being on the third floor if you views of New York and the rooftop bar and Paul are an ideal place to relax whatever time of day. The rooms are well appointed and despite being New YorkI reasonable in size. The blackout curtains are a blessing in the city that doesn't sleep especially if you're suffering from jetlag! The effective use of glass The walling and full height windows give many rooms spectacular views of the skyline.There is a great downstairs restaurant and bar area with outside space open during the summer months. The concierge service as you expect is very efficient.All of the main attractions from Soho to the meatpacking district are within walking distance as is ground zero and the highline.We had a great time here and would certainly return.

Great location but the room was smaller then I thought. It was clean and nice ambiance. Roof bar was too small, couldn't find any seats but it had great view! I will comeback for the location and service.

Not up to the level of the Chicago James. We stayed here as we felt our experience in Chicago would be reflected in Soho. This was not the case. Overall I would likely look to stay elsewhere the next visit to NY

If you want a noisy venue, the James Hotel Soho is for you! We lived in Manhattan for 40 years so we are not country bumpkins. Turns out with respect to the James Hotel Soho, we most certainly were! We don’t travel to NYC often, but when we do we like to splurge a little bit and stay in a suite on a high floor with City views. The James seemed to offer that-even had a rooftop bar-the Jimmy- a “contemporary interpretation of a classic pub with a 1970’s New York twist.” But here was our mistake-we didn’t read the asterisk in the Jimmy’s description on the website, but even then we could not have been prepared. This past Saturday-April 29th- was a beautiful spring day in NYC. At the Jimmy, starting at 3 PM and continuing to 2 AM, music from this supposed pub like atmosphere blasted though out the hotel-from the 18th floor rooftop down the elevator shaft to the lobby. This was no pub-it was Studio 54 redux- a famous NYC discoteque- replete with bouncers and an outdoor rope line.We were on the 16th floor in a very pleasant suite but there was no way we could remain in our hotel room. We sought out the manager and complained. He immediately recognized the legitimacy of our complaint and essentially told us there was not much he could do with respect to the noise as that the rooftop bar was a separate entity from the hotel. He offered a small room on the 5th floor which we had no choice but to accept. So not only was our peace and quiet disturbed on Saturday, but we lost the ambiance that our 16th floor room would have provided for our Sunday morning. This was a totally disastrous and wasted weekend at the James.The only thing I could imagine because most, if not all, of the “partygoers” were not hotel guests, is that corporate James is making a lot of money off the lease rental for the rooftop or shares in the receipt of revenue to allow the Jimmy to potentially disturb its guests on a beautiful day. So beware, and perhaps the James should state more clearly on its website the risk to their guest’s peace and quiet.

I was here last week for business and this was my first time Traveling to this hotel alone. One of the elevators wasn't working and every time I had to leave or come back it was very stressful. When I ordered breakfast on Tuesday morning by my favorite in-room dining server EVER I told her how annoying the elevators were and when I arrived back after a long day there was a nice hand written amenity left by Erica apologizing and saying that the rest of my stay was better. Thank you!!

This is my wife and my own second stay at The James Hotel in Soho. I have traveled to the city numerous times and never stayed in the same hotel twice. The reason for this repeat stay derived from the first impression bestowed upon on us during that initial visit. Everyone from the front desk to the valet create a comfortable and accommodating environment complete with friendly personalities. Although the James may not provide a wide variety of amenities, the offerings are sufficient for stay in New York. It also helps that Soho is my favorite neighborhood and the overall feeling creates a more relaxing atmosphere contrasting with the hectic activity the rest of the city can't help but evoke.

The James is a lovely boutique hotel. The staff is friendly and courteous. They make you feel so comfortable and at home. They delivered a beautiful and delicious surprise birthday cake to my room. So thoughtful. The hotel is design focused without being stuffy or pretentious. There are several indoor and outdoor spaces. The Jimmy rooftop is gorgeous if you can get there before the crowds flood in.  The scones from Balthazar and a cup of strong brewed coffee are a great way to start the day. Fruit is provided in the lobby during the day and wine and cheese is offered in the evening. We look forward to coming again when the pool is open and the croquet set is out.The décor is comfortably minimalist, although we were surprised by the well worn bath mat and robe in the bathroom. A refresh is definitely recommended.

Nice hotel with a gym , a rooftop pool and a bar with a view. A good alternative to the main hotel chains and close to a lot of restaurants. You even have a convenience store at the bottom of the building

We chose The James this time for its location near a family member, and were pleasantly surprised at how "at home" we felt there. From the doorman and desk staff to the afternoon wine and cheese (and morning coffee and muffin) it had a friendly and relaxed vibe. We stayed twice, in a queen room, but on different levels.The room on the higher floor was in much better condition than the other room on the 2nd floor. That level felt a bit shabbier...perhaps the higher floor had been recently renovated. Beds were comfortable, and the bathroom on the higher floor had underfloor heating. There was an attractive optional screen for bathroom privacy. We would definitely stay here again.

7th floor king suite. Great location in SOHO. Pleasant staff, clean room, great views and drinks at the rooftop bar. Was concerned and considered changing hotels after reading some reviews about cleanliness and quality but did not run into a single issue. Would stay again in a heart beat. Actually preferred it to 11 Howard Place where we stayed as well.

The James is a great choice. Can't beat the location, area shopping and dining are terrific. Such a special place. We were there to celebrate a special occasion and it was at every turn. The restaurant in the hotel, David Burkes Kitchen is lovely as are all the people who work there. We will return soon...

We picked this hotel because we had an event in Soho and the location was quite convenient. Overall, it was a largely positive experience with a few missed details that were frustrating.Pros:1) The location-the hotel is on the very edge of Soho. As such, it's also quite convenient to Tribeca. Lots of shops, restaurants, and bars. 2) Architecturally interesting building3) Large rooms by lower Manhattan standardsThe Meh: 1) Being on the edge of Soho, it's right near the entrance to the Holland tunnel and a less than gorgeous block. Some rooms look out onto a vacant lot bordered by the tunnel traffic. #notelegant2) The room looked a little worse for the wear-dents and dings on some of the fixtures etc.The Bad:1) The toiletries were of inferior quality. Despite being natural/organic/free of bad stuff, they were not premium. The shampoo was positively watery.2) They forgot to re-stock towels the second night so I literally had no towels (which I figured out post-shower). 3) Only one elevator was working leading to vertiginously long waits for the elevator. 4) The rooftop bar has a great view but the service was lacking and the crowd was frankly a little trashy.

Amazing corner suite on 14th floor arranged by manager. You won't get a better view in downtown Manhattan.Great SOHO locationNice extras such as coffee, fruit, pastries in the sky lobbyCool roof terrace and bar Highly recommended - the best hotel, right in the heart of the action.Thanks mr Rauer !!!!

The James treats you well. I stay at the James about every other month. During my most recent stay Rebecca at the front remembered me by name when I checked in. The next evening I ran into Julio the Room Service manager. I had not seen him in over a month and he also remembered me by name. Very impressive service!Thanks for making me feel appreciated.

This hotel was everything we hoped for... it's got a true NYC loft vibe and the bathroom was super cool... Room service for dinner was amazing, you have to try... And the restaurant down stairs was just as great. We would stay here again even though they had a mix up and charged us for our stay when checking out even though it was pre paid. This left us short $3000 Australia for the rest of our trip. Just make sure your clear when you have pre paid from Australia so this doesn't happen to you.

I booked this hotel at last minute. I checked into a room that was shabby by any standard, much less the standards of a top hotel. There were stains on the chair, the table and the floor. The windows were streaked with fingerprints. The u-bolt looked as though someone had tried to force their way into the room. The smoke detector was missing, ripped out of its housing. The toilet paper holder fell out of its place in the wall. I called room service once -- at around 8 p.m. -- and was told they were not taking orders because they were "walking the floor"? Front desk said they would call back when restaurant opened. They did not. I called three times before someone finally answered. None of these things individually is terrible. But taken together, they suggest a hotel in a slump in terms of maintenance, service and attitude.
user_name:
T. M
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We had a great stay, the room was small but modern and cozy and bathroom was very sleek. This is a Fab location in SoHo which just can't be beat! Interesting building, friendly staff, and wine and cheese in the lobby each afternoon. Looking forward to going back this summer as there is a several outdoor areas including rooftop bar with pool and several garden bars and restaurants.

I guess I'm in the minority here. My stay at The James hotel was a bit unpleasant. My main complaints are cleanliness and maintenance.What happened? Well other than my room being infested with spiders (I saw 3 large ones on separate occasions) and my shower tile being moldy/rusty/dirty, I also had the pleasantly of my smoke detector battery begin to beep low battery at 3am.This is where things took a poor turn. It wasn't your normal beeping but a loud continuous beep every 30 seconds with an announcement that the battery was low. Ok, bad luck. But then I had to call Down to the front desk twice to finally get the maintenance man to come up and replace the battery. The lack of attention to my serious complaint made me angry.Other than that it's in a decent location and the rooms are ok. Probably won't go back with all the options in Manhattan

We have a nice room on the 16th with a beautiful view of the city. Nice bathroom and the bed and sheets were really comfortable. I like the hh in the evenings with wine and cheese. Also in the mornings you get pastries and coffee. Another plus is the drinking water they provide in the rooms. I loved that, so I don't have to waste money buying bottles of water. We had dinner at the restaurant of the hotel my fish was really bad. I wasn't that impress. The roof top was very nice it has a cool Sculpture, a pool and a beautiful view of the city. The locations is excellent close to shopping, cafes and great restaurants. We also went one day to Brooklyn. We had a great time exploring and walking around. We had lunch at PICCOLA CUCINA in Spring street. Highly recommend it. The food and the service were amazing. Sicilian food.

Had a nice stay in a corner queen room. The room was a good size and I liked the bathroom, comfy bed, soft robe and the views. I didn’t take advantage of breakfast or any other amenities, really just used it as a place to sleep. One issue I had was that they could not figure out a way to extend the buy 3 nights, stay the 4th free January promotion. My office had made the original reservation for 2 nights. I decided to stay in town longer and switch to 5 total, so called the reservations hotline. The person on the phone could not figure it out and told me just to handle it at the front desk. Then the front desk told me that the deal was only available at time of booking. I extended one night and then stayed elsewhere for a few nights. The hotel was completely empty: it was the middle of January. Rather than figuring out how to extend the deal, they lost the rest of my business and the room (presumably) stayed empty. I would still stay again, but just do a better job on my end when booking to look at the deals.

We had a great stay at The James in NYC. If you're spending time in lower Manhattan, it's in a prime spot conveniently in SOHO but close to Tribeca and Greenwich Village. There is also a subway stop just two blocks away.The room was about average size for a Manhattan hotel, not big but not tiny. We had a great view and the entire room had great natural light. Amenities were also nice - higher end products provided and a really nice bathroom. The staff was friendly and attentive though we're didn't ask for anything special.Do yourself a favor and check out The Jimmy bar upstairs before you go. It was really cool, had great cocktails, and also a great view.

We stayed at the James over Valentine's day. I had requested a room with a view since it was my husband's first visit to NYC. When we arrived we were kindly greeted by the bellman who assisted with our luggage and the valet parking. Parking is $55 a night which is a good price for New York. At check in we were upgraded which was a great suprise but nothing compared to our room. Our bellman took us up and when we saw our room we were so very happy! We had a corner suite with floor to ceiling windows looking at the freedom tower. We could literally lay in bed and look at it. The room is small but not for NYC standards. Bed was comfortable and amenities were nice. We went up to the Jimmy rooftop bar after dinner Valentine's evening and enjoyed a cocktail with the wonderful view. This hotel is ideally located for walking to the trains, restaurants and shopping. We would definitely stay here again!

My husband and I stayed at The James for a long weekend, to celebrate our anniversary. It was wonderful. We were surprised to have chilled champagne and strawberries waiting in our room, and a lovely note congratulating us. Such a caring detail. The rest of our stay was flawless, and the staff could not have been nicer, thoughtful and helpful. Our room was lovely, with a beautiful view, and tastefully decorated. Thank you all for making such a memorable stay. Definitely recommend and will return!

Stayed here all week and not as happy as i have been in the past.There is no "loyalty" towards people that have stayed there over and over. I usually get a small upgrade and when I asked they said there were none, however my traveling companion, checking in at the same time as me, that was staying there for the first time got an upgraded room.My biggest complaint this time was the noise. I have noticed this in the past but this time it was awful! Every time someone on the floor would turn on their shower it would sound like someone was drilling. I know this was what it was, because it would happen when I turned on my shower. This was especially annoying when this was happening before my alarm (sometimes two hours before I was planned to wake up) Not the most pleasant experience. So I was disappointed this stay.:(

In general, staying at James New York was a great experience. Soho, Tribeca and DownTown are all a very short and enjoyable walk away.I had a corner studio room and recommend spending that little more as the views are great and help you feel connected with the city. The shower and bathroom was modern and refreshing, a very comfy bed that aided sleeping and dealing with jet lag from Europe and reliable TV and internet service in the room. I also liked that the windows in the room could be opened, so allowing fresh air into the room. Likewise, the bar on the top floor offers amazing cocktails and a stunning view of the city: very chic and stylish and made me feel like I was in a movie! Also there is a fantastic sushi restaurant and a cool coffee bar directly opposite hotel and a fantastic deli/convenience store next door. My only criticism is the lack of help from staff with luggage! They never helped me at all when arriving at hotel via taxi, to getting luggage into my room at reception. It felt like this was a policy rather than an oversight. I was very happy to tip staff so Im not sure why it happened but it left a bad taste. They should address this ASAP.

I stayed here for four nights with my mum to celebrate my 21st.Convenient Soho location, right beside the a/c/e and 1 subway lines with many more lines just a 10 minute walk away.Mr. Rauer and all his staff went out of their way to make our stay very special.Check in desk staff, doormen and house keeping were all exceptionally friendly and helpful.We had a beautiful corner king skyline room with amazing and unobstructed views of The freedom tower.We were on the 14th floor so I don't know how lower levels compare but our room was very quiet and perfect for a good nights sleep.Room was very clean, warm, sleek and comfortable.Prosecco and cake were even sent up by Mr. Rauer to celebrate my birthday, such a lovely touch.We were amazed by the very personalised and accommodating service at the James.We also sampled some of The cocktails at the Jimmy which were really delicious (loved all my exes live in Texas), Great views of lower Manhattan, Soho, Jersey city and even the empire state and the bar staff were all very friendly and welcoming.Would definitely recommend hotel and hope to stay again myself.

We had a lovely experience at the James! Everyone was king and helpful. Morgan was a dream and helped us score some fabulous reservations in addition to giving us lots of recommendations. Lobby very swanky. Rooms very clean and beautiful view.Jimmy (the bar) very cool!Location is really nice - walking distance to Greenwich and east and west village. And by two subway spots! Would stay here again.

Cozy, friendly, comfortable with clever spaces and out door cuteness. We had a mix up with valet service that management addressed. If this is the neighborhood you want to be in. This hotel is a great choice. We shall return.

Beautiful design hotel, perfectly located if you want to visit Soho, hot spot roof top bar with welcoming ambiance, delicious restaurant and great staff..... but above all Johnny and Elaine stood out of the crowd surprising me with the best service I could expect from this Hotel, amazing!!

I was thrilled to book The James for a great deal on Hotel Tonight for a last minute trip to NYC. My office is just around the corner, so having convenience and a chic hotel was a win-win. I arrived on a red-eye at 4:30am to be ready for an 8:15 meeting. When I got to the hotel at 5:15, they were more than happy to get me a room right away so I could get some sleep before the meeting. The room had a great west-facing room and was really spacious (I've stayed in much smaller and much more expensive in NYC). I love the shower and bathroom especially. I met a friend for dinner/drinks at The Jimmy and despite it being a cold, rainy night, thoroughly enjoyed the views and ambiance. I would definitely stay here again and strongly recommend The James!

Room was very small; hotel staff entered room 4 times for maintenance during a one night stay for water leak and left items from previous guest. Poor view from 3rd floor. No front desk attendance at 6.30am for check out.

Stayed in a Queen room this time for 4 nights from Jan 16 - Jan 20. Room was comfortable and a good size given NYC standards. The hotel is starting to show its age. Woke up to dark brown water coming from the bathroom faucet and shower. Management was able to implement a fix by the time I returned to my room later in the evening but left me curious on how that even happens. Then the shower fails even after identifying the issue to the front desk staff and continued for a second day with no fix by the time I checked out. Overall an average stay but left disappointed and will likely seek out other options for upcoming stays.

I have stayed at a lot of hotels in NYC and this one was one of my favorites so far. It's in a great location. The hotel is unique, modern, and clean. The staff is friendly. The rooms are small, NYC-size, but it's laid out really well, is very comfortable and the price was great. The amenities are wonderful as well, great workout room with an excellent view. If you are looking for a hotel in the Soho or Tribeca area this is a definite contender. I would go back!

I really loved the views at the James! great views in the fitness center, room, and in the sky lobby. The rooftop bar was lovely as well. I was thankful for the free filtered water in the room and the bedside Human of New York book was a great touch! I was thoroughly satisfied with my stay.

My friend and I got a room at the James last minute during an unexpected snowfall. Aside from getting a great rate, we were given a high floor. The room was very clean, and the bathroom was a nice size. The front desk (particularly Maurice), was very welcoming. They went out of their way to accommodate us. The rooftop lounge was fairly quiet on a snowy night, which allowed us to enjoy it and see the beautiful views. I would definitely return to the James...hopefully sooner than later!

This was a last minute trip as our house got booked up on AIRBNB. I choose the James for it's location & at my time of purchase it was so budget friendly (which was imperative to make AIRBNBing our house make sense). When booking, I requested a quiet room (I'm so sensitive to noise) upon check-in, I was nervous that my room (on the 8th floor, next to a high traffic street) would be too loud to sleep in. The front desk readily changed me to a much quieter room. The staff as a whole were wonderful. I believe it was Kenny that was working the bell desk when I checked in and he was so sweet - like a ray of sunshine. Then all others, from the front desk to housekeeping, all had a positive attitude and were eager to accommodate me. It's centrally located to SOHO and many subway lines which is an additional plus. Complimentary coffee & scones are provided in the lobby every morning (this though, is GREAT coffee and scones).Only complaint is, as someone who loves to work-out, the gym is small. But, most NY gyms are in horrible basements and this one is surrounded by windows, light & bright. If working out is your thing, I would recommend you be flexible. If the weather is nice, just jump down to the west side highway for a walk or bike-ride!

We could not be more pleased with our stay at the James in SoHo. The hotel itself is beautiful and extremely well kept. What made our stay over the top was the employees. They went above and beyond to make ensure we had everything we needed to have a great stay. Johnny, the manager, really exceeded our expectations. Thank you for making our stay so incredible Johnny. By far the best, most memorable experience at a hotel.

First time staying at the James. Stayed first week of January when hotel rates are lower, they were running a 4 nights for the price of 3 deal, so we averaged around $300/night. Hotel was clean, staff was friendly. Did not go to their rooftop lounge which is supposed to be hip (although I guess that changes in NY every few months so who knows at this point). Room service menu was good. Clean and fairly spacious (for NYC) rooms. Appreciated the fact that the gym - even though it was small - was on the top floor with a ton of windows as opposed to one of these lower floor gyms with few or no windows that you sometimes get.

Small, but well laid out rooms that made it feel much larger. Very clean. All amenities. love the area too! Enjoyed the breakfast. The rooftop bar is great, but we didn't get there this time. Fun stuff.
user_name:
Donald H
West Islip, New York

review_body: I was honestly not expecting much, but I was positively surprised. Staff is nice, helpful and friendly (except at the rooftop bar), place is modern and functional. Some of the furnishings feel cheap a bit too "Ikea" but ok. I didn't like the regular-sized-attached-to-the-wall shampoo conditioner and body wash...feels too cheap gym. But the rooms are nice and adequate, bed is very comfortable. I ordered room service and food was good and surprisingly fast. I would return if my meetings were in the area, a very good option for Soho.

Accommodating and welcoming staff that go above and beyond, beautifully appointed rooms, heated floors! Nice amenities! Complimentary wine/coffee/cookies/pastries in Sky Lobby. Beautiful views from my room and the fitness center. Would definitely book and stay again here.

We couldn't have asked for a better experience for our New Years weekend. The hotel was impeccable. The views from our room were astounding. The process for checking in/out was efficient and fast. The evening happy hour with complimentary wine and cheese was an added bonus. Johnny was great in providing us with recommendations for activities and places of interest in the area. We also dined at David Burke kitchen downstairs and the food/service was excellent. We would definitely stay here again and you get great value for your money.

Impressed by the staff, the location, the design throughout as well as the room itself. Thanks to Johnny on reception for being so accommodating after we'd had a lengthy trip from the UK. Would definitely stay again,

Brian Morr helped us with making our reservations. Brian made sure we had everything we needed for our NYE trip. We had a fantastic view of NYC from our corner room. The size of the room was just perfect. We had a very comfortable bed with the best pillows plus a roll away bed. Bathroom was beautiful. We went up to the rooftop and had drinks up there. View was spectacular! Soho is a beautiful place to be in with so much to do. Brian Morr and the other staff who worked during NYE were so great and attentive. We will definitely come back to The James.

I've been wanting to stay at The James for a few trips now, but this is the first time we actually booked - and I'm so glad we did! We had a late train into the city and didn't arrive until around 11:30pm. The staff members were so helpful (a trend that continued throughout our stay), and checked us in quickly so we could get to the bed.We had booked a Deluxe Room on Expedia and we were very happy with it. A fantastic size, great bathroom, comfortable bed. We only seemed to have one good pillow, but that was no big deal! Loved the dual shower heads and the option to have the bathroom screen up or down.My only (vain) complaint is there isn't really a great place for makeup application (lighting comes from straight above in the bathroom). Definitely doesn't affect my opinion of our stay though.There was coffee offered in the mornings and wine and nibbles in the afternoon, but unfortunately we didn't have time to take this up (or visit the rooftop bar). Hopefully we can stay here again on our next visit!

My boyfriend and I booked a room at this hotel about a week ago. We really liked the location, as there are many places you can walk to and be entertained. We also enjoyed the rooftop bar located inside of the hotel, convenient to have drinks before/after going out. Checking in was easy and quick. Tara, the banquet manager, made us feel welcomed and truly demonstrated excellent customer service, something I am very particular about.

Have spent 9 nights in this superbly located hotel which is staffed by very helpful and attentive staff. Special hello to Eric. Very central to all the wonders of Soho boutiques, galleries & restaurants as well as the major sites eg: 9:11 memorial, Brooklyn Bridge, the Staten Island ferry, Wall Street. With an outdoor pool this would be an ideal hotel in the warmer months .

i love the james hotel. the hotel room staff and desk staff are nice and the rooms are clean and have good natural light. we love the restaurant. beware of the unstable rooftop bar bouncers that guard the elevator. they told us the rooftop bar was not open and we would not be able to have an after dinner drink. The restaurant presented our party of 10 people with the most beautiful vegetarian family style meal on earth. the chef is a talented gracious artist and we loved it! i'm sure they would make a vegan meal for you too - if you request in advance for a group.when we took a different elevator after being detained for 20 minutes by the two men, we entered the bar and it was thriving and full of people. very strange dynamic for such an expensive restaurant and hotel.

I had a last minute trip to NYC this week and was lucky enough to book The James Hotel for the night. I was a bit underprepared and thusly a tad stressed. The staff at The James were so amazing that they filled in the blanks of all my missing information for my meetings !My very Manhattanesque corner room was great. Room service was great and quick. But the greatest shout-out goes to Brian at the front desk. He not only got me directions to my morning meeting - but also recommended the best spot to meet my staff for a coffee prior. Talk about going the extra mile. For a guy that travels for a living, I'm afraid my expectations of service have lowered over the last few years. What a pleasant throw-back to a time when hotels really understood a guest's needs.Thank you Brian, and I highly recommend The James Hotel when you are in Manhattan.

I had stayed at the James with my mother. We had ordered room service twice, while the food was just ok, the staff, Erica specifically, was amazing! We ordered breakfast early one morning (very prompt service) Erica even poured our coffees for us! She was so friendly and funny!Was very knowledge about the big city and able to recommend cool bars and restaurants for us to go to! Because of great service like Erica's we will continue to keep coming back to the James!!

I enjoyed my stay at the James Hotel. The staff was beyond exceptional and awesome! Team members, Rebecca Charles, Rebecca Z., Brian, Ecker, Elaine, Yu-On, Jimmy, Clarence, John, and Julian, were all amazing, helpful, and extremely friendly. It was great meeting them and I appreciate all of their hard work. The hotel was in a great location that was convenient.

Good location clean rooms, good coffee and breakfast in the Moring . Service overall was great. Rebecca Charles was amazing along with Brian, Yu-On, Elaine, and Rebecca at the front desk. Clarence, Morgan I believe the concierge, John the Bellman, Julian, and Elmo all so friendly and very helpful couldn't ask for a better staff to take care of my friends and I.

Just returned from our second visit within a few weeks to The James, and enjoyed a lovely 10 night stay at the hotel while moving my daughter to Manhattan. We had been staying at the St. Regis annually for 13 years, which had become like a second home and family to us in NYC, and I was hesitant about what we might experience at a newer, boutique hotel. I was pleasantly surprised when greeted by the front desk gal following a long journey from India with a very welcome glass of a nice Pinot Noir, and delighted with our room which was spacious, comfortable, and with a fantastic view of the city. The following day was Thanksgiving when we had been invited to a private home for dinner, and were asked to bring a food dish. It was late in the evening when I arrived, and with few stores open, my options were limited to none. Johnny, the front desk manager who generously assisted me during my initial stay at the hotel, came to the rescue and offered to procure 2 desserts for us from David Burke Kitchen...which ended up to be the hit of the party! Throughout our stay, which Johnny extended twice for us, he went above and beyond to ensure that any and all of our needs were met. Not only was he hospitable, professional, and very helpful - he was also warm and personable, with a charming sense of humor. Johnny and his team helped us to feel very much at home at The James, and I highly recommend the hotel if you are seeking an intimate place to stay in Lower Manhattan.

Our third stay at The James in Soho, and we were looking forward to it. It's 4:00, and the $1,000 suite that was supposed to be ready at 2:00 is finally good to go. Delivered very late with no explanation or warning, and delivered without water glasses, wine glasses, coffee cups -- apparently housekeeping no longer checks. Nothing I could do about the filth on the windows obscuring what used to be a great view. I made multiple trips down myself to get what we needed, and not only did the staff seem completely uninterested, but it was as though I was imposing on them by going down myself to fetch what should have been in the room. Jerome, the night manager, when I asked to speak with him, made up a story about having seen me check in yesterday and he knew the room wasn't delivered late. When I called him on it (we actually checked in today, he wasn't in the hotel), the fact that he had it completely wrong bothered him not one bit. Traveling all the time, things can certainly go wrong. A competent hotel with a caring and trained team knows how to make it right. Not The James. Not anymore. A pity. Stay away.

If you are looking for a place to stay that doesn't let all the "New York buzz" in, this is it. Almost peaceful atmosphere and great in room dining, super breakfast! It's worth choosing the upper floors, great view.

Enter the building from ground level and actual hotel was 2 floors up. Arrived and although room was suppose to be ready upon arrival we had to wait over an hour. Our room was supposedly an upgrade! It was small with no space for luggage. My husband put his luggage on the floor. TV did not work, called for assistance. Staff was uninterested and had no time for us. Lobby & checkin desk looked more like a removable lobby that could be disassembled and put in a closet. Even the people behind the desk were in jeans and grungy old shirts. For $500.00 a night the least they could do is wear a nice shirt and a clean pair of trousers!! They do not serve breakfast and we were never told that coffee was available at the checkin area. The entire stay was a bad experience. Don't know where the staff was trained but it certainly appears to us that they need another lesson for 2.

10 stars!! Thanks to Johnny and Elaine at The James Hotel in Soho, for making our 20th Anniversary Magical!The upgrade to the Penthouse suite was a dream come true for us, we had the most Amazing View of the city and the suite was beautiful! The chocolate covered strawberries and wine included.

I travel often to NYC from Australia for work and usually stay at boutique hotels for long stays. I have to say I felt very welcomed here and it was like I was at home. Johnny in particular was very helpful and accomodating and let me say the Bellman (I've totally blanked at his name maybe Gill) genuine person so accomodating and professional. It really made our stay standout. It's also the little extras that make your stay much easier and stand out over other hotels such as filtered water in your room daily and Balthazar coffee and snacks and not to mention wine and cheese and crackers in the evening. The only comment I would make about the rooms is they probably needs a bit of a make over as you are still paying a premium and the rooms are a bit small. You will still get a good night sleep as it's the most comfy mattress ever. I still will be back next summer!

We decided last minute to cancel our reservation at the Waldorf and stay here. We had stayed at the James in Chicago and liked it but this stay in Soho was really disappointing. First, for a nightly rate somewhere between $400-500 this hotel needs to seriously up its game:The lobby is small and unimpressive and doesn't offer many of the standard amenities lesser hotels offer. For example, we never saw any evening wine and beer happy hour as they had promised. Despite being "upgraded" to a corner suite on the 17th floor (which we later learned that night was right below the bar where we listened to loud music pumping till early the next morning - something the staff didn't think to warn us about) the room did not feel luxurious in any way - we had to call and request extra blankets because we were too cold under a very thin duvet. Same deal with the towels - there was hardly any place for towels in the bathroom and no extra towels were provided. We also had to request extra pillows because there were only two on the bed, not really enough to lean back against the hard headboard. We requested late check out and were told different prices for the check out, then were called repeatedly the day of check out asking why we had not yet checked out. Our room keys stopped working so we just gave up and checked out early. Finally, I let the manager know upon checkout all the issues we experienced. He was nice and adjusted our bill a bit, but after promising to send us our bill via email, it never came. I called today twice to request a folio and still don't have it. Altogether, an unimpressive stay in a not particularly inspiring part of Soho with a hotel that's clearly not on its game. Splurge at the Ace Hotel or go to the Eventi, or Waldorf, but you won't miss anything at the James New York.

The James is in a great Soho location, walking distance to the Freedom Tower. I stay here regularly for business and feel they have elevated their level of service. Very friendly, Rebecca at the front desk remembered me by name when I checked in, which was impressive.My room was very comfortable and will continue to make The James my primary hotel in NYC.
user_name:
Mr John Willam B
Columbus, Ohio

review_body: As a repeat visitor to the James NY, I can say without hesitation that it is not up to par with the level previously set by management. This is my 5th visit to the James since 2013 - in fact I have not stayed at another hotel in NY SINCE 2013 - so I am VERY sad and disappointed to see it in this fashion. I booked a 3 night stay and am considering moving to another hotel even if I lose money after being here just a few hours.I am in a Corner King Suite 1008 - however, I have stayed in this room type EVERY single time I have visited and it has never been this small. The other rooms I have been in felt more like a small apartment than a hotel room. This one is more akin to the size of a standard room that just so happens to be on the corner of the building. I called immediately to change rooms upon a timely check-in and was told there was no other option than a lower floor with the same floor plan. This struck me as odd when 10 minutes earlier as I was checking in there were 3 options available - and the remaining option now was not even among those previously offered. Unfortunately, the size of the room is only one of the issues here.Not only is the room smaller than previous visits, but it's in poor shape and borderline dirty. For over $500 a night, I expect a clean room. The floors look as if they haven't been mopped or treated in a very long time - scuffs and dust everywhere. And it's not just the floors; there is dust everywhere - seriously, everywhere. Imagine going to the snack bar to find lint on the food and dust balls flying up as you picked up an item. Eww. The robes provided are of two completely different styles and frayed. It almost looks like they hung up a guests personal robe that was left behind; one looks that much different than the other. And, they are shrunken.I can say as a frequent traveler that prefers boutique hotels, especially THIS PARTICULAR hotel, I am not happy to write this review. I do not write reviews often as I am not always in a unique position to comment, but in this case I am familiar enough with this hotel to notice that it has gone down in terms of value and overall experience.If you want a great location: come to The James. If you want a rooftop bar that is cozy and romantic: come to The James. If you want a comfy bed and roomy bathroom: come to The James. But if you have stayed here before, you will see that The James isn't quite the boutique experience it used to be. It needs some TLC.

We were taken here by a couple of New Yorkers and it turned out to be a true New York bar. Amazing view from the roof terrace which has a pool, great drinks and good music. Certainly worth a visit. Well made cocktails and excellent DJ

Perfect place for a 4 night stay hidden gem ! Intimate and great atmosfere, David Kitchen and Jimmy's roof top bar great. place to unwind all under the same roof Maidstone service a little sloppy as didnt replenish my complimentary tea and coffee all week but room spotless daily

Everyone I encountered made my stay really enjoyable. I saw Erica at breakfast and she actually remembered my name from my previous stay at The James! It made me feel special and it was the true meaning of customer service. Definitely recommend this location!

Misrepresentations online and in person at the hotel. The last three times I have stayed here, the computers in the lobby do not work, only one elevator works, the toilet in my room was broken, then after moving rooms....we found that the sink in the next room was broken( it did not drain out the water) In the third room we were moved to there were bugs coming out of the drain in the shower.....like small cockroaches. My daughter 'freaked out'. There was rust and broken tiles in the bathroom, and the cleaning was not what it use to be. Management could not care less......and said there were no other rooms......yet, when I checked on both their own website and Expedia, there were still rooms left.I have stayed at this hotel maybe 20 times, but never again. The front desk staff are hopeless and state that maintenance issues are beyond their control!!! Well I was not offered anything to make my very expensive stay enjoyable....which clearly was in their control. I suggest all patrons 'beware'!

Travel Frequently for business / pleasure and what an amazing hotel and experience. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in .. besides the fabulous location and beautiful design, the people were the best part of the experience. Everyone treated us like we were friends or family. The personal touch went along way. Looking forward to another stay before end of year :)

Dates: 7-12 October 2016Wifi: Free and goodStyle: Modern contemporary high endSituation: Excellent in SohoService: SatisfactoryRoom: #1. 706 #2. 702Room description: #1. King Guestroom #2. Corner KingBed: ComfortableBathroom: Good size, big walk in showerBath and body products: OkRestaurant: Indoor and garden (did not try).Facilities: Rooftop pool and bar, complimentary snacks/refreshment in lobby, small gymAfter having had two previous enjoyable stays at the James in Chicago thought it would be nice to try the New York hotel.
