Considering rooms are small in New York I was happy to see on their webpage King Guestrooms measured 29 sqm/315 sq.ft which became the final decision to choose the James. The location is perfect within easy reach of the nearby neighbourhoods and down-town area. I would not say building looks stunning from the outside but interior decor is sleek, modern and pleasant. The entrance to the hotel is small and insignificant. Nothing elegant in my opinion. There was no door man or bellboy so we had to carry the luggage ourselves. I was surprised about leaving entrance without surveillance since the reception is located one floor up. During our stay entrance was manned most of the time, but not continuously which from a security point of view I found worrying. The reception is tiny (two smaller desks in front of the elevators) but has an agreeable lobby area. Check-in procedures were easy but arriving at 2 pm room was not ready. Was told it would be ”a couple of minutes”. Decided to wait and have a drink at the nice garden terrace. Reception should call us when the room was available but as it turned out they never did. Fortunately little more than one hour later we went back to reception and room was ”just ready” (hmmm… heard that one before). 7th floor is in the middle of the hotel which was fine. The insulation was good both regarding windows and adjacent rooms. Nice light room with large windows. Modern style in white with dark brown wooden furnitures. Quite simple but nice. Good size bathroom with large walk in shower. However, the room does not measure 29 sqm, it was about 21-22 sqm/225-235 sq ft. I definitely felt deceived since this was a crucial point for choosing the James. The hotel was basically fully booked but front desk officer on duty said they had a larger ”Deluxe King Guestroom” on 11th floor. This room was identical (apart from layout was rotated). Front desk officer was surprised as he thought the deluxe room were larger but nevertheless the hotel had no larger King Guestrooms. Corner rooms were larger but they had no one available. I told him I felt cheated and I also sent a message to the general manager, Joseph Rauer, regarding the situation. Next day I was informed hotel should try to arrange something. In the morning, while we were walking in the lower east end, I was called by front desk officer on duty telling us to be ready to move into another room and in order to guarantee the room would be available we had to have our luggage packed immediately. So we took a cab back to the hotel, packed our stuff so we could move. But room was no ready in any case so we left our things to be moved by the hotel later. Next room on the same floor was a Corner King. Yes, definitely a larger room with fantastic light and views. However, even here the hotel’s website lies: the room is supposed to be 35 sqm/380 sq ft, but it is not more than about 27 sqm/290 sq ft. Furthermore, the previous room had two wardrobes and this only one. The bathroom was also slightly smaller. General manager, Joseph Rauer, sent me a reply the following day saying he was happy the hotel had managed to transfer us to ”a more suitable room in consideration of the length of your stay”. Not in consideration of what I actually had booked according to their website and booking confirmation? We were given no apology or explanation. Shortly before our departure I wrote him back with my comments (basically what is in this review) but have had no response to that. The hotel has got many great reviews and I can agree that this is not a bad hotel. The rooftop bar/terrace is brilliant. The staff is friendly. Filtered water replenished every evening in the room. Nice lounge area with complimentary refreshments throughout the day. Location is excellent. However I cannot get over the misleading information on their website about size of room. Furthermore, according to webpage they have complimentary car service for travel within select downtown areas but fail to state it only operates weekdays. They do not have any real concierge service either. We asked front desk to book a table for lunch at a restaurant. They never called back to give us an answer. Complimentary coffee in the room is nice, but why only 1 regular and 1 decaf? No extra glasses in minibar, only the two in the bathroom. When rooftop bar is open there can be a long waiting time for the elevators. The facilities in the fitness room must be serviced. Most of the machine did not work properly and some not at all. Finally must mention, to my surprise, how quickly the hotel has become visibly worn considering it was built 2010.I was close to book the James Miami but with this experience, the inadequate answer and failure to respond from the managing director have made me loose faith in the James hotels. They have lost me as a client.

Once again, fabulous service at The James! Johnny Houston and the whole team treated me like gold. Great recommendations and assistance; lovely Tom with incredibly comfortable bed and soft pillows; I love the complimentary Torrefazione coffee and Balthazar scones in the morning; wine and cheese in the evening. This is my go-to hotel whenever I'm in town.

Travel to NYC often and have stayed at many traditional as well as highly rated boutique hotels. I have several favourites, but for me, the James is at the top of the list. The culture is genuinely focused on making you feel welcome, comfortable and satisfied. The location is very convenient and the attention to detail in the rooms, common areas and amenities is excellent. Special kudos on this past trip to Maurice and You-On. Five stars.

My husband and I checked into The James hotel this past Saturday night. We were greeted by the gentleman working the ground floor area (where we had valeted our car), he instructed us to the lobby and we met the polite, friendly front desk staff. The room was beautiful- very clean, nice mini bar and snack options. We stopped up at the jimmy (rooftop bar with a pool!) for a night cap, exceptional city views, and a great mix of music. Overall every interaction we had with the staff was warm, friendly and very accommodating. I would stay there again in a heartbeat- I also loved the neighborhood, close enough to all the good spots downtown, but not directly in it, so was a little more quiet.
user_name:
magz521
New York City, New York

review_body: This was our first stay at The James. We were pleasantly surprised at the incredible view from our corner studio, which looked directly at the World Trade Center and other gorgeous architecture. The rooms are New York sized and beautifully equipped. The beds are comfortable, but beware the pillows are super flat, and you'll need extras for a good night's sleep. Room service is quick, modestly priced, and, from David Burke's kitchen, wonderfully prepared.The Soho location is perfect, and with the entrance on Grand, you're able to get in/out of cabs easily, without fighting lots of traffic. Restaurants are everywhere, and the staff is willing to help with anything you need. They really are good.Maurice and Yu-on at the front desk made us feel at home the moment we walked in, and Julian from housekeeping was on top of everything we needed, from pillows to ice. Thanks guys.

The room was well appointed and the property is great but what really makes these stays stand out, are the staff members at The James!I was at breakfast and saw the same staff member at breakfast that we had seen at our last stay...I did't remember her name but she remembered mine! Now I know her name and will remember next time, thank you Erica for making our second stay at The James even better than the first. We will be back!

1. Not pretentious in any way. Warm, inviting staff that went above and beyond including having cupcakes and a note waiting for us in our room after we got back from a show for my son's 7th birthday. 2. THE VIEW: The Corner King Studio was breathtaking. WELL worth the upgrade.3. Amenities: David Burke's Kitchen was phenomenal. They were SO attentive to us and patient with my 7 year old ordering for me (offering the gentleman a pillow to sit higher in the booth and even to cut his chicken). Best meal we had in New York!

We stayed here for three nights and enjoyed both the room, which was quiet and comfortable, and the location, which allowed us to walk to many parts of southern Manhattan and offered easy subway access for venturing further. But with so many wonderful sites and restaurants nearby, there really is rather little reason to leave the neighborhood... The staff were friendly and knowledgeable about the area. If you don't want to climb stairs, you'll need to take two different elevators to get to your room. This is fine in the morning and during the day, but towards the afternoon/evening you'll need to share the elevators with the well-dressed crowd going to the Jimmy, so budget a little extra time and patience. The rooftop pool is tiny (and cold!) but you can get wet if you want to, and the space offers lovely views towards both New Jersey and Brooklyn.

This was our first stay to the James Hotel - SOHO. It was amazing and we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. One of the key elements is that is a pet friendly hotel which was perfect because of our 2 Corgi's Dudley and Kimchi. They felt right at home and we felt safe leaving them while we explored the city. The Staff at the hotel (concierge, front desk, manager, room service and maid service) was amazing and pampered us and the dogs beyond our expectations - they brought us champagne, fresh fruit and treats for the pups. Nothing but rave reviews for the James!

I wish I could say one positive thing about this hotel, but alas, the entire experience from the room to the service was terrible. When I checked into my room, it was much smaller than anticipated. Additionally, the room was a mess - there were several stains on the floor, there was dust everywhere, and the curtains were threadbare. When I called the front desk to request a different room, I encountered an extremely hostile manager - who demanded that he be let into my room immediately so I could assess the damage. My partner was arriving at the hotel and required valet parking so we could go to a meeting on time. The road was blocked but the hotel refused to send a valet half a block away to retrieve the car. After 30 minutes, they finally dispatched someone, promising me that they would comp parking. When I checked out, the front desk attendant said that she would need to validate the comped parking with a manager and would call me before I was charged. Needless to say, I was stunned when I received no call but saw the charge on my credit card bill. The facilities are disgusting, the staff are rude, and their ethics are questionable. Stay at the Soho Grand, NOMO, or Howard 11 and avoid this hell on earth.

We recently stayed here for 10 nights and were really pleased with The James. The front reception staff were delightful and always willing to help especially Elaine Rebecca Z. Our house maid alsoJoann looked after us very well!The hotel is really well situated and we were able to set around easily. Rooms were big enough with lovely big windows.Loved the rooftop bar. Amazing view and great vibe. Would recommend this hotel

My boyfriend and I stayed here one night for a staycation-type getaway. We live in the city so I can't speak to how convenient the location is for those coming in to the city for the first time- seems it would be a bit of a hassle getting there from LaGuardia or JFK, and it's not located close to any Midtown attractions (a good thing, in my opinion). It is walking distance from plenty of shopping, restaurants, and bars, and is a good option for those who want to explore Soho. We checked in on a Sunday afternoon and checked out at 2 pm the following day and could not have had a better experience. Everyone, from the front desk to the concierge to the man who delivered our room service, was friendly and beyond helpful.We were upgraded to a suite for no extra charge and it was a generous amount of space for NYC. The wood floors were pretty scuffed up, but otherwise the room was clean and attractive, with solid amenities including a comprehensive minibar (with full liquor bottles), a bathroom with separate soaking tub and rainfall shower, two iHome docks (one was an older model, the other had Bluetooth capabilities and a USB plug), and two flat-screen TVs. No in-room coffee makers (coffee is served daily in the lobby), but we did have an electric kettle. We had a corner room on the 15th floor that afforded incredible views from the bedroom and living space. We ordered room service from David Burke Kitchen at a strange mid-afternoon time and the food arrived quickly. Pricey, but gratuity was included (which we personally agree with), portions were generous (particularly for NYC), and everything was delicious. We later requested ice and two different people brought buckets. Just truly great service. The man who brought our room service saw us later in the elevator and made a point to say hello and ask us about our stay.We did check out the rooftop bar around 6:30 pm (it opens to the public at 9 pm) and although the views from the rooftop deck were incredible, the indoor space was pretty tight and the outdoor space was chilly in the offseason. The pool looked more aesthetically pleasing than functional, as it was pretty small and shallow.I definitely recommend spending extra for a higher floor with a view. Our room had blackout blinds and we didn't hear a peep all night. Hit up the bodega next to the hotel and save money on the minibar. Also worth it to check out some of the incredible food delivery options in the neighborhood. Front desk was able to recommend a solid lunch option in the neighborhood, and late 2 pm check out was AMAZING.
user_name:
Madeline O
New York City, New York

review_body: Wonderful overnight stay with my Wife. Best most attentive staff I have ever encountered. I travel for business monthly and this was the most knowledgeable and professional staff I have encountered. Managers Ecker, Johnnie , Vasylyna and JeromeAgent. YuOnCan't wait to return

A very good choice in Soho. Friendly and service minded personel, very trendy public areas (lobby+ground-floor). In addition the rooftop pool + bar well worth a visit. Rooms are good, with comfortable beds and functioning bathrooms. Try to get a room on an high floor, and the best choice is the corner rooms of grand street and Thompson. 6th ave and canal St. are fairy noisy. Restaurant is not worth a visit, not even for breakfast. Actually the Soho market on Grand street is a great choice for something quick to eat if you prefer the health choice. Green juices salads. Bear in mind Soho market is not a restaurant rather a market. Subway stop close by.

It's a modern, lovely place. The rooftop bar looks fun (though a little to loud for us on an early Sunday afternoon) and the rooms were nice. The staff was friendly and professional. The central location makes it an easy choice. We had a small housekeeping problem which was promptly and professionally fixed which was great. Overall a pleasant stay.

My husband and I were in New York for a few days and unfortunately I got very sick while I was there. I ended up staying in our room for most of our stay and Joann who was our housekeeper was so nice to me and really helped in making my stay as comfortable as possible. I really appreciated her help, she was so kind and thoughtful. The James Hotel was very nice and exceeded our expectations.

Drop bread crumbs behind you or you might not find your way out. It's a great place—but confusing to get around internally. Had a cozy corner room which was clean, and a nice big bathroom. The rooftop bar was swanky... almost a nightclub. Really friendly staff. Great location.

Door man, easy to find, great location if visiting lower side of NYC - close to metro.Complimentary Coffee, Tea, muffin for breakfast in lobby and wine/cheese at 6pm.Hotel did not seem too booked - never a crowd.Room was very comfortable, sounds drowned out by nice new windows, excellent HVAC system-very quiet.Modern, sophisticated, artsy, hip, comfortableThe glass bath walls were a bit of a shocker but fun. Huge shower, no bathtuba bit of an inconvenience that 2 elevators are required to get you up to the room. So don't leave anything behind when you leaveHad to call for washcloths - a bit odd that there was only 1 washcloth in bath.Housekeeping had a sense of humor and aimed the handheld shower towards the door so you couldn't help but get sprayed when you turned it on if you didn't notice it. This happened 2x-once upon arrival and then after turn-down. That sticks out in my mind as annoying but slept well and wish it had been for more than one night.

Met up with family members in from Chicago to spend a few days in the city and attend some tennis matches at the US Open. The rooms were small as you would expect, but luxurious and comfortable. Though not me, the people staying there would be described as young, and well-off, international hipsters. I can see why my son selected this hotel and its location. The hotel staff were pleasant and courteous. We ate one evening at The Treehouse Bar in the hotel. Service and food were excellent. The neighborhood was convenient to get a reasonably priced breakfast when not having coffee and newspaper in the small but comfortable lobby.

Staying here for 8 nights. Hotel is near shops on Broadway st and close enough to Spring St subway. Plenty of restaurants and bars around the hotel.The room is quiet and clean. AC is quiet which is a A plus. It is quite a good size room with bath shower. Starbucks instant coffee is provided with the room which is pretty good. It has a mini fridge and kettle. The gym is quite nice. It is a great view of the Freedom Tower and can see the Brooklyn Bridge. The equipment is decent. Probably need some update soon specially the bike. There is a roof top bar and pool in the hotel. The bar is open for public so gets really busy at night and weekend. Down side of this is the hotel guest can't really use the deck or the pool since it is right next to the bar. Unless you are starving for attention and have a fabulous body. I don't think you will be comfortable laying there with your speedos and bikini. Overall this is a nice up scaled hotel. Too bad that the pool and deck is right next to the bar and open to the public.

Awesome stay, dreamalikeroofbar, easy subway logistics to all over NY, perfect rooms, cheese an wine on afternoonsConcegierge and all personel service was on top rateSoho is nicely suited, all around the hotel u find exactly what u needfor shop, cafe & eatingWe will be back for sureThank you

We had visited The James previously for family that was staying there and was very excited to stay there this past weekend ourselves. The view from the room was amazing and the room itself was clean and comfortable with nice modern decor. All accommodations at the hotel were great from the food at the David Burke Kitchen to the views up on the rooftop bar and even the outdoor garden area had a very relaxing feel to it. The staff was very helpful and could not have been nicer! We were greeted by Kenny when we arrived and sad that he wasn't going to be there for the remainder of our stay but we were very well taken care of by John, Jimmy, Jemiah ,and Ecker. Jerome set up the rooms and did a great job. Thank you all for making our weekend getaway such a great experience! It surpassed all expectations and can't wait to go back.

I had such a great experience at The James this weekend. The Soho location was perfect with easy access to shopping and dining. In the spare time we had, we were able to relax in the gorgeous outdoor garden. The garden was bursting with greenery, which makes you forget that you are in downtown Manhattan. Our room was clean, modern and had the most fantastic review of the Freedom tower. It almost made me not want to leave! Also, kudos for having organic, chemical-free soap and lotion in the bathroom! The staff was helpful and courteous. Everyone we came into contact with greeted us with a smile. John and both of the Rebeccas at the front desk were super helpful and checked me in to the hotel in a timely fashion. Ecker, one of the managers, was very friendly and gave us helpful information about the hotel amenities. I definitely recommend The James hotel to those visiting Manhattan or anyone looking for a beautiful place for a staycation.
user_name:
MR5100
New York City, New York

review_body: From my ride up the glass elevator to unexpectedly bagging our dinner reservations to take advantage of the patio on a perfect evening—and then checking out the roof deck— the James was fantastic. We couldn't have been happier with our visit, and we'll certainly be back. The staff is terrific. The location is also notably stellar for shopping and for food. And our view was wonderful! We'll certainly be back.

I was expecting a tiny room and overly expensive pomp and circumstance with not much substance, but I was wrong. I stayed at this fantastic property on the border of Soho and TriBeCa. It had modern rooms with great product. Expansive views of the city and its location was quite close to the shopping of Soho. I enjoyed the outdoor restaurant and the fantastic roof bar. The staff was attentive and engaging, but the management team seemed to be a little aloof and too good for trifling with the guests. But, in the end that is my only complaint and the sole reason I did not give the full 5 stars. I would stay at this property again and I hope next time to catch them filming a Law and Order episode on the basketball court nearby.

My stay at the James was short but sweet. The hotel itself is very modern and trendy. The room I had was fantastic - room 1003, a corner. The view was incredible - looking straight at the Freedom Tower from the bed. And the staff were incredibly helpful, especially Jimmy and Kenny, who answered questions I had about stores in the area and the best way to get where I was going. They got me a cab, and we chatted about the Mets while we waited. Incredibly friendly and helpful, which made the short say at the James well worth it. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Nice room. Very small. Terrible setup for doing work. Small round table (no desk) and no electrical outlets nearby. Room service food mixed but not overly priced for NYC. Still would recommend the Trump Soho instead.

Stayed at The James with friends who had been there many times before. I have to say it definitely lived up to their glowing reviews. The place was very clean. The rooms were big & bright with spectacular views. The beds were comfortable & the shower fantastic. It is in a great location in Soho. But what made the stay perfect was the excellent service. I can't say enough about the staff. Everyone we met was so friendly and helpful. Just some of the wonderful people we met: Kenny, Jimmy, John, Jerome, Ecker, Jemiah, and the two Rebeccas. Thank you for making our stay so great. We will definitely be back.

Expensive but overall worth it. I would recommand this hotel if you get a high floor room. Otherwise you will feel you overpaid.Staff is friendly, rooms are cleand and the athmosphere is zen and yet lively.

After spending weeks researching a hotel in New York for a once in a lifetime trip for my sisters 50th Birthday we got off an extremely early flight from Heathrow to arrive at the hotel on a sunny Thursday lunchtime. My search criteria's were an outside pool, last of the summer sun, thought we could catch up on the Jet Lag by the pool Thursday afternoon. Concierge Lounge, because of the time difference on arrival wanted to be able to get small refreshments during the day to help get us onto Easter Time. Trendy Bar, this hotel advertised a bar on roof terrace beside outside pool. Club, being 50+ we wanted someone to carry on our celebrations after a fab dinner in New York this hotel offered Jimmy's a nightclub open throughout the night.The James ticked all the above boxes and after several calls to the hotel to confirm that the Pool would be open on our dates, (booked hotel with outside pool at Easter in Barcelona and when we arrived it was not open), that the club was open on a Thursday night. That the room was capable of taking 3 adults. That the James lounge was opened all day (have been to hotels where they advertise a club lounge but it only opens for couple of hours a day) etc etc Upon arrival at the Hotel our room was not available, this was not a surprise or a disappointment because we got to the hotel at 12.45 for a 2 check in. While we were waiting I asked if we could go to the outdoor pool to sit in the afternoon sun, this is when we found out that the pool closed on Labour Day. My problem with this information was the fact that the staff seemed to miss believe that I had been told that it would be open. (discussed this during 2 phone calls, not 1). they really did look at me as if I was making it up!! After sitting for another 10 mins in complete dis belief of our pool information (80 degrees outside) I asked if we could go to the concierge lounge (James Club) to get some soft drinks snack etc while we were waiting, we were then told we were sitting in it, the seats in reception of hotel! and that there was fruit and water further down the reception area, I told them I was led to believe that it was an all day lounge supplying refreshments. The timetable was 11 to 6 fruit and water, 5 to 6 a cookie, 6 to 7 wine. and that was it, not my idea of a concierge at a hotel.While we were sitting there other people arrived at the desk asking for the pool etc and the pool bar and were told the same information, then 4 young guys asked about the club and I found out by eavesdropping that the bar on the roof and club only stays open if there are sufficient numbers to keep it open, I understood by the way she said it that it would not be open after 11pm that evening, promised on calls that this would be a 2/3am finish.The way the staff dealt with the whole situation was even more disappointing than the hotel.We left the hotel there and then with our cases with no where to go in New York. Unbelievable!

Where does one begin as 'nightmare' of a hotel stay is an understatement, booking several premium rooms and hosting an event at the hotel over a weekend; specific room types meaning I paid a premium for the rooms, catering, event space, you name it. So I don't normally assume that my hotel stay is the hotel's top priority but given the total $ we dished out, in this case I definitely did. So the shock when one of my family members called me stating that the The shock at check in when one of the specific room types booked was not available - the person that was staying in the hotel the night before decided to stay an extra night - bumping my PREPAID reservation - so instead of a premium for a lux suite on a high floor with a lovely view, I paid the same rate for a crappy, LOUD room on a low floor - hours of arguing the next week to rectify this.The shock when someone sent me a 'gift' for the 2nd night of my stay - a post event, congratulatory gift, but the hotel decided to deliver it the 1st night at check in - there goes that surprise.The shock when my family was having breakfast at David Burke Kitchen, waiting an HOUR for their eggs and oj, only to finally be told that the server/kitchen lost the order. After another 30 minutes breakfast finally arrived as did the bill. Yes the restaurant made them pay full price despite this.The shock that the hotel never gave the hotel guests in my party the note I had written for their arrival - giving transportation instructions. The shock when my cc bill arrived to discover I had been over charged for my hotel stay. The shock that I have to actually write such a scathing review ...
user_name:
alyxia67
New York City, New York

review_body: I am fortunate to receive great and helpful service during my recent stay in London and New York. I often promised to write positive reviews to show my gratitude, but never did. This time I feel I need to act.I travelled to New York in late August to see Bruce Springsteen in New Jersey. Since this was my first visit to NYC, I was apprehensive. Get to the point, I didn't know how to get to the gig in NJ and back. Fortunately, Morgan, the hotel's concierge, happens to be a Springsteen fan. He gave me all the helpful advice I needed. When I needed to travel to DC for the next Springsteen gig, he planned the trip for me, trying to make the journey as quick and cheap as possible. He even searched for a US Open ticket for me. Good seat at cheaper price than those found on reseller's sites. Furthermore, when I mentioned I needed to buy a present for my girlfriend, he suggested just the right shop. Thanks to Morgan, my stay at the James was memorable. I am most impressed and never think of stay anywhere else when I next visit.I should also mention that an American Breakfast I had at the hotel is the best ever. Again, the service was wonderful. Sorry, I forgot to ask for the name of the guy who served me. All in all, I love the James in Soho and I love New York. Can't wait to go back.

I never usually write reviews but i had to this time. Myself and my wife were in New York for a long weekend and chose The James as my wife wished to be in SOHO near to shops restaurants etc. the hotel rooms were fine - that is why I gave two stars. However the hotel has a very busy bar on the top floor of the hotel and for the majority of the stay there were queues to get the lift to our room. this was further compounded by one of the two lifts being out of action for the sat and sun which meant there had to be a bouncer in the downstairs lobby trying to manage guests and visitors. In fairness he did his best to let guests in first but the result for us was that we avoided the hotel for the most part over the weekend because of the ordeal of getting to and from our room. if you want to use this hotel where you will be out most of the time and only come back to sleep - fine.if you want to use this hotel for a base to run to museums and shops and restaurants, popping back in numerous times over day to relax and drop off bags etc - avoid. as i said to girl at check out when they realised there was only one lift working for the weekend they should have made a decision whether it was worth opening a large rooftop bar to the public- severly compromising guests. they declined to comment and said they were sorry i felt that way. other positives were the doormen were v nice and helpful and the hotel was clean. but having to queue for lifts and share lifts with drunk people going to and from room is not something that we would expect - especially given the price point of this hotel. in all there are better hotels and if you want to experience the james - go to the bar. otherwise stay anywhere else

The views are amazing a top the St James Hotel! We spent the HOT summer evening by the bar with the open doors to the pool for appetizers and drinks. There was a DJ by the pool with jamming tunes. The location is KEY! We took an evening stroll after to take in the 9/11 memorial by night. I can't wait to return!!!!

Service in general in the hotel was great, Very good housekeeping and care put into the preparation and turning down the room, especially by Joann, what a pleasant character to deal with, adds a homey feel to my stay.

Stayed at the James New York in September on a business trip for two nights in room 609, a corner room with good exposure and floor to ceiling windows. The hotel has a modern feel with exposed concrete, clean lines and new fixtures and furnishings. Although it is not as nice as the Gramercy Park Hotel or other properties it is still quite good. As far as whether the decoration is too your liking you can see some of the attached pictures. As for the advantages and disadvantages, here goes:1. The large windows and views even from the 6th floor were good. The walls are thick and there was no noticeable noise from other rooms or the street below. 2. The rainfall shower and bathroom are quite good. 3. The size of the room is about average for a hotel in NY. The shower and bathroom is in a glassed off area rather than in a separate room. 4. The service is friendly and efficient with very prompt delivery for in-room dining. Breakfast was delicious. 5. The restaurant on site David Burke kitchen was also quite good. 6. The rooftop and terrace are terrific. The (very few) less good parts...1. The layout of the hotel is a bit confusing and takes some getting used to, with different levels and elevators to navigate around. 2. Bluetooth-enabled speaker and alarm wasn't particularly user friendly or up to the standards of the rest of the hotel. 3. The conditioner bottle in the shower was empty and needed to be refilled. The shampoo and conditioner is labeled and advertised as "gluten free" which seemed a little interesting and yet it must appeal to some. That's it. Nothing to write a rave about but a very nice and convenient hotel for a business trip or touring, with a good set of restaurants and the like on site and nearby.

Lower SOHO, on Canal & Ave. of the Americas. across from the Westside subway line, near lots of restaurants and bars, near Little Italy and Chinatown; good vibes; noisy rooftop bar, but nice; cofFee & Times on Sundays- 2nd time there!

Moved over to this hotel after leaving my longtime hotel 57 due to construction I've been here to the rooftop bar and pool before but never stayed in the hotel and was truly blown away by the massive size of the room as well as the layout and views can't be beaten anywhere in Manhattan it may not be the cheapest place but it certainly is the best highly recommended why stay anywhere else
user_name:
Derek B
Upper East Side, New York

review_body: Was trying to find a nice hotel in the heart of soho. The James is a few blocks away from what I would call the heart of soho. Small room but big bathroom and shower. My biggest issue was the floors. They were wood but seemed dirty. Pet hair maybe? It grossed me out.

This was a repeat visit to this Soho based modern hotel. It has a good balance of convenience, price, friendly atmosphere, with a relatively younger dynamic clientele. The gym on the 17th floor has a great view as has the very hip and happening Jimmy's roof bar. The free breakfast coffee and scones make for another nice touch. Areas for improvement: maintenance of the Life Fitness gym equipment.

I stayed here for a quick weekend getaway and a friend recommended I stay at the James and I'm so glad I did. We got a corner suite on the 14th floor, which had a spectacular view from the bedroom and from the living room. The bed was soft and comfortable, and the bathroom was huge. WITH HEATED FLOORS. I loved the suite so much I wish I could live there. The cherry on top of the trip was the staff. We were helped by two lovely ladies both named Rebecca at the front desk (The Rebecca's!). They helped confirm our reservation, told us all about the David Burke Kitchen, Jimmy's, and all the amenities included in the suite. They were so nice and helpful, honestly the best! I would definitely stay here again!

Having had the pleasure of a few good hotels in my time in NYC (some good, some great, some so bad it cannot be repeated in a forum like this) I was very pleased to see that the good things others had said about the James were echoed in my own stay.Upon arrival, very late at 1.30am I may add, we were greeted by warmth from the bell hop and shown to the reception which sits a few floors up. Check in was quick and friendly and our room was bigger than many in New York, with a very modern and clean feel and good views. We actually had a small problem with the blind for the bathroom but it was resolved quickly by a transfer the next day and done so seamlessly it was effortless.The staff across the board were very friendly and although the pool closing early at weekends may inconvenience some, it was not a major issue for us and it was largely empty during the weekdays so you had a great spot to relax when not enjoying the many delights New York has to offer.Special mention goes to the bell hops who were brilliant fun and a great first and last impression and embodied how good the hotel was.Location was great, very central, we could pop to the local shops and bars or get to anywhere on the subway and even heading out of town was easy as you're not far from the bridges.Definitely recommend.

it was with excitement we were looking to our latest trip to NYC and a new hotel in the James in our favourite area soho and it has been a major dissapointment from the start. first given our last visit was similar price the room in our last hotel trump soho ws so much bigger than the standard room in the james and is on par with the husain rooms in that they are tiny and do not reflect the cost. in this case more money is not equal to more space and I would recommend getting a room at the trump which us so much more spacious . also we have asked for 4 days for memory foam pillows and we're still waiting as they don't have enough it appears .. which in its self should tell the management they need to buy more if they are this requested. this was a re arranged 50th birthday treat for me as last year when I turned 50 my wife was seriously ill just prior to our trip and we had to cancel and we decided to go with the james but wish I had re booked the trump. the staff whilst friendly enough just don't seem to follow through on their promises and it is wearing having to request the same things over and over and after we complained about room size etc although we were moved to a floor 2 floors higher with a quieter outlook it was still the same size so no real upgrade.pluses though are the door staff Eric and Co for recommendations tc and Jimmys roof bar has stunning views over NYC

Danced and drank around the pool with a mixed group of friends at the Rooftop bar. Really enjoyed the view at sunset, drew a great crowd and everyone was really friendly. The Low rider chill cocktail was spot on.

Great location however when you have a room just underneath Jimmy's it is an experience I would never recommend to friends of family. Besides the noise of music also drunk people on the 16th floor and the elevator.For me this results is a low price quality experience which I do not want to repeat.

The James is located in SoHo and is one of the hotels located closest to our daughter's apartment. You need to take an elevator to the lobby to check in. David Burke's kitchen is located in the building which is a well known farm to table restaurant. There is a lovely outside bar area if it is not too hot. There is a roof top pool which has a club as well. Don't think you are going to swim laps because it is very small. Check it out for the beautiful view. The rooms were clean but small. They offere a mini bar with an assortment of drinks and snacks but very pricey. They had water in a glass container by the bed but no free water to take with you. Since we are not in the room for a long time it was fine. We were not happy with the noise level at night. It may be because of the night club when folks are leaving. We woke up about 2:00 am to shouts and some loud voices in the hallway which did not stop until 5:00am. We also encountered rude drunk young men in the elevator when we were heading out earlier. They do offer free coffee in the mornings in the lobby. The staff was friendly and helpful but we will consider another option when visiting NYC next time.

This Soho located hotel is an excellent choice for business and leisure travellers. Ideally located in the Soho area, all shopping and entertainment places are nearby. The service is also outstanding. Design of rooms and public areas is very modern and functional. The view from the room I stayed was amazing too. Rooms are of good size for Manhattan standards.I will definitely stay again. Thank you!

Great views from the rooftop bar area, lots of tables set up for dining if you want some snacks with your cocktails. Great cocktails, great food-menu changes with the season/time, both overpriced but tasted great so can't complain and this is NYC so to be expected. Right next to an entrance for the high line, you can see the river from the roof. decent music. The term pool is wildly generous, its a large in ground tub. its a nice scene / vibe except on truly hot days when everyone is desperate for water and it becomes obscenely crowded. Entrance to to rooftop pool and bar is free fyi.

Boutique hotel in SOHO with excellent restaurant (David Burke) nightclub (Jimmy) and rooftop plunge pool. The views are amazing. The valet was efficient. The staff was friendly. The room was super swanky and extremely neat and clean thanks to JOANN in housekeeping.

Location is perfect, the views are spectacular. The rooms are perfect and well equipped. Beautiful bath, with an awesome shower. Great bedding and a very comfortable bed. Try for the late check out, the bed is that good. Every single staff member we engaged was polite and willing to assist with a kind smile and great style. Loved our stay!

Gorgeous white modern tower in top location between Soho and Tribeca,Room had REALLY excellent windows, minimal sound from street -actually quiet. My room was upgraded, (I paid for it), and the king corner room was spectacular,open, modern, clean, and gorgeous. Ordered room service -arrived late at night.Great chicken soup, try it.The hotel has a super crazy rooftop bar with a MAJOR bar scene,the entrance to the roof bar is like a club, with a bouncer, all the attitude of a nightclub.The pool is tiny, and the place is so busy , and probably few guests were up there.We were asked to move from the wooden bench facing the dirty back of the bar because someone reserved the wooden bench.(only in New York).Do not recommend going up there.Restaurant in lower level was solid, had yogurt,fruit. Good free coffee in lobby.Outdoor restaurant is $$$$$$$ over priced.So stay at hotel, enjoy the room, but don't do anything else there.

This is our second time visiting the James Hotel because our first time was so nice. When we were checking in we were asked if we wanted a glass of wine. Such a nice gesture on the staff. And of course we accepted. Everyone is so friendly and made us feel special. The roof top bar has spectacular views of the city. We had a corner room so the views from our room were just beautiful. SoHo is a nice part of the city to stay. We are planning on staying at this hotel again.

Me and my wife have three children under the age of five it was our eight year anniversary and we just wanted to get away for a day and relax we chose the right place they were accommodating clean relaxing located in a great area with tons of stuff to do in the hotel great restaurant and probably the friendliest staff I've ever encountered can't wait to go back !!

Great location, in the heart of soho. The rooms are a good size. The staff are super helpful, and regularly check in to see if you need anything. The complimentary wine and cheese every afternoon is a beautiful touch. The jimmy roof top is a fantastic view of southern Manhattan, and the pool was lovely on the hot summer days.Not much more to say really, this place is absolutely excellent, and I'd definitely stay there again when visiting NYC.

We stayed 2 nights. Loved the location (Soho); staff was uniformly warm and professional; room nicely appointed; fantastic rooftop bar. Just don't get a room on floors 16 or 17 if you want to get to sleep early - the bar music is really loud until 2 am. Otherwise, highly recommended. (Join the Tablet Club for room upgrades, late checkout, and other benefits - really glad we did this - great value even if you just stay 1 or 2 times a year in Tablet hotels).

We appreciated staying at The James. However the price did not match the service level expected. Nonetheless, great location, well- connected by subway and the roof-top pool offers a killer view of New York at nights. The Friday night pool parties, which is open to the general public and it feels like all of SOHO is in attendance, is a bit of an inconvenience to the hotel guests who pay $400 and per night.

My top choice in NYC. The Staff is incredibly accommodating and Johnny Houston (Front Desk Manager) in particular is a fantastic host - always one step ahead of any need. Looking forward to my next visit!

My wife and I were disappointed with our 6 night stay at the James in July. For a hotel that appears to have high aspirations, it lets itself down in many areas. Firstly we found the majority of staff were not very friendly and didn't go out of their way to help. The main issue is the rooftop pool bar, Jimmy. It gets packed at night with a younger crowd that come in off the street, and the rooftop pool closes in the afternoon to accommodate this. The bar is often four deep and you'll have to wait up to 20 minutes to try and get a drink at night, from a rude bar tender. There is no priority for hotel guests and the whole rooftop pool area is poorly managed. Even the pool boy took his shirt off, sat in the pool and didn't help any of the guest. If you are going here for the pool area and pool bar, beware. One day we were notified (only by a sign in the elevator), that the pool would be closed that day due to a private function! I was told that the pool bar is under separate ownership and the hotel has no control of it. The James markets itself on the rooftop bar and pool, which lets down the whole experience.

Great hotel...amazing bathroom...great location...awesome rooftop. Definitely a plus. Plenty of restaurants to choose from walking distance. Train station at the corner. Small but cool rooftop pool. The exterior of the hotel ehh but once inside its beautiful.

Great hotel and downtown location. Fantastic views of the city from Jimmy - the rooftop indoor/outdoor bar - especially good at night with views of Freedom Tower- spectacular Manhattan setting on a summer night. Rooftop pool is small but such a great place for a pool.

The James has literally the best room service ever courtesy of David Burke Kitchen. All the staff we dealt with the Jimmy to the hotel to restaurant and special events were welcoming and extremely helpful

Had a small corner suite that was just bleh. Reception area is on the small side and the room looked like it had a lot of travelers pass through it! A few scratches, dents, and the rooms were quite cramped next to each-other to the pt where you could hear almost everything in the hallways like doors closing/opening!
user_name:
cliffstravels
New York City, New York

review_body: I loved staying at the James Hotel. Great location, beautiful outdoor area and rooftop. The rooms were clean and lovely. Also Kenny, the bellman, went above and beyond in making my stay perfect! Next time I visit NYC, I will absolutely stay at the James again.

The absolute worst experience I have ever had with a hotel. My husband and I took an anniversary trip to New York City over Memorial Day weekend, and chose to stay at The James Hotel. The stay itself was fine, but what happened after was absolutely not acceptable. We were charged for over one hundred dollars of minibar expenses, when we never took anything. We didn't touch the minibar, it's just something we never, ever do. I found the charge on my credit card a few weeks after our stay, and spoke to several people at the James, constantly getting a different answer. It went from "our mistake, it will be credited back", to accusations from the food and beverage manager, "I was personally in your room and saw that the alcohol was gone, and that there were drinks in the room" (there wasn't, only our water glasses). I eventually had to call my credit card company and report them for fraud, which finally worked out in my favor, but the entire process took two months, several hours, many calls, and much frustration. It's too bad as we would have considered staying with them again, but after this debacle we will stay far away. I warn visitors of this hotel to make sure they get all receipts while checking out, and confirm that they are not getting fraudulently charged. We have never had anything like this happen to us before, and we are very disappointed in how the hotel management handled it.

I can't begin to tell you how extraordinary this hotel is. My friends are I are local in New York but decided on a staycation for my roommate's birthday. We booked a room at the last minute for the pool (given the fact that the other hotel pools in the area seemed to get too crowded or have too many people on any given day) and we were not disappointed. From the moment I walked in I felt like I was at home. The staff treated us extremely well, upgrading our room based on sheer availability and kindness. Upon checkin, we were offered a glass of wine, and then given recommendations about what we should do that night (we did end up having a few drinks at the Jimmy). Being a local, it's amazing when the place you're staying and the staff make you feel like you're actually on vacation. None of the staff had any qualms that we were local and in fact went out of their way to make sure our stay was the best it could be. When we went up to the pool the next morning, we were happily surprised when the front desk staff told us we could check out and still stay by the pool until it closed. I then randomly happened to meet the General Manager and the Director of Front Office Operations and even though they clearly had work to do and were busy, they stopped not only to talk to me, but to ensure that we were having a great time, making sure we were comfortable by the pool and even making the joke of taking away my cell phone to ensure we stayed stress-free! The room was beautiful, had a very comfortable bed, and the carafe of water on the bedside is a nice touch. Overall we were extremely comfortable and had an amazing time even staying over for one night.

I requested a room upgrade and late check-out, both of which were available for a reasonable fee. The staff was incredibly helpful and pleasant. Room service was on time every morning and served by a joyful attendant. The bedroom was a decent size for NYC, super clean, really comfortable bed, and terrific views from the large windows. I loved the fitness room that overlooks the city as well as the roof-top pool. I will definitely return.

I stayed at the James NYC over the weekend and had an excellent experience. The location is ideal, the hotel is gorgeous, and the service was fantastic. The views from both the roof top and the rooms are spectacular. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Superior, 10-Star, Customer Service provided by all members of the staff. We were treated exceptionally well and we enjoyed being pampered. The rooms are a great size for the city & maybe some of the most comfortable beds. The morning coffee and evening win & cheese hour were both delightful and great touches. t We're in NYC 6-8 times a year, but this was our first visit to the James Hotel and we'll be back! Thank you Jay, Jason & Kenny for your excellent service, but a super thanks to John for making this the best, personalized experience we've ever had in any city, state, country or continent!!

Stayed with my wife in a beautiful room with amazing unobstructed views of lower Manhattan, Brooklyn, and Jersey City. Unique rooftop pool bar stood out, as did the wine and cheese happy hour and courteous/knowledgeable staff. The location is great and QR coded art by floor was something I had never seen before. La Colombe coffee and scones in the AM was also a hit! Would definitely stay here again on next nyc trip!

Just returned from a 4 night stay as a couple at the James. Second time to New York and staying in Soho gives a real taste of New York in comparison to Midtown. We had stayed at the James in Miami and were really impressed so thought this would be a good choice. Good points: close to subway, great neighbourhood for shops, restaurants and bars all within walking distance. Doormen were so friendly and helpful, I didn't get their names but they do a great job welcoming people to the hotel and deserve credit for this. Rooms are very stylish great decor as is all of the hotel. Stayed in a king superior which was spacious enough for us. Bed very comfy, we asked for the memory foam pillows which were much more supportive. A/C worked brilliantly and was a relief from the 30+ degree heat. View from the room was fabulous, although I wish we had paid more for the corner king to get an even better view. Free coffee in the morning and wine/cheese in the evening but pastries had all gone when we got to the lobby at 9am one morning. Showers are lovely and spacious. It was my partners birthday and I had asked if there was anything they could do as a surprise, a young guy at the front desk (I didn't get his name) arranged for a very tasty chocolate cake to be left in the room whilst we were out which was a really nice touch so thank you for that! The same guy was also helpful at check in and gave us tips for places to go for drinks. The hotel is hip and stylish and a great place to be. A few negatives from our point of view: I found the room to be quite noisy late at night with other guests on the same floor closing doors and being generally noisy whilst waiting for lifts and also music from the rooftop but wasn't enough to keep us awake. Nothing major in terms of the room but in a hotel of this standard I wouldn't expect to have milk sachets not replaced or washcloths replaced for 2 days, it just felt that attention to detail was lacking - holes in towels, dressing gowns with loop holes detached etc. Lastly, the rooftop was one of the main reasons we booked this hotel. The opening times and areas reserved are made clear, however it generally felt that the public/private parties are prioritised over hotel guests, which I found surprising. It is clearly a very popular spot for parties/events which is hardly surprising as the views are amazing day or night. No one said anything in particular which was rude or offensive but there was just a general vibe that felt unwelcoming as guests. On our last day we wanted to see the view in the morning so headed up just to take some photos around 9am, it was quiet, there was a member of staff walking around and a couple of people sat/stood around drinking coffee. I had suggested to my partner that we get a drink to enjoy the view, despite the member of staff not being welcoming. There was some coffee/pastries on the bar just like what is provided downstairs...he poured himself a drink and was just about to offer me one when a woman who was stood around said "actually they are for a photo shoot that is happening this morning"...it felt like somehow we had done something wrong despite there being no sign that this was not for hotel guests and the member of staff had not informed us that there was an event happening. We apologised to the woman and she said it was OK but it should have been pointed out to us beforehand. We just wanted to relax and enjoy the views but every time we visited the rooftop it felt somehow uninviting in atmosphere. In the evening it was very busy as I would have expected though and there was a long wait for the bar. Also there is a different lift to get up to the bar after a certain time so you can't just go up from your room floor. I would suggest if the rooftop is a place you want to visit, you would be better trying to make reservations not as a hotel guest. Overall the James was a great experience and we loved New York! Thanks to the staff that made us feel welcome :)

Nice hotel with great amenities. Got a comfy corner room with lots of space. Lovely outdoor areas. Nice touch in a sea of concrete streets and buildings! Great neighborhood with lots to see and do. Wonderful shopping and restaurants within a 5 minute walk. Two downsides -- Kinda tough getting a taxi. Especially if you're planning to dine and do a show after 5 pm. Hotel doorman was so helpful, but it took him over 15 minutes to finally get us a cab to Times Square area. Second issue was more troublesome in that their rooftop lounge is a very popular spot in the evenings, which means it's extremely loud (live music with waaayyyy too much bass!) plus tough getting an elevator to our room.

Staying on the edge of TiBeCa and Soho is great. The hotel is very comfortable especially since it is hip and modern. Although the rooms are not large, you don't feel cramped because of the ceiling height, Windows and thoughtfulness of the design. The staff were attentive and friendly. It was nice that one didn't feel secondary to "roof top bar".

Arrived a little early Friday afternoon for an overnight stay meeting up with my brother in law and his wife who were visiting from Australia. Coming over from New Jersey out of the Holland Tunnel with very easy access to the front of this hotel. I pulled up to valet my car ( Very convenient ! ) and was greeted by a very professional gentleman who took my keys, removed my bags from my car and directed me up to reception. We had booked a corner studio online. When I arrived at reception to check in I was told that there was some good news and some bad news. The good news was that my wife and I had been upgraded to the Penthouse ! The bad news was that the room wasn't ready. I would take bad news like that every day of the week ! We located our relatives and went off for some afternoon food and drinks. When we returned our bags had already been brought up to our room. We all went up to the Penthouse for a look. Spectacular !! is all I can say. I have been in some nice hotel rooms before but never one like this. It was like a luxury Manhattan apartment. That said I can only provide a review of this room. I'm sure the other rooms are really nice too. The Hotel also has a rooftop pool which is kind of on the small side and might be a little uncomfortable to swim in when the bar is open which is also on the roof. The bar could use a little more help when it gets crowded as it took some time to get drinks later in the evening. When we were up there in the afternoon around 5 there was no issue. We all went back to the penthouse where we sat in the lounge, had some champagne, ( Provided by my other sister in law ) took in the great view and talked till 3 in the morning. What a great time provided by the very special James Hotel. I highly recommend this hotel. Even if you don't get an upgrade. But then again you never know do you.

It was a weekend get together when everyone was coming from miles around to meet up. It was a nice hotel, reasonably priced, stylish, and comfortable. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We didn't have a place to hang out other than restaurants, which gets pricey after a while. The rooms were too small to use as our lounge but the lobby and the Garden area were perfect. Again, the staff were extremely helpful as we needed glasses to drink our store bought Champagne and they were happy to oblige. Finally, I left my watch in the room. Fully expecting that even if it was found that it was gone (jaded pessimist, I know), I was pleasantly surprised that when I called to inquire the housekeeping staff had indeed found it and was happy to help shepherd it home to me.

I love the James! I have stayed here twice and always received wonderful service and the rooms are fairly priced. The size of the hotel, the aesthetics, and the location are all just right. I would highly recommend The James

What a great way to celebrate my wife's birthday! We had an amazing room at The James Soho- the One Bedroom Apartment with a beautiful view of NYC. Had a great night's sleep and never heard the city! What awesome views! Beautiful and spacious room and bathroom. The experience overall was great- gave me a good intro to the Soho neighborhood, nice touches like coffee and scones in the morning, fruit in the afternoon and wine at night! Dinner at the David Burke Kitchen outside under the stars was amazing.

My sisters and I travelled to NYC to celebrate my sisters 40th birthday and chose the James Hotel. This hotel is in a superb location, our corner rooms had amazing views. The staff were exceptional. They were very attentive and even gave us proper wine glasses for the wine hour.Definitely worth going

I travelled to NYC for my birthday celebrations and stayed at the James. The staff during my staff from Wednesday to Saturday were amazing, one particular member stands out but unfortunately I didn't catch his name. From the day we arrived he was so helpful from providing ice with our water to supplying wine glasses with our wine. The rooftop bar was amazing and again this one staff member was able to secure a reservation for us at short notice. Overall, the hotel, the location and particularly the staff were brilliant, very helpful and really down to Earth. To see the real NYC I would definitely recommend a stay here.

Went with my sisters to celebrate birthday, the hotel was very accommodating. We had 2 corners rooms ample space and the views were amazing.We reserved areas in the rooftop bar, superb way to spend for pre-dinner drinks.Thanks goes to the maintenance man who provided for our needs and the managers who provided us wine glasses and provided a room as a gesture due to a late flight.

We are in NYC a couple times a year, and love the Sixty chain, Kimptons, Hotel Hugo, and other nice but not huge chains. We had heard The James was a nice option...unfortunately we aren't super impressed at all. We had a nice check-in experience as we arrived early and our bags were stored so we could explore a little. As we booked 2 nights, on 2 different sites (cheaper that way), he graciously let us know that we would not have to change rooms and that he'd go ahead and check us in for both nights and bookings. That's about as good as our experience got. When we got back to the hotel after dinner, we checked with reception to get our room keys. We were told our bags had already been taken up...Great! But of course, they weren't. Whatever, no biggie, they came soon enough. The room is fine, nothing spectacular, especially for the price point. Dried urine on the toilet seat, but it wasn't worth the hassle of changing rooms so we just cleaned it ourselves, but come on...it's not like it was a dirty sock under the bed...It's the TOILET SEAT. As most rooftop bar/pools are, the evenings belong to the public (and at least they notify you of this in the elevator signs), and we had a nice enough time on a beautiful night overlooking the financial district, terrific views- best part of the hotel by far. Here's where they get annoying...we headed out this morning for a little food and shopping before it got too hot out. Left at 10:30am, returned at 2pm, looking forward to a relaxing afternoon on the roof at the pool with an overpriced NYC drink. Room keys don't work, back to reception. Sorry, we thought you checked out, so we need to check you back in. So we go through the whole check-in process again (didn't he tell me I wouldn't have to go through this?...whatever, maybe I misunderstood him/or vice versa. At least they let us stay in the same room. Get back to the room and it was still not cleaned up. Not the end of the world but we left the Housekeeping sign up so we could have a fresh room to return to, and if they thought we were leaving wouldn't that have been done first thing to turn the room? Quick change in the room and up to the rooftop pool, our plan for the afternoon and the main reason we booked here (for the pool). SORRY FOOL, we close (remove the lounge chairs) the pool to the guests at 2pm to let the public in at 3. What? Did the public pay $300-500+ a night to sit at the pool? So here I sit, as they take the lounge chairs up and re-arrange for the public...You know, none of this is the worst experience ever, but at the very least they should let you know that when you come in for a weekend in the city, you can't use the amenities all the time. Have signs posted, put it visibly accessible for us, mention it on the website. I mean, it's the first picture that usually pops up when you're advertising the hotel. Let people know that you have to wake up and go straight to the pool if you want to use it. Small nice features if this type of thing impresses you is some lackluster free wine and cheese each evening and some terrific coffee and okay pastries each morning.That's it...If you want a nice alternative, try the SixtySoho or Sixty LES. Also Hotel Hugo was terrific, as was Dream in Meatpacking. Too many choices in the city to return here. Too bad...

We (mum and daughter) have just returned from a memorable trip to NYC. The hotel is beautiful, cool and sophisticated, with natural fabrics, wood surfaces and original artworks, outside the terraced bars and restaurant are shaded by trees, grasses and shrubs, and its location in Soho, with its bars, restaurants and shops is perfect for a city break holiday. However, by far the hotel's greatest asset is its staff, helpful, knowledgeable and fun, they made a great holiday even greater.Yes it is expensive, but for such a unique boutique experience we felt it was worth it.
user_name:
roma h
Greater London, United Kingdom

review_body: If you want to pay $500+ for a basic room and no amenities, then stay here. Absolutely zero ambience, and the rooftop bar, one of the neat amenities at the hotel, wasn't available during our stay. Staff were friendly but inexperienced and didn't seem to want to do anything.

The only issue I had with this hotel was the ac unit made a horribly loud noise before starting up every time & the walls seem paper thin....we could hear every door open & close & almost like a knocking above us.

Perfect location, great service, amazing view from the rooftop! A must if staying in soho!!! The terrace of the restaurant is a pearl in Manhattan, the room with the city view was small but cozy. The staff was very attentive. They want toImprove the service on the rooftop bar, especially when pack.

The James is all about understated style, from the unassuming entrance on Grand Street to the comfortably relaxed lounge area in 20th century scandi design, to the smart roof terrace lunch restaurant. We came for a long weekend and found the hotel perfectly located to be just a walk or short über ride away from all the things we wanted to do. The "standard" room was indeed standard in term of size, but very stylishly fitted out with dark stained wooden floors, white crisp linens and a sumptiously dark tiled bathroom with a massive ceiling shower. Only small irritation was the sideboard being set up like a fully stocked corner shop with sweets, chocolates, crisps, popcorn, beer, booze, softdrinks etc. but we were able to quickly shove all the goods on sale into one of the cupboard to give us some more space and for the room not to feel cluttered. The small pool on the rooftop was a peaceful retreat and gave a welcome rest and cooling down from walking around in 30C. However, from 3pm they open the pool to the public and it then immediately turns from blissful resting place to frantic party hangout. It was great fun later in the evening, and the DJ was very good.Breakfast dowstairs in the David Burke Kitchen was delicious -loved the very berry waffles! Staff throughout the hotel were super friendly and helpful, and not overly formal or overbearingly enthusiastic as sometimes US hotel staff can be.Would we come back -yes, most definitely.

I stayed at The James with my husband at the beginning of May and I would highly recommend it as a downtown hotel. Lots of shops and restaurants and close to everything downtown! The room size was reasonable and very functional. We had a corner room with a view of 1WTC, the size was perfect. Anything smaller might be a bit of a squeeze for 2 people. We ordered room service once and it was delicious. The staff was friendly and very helpful when I went back 3 days later to collect some things I left in the room. Kenny at the front door was fantastic - almost worth a visit just to be assisted by him! (The only 2 things they could improve on - their G&T's and the serving of tea - perfecting the latter seems to elude those beyond the pond)

Staying downtown is definitely the way to go. The St. James is in a perfect location and feels cool and authenticity Soho. Room was small but comfortable and well designed. The bathroom looked as if it only had a glass wall between it and the bed, but a shade came down for privacy. I was really looking forward to using the very modern and minimalistic, rainwater shower, but the water pressure was low and the water was tepid at best. That part was very disappointing. We didn't try the restaurant or bar -so many options nearby.

Wonderful boutique hotel, great situation in the middle of Soho.Roof top bar, very good food, all staff helpful, friendly and nothing too much trouble. All with a smile.Rooms well appointed and fun.Many restaurants and cafes close by. So much to see just walking, walking.Fabulous shops and small parks.The James good to come home to.

I have to credit the staff that they are doing the best they can with the resources they have. In my opinion, this comes down to bad upper management who is clearly more concerned with their bottom line and filling beds than actually maintaining their property or properly training and managing their staff. What I kept hearing was, "We're sorry sir. Our mistake." Wrong room assigned, key cards that don't work, stained curtains, clogged sink, a Costco power strip inserted into the nightstand for electronics, and faded art in the hallways that use QR codes as a cool factor. This once hip and shining beacon needs a major overhaul and update.

Just back from a weekend in NYC and had a wonderful stay at the James Hotel. Great location, comfortable bed, and wonderful service. The lobby area is especially noteworthy with time appropriate treats/drinks available throughout the day. My girlfriends and I enjoyed exceptional service from one of the managers (Johnny Houston), who kept our wine glasses full and ensured we enjoyed the cheese and crackers that were available. Great rooftop bar as well. Look forward to coming back again!

In general I really enjoyed staying here. The room was small but well planned, with dark hardware floor. Big windows overlooking Soho and a very comfortable bed and linen. Bathroom with a roomy walk in shower (although I did not like the soap and shampoo that was provided, had a minty smell and stung). It is located in the south east corner of Soho, a quiet street but yet not far from cafés and shopping. The entrance looks like any ordinary apartment building, with the reception situated on the first floor. You don’t pass any lounge, restaurant or bar on the way to your room, so all along I had the feeling I was renting an apartment rather than staying in a hotel. The bar on the rooftop was not accessible when I stayed in the hotel, some closed events toke place, and apparently that happens a lot. Not a worry for me, but if you are looking for more social space and personal service this is not the place. The gym on the top floor was small but well equipped. Had a scare when I enjoyed the view, slightly leaning on to the window, and it suddenly swung open... I reported it so I am sure they fixed it.There is a restaurant connected to the hotel, but I found my favorite breakfast place 4o meters away: Sanctuary T. The serve delicious sandwiches, pancakes and good coffee (although they actually specializes in tea).

Great hotel and great customer service . The rooms were clean, modern, and beautiful. The food there was also amazing ! I couldn't have asked for a better time . I will definitely be back at The James !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Cool place, sweet but small rooms! Great staff...never feels crowded and feels like you are one of very few guests. Awesome Rooftop bar!!close to canal st. train and has some cool areas in the hotel to hang out (lobby area, outdoor eating area).

Hotel was first notch! Director of Front Office, Elmo Wells, was very helpful and attentive. Usually in hotels in NYC you are shuffled in and out. This gentleman is a true professional and even helped us with Concierge needs!

Modern hotel in the heart of soho with easy access to all areas of Manhattan. Though modern the hotel does not lose its sense of comfort. Floor to ceiling windows with views of the city and a king size bed were great to come back to after a night on the town. The rooftop bar is one of the most exclusive and sought after bars around. Staff was courteous and inviting. The James is a must stay and i will recommend to all!!

This is a must if you are going to a bar! The view is breathtaking, the DJ really tuned into the mood at the bar. We tried several of different drinks - all good! The guacamole was perfect-also the tortilla chips. Next time we hope to have a clear sky

This hotel is so beautiful, so hip, so well designed - I loved it and just returned from a week in a gorgeous corner room with spectacular views! Loved the urban garden and the lobby decor - just the overall vibe was amazing. Coffee and scones in the AM a huge bonus (thank you for providing every day until 10AM!), and generally just a lot of chill flexibility offered to their guests. I would absolutely stay here again as I loved it, but I want to let people know that the rooftop while insanely cool is almost always booked for private parties. This was a big disappointment for us as it was the primary reason we booked this hotel. There is zero chill in regard to the elevator situation or being considered a guest when it comes to the rooftop. The guy with an earphone on the deck acts like an air traffic controller and tells you that if you are a hotel guest you must stay in a small unattractive area that has no bar service. He kept saying "I have 2 private parties coming of 150! - you need to move!" This was Saturday evening at about 5:15PM (the rooftop opens at 5) and it was wide open. He said "come back another night." Honestly he was over the top it in his rudeness/dismissiveness, but I understand management needs to make the changes. Many other nights it was posted in the elevator "private party start tonight on the rooftop at 8PM". In general, while this rooftop is the coolest thing going in SoHo (and arguably some of the best views in NYC), why spend all of the money to stay at The James if they treat you like you don't belong there. Clearly, they want it saved for VIP parties and locals. In fairness to their clientele they should just disclose this. I would have given The James five stars plus if it weren't for this fact!

I really feel if you want to visit this hotel keep your expectations low. The rooms are worn and tired. Many areas of the hotel are in need of maintenance. The beds are very comfortable. Reception staff are pleasant and were keen to resolve issues with had with housekeeping removing items from our room and putting them in the trash. If you want something special in NYC this is not the place to go! And it's true you can't use the pool out of season (we weren't made aware of the seasons until we got there as booked through a third party) even if it is a hot day.

Just returned from a 4 night stay at The James in NYC and I can't say enough about this SOHO hotel! The service and staff are 5 star and really make you feel at home. We were great most mornings by Johnny and a cup of coffee. He went out of his way to make us comfortable, making itinerary suggestions, storing luggage and he even introduced my niece to another employee to talk sports! Rooms are small (average for NYC) but the beds comfortable and you have everything you need. Quiet and relaxing at the end of your day sightseeing! Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby! We will definitely be back to my new SOHO fave! I didn't get the door man's name on Sunday but he went out of his way to get me a driver to the airport for a flat fee and with the rain and traffic it saved me a great deal of money! Thank you To The James we will be back!

Morgan and Brian did an amazing job accommodating me and my special requests i highly recommend this hotel and kudos to the staff!I planned to propose to my GF and the staff did an amazing job!Morgan and Brian are the best!Thanks alot!

Hotel hot water tank must be small or on the fritz ... no hot water for showers on Wed AM, and no explanation or reconciliation. Unacceptable for this level of a hotel property. When I called the front desk, they said they would call back or send up engineering. Had to take a freezing cold shower as there was no call back, no engineer and the front desk played that they didn't know anything about the issue. My colleague had the same issue on another floor, so I don't think this would have been a surprise to them.

My wife and I stayed for 5 days. We wanted to explore Soho and lower Manhattan. The location on Grand and 6th Avenue was great and thieves to the West over the Hudson River are stunning. The hotel though was not our favourite. The public spaces feel a little restricted and while the rooms are well designed they are small and lack space to unpack. Also the walls are very thin! The staff are very helpful, the rooftop bar is very popular and fun and the Treetop bar which overlooks 6th Avenue at 2nd storey night is nice in the summer. The signature restaurant is good but expensive. While the hotel works hard with boutique type touches such as complimentary coffee and pastries in the lobby and wine and cheese in the evening the building itself means that the hotel just doesn't have that boutique feel.bwe encountered several repeat visitors so it suits some but we will not be going back.

i travel a decent amount for business and pleasure - and i have stayed in many hotels in NYC over the years - my travel agent booked me at the james when it first opened - i had not been to the one in chicago so i wasn't sure what it would be like but i thought i would give it a try... WOW! this has become my go-to hotel and it is by far the best in the city - and i have tried many! bed is super comfy, floor is beautiful, floor to ceiling windows, amazing rain shower head, they use full size toiletries so there is no waste from those little plastic bottles, there is always someone super friendly at the door, the rooftop bar is great to meet friends at or have some business drinks, the room service food is amazing and all from david burke kitchen - the shoestring french fries are to die for! the best part is the manager, johnny houston, he remembered me when i came back, gave me his card and has been giving me incredible service ever since. DO NOT STAY ANYWHERE ELSE! This hotel rocks!

I stayed at the James Hotel during the second week of April. I typically stay down the block at another hotel. Not anymore. This hotel is so much better. Not only are the rooms bigger and nicer, but the overall "feel" to the place is totally high end, but comfortable. Loved the free coffee and pastries in the morning and cheese and wine in the evening. Service was incredible. Definitely my new favorite hotel in Soho.

This hotel is clean. The staff is very professional and they make you feel very welcome. We were upgraded to a corner suite this past time and it was a incredible view with many window.
