This was our second stay at The James and we are already booked for our 3. The location is right in Soho, walking to meat packing and west village was a breeze.

Stayed at this hotel nearly a year ago. Liked the room and the rooftop bar. Location is convenient. Not among the top places in New York but good enough. Close to Soho, Chinatown, and it is an area that is improving. The rooftop bar has very nice views and apparently a very trendy spot in the city. Drinks are less impressive.I take off one star for the service. My mother-in-law came back to the room one night and found all her toiletries on the floor. Her skin care products got all broken, and most importantly a piece of cleaning pad mysteriously disappeared. The pad is probably a couple of dollars' worth but the problem is she has a medical condition that requires her to use the pad every night. It was already night and it's impossible to purchase it anywhere. It was very stressful. We complained that night as well as the next morning when we were checking out. The crew apologized but did nothing to remedy it. After getting back home I realized that I lost my laptop charger in my room. So I called the hotel to ask them to mail it to me. The manager I was speaking to was very nice. I mentioned the incident of my mother-in-law to him and he offered to refund some money for the trouble.Would be happy if things were smooth since then! Well, long story short, it took nearly two weeks for me to finally get my charger and the refund, after I called four or five times to the hotel in increasing frustration. Every time it was a different person, who would tell me my charger was on the way, but then apparently it would get lost in a black hole in the hotel. I would have just bought a new one had I known! Oh in between I did receive a charger from the hotel....an apple watch charger, although I clearly said mine was macbook pro charger.Anyway in the end I did receive the charger and the refund so it was all fine. Will probably stay again if I need to be in this area of New York.

I love this hotel. Modern, light, airy and great service. A well furnished spacious room, with lots of light (corner king), and great amenities. Food was delicious, and the best bit...Dog friendly! NOTE: the restaurant is NOT dog friendly as it is managed separately. However, the hotel rooms and public areas are dog friendly. The staff were helpful, the scones for breakfast with coffee were gratis and delicious, and the housekeeping were quick/efficient and thorough! By far, my favourite hotel in this part of Manhattan...can't beat location for Holland Tunnel and access to newark. Room service selection and quality was excellent.

Although in a great location for the Village, this hotel is worth consideration no matter which area you intend to visit. Very cool and stylish ambience, with seriously nice and helpful people all over. Our corner King had amazing views with floor to ceiling windows, very modern facilities and comfortable bed. The rooftop bar is a destination in itself. Highly recommended and we will certainly return on our next trip.

I am usually a big hotel chain stay person -but I stayed in this place because the company that i was meeting with booked me this hotel. I was very pleasantly surprised by it's location -near to broadway and other places -yet reasonably quiet. I really liked the room, the bed, the view, the triple filtered water bottle. For the rate that they had me booked -I got a nice bottle of complimentary wine as well. Next time if I do stay in NYC - The James will be on top of my list!.

My husband and I came to NYC to visit our son and his wife who just moved to Brooklyn Heights. We wanted to be in NYC in order to enjoy the museums, shows, restaurants etc., but we also wanted to have reasonable access to Brooklyn. The James Hotel worked very well for us.We stayed for a week and had a corner room (6th floor) with picture windows across two adjacent walls. The view of The Freedom Tower was wonderful. The king bed was extremely comfortable (not too firm) and the linens were of high quality. There were bedside reading lights on both sides of the bed. Most importantly, there was a power strip on my side of the bed so I could charge several devices simultaneously.There is a small stocked refrigerator that had space to put a few items of our own. There is a small round table with one wire frame chair. In addition, there is a five foot bench which served as seating and storage below.Storage was limited to the bedside tables, bench 2-drawer storage, shelving that is 5-6 feet above the ground. This made it difficult for me to reach the shelves since I'm 5'3". There is a closet with several hangers, ironing board and iron. When I called the front desk to inquire about storage, they provided us with two luggage racks which enabled me to have access to the contents.The bathroom is quite roomy (roughly 6' x 6-1/2' plus a generous sized shower. The rain style shower head and sprayer are very nice quality. The towels, including bath sheets, are Turkish cotton and are of high quality. There is ample counter space to place bathroom items. The 5' shelf is roughly 5" deep. The hairdryer, unfortunately, is the type of Conair that runs very hot. It does, however, get the job done. The curious shade in the bathroom which covers the glass wall does a nice job of ensuring privacy.I was impressed with the quality of housekeeping, front desk assistance and technical help. A light bulb burned out and was replaced within ten minutes. A neighbor arrived at their room, which was adjacent to ours, at 2 AM and began laughing and talking very loudly outside our door. I called the front desk and they immediately came up to speak to the revelers. The location is such that we never had trouble getting a cab. The only drawback is that we were quite a distance from the Met Museum. Wine and cheese is provided in the evening and later in the evening cookies are available. Breakfast fare is limited to a small scone and coffee.Across the street is a small shop entitled Thompson's Finest Deli (green menus on the outside walls) which has a great variety of snacks, including bagels with lox, breakfast sandwiches and of omelette so. The entire staff is very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend a stay at The James New York.

The James is a solid hip boutique hotel in Soho and very close to TriBeCa. The room I had was a corner room with great Windows and views to the west. The inhouse restaurant is Michael Burke and is excellent. They do the room service too. The rooftop is a bar and pool with a deck called The Jimmy. It is awesome. I liked it a lot. Friendly staff too.

Thank you to the James hotel for my 4 night stay. What a lovely hotel in a great location with some of the best views in New York. Clean and very cool rooms Will Defo be back again. Keep up the good work. thanks

Wow. Wow. Wow! From the moment I walked in I knew it- This hotel is perfect! Great location- soho (but not deep inside, on the side kinda Soho ;)Great service! Great room! Not small, beautifully designed with a great view. And I still didn't check the food and the roof :)Happy to be here, no doubt I will be back!

Stayed for 4 days in late March, 2016 - The staff was very friendly and helpful - let us check in a bit early after a long flight from the Left coast. Room was very nice, clean modern feel, comfortable size - we were on the 12th floor facing west which offered an excellent view, and was high enough off the street that it was fairly peaceful, for NY. The bed was fantastically comfortable, slept better than I had in months, and the towels were thick and soft. The rain shower head was cool but really needed the wand to get the suds out of your hair. Really big bathroom for New York standards - the glass wall with retractable blind was a nice modern touch, let in enough light but also provided for privacy. The James provides shampoo, soap and conditioner in bulk bottles. This used to bother me, but it really does make more sense and is much more ecological, so I'm good with it. The product, I can't remember the name, but it was nice. Had an inroom safe, and a generous minibar selection. Oh, the WiFi signal was strong on our floor. You just had to log in about once every 24 hours. There was a large bench seat and a small table and chair, in room that was great for setting out the suitcase. Closet had a lot of hangers. And it was really clean! Really, I couldn't ask for more in a room. My only complaint with the property was with the Treehouse bar. Kind of pricey (even for Soho) and lacking - BUT to be fair, I think it was just opening for the season so I'll cut them some slack. Of course Jimmy on the top provides the best views in a really amazing setting - if only we could get a seat and a drink, I'm sure we would have liked it better! But the lounge at the SoHo Grand next door was an excellent substitute. Finally the location was really perfect. SW corner of SoHo with several different subway stations within a 5 minute walk - and easy access to pretty much anything on the South end of Manhattan.

I could have slept in the bed for days!! They were the most comfortable and soft beds and bedding I have ever experienced. I would have loved to take it home. I loved the complimentary bottles of water that were provided as well. The water tasted very fresh with each bottle.

We stayed at The James twice during our New York holiday. Starting from being greeted by the doormen, to checking out, it was a great experience. The staff were very helpful and knowledgable on places to eat locally and helping with directions. Rooms were very clean and tidy, showers were fantastic, including the toiletries (amazing). Check out the rooftop bar on dusk, incredible views. I would highly recommend the James to anyone wanting to stay in the SOHO area.

The James Soho was a pleasant surprise, truly a 'hidden gem'. It felt like an oasis in the middle of the big city. My room was nothing short of stunning - get a corner view if you can, the Freedom Tower was my nightlight, doesn't get much better.I enjoyed the clean feel of the wood floors and the lighting is thoughtfully placed throughout the room. Best minibar ever, it was hardly mini, more like a buffet and certainly well stocked in the liquor department!This location is really great, I stayed in Tribeca last time and while I loved it, it took forever to get to midtown in a cab. Being right off 6th Avenue makes for a much easier commute should you need to go up that way for business or pleasure.Modern, stylish, convenient, great bar and restaurant as well. I'll be back!

Perfect location. Nice rooms. The best rooftop bar! Complimentary pastries&coffee in the morning and wine&cheese in the afternoon. And the staff is supernice and really make you feel at home! We'll come back!

The James hotel is a homey boutique hotel which makes you feel like you're visiting a family member. The staff are very welcoming and their service is exceptional. This hotel is recomended for anyone who wants to feel like ghey are visiting a rich cousin

Stayed here on business, unfortunately there was a lot of construction going on. Would not have stayed if i had known, but all things considered was a good experience. One item to note, parking is a nightmare. Even waiting for the valet i had to circle the block because there was no room to even wait. Getting the car back took patience. Still, good value for the area.

Excellent location. Walk from stores (i.e.Dean and Delucca's) Soho, to Ground Zero.Nice linens, comfortable bed,friendly staff, great roof deck bar. It needs a bit of a facelift.My only major complaint was there was not many surfaces to put stuff down. I would only stay there for a weekend, because it felt a bit claustrophobic. Bathroom was okay, but not much room for toiletries. We had the standard king room. Maybe the next step up would be better if you stayed longer than a weekend.

Had room on 12th floor with double Windows, the view as fantastic especially at night when all the buildings are lit up. Rooms are light and airy and due to the vast amount of natural light coming in feel spacious. Bathroom toiletries were full size and smelt Devine, super shower and the heated floor was lovely. The staff are very friendly especially Kenny. The complimentary snacks and coffee were a real bonus and delicious. Would defeinately stay here again.

The hotel has striking minimalist architecture. Rooms look a tad Spartan, a lot of glass, white lines and edges. The beds and pillows were very soft, which may or may not be to your liking. I called for several foam pillows and they helped. Rooms were clean. The corner rooms have great views of the Neighbourhood. The corner room was a good size for a Manhattan boutique hotel. Thankfully they have blackout curtains so you don't have to worry about bright lights from outside. There is some noise from the street but the hotel is in a relatively quiet end of soho so we were not affected by street noise at all. The entrance to the hotel is not on the same floor as the lobby. In order to get to your room you therefore have to take two different elevators. Troublesome especially if you have heavy bags (there wasn't anyone at the bell desk at the entrance when we arrived). For a smallish hotel the elevators saw a lot of traffic especially during the evening hours because of the rooftop bar upstairs. Prepare to squeeze into crowded lifts and to wait a few minutes to get one. There was a lot of noise in the hotel because of the traffic. Walls seem to be thin. We could hear the TV and conversations of the guest next door. Bumps from the room upstairs resonated very distinctly throughout the room. Do not book this hotel if you are expecting an oasis of calm. Canal street subway station is a few steps away. Hotel is also within walking distance of Soho shopping. Stands out as a design hotel, but like many of these, the James focuses more on its own aesthetic rather than the customer's holistic experience. Worthwhile checking the rooftop bar out for the views and to experience the hotel's design (half of New York seems to be doing so judging from the traffic).

I was recently in the City to show my cousin who was visiting from the mid west, around NYC. From the moment we pulled up to the hotel until they waved goodbye, every employee we came in contact with was happy friendly and helpful. John greeted us on the ground floor to take care of our car and send us up to the lobby. He also gave us great suggestions, and eventually brought our bags to the room when it was ready. We were early to check in, but the reception desk checked our bags and took my phone number so they could call us when the room was available. We left all superfluous items, and set out to sightsee. The neighborhood is excellent and convenient to many sights. You are near a metro that is only one stop from the 911 memorial. There are many shops, restaurants and pubs in the area, and the cool vibe of TriBeCa and SoHo. Reception gave us directons and we headed over toward the Highline park. It is a bit of a walk, but we were up for it. I am sure you could get a train there easily as well. Once we got to Meatpacking Dist. we had a quick bite before heading up to the Highline. We walked all the way to the end taking in the views and the people. While walking the hotel notified us that our room was ready whenever we made it back. We got a ride back to the hotel so we could get there quicker. We were greeted with news that they had been able to upgrade us to a King room, we had a corner room on the 9th floor which offered a lovely view of the buildings around us. They also let us know that there is complementary wine and cheese in the lobby for guests at 6, and that cookies are out from 8-11pm! We went to the room and got cleaned up and made a dinner reservation at a great restaurant around the corner. A great recommendation by Eric, who was Johns evening replacement. We walked the blocks around our hotel and found a great French Patisserie for 4 o'clock coffee and snack. We headed back to the hotel around 6 to change for dinner, we stopped for a glass of wine in the lobby, then changed and went up to the rooftop bar where we enjoyed a drink and a beautiful sunset over the river with a view of Hoboken. After dinner we walked to World Trade Ctr and then back to the rooftop bar- Jimmy. The views of the city lights was wonderful. The room and bed were very comfortable and quiet. (on a Tues-Wed). And we woke up rested for our walk across the Brooklyn Bridge the next day. The staff continued to be helpful and friendly holding our luggage and offering suggestions in Brooklyn. The checkout was smooth and easy. It was a great mini vacation.

Excellent location. Rooms are well appointed but they are very small. I had a deluxe King and I found it to be uncomfortably small. Great rooftop bar, pretty restaurant in the hotel. Hotel staff is very accommodating and friendly.
user_name:
Ron P
New York City, New York

review_body: Two years ago I stayed at the James and gave it a great review. It was just as good when I stayed there this past weekend. Fantastic location close to Soho and TriBeCa - and for those who like to run or walk it is a short walk or run over to the Hudson where there are biking and walking paths.

This hotel is in a good location. The front desk staff and bell man are super friendly, they are the only reason that this hotel got one star instead of zero. I booked it through Expedia thus they managed to upgrade our room, upgraded room is okay but nothing fancy.  1. There's a group of girls who stand in the hallway, in the middle of the night also in the morning talking loudly like no one is around. I felt like I walked into a club or a bar.  2.They double charged me on my room, refunded after I called my bank and my bank called them. It might be a mistake or who knows. I am just glad I got it back. 3.They charged me about $440 for drinks, but the problem is I didn't went to their bar nor do I drink, basically I cannot have any alcohol due to my physical conditions. It is NOT my signature and I NEVER authorized the charge. I talked to them about it, the front desk lady said the management will get back to me, after waiting for 3 days and their manager get back to me saying they will not refund me and asked me to contact the bar's general manager.  4. My boyfriend had a head injury in their room due to their poor maintenance, I know it is not normal for a hotel for this to happen and they probably didn't expect it to happen. But after my bf showed them his injury and walked them through the room, they never get back to him even though they said they will. Plus, we did not ask for anything, expect we wanted to make sure this will not happen in the future.  I have uploaded the photos, please have a look and don't be surprised if the hotel don't pay attention to your issues.

We just stayed for the weekend and it was our first time here. It was clean and everyone was friendly and helpful. The location is very nice in downtown and stores are all nearby and just nice to roam around. The rooms weren't huge but it was decent for NYC. The shower had good pressure and hot water. The mini bar had extra room for you to put your own things as well. The Jimmy bar was good though it gets crowded and it gets loud at night. They had PCs in the lobby for use with a printer. I was told they serve drinks at 5pm, and cookies at night as well as breakfast snacks and cookies in the morning but we didn't go to it so I can't say for sure if this was the case. But I imagine it was there if they told us.

For the last two years, I've always stayed at the James when I'm in NYC for business. However, this trip was less than mediocre. When I was checking in, I asked for a room away from the elevator on a higher floor because I'm a light sleeper. I was put on the 8th floor right across from the elevator. I ended up getting only a few hours of sleep because of all the late night partiers coming off the elevator at 2am being obnoxious. When I called the front desk they assured me that they would put me in a room on a higher floor away from the elevator. Several hours passed and no word of a room change. Then I called the front desk asking if the new room was ready, they had no clue that I requested a room change. Then the manager comes up explaining that there was a confusion in room change then proceeds to put me on the 4th floor facing the traffic where it's even louder. I will no longer be staying at the James.
user_name:
Andrew C
New York City, New York

review_body: My sister and I flew up to NYC for shopping trip. The James is a great location for SoHo and Broadway Street shopping. Beautiful "boutique" style hotel with very comfortable rooms and great restaurant and bar on-site. We would definately return.

A well located boutique hotel in Soho. Our corner king junior suite had great views of the new World Trade Center as well as the East River. Modern bathroom and furniture for a comfortable room experience. Short stroll to great shopping, bakeries, restaurants and coffee shops in Soho, Tribeca and the West Village. Friendly staff too.

It is always a hard location in lower Manhattan to find a decent hotel at a decent price, however after much research into this for my needs while staying in Manhattan i decided on the James Hotel. I arrived to the hotel's bizarre layout of an entrance, The lobby is on the first floor. After waiting for the elevator to go to the reception I arrived and checked in to ask for a high floor and quiet room as I was there for business. The receptionist checked me in and insured me that the room was 'amazing' with such good views on the city. I was already late for a conference call so I said thank you without paying much attention to the room number. The porter assisted me to the room and took my bags which i am happy about as this is their job and payment. I went into my room dialed into the call and worked however after ending my call i started looking around the room and noticed how loud it was, I was on level 3. Practically on the street level and my view was looking over a derelict area of 'Avenue of the Americas'. I tried to focus on my work but was constantly distracted by the outside noise. I then was walking around the room 'Corner studio' and stepped on a screw. as much as this was painful i was shocked that this would happen in a 'Luxury' Hotel. I immediately called down to reception to not only tell them about the noise after asking for a quiet room but also how I had just stepped on a screw and hurt my foot. After taking 20 minutes to call me back they had then agreed to move me to a higher floor and ensured me that this was a much nicer room. I moved to the 8th floor which admittedly was quieter but still does not warrant a Luxury Status. There was no apology from the hotel for the screw or for me stepping on this, no gesture of good will and certainly no acknowledgement that they had done wrong. My stay here was average and nothing special, I certainly did not like the area and I travel to NYC very often for work and pleasure. On departing i mentioned the screw incident and nothing was even spoken about. I asked to be sent my invoice on departing and was told there was nothing else to pay as the bill was paid before arriving.On my return to the UK, I asked the hotel for a breakdown of the stay as I noticed a charge on my credit card i didn't recognise, I had sent that email in December. I never received a reply, I chased this and only now in February had received a response. The email was DISMISSIVE, RUDE and UNHELPFUL. They reply was - to receive an invoice of your stay, you will need to request that from Expedia - that is it. Not answering my question or acknowledging the fact it has taken them 3 months to reply. After looking into this further I found out that they have the capability of finding this information out for me however they were too LAZY to do so, as a few emails later I received the invoice. After back and forth emails and much time spent on this issue along with frustration of not having received a reply sooner and the dismissive response i did receive, I was then promised a refund for 1 night stay. 2 days later they decided that this was not possible and they could not provide this but rather offer me an upgrade when I next stay here. This is unacceptable as I will not be staying in a hotel worthy of only 2 stars. This hotel did not suit my needs or expectations and was highly disappointed.To this day there was no acknowledgement of the screws being loose on the floor which I showed the hotel staff and they also turned the whole discussion of them not replying for 3 month around to blame this on me for not being able to offer me any compensation. Unacceptable customer service and very poor behaviour from the management.

Stayed for a week in January .Perfect location, service was great, friendly and accomodating staff, beautiful rooms and nice little touches (like the wine & cheese in the afternoon)!Kenny & Eric were always there to greet you with a friendly smile.Loved the restaurant and lobby area too.Definitely would stay there again.

This place is incredible. The rooms are extraordinary. The service is phenomenal. The location is perfect. Everything is next level 10/10. Mr. Collins provided the best care and service. THANK YOU for a wonderful weekend.

Well So Ho fans, I am pleased to report that The James New York remains the Gem of So Ho! My wife, children, and I came in for the night of 2/6 to celebrate my wife’s B-day as The James New York is one of her favorite places on earth. This is my fourth review of the James over the last several years and while staffing has changed from time to time, as it does in any hotel, I can tell you The James New York certainly has not lost the recipe for success over the years and consistency is so important in the hospitality business. Customer service from reservations and throughout our entire stay was and continues to be top shelf. Our rooms were immaculate and our stay was simply amazing. John and Jimmy are two of the best doormen in the industry and have become great friends. Jerome, the new front desk manager, is a true hospitality specialist and made us feel just like we were home. Johnny is great as well. At the front desk, Debbie was awesome and the two Jessica’s were so pleasant.The David Burke Kitchen was just as amazing as it always is and a great choice for my wife’s B-Day Dinner. Heather, the new restaurant manager, is an absolute great find for David Burke and our great friend Max, at the bar, always makes an awesome Honey Badger and is an exceptional person.  To the James Team - Keep up the great work. We will be back very soon.

This hotel was very clean. Great location to china town, little Italy, Broadway. The food was excellent and the staff was very welcoming and will go out of their way to help make your request happen. Great wine and cheese hour along with excellent cookie service! Fast room service and great food choices. Beds very comfortable and quiet.

first time at the james...people could not be nicer....food with david burke kitchen providing in room dining and service to meeting room...awesome!! julio Quijata was fast, thoughtful and the front desk manager in the morning made sure i had everything to be able to work early a.m.!

Stayed here for 3 nights and overall a great experience. The customer service was top notch, location was central to everything in Soho and the rooms/lobby area were sleek and low key. The room itself was spacious for NYC and had nice decor but I will say the sheets seemed a little cheap for this calibur of a hotel...had the thin paper feel to them. But the bed and pillows were comfy. Also, the mini bar in the room had an open bag of chips left there...they didn't charge me, but was a tad turned off that it was overlooked. Despite these minor details, I still give the place a five because everything else about it exceeded expectations.

Nice view from the room, but everything else was very average. No staff to be found. Tried to call in room service late one night and was more or less blown off. Got a call from the manager and was told my breakfast would be free the next morning. The breakfast charge was on my bill. Disappointing stay. Would not recommend it.

The hotel is a lovely place. The room was spotless, the lobby is gorgeous and everyone was friendly. However, there is a lot of noise inside the building. We stayed on the 16th floor and I was kept awake all night long by intermittent building noises. I don't know if it was other guests, or whether it was mechanical stuff in the building (scraping noises, thuds, etc.), but eventually I put in earplugs and finished the night up quietly. I also suggest not staying in a west-facing room if possible, because you hear a lot of honking traffic on the approach to the Holland Tunnel. I am sure a room facing east or north is preferable. We did think the hotel was lovely and we felt well taken care of, but... it was somewhat noisy, both inside and out! So great to walk right out in to Soho to enjoy.

I had another wonderful visit at the James last week. This is quickly becoming one of my favorite NY hotels to stay at. Our service was impeccable from the first step out of the cab to the morning of my check out. I felt well taken care of the entire visit and was very impressed by the doorman. He remembered us by name and took care of our every need. All rooms are great views and i LOVE the set up of the room as well. Spacious bathroom, Spacious Closet and nightly turn down service with delicious truffles. Will absolutely be back at the James for my next business trip

This great boutique hotel is a great place to explore SoHo and surrounding areasthe staff are very friendly and helpful, Eric the concierge, Elaine at check innhave stayed at 4&5 hotel in New York over the past 5 years

Well located in New York's SOHO district, the hotel was a pleasant stay. Very modern with all the amenities. The room was neat a relatively spacious with a comfortable bed.I recommend this to the business traveller or if you're looking to be close to SOHO's action.

Friendly staff. Great location. Fantastic rooftop views. The rooms themselves are fairly small. Perfectly adequate for the lone traveler but could be a bit claustrophobic for couples. Several minor complaints to the hotel and my room: broken towel bar, slow drain, rattling a/c vents, not great choices of in-room furniture, slow elevators. Overall, it's a pretty good deal given the location but they should do some spic and spanning to get the overall quality up.

It was out first time in the James, we stayed one night and attended the amFAR Gala. Very modern hotel compared to others in Nyc , European style, we enjoyed a sunny southern view corner room , which was bigger than I thought after reading the reviews. You can hear the street a little, however you are in Nyc , the city which never sleeps ! Great Service , car drop of , help with bags was excellent, Kenny the doorman was fantastic ! We had delicious breakfast at David Burke's kitchen, which I can recommend to try (not included in hotel ).A great hotel at central location, very good for fashion week.

A boutique hotel with nice amenities, next door to the David Burke Kitchen, that focuses on service. When something doesn't work, they get on top of it. Thanks to Robinson for making sure I could watch the New Hampshire primaries on CNN and to Joann for sprucing up my room so nicely!

I've stayed at The James 3 or 4 times now, and several other neighborhood boutique hotels as our head office is in SoHo. Of all the great places to stay in the vicinity this is quite possibly the best. There's something wonderful that's hard to explain, but I think it's that every detail is handled so well, you don't even notice things it if that makes any sense. The check in process is always efficient and super-friendly no mater what time of day. The lobby is small but chilled and full of interesting, comfortable furniture and is a great place to work (and enjoy some free wine!). The bars and restaurants are expensive due to the area but are very high quality with room service of equal excellence. The rooms are a decent size for New York, have great views, comfy beds, fluffy white towels, are always spotless and there's a bottle of drinking water that's refreshed daily so you don't have to purchase this basic necessity from the minibar. Gym is small but more than adequate for a quick work out. I had a request that was handled graciously by the font office manager Jerome - it's all these things that will keep me coming back and I look forward to my next stay. Sometimes they do amazing deals too.

I recently stayed at The James during a business trip to Manhattan. I was staying a little farther from my meeting then expected but the friendliness of the staff and fun location made it worth it. I was unfamiliar with the area and the room service staff were knowledgable about the area and eager to point me in the right direction. The hotel was very well kept and I felt very comfortable my entire stay. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to the area.

I asked the front desk if they can hold my cake in the freezer while I was out to dinner, and they did. When it was time to blow out the candles and enjoy it, the woman who brought the cake up to us told us there was a fee that I was not aware of. She seemed angry that I was asking her for plates & forks.
user_name:
Elise F
New York City, New York

review_body: Upgraded to a corner room with no problem, everyone is very helpful and knowledgeable about transportation, restaurants, events. Had a really comfortable stay - Fresh coffee and scones in the morning, New York Times and Wall Street Journal available in room or in lobby.

This place is seriously divine! Mind you I had a couple of drinks prior to visiting but the view here was just insane and while the sun was going down you literally could not ask for a more perfect New York evening.

Been past this place many a time and from the outside its very unassuming. Finally on my return to New York just before Christmas a colleague of mine said "you like downtown, why don't you give The James a shot. He's tried the sister one in Chicago and wasn't disappointed.So off I went. It's uber cool. First impressions, the concierge staff, very helpful matched by the receptionist. Rooms functional but smart and everything there for the discerning business traveller or couple holidaying in the Big Apple. The bar upstairs was well stocked and the barman ran the bar with great aplomb. I had, among other things my best Negroni for some time and he gave me some sound advice on Bourbon. It would be nice in the summertime with the small plung pool and outside terrace. I tried the David Burke kitchen for breakfast which was a joy. There was a fashion shoot in the hotel on the last day it the staff did everything in their power to avoid disruption to the residents. As Arnie famously said, I'll be back!

The past New Years Eve was our second stay at the James. The hotel is situated in a great location near shopping and restaurants that we enjoy visiting. The staff is very friendly and informative concerning the surrounding area. The hotel itself is very modern with artistic touches to be found throughout. The rooms are immaculate and comfortable. We also really enjoy the complimentary bottled water which is provided in the room. The hotel has a rooftop bar called the Jimmy on the 18th floor which provides spectacular views and great drinks. If you are considering staying in Soho than the James New York is the place I would recommend.

Just checked in amazing room, comfy bed and perfect in everyway. the staff is geat, the place is super clean and immaculate. we have stayed before and lalways love it. We love the beds ! It is normal size for NYC but for us the staff makes it special

I've stayed at the James a few times. Good location and nice sized rooms (for NY) with great views. The problem: Broken shower and poor customer service.Details: During our last stay we had the unfortunate experience of being in a room with a broken shower (i.e., wouldn't drain). We didn't find out that the drain was clogged until shortly before check-out and I didn't want to stand in several inches of standing water in a hotel shower, so we had to spend a day of traveling feeling gross and dirty. I expect the bare minimum, such as a working shower, at this caliber of hotel...but okay, things happen. So then I made the mistake of thinking that we would experience some decent customer service since it's a big inconvenience to not be able to shower at any hotel, especially a "nice" hotel. We went down to talk to the front desk about the shower and they offered to comp our mini bar...too bad we didn't use the mini bar. So then they offered a free upgrade for our next visit (as if we would ever come back)! After some complaining, since apparently you have to make your case on why not being able to shower is bad, we got $50 dollars discounted from our stay. Tips: Stay at your own risk! And check the shower!
user_name:
CodyR1930
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Loved staying at the James. The beauty and warmth of the lobby make it an excellent way to wind down after a busy day. They offer a wine happy hour which is special. The rooms are lovely as well. They use an open concept which is very cool to see. The hair products aren't very good for my long hair, but I get the organic thing and can appreciate it. My minibar was also stocked with healthy options that agreed with me. Enjoyed a conversation with the minibar attendant Tara or Sara and she gave me great recommendations of nearby restaurants that I could walk to. The jimmy is also amazing and is a definite must see while you are there.

Very nice staff always welcoming when you arrive. Nice rooms. Best thing is the free wine and cheese in the evening. Corner room upgrades are nice. Favorite place to stay in Soho. And air conditioners work (unlike some of the other hotels in Soho!)

I visited the James New York for roughly 2.5 weeks. The hotel is beautifully kept with an arty and modern vibe. The decor is modern and sleek, impeccably kept. There are nice touches of artwork and local furniture about the place which create a unique feel. The lobby staff are very friendly and attentive, always someone to assist. Rooms are true to the photos on the website. Views are fantastic. The gym on the 17th floor has life fitness equipment with an awesome view which made workouts very pleasurable. In a great part of town with some of the best food. Big shout out to Johnny, who provided second to none service and attention throughout our stay... So much so that we brought Levain cookies back to the hotel just for him !

Modern Hotel with Great Service. Johnny Houston (Manager) was amazing in accommodating all our needs and making sure our stay was great. Housekeeping was just as amazing - our housekeeper (Claudia) cleaned our room beyond expectations...image 2 girls in NY for 6 days and what the room looked like. When we came back to our room each day is was seriously spotless..all clothes folded, shoes lined up and fresh bottles of water, etc....Don't miss the upstairs bar - especially at night, great view.Great place to stay in Soho.

Just spent the weekend at The James with my family and couldn't have been more pleased. The hotel is modern and sleek. The location is perfect for what we needed. We were a little surprised that there was only 2 elevators for hotel quests and the club up on the roof, but we rarely had to wait. We ordered breakfast from room service to be ordered promptly at 6:30am and at 6:29 Erica was standing there with a smiling face waiting to feed us with a huge smile on her face. The maids we're a little slow but we would def return. Keep up the great work.

Just stayed here this past weekend and was disappointed. Booked a corner room, which had a great view! However, my sheets were stained and the air quality was bad. It was either cold or too hot. The friendliest person was by far the Valet. The rest of the staff we found to be apathetic. I expected more from The James.

We stayed for a night to celebrate our 9 year anniversary and were given a upgrade to a penthouse suite. Easily the best Manhattan hotel room I have ever seen, 180 degree views from the Hudson to Brooklyn. Amazing room, amazing staff, amazing hotel. STAY HERE!

All of the staff was extremely helpful and genuinely friendly at all hours - from valet service to the concierge (especially Johnny), to everyone else we bumped into along the way. The lobby and rooms were stylish, modern, clean, and comfortable, and the views were wonderful. We would definitely stay here again!

We had a a great stay and Eric did a great job helping us. Bathrooms are very modern and rooms are well maintained. Will likely become one of my go to hotels when coming to New York. Jimmy has a good scene at night and you can access it from the main hotel elevators which is a great plus to avoid the line.

The hotel was just amazing. This was our first overnight visit to the big city and I was shocked at how gracious the folks working at the hotel were. I have heard so many horror stories about NYC and the people but that just wasn't the case. We didn't really know where to go and asked a hotel employee and she gave us some great suggestions, she must live in the city because she definitely didn't steer us wrong. We had great drinks and meals at many of the places she recommended, thank you Erica!Honestly, it made our trip. So thank you James Hotel and staff we will definitely be back!

From start to finish it was exquisite service, gorgeous furnishings and stellar views. My experience began with John the valet personally walking me up a couple stairs and into the lobby elevator, radioing ahead to the front desk that I was coming up, where he introduced me to Morgan and Deb at registration. Deb had already pulled my reservation up due to the short advance notice by the valet and so after I showed my ID I was off to my room. I had the corner studio which was 5 star. There was a bottle of fresh water from the tap (NYC has amazing tap water) that they claim is run thru a triple filtration system before being bottled for you. A full selection of snacks, wine, beer and top shelf liquor was available in my room (I didn't indulge because there were no price tags, haha - but it was nice that it was convenient if I had wanted to). I went up stairs to the rooftop bar with outdoor court. Superb atmosphere. Very posh. I really wish it would have been more summery weather so that i could have enjoyed the pool. I will try to upload some pics. Thanks again staff and creators of The James! Very nice indeed.
user_name:
Mdisneylei
New York City, New York

review_body: Boutique hotel in central SoHo. Very nice hotel, nice room with with a great bathroom. Worked long hours and mainly from my hotel room. Never like working from the room. But here it is different. Meeting facilities in the hotel are poor. I'll stay here again.

Since the hotel rooms were booked for us- and one is not really sure what your going to be getting with hotels in NYC- we were thrilled to find that when we got there the first thing you noticed was the attention and courtesy and care of the staff. From the guys on the door to the concierge to the team on the front office we couldn't have been made more welcome. The rooms were super stylish bathrooms qnd everything was well provisioned and the big bonuses were a fantastic bar on the rooftop and a superb restaurant in the basement. We wouldn't have needed to leave the hotel at all were it not for the fact that it is superbly located is for everything SoHo has to offer. To summarise- great hotel, great service, very happy clients! Special mention to Debs on the desk, and Jay J and Kenny at the door really went out their way to make sure we had everything we needed.

We stayed at The James and LOVED it!!! The hotel was perfect for the location we needed. The staff was really nice but Erica in room service was hilarious and gave us great recommendations for bars and restaurants in the area. We mentioned it was my husbands 40th birthday and Erica sent up a b-day cake for us to enjoy.
user_name:
Jessica Z
New York City, New York

review_body: Overall, my experience at The James was very good, especially considering that we were in NYC for the blizzard. Service overall was outstanding. We arrived very late and the hotel staff made sure to welcome us and had held a room for us. Throughout the blizzard, we were treated with the utmost courtesy. Hotel staff (believe his name was Michael) went out of his way to bring us whatever we needed and even went so far as to research restaurants in the area that were open and serving dinner. The concierge and doormen were wonderful and took care to make sure that we had everything we needed for transportation to and from the hotel. I would definitely stay here again, but would like to note that the hotel could use some updating. Rooms and bathrooms look a little worn and tired. A fresh coat of paint and updated linens would do wonders and would have made my overall experience 5 star. The room service, food, and drinks were great. Bar staff at Jimmy were very friendly and welcoming. Location is great - very close to the Canal Street subway station. This is a refreshing change from the chaos of Times Square. The hotel is located very close to shops and restaurants in Soho that make staying here very worthwhile.

We stayed here for a wedding weekend and could not be more pleased. The service was outstanding, beginning with Kenny, who greeted us on the ground floor, took care of our bags, and showed us our room. He also made great recommendations for restaurants in the area, which there are obviously plenty. Kenny was also most helpful upon our departure after the 3 night stay. The rooms were very well appointed, comfortable beds, and great views. All of our friends who were staying in other hotels in the area, came to the rooftop bar to start and end our evenings every night that we were there. We usually stay on the Upper East Side, in Meatpacking/Chelsea, or Columbus Circle, but never again. Could easily get everywhere, and SoHo is just really hard to beat! Chinatown, NoLita, Meatpacking and Bowery all within walking distance. this was much more fun than the larger hotels around us. Atmosphere is hard to beat. Would love to try it out in warmer weather as well. Truly a great stay.

Excellent location, staff, and amenities. I was just looking for nice cozy place to take my husband for his birthday and this hotel is that and more. The staff was always friendly and helpful when we saw and interacted with anyone. When we arrived when booking I had mention that i was there for my husband birthday they surprise him with cheese cake sticks that said "Happy Birthday from The James Hotel" he felt extremely special and I thought that was very thoughtful of them. OMG! the view <3 <3 <3 we fell in love with the view. Even though our room was right across from the elevator, I never heard anything while we were in the room. Free wifi is a huge plus and we got a pretty good price for our room as well. The pillows and the bed was everything i wanted to take them home with me b/c extremely comfortable. In the night time we went to "Jimmy" which is a rooftop upstairs and the service was excellent, everyone was friendly and the music was perfect. We order room service the day after and everything was delicious and got there on a timely matter.I was running a little late and i called for late check out and they were kind enough in letting me stay 2 hours extra. I will definitely visit "The James New York" again.

The James provides an excellent mixture of modern art and classic detailed oriented service. I have visited a few times in different room types, each with their own appeal and comfort. When reserving ensure you book a corner room, as the view is amazing.I recommend The James to anyone looking for a higher end hotel within walking distance to great shopping and fabulous restaurants. JIMMY rooftop bar is also worth checking out, cool atmosphere and unrivaled views of manhattan. We will be back!

We forgot to place a preorder the night before we had to catch our flight, but we were lucky enough to have Erica bring us breakfast and coffee very quickly. She was so friendly and helped us find the best way to get to the airport. Erica was hilarious! We would definitely come back to enjoy her service.

Relatively spacious (corner) room with good views, well located in Soho. Bed was very comfortable and room amenities were adequate, with a nicely laid out bathroom. The staff were friendly and helpful, including the concierge arranging transportation and NYC ballet tickets. The gym could use more equipment but the views of downtown are quite spectacular from the treadmills. Overall, a good alternative if you want to stay in Soho.

My stay at the James was far above what I expected. I was met by the manager, Johnny, who knew me by name. Every single one of my requests were not only completed but exceeded. The room was extremely comfortable and had a fantastic view. I plan to stay here on my next trip in a few weeks.

I always stay at The James when I'm in NY. I love this hotel and the staff is always incredibly helpful and friendly. Thanks Johnny Houston for upgrading me to an even bigger room. Thanks Keith for FedExing my forgotten item back to me. Thanks Kenny, Brian, Deb, Rebecca Z. and Jami Arius (?) at the front desk. Thanks Eric for flagging down my cabs and Ubers. Hope to see you all next time!Margaret

Loved Soho and NYC however, this Hotel is way over priced and over rated.Excellent top story bar and helpful staff but the Hotel seriously requires refurbishment.Make sure if you chose this Hotel to stay in a high floor as road noise can be excessive.

We stayed in a corner king studio. Great room. Awesome view. Comfy bed. Loved the heated bathroom floor. The staff is very friendly & helpful. Excellent location. The bar on the top floor is fun. Some reviewers complained about the linens. The towels in our room on check-in were in rough shape but after that they were like brand new. Thick & plush. Our room could have been cleaner the first few days of our stay. After that the cleaning staff must have changed because our room was much cleaner on our last couple of days. Hooks on the walls & maybe a small tower of drawers near the entrance would be nice additions. The lighting in the bathroom is too dim. A lit make-up mirror would be great. Room service is highway robbery (almost $50 for two smoothies & a latte). There are lots of stores, restaurants, cafes & bars all around the hotel.We would definitely stay here again.

The hotel itself is awesome and was situated in the perfect location for our visit to New York. The service at the hotel was great everyone was very accommodating , Erica in room service was a highlight. We will definitely be back for another visit.

I've been living in New York City for 8 years so the thought of spending money to get a hotel instead of sleeping in my apartment does not come easily. However, my boyfriend had just spent the day in the ER and I thought it would be a nice treat to just relax and pretend we were on vacation. The James Hotel was the perfect place to get some much needed R&R. We had an awesome view, the coolest shower, and the best night sleep ever (the beds are amazing!!). Erica from room service was the icing on the cake, she was the real reason we had such a great experience. Erica was extremely accommodation, knowledgable and so friendly! She even sent us up champagne and chocolate covered strawberries after I told her we had spent the day in the ER. I would stay in any hotel if I knew Erica was going to be working.
user_name:
ears1010
New York City, New York

review_body: I've stayed in many parts of New York, but never Soho, and I am sorry I ever stayed anywhere else; the concentration of restaurants, shops and amusements is amazing. The hotel itself fits into the neighborhood well, and is both beautiful and well-designed - despite having New York size rooms, the use of space was excellent, and we never felt cramped during our stay. However, the service was the highlight - were were constantly pleased by the friendliness, efficiency and helpfulness of every staff member we saw. I also appreciated in particular the timeliness of the room staff; the room was always made up, and we never stepped into a room with an unmade bed. I also highly recommend Jimmy's the rooftop bar (props to Miguel and his concoctions). This is clearly my number 1 choice in New York

First time I stayed at The James and I was thoroughly pleased. Service was amazing and staff was personable. Rooms were clean and Rooftop bar was a lot of fun. This will be my go to for NYC hotels going forward.

The James is a very pretty hotel. The lobby is modern and most rooms have an impressive view of the city. The staff is also very accommodating and friendly. Jerome is a lovely man. However, the hotel as a whole needs to step up its game. Basic details go unnoticed and there seems to be a pattern, based on other reviews. For my stay, we experienced TV's too dim to see (tried to adjust it; still nope!), TV remotes needing new batteries, bedside clock 6 hrs slow and cannot be adjusted (what?), toilet-paper holder that is loose on the wall and falls to floor when you rip paper from it, lamps that are loose and swing around when you pick them up, lack of general lighting, chipped furniture or room wood fixtures, bulbs out or missing, amenities like hand cream in bathroom missing, 1 bar of soap for the entire bathroom shower and tub (yes, we can ask for another, but that's not the point). I could go on.This hotel cost me close to $400 per night for a suite (totaling around $1,000 for a weekend stay). The room's view was amazing, but the lack of basic details made me feel like I was getting gypped. I wouldn't expect these types of basic silly issues at a Holiday Inn. So an expensive luxury hotel in Soho should absolutely never have them, ever. The James is not good enough. They haven't earned the right to charge $400/night because they keep low expectations of their guests. Just to further prove the widespread issue, we even switched suites to a new one and the 2nd room still had some or most of these issues listed above. Guests simply don't get enough for their money here and in a city like NYC, that lacks in hotels like Wall St does for money, there are so many other great hotels to choose from. This is not Richmond, Virginia where luxury choices may be slim. If The James wants to compete, or better yet, stay in business at all, they better take a real hard look at every single room in the building.

Decided to stay at The James Hotel mostly because it was located in SoHo and was close to my meeting location. Check-in was smooth and very easy. We arrived at 11 am and did not think a room would be ready or offered. It was offered and I was able to drop my luggage, wash up and run around SoHo for a better part of the day. The front desk staff was informative about the cheese/wine happy hour roof top, the David Burke Kitchen and breakfast. The front door guy, Kenny, was most helpful on check-in too. The room was clean but the furniture and nice wood floors was slightly worn in certain spots. Not a big deal as the room was clean and the bathroom was exceptional, clean, full of nice shower products too. The pantry offered anything one would need but I could not locate a price list for any of the items. We ate the David Burke Kitchen but had to sit upstairs in the Treetop since a private party reserved the entire restaurant. No problem as the kitchen still served us upstairs. The food was good and will review same later. The coffee and scones served in the morning was perfect. The front door guy, Jay from the DR, was the best. He arranged for our car and placed our luggage in it without prompting. We will stay here again and probably get the larger room. Don't get me wrong, the room was not small and adequate for two. The bed was comfortable and the heated bathroom floors were helpful. Give The James a try!

We chose this hotel for the location and the reasonable price, but it offered way more than we expected. The room was very comfortable and with a drop-dead view of the NY skyline (and a bathroom almost the size of the room), but more than anything, the hotel staff , without exception, was among the best and most helpful we have seen. They really seem to care about their guests, ready to respond to every request. They have complimentary wine and cheese each evening and scones and coffee in the morning. Further, their restaurant, David Burke Kitchen, was excellent from breakfast to dinner. It's a must if you're staying in or near SoHo.

The James is perfectly located close to the cool shops and restaurants of SOHO, Tribecca, and the Village. The decor is modern but comfortable. Unbelievably comfortable bedding. The baths have heated floors and rain showers. Excellent fitness center with gorgeous views. Concierge - Kieth - is incredibly knowledgeable of the area. His restaurant picks were exactly on target for what we wanted - great interesting food; cool atmosphere; casual. All of his picks were way better and more reasonably priced than what are used to Uptown. Also, Deb at the desk is a cheerful and helpful delight.

I've stayed at the James a few times, and have never once been disappointed. From the moment you walk through the door, Eric and Jay are there to greet you with the warmest smiles and friendly conversation—very nice guys! Brian was very helpful with my check-in and made sure I had everything I needed. On my way to my room, I ran into another familiar face, Julio, and as always he was a delight. He even brought up a comp bottle of wine to my room. Last but not least, Mimi.. she is one of the sweetest girls I've ever met, and makes you feel right at home. I've stayed at a few other boutique hotels in the city, but the attentiveness and friendliness of the staff is what differentiates the James from the rest. :)

I’ve been to this hotel several times and I have never been disappointed. They are consistently on point with what makes a hotel stay great. The rooms are really cool and they have a unique style that you only find in an upscale NYC hotel like the James. Great entertainment at the Jimmy and the neighborhood is awesome. However, the best part for me is the overall service. Mimi, was the person helming me with room service and I have to say she was great. Pleasant, attentive and quick with my order. I would highly recommend the James

I stood at the James Hotel here in New York and its not like any other hotel I have stayed at, its amazing, the rooms are so different and beautiful and open, the view I had was so nice it viewed 2 sides of the room...I ate at David Burke restaurant and the food was great too. The locate is great it has all these stores to shop at close by. I would for sure stay here again and refer friends and family... looking forward to seeing the one in Chicago.

I've been staying at The James for years, and have never had a less than spectacular experience there. The views of lower Manhattan are unbelievable, the rooms are hip with a great eye for detail, the rooftop bar is amazing. On my most recent visit I brought my mother and aunt along for their first stay. Eric and the rest of the front door staff treated my family like their own, which I cannot thank them enough for. Then there are the little perks: coffee and scones in the morning, wine and cookies at night in the lobby--then head out to any one of a huge number of amazing restaurants within walking distance... or hop on the subway less than a block away and see all that the city has to offer. Fantastic.
user_name:
Travis C
Bethesda, Maryland, United States

review_body: My mother used to stay here when she would visit me in NYC. She was always happy with the room and it was always clean. It's great in the summer with the pool on the roof and The Jimmy (the rooftop bar) is great for a nightcap. They have a great happy hour every day in the lobby with wine and cheese. However, her last time here her credit card numbers were stolen. Its a shame because she really enjoyed the hotel but its hard to return to a hotel after something like that happens.

We did not stayed at the hotel, we went to Jimmy's Bar, located on the roof, it is cain of expensive but the view of Manhattan is amazing and priceless, you should make a reservation before you go, I did it 10 minutes before thru Internet, the bar is nice and comfortable, nice music, and good service, for sure I will go again.

We were especially impressed with the gentlemen at the front door. Eric and (I believe) John (?) who brought our luggage up and got a car for us to the airport were amazing. Everything was done at or before the time the said it would be done. So much attention to detail on both of their parts. This hotel is perfect for walking distance to everything. So many places to go and see within just one half mile of the property. The housekeeping staff was also amazing. Quickly and friendly.

I recently stayed at The James at the recommendation of a New York resident. I've stayed all over the city, and like Soho, so tried it. Upon arrival, I had to open the door with luggage until the concierge/doorman/ receptionist helped me. Upon check in there was a problem with room being ready on time. This was at 5:30 pm. Took another that was ready, and the room seemed nice for NYC standards. However, to say this is a boutique hotel is false. The toiletries were substandard, and the entire length of my stay(week) I had to ask daily for washcloths, water refills, coffee refills.What kind of hotel doesn't have washcloths?and how about buying some new ones that don't treat your skin as a cheese grater? Buy some new towels!!! In room coffee was instant, Instantly placing this establishment below three star chains that are a fraction of the price.employees were less than helpful at every turn. Normal hotel amenities were obsolete.was told upon check in there was coffee and pastries every morning. Maybe coffee, but hardened muffins hardly count as sustenance,when they were even present.One day out of 6! We went to check out the rooftop bar, but all the slovenly dressed,attitude stricken employees made you feel unwelcome, and the service was horrible. We eventually got up and left after waiting for server to return.room service was much of the same.food was good,but looked hastily thrown together, and the attitude of the girl in the paperboy hat was deplorable. Every single member of this staff seemed to be in a perpetual state of misery, and it showed. Poor service. I didn't encounter a manager at all,just some unhappy, poorly trained employees that seemed to have more important things to do, like act and look smug to those that pay their salaries. Maybe I expect too much, but a holiday inn express would've probably been happy to have me and my money at a fraction of the price and without instant coffee!!

The location to subway, dining options, and attractions was great. To take it to the level of boutique would require better attention to detail. Too many small issues hurt the overall rating. I'd stay again should there be a good deal/discount.
user_name:
wscottem
New York City, New York

review_body: Great hotel in a great location, with super helpful staff. I had about 20 boxes of shopping delivered to the hotel before my arrival, and they were all waiting for me in my room when I got there. I'd highly recommend this place!

I had to make a last minute trip to NYC, and my regular hotel was booked. My assistant put me in The James Hotel, and I was pleasantly surprised by this compact, well designed hotel adjacent to the trendy neighborhoods of SOHO and Tribeca. The staff was young, friendly, and efficient, and the room was well designed and comfortable. I had a corner room with floor to ceiling glass windows that offered great views to the surrounding neighborhood. The room was clean and of sufficient size (especially for a NY hotels) to allow one to move around without feeling claustrophobic. The bathroom only had a shower (which was fine) and was stocked with a nice selection of complimentary products.Wanting a simple and easy solution for dinner, the restaurant, David Burke Kitchen, located on the ground floor was quite good, with a lively bar scene full of locals and NYC visitors alike. The roof top terrace and bar offers great views of the city with enough trendy hipness to satisfy one’s desire to “go out” without having to!

This hotel is the perfect spot to enjoy NYC. The location is wonderful for shopping and enjoying the great restaurants in SoHo. The staff is extremely customer oriented; they are attentive and happy to help in any way needed. The room was perfectly clean and stylish, bed comfy, room service on spot. Rooftop bar and pool and views amazing. Plan on returning soon and often. Love the James Soho!

I was excited about this place as it appeared to be a reasonably priced high rise lux hotel in SOHO. At best I would give this hotel an ok rating at the very best. First off, the doorman was excellent, he walked out to our car immediately, took our bags. The front desk was a little confused. initially they told us to it was too early to check in (we were there at around 2pm) and then told us there was an upgrade we could check into immediately. The door man still had our bags and a bottle of champagne that was suppose to be brought up. We decided to go up to the room and hang out for a bit before going out. We went out and came back to the room but someone was in it. We came down and told them someone was in the room. Initially the manager came out and apologized and was very nice. He kindly offered us a 150 dollar brunch certificate for the inconvenience. Our luggage and champagne weren't brought up so I figured they just never checked us in. Otherwise the room was nice, we spent the entire 150 on champagne in the brunch, no other problems. Also the door man was very nice and kept my car out in front and didn't end up charging us for parking. We never went to the roof deck, mostly because we didn't want to goto the front desk first to ask them to let us up there after 9pm (elevator won't let you just go up to the roof from your room). Thats it bye.

First time in SoHo many time visitor to Manhattan and the business district. Thought the hotel was in a great location for SoHo exploring but the physical condition of the hotel was clearly three stars. Rooms are a bit beaten up, stains on furniture and cabinets. Upgraded room and was still very small. Bathroom has little room for shaving kits or other storage. The reason for four stars was the service was quite good and the wifi lighting fast. Called for extra towels and the response was rapid.All in all okay.

I have been staying at the James for years because of their location and lovely staff. Recently it seems like Front Office management has been switch and the change is soooo noticeable. My last 2 stays have been HORRIBLE. NO BELLMAN TO RECEIVE ME, after I waited like 15 minutes, I decide to take the glass elevator to the FD. Noone at the front desk either. They were all inside their office chatting n relaxing while guests were waiting. The next morning, when I went to get my coffee, NO CUPS OR NAPKINS ON THE TABLE. Are you kidding me? No managers to apologize or explain. I really like this place but please your FD staff need more guidance. WHERE IS NATHAN & KRISTINA? These guys used to be on point on everything n the warm way they used to welcome guests was terrific. Extremely disappointed on this property now. Def not returning.
user_name:
John S
New York City, New York

review_body: A couple of years ago we decided to stay in the Soho - West Village area of NYC. The James was recommended to us; and it has not let us down. We've been back at least twice a year for the past 3 years. From the first time they make you feel welcomed; but, after a few, they make you feel like you're returning home. We love the neighborhood feel, when walking in the streets close to the hotel. Certainly a huge improvement, over staying in midtown. The rooftop bar, the David Burke restaurant, etc. all are good; they have too, there a too many choices at walking distance. We just returned home, after a nice weekend in NYC; and we are already looking forward to our next visit to The James...

Location of the hotel is great - very convenient to public transportation, or within walking distance of Greenwich village and surrounding areas. The property itself is very nice - feels like it's out of a James Bond movie - very eclectic, but the rooms and overall hotel are super clean and well maintained. The rooms are't huge, but you never feel tight in them as they have plenty of sitting space, desk space, nice high ceilings and big windows to open it up. Gym was well equipped as well - would def go back again.

I had pre- anticipation of what a chic hotel in downtown would be and was quite frankly a bit nervous. However, upon arriving at the front door my fears went away. In comes this tall gentleman, named Kenny who greeted me with tremendous warmth. He then leads me to this beautiful oasis they call their Sky Lobby where a team of warm and friendly staff arranged my room . Accommodations were hip but warm, with everything you could need- Starbucks coffee, slippers, and the most amazing shower and bed! All in all, a great stay. Highly recommend for anyone needing a great place in the city. I know I found my only choice now- thank you James Hotel. I'll see you back real soon.
user_name:
Karen S
Jersey City, New Jersey

review_body: Gorgeous hotel, great amenities, fabulous staff, everything I could ask for in a hotel was included. It is very clean, modern and comfortable. My room was quiet and very pleasant. I tend to be quite picky when I stay in a hotel. I serious found nothing that bothered me. I did my daily stretches right in my room. The room's hardwood floor was very clean and there was enough room for my yoga practice.

If you come to New York and you don´t want to support Mr. Trump at Soho Grand, but want to stay as close as possible to Soho and the nice places, you should select The James in 27 Grand st. We had a very warm welcome, immediatly got a free upgrade and had a super nice be with a great view onto the citiy. Nice bathroom, First coffee and muffin from 6.a.m in the lounge (you can walk down there in your bath robe and quickly jump back into the elevator into your room. The rooftop bar is soooo New York. Great scene, fun bar tenders, good music, exquisit atmosphere. We didn´t check out the restaurant in the basement but heard it should be good. The bathroom is spacious and w loved the very friendly people in the hotel with good advice where to go. The bed quality was wonderful - even with jet lag we slept like king and queen. Yes we would come back here. Even you are in busy Soho, this place is a calm place to relax.

This hotel came recommended so I booked a 5 night stay here. A sorry mistake. Our room was dirty as if someone checked into before us and then took a different room. They forgot to bring the champagne and fruit I ordered to set the ambiance for our NYC getaway. I called housekeeping 3 days straight just to get a box of Kleenex in our room, they finally brought one that had 6 kleenexes left in it. The floors were dirty, the comforter was stained and marked up with a pen. The walls are chipped and need paint. There is no soy or almond milk for special diet needs offered, although I requested it ahead of our stay. The gym is stuffy, dirty and unkept with no bathroom nearby, although it's well equipped with weights. The only redeeming factor are the kind check in hosts & hostesses and bellman. Maid service is terribly slow, not consistent, and late in the day. Otherwise, I can't wait to leave. The bar is small but fantastic. It's only redeeming factor.

Was so excited to stay at the James after having a great experience at the James in Chicago. The New York James was just ok. The service was mediocre at best unlike Chicago. The happy hour was a few bottles of cheap with and Costco cheese slices in an uninspired lobby setting. The rooms were small - typical for New York. We experienced both night a loud noise that started around 4:30am when others in the hotel started using the showers that sounded like a jackhammer outside the room. We called down to the front desk and they explained it was the water pipes and engineering was looking into it. After a 4:30 wake up call we were not happy. No apologies offered by the hotel. All that being said, the location is great and the rooftop bar is fun. For the money, I'll look at other options next time.

Hotel building is pretty cool. Very noticeable from everywhere. Jimmy -- the club on the roof is really nice. Having two building lobbies is neat, but it's a pain to get in or out on the day-to-day living. We stayed in a suite (the website calls it an Apartment - but it features no kitchen amenities) which was smaller than advertised and had only one tiny wardrobe for storage. The TV's worked well and the 270-degree views were pretty great. Bed was terrible - fine for a night or two but not much more than that. Sheets were like paper and I think we had pillows, but they were so thin it was hard to tell. Bathroom was pretty terrific - far superior to many other Manhattan hotel bathrooms. The heated floors are a really nice touch. Staff was friendly and helpful and it's easy to get a cab on 6th Ave to get anywhere, also the hotel is basically on Canal Street, where you can get on virtually any subway line easily.
user_name:
Mr Jarrett C
Los Angeles, California

review_body: I had the distinct pleasure in staying at the James NY located in beautiful Soho. The minute i arrived I was greated by the most professional Bellman whom took my lugage right out of my hand and directed me to the lobby. Upon checking-in the staff was very cordial and allowed me to get a nice city view which was requested. My room was what I expected based on what was shared by others that stayed at this hotel. The resturant in the hotel is great which I highly recommend since there are other good places to dine in Soho. The worst part was leaving on Sunday. Thanks to the staff for an enjoyable stay in the Big Apple....

I've been a loyal guest since The James opened in 2010. The location is superb. My room choice is always a Corner Studio. I recognize Eric and other Staff year after year. They remain pleasant, courteous and prompt. Wi-Fi is strong and 2:00 check-in is appreciated. Unfortunately, there's a noticeable, steady decline in the attention to detail. The lobby furnishings were once tastefully modern and comfortable. They're now stained and saggy. Not an enjoyable space for a morning cup of coffee. A coffee maker is no longer available in the room, though there is an electric kettle to boil water for instant.Hotel guests compete with rooftop bar patrons for limited elevator space. Bar patrons trump hotel guests on the weekends. I don't anticipate that will ever change. Hotel guests are squeezed out of the relaxing pool area to get ready for the onslaught of locals and non-guests. It borders on insulting. I haven't been back up there since I was asked to move a few years ago. No problem with the room size. Expect small-ish. No noise issues. Plenty of hanging space and the bench drawers are ample. Lighting is fine with the exception of a couple burned out bulbs recently. The once comfortable mattress needs to be turned or replaced. The power strip next to the bed failed to charge my devices overnight. I checked to make sure it was plugged in and reset it but I ended up having to charge up in the bathroom outlet.The heated tile floor in the bathroom can't make-up for the dingy, frayed bathrobe and matching towels. Both were once fluffy and plush. I couldn't even bring myself to use the robe this time. The shower and sink drained at a frustratingly slow pace. The Intelligent Nutrient Harmonic bath products bolted to the shower wall are divine, but I miss having the body lotion ... any body lotion for that matter. You'll have to pack your own.The turndown service used to include fresh water and a sampling of Kee's Chocolates from around the corner as opposed to my most recent visit where there was simply a bucket of ice and half filled water carafe.I ordered a continental breakfast which arrived promptly. However, the coffee pot was missing the knob on the lid and the pastry was placed on a sweaty covered plate. No preserves or butter. A huge departure from previous stays when it arrived in a linen lined basket with a selection of preserves and softened butter ... and an undamaged coffee pot.For years I was greeted with a handwritten note welcoming me back for my 7th, 10th, etc. stay. The note was accompanied by a bottle of wine or fruit. It was a wonderful gesture and I felt choosing The James was money well spent. On this last visit, the only personal service was from Housekeeping. They left a note thanking me for the tip.The Staff does well with what they've been left to work with. The James isn't a huge hotel. What once set them apart from other hotels no longer exists. Being eco-friendly and a supporter of local artists and small business looks good in promotional material, but isn't enough to keep my business. I've rescinded the recommendation to friends to stay at The James and I'll begin looking for another hotel.

Hip but lovely. So we stayed here for a week in July. It's a great location with public transport links. We had a corner King room which had a great view and plenty of space. It had a bathroom with a glass partition. That's always a bit odd but there is a blind that can be pulled down.The pool is basically a big bath but for that location it is to be expected. On Saturday they had a pool party that had queues of people trying to get in. If people still had flip phones then everyone in that line would own one.Nice touches were the free wine and cheese in the lobby in the early evening that few people appeared to take advantage of but was appreciated before going out for the night.Only grumble would be the communication before the booking. They offered a rate match and then essentially took the best part of three months to actually apply it.

Perfect Soho location; smaller spot with gorgeous restaurant and rooftop bar. Traveling solo and felt safe while having fun on the premise in between my city stops. Highly recommend; good value. Jeff, Juan Carlos and Jason at David Burke Kitchen are the Best!

I booked the hotel for my wife's birthday weekend. The hotel was over the top and she was blown away by the room and the views. We had a great night and enjoyed brunch at David Burke's Kitchen the next morning. I would highly recommend The James!!

Arrived late that evening after a long day. Modern and lovely ambience perfect for business or leisure. Great views from the 10th looking towards Grand. The room itself nice King size bed.
