The Rain shower great way to awaken and freshen up for the day. The floor warmer help as well for the chilly morning. Great Breakfast at David Burke Kitchen to end trip with friends.

Liked the trendy boutique room and glass wall of the bathroom. Large walk in shower with Apothecary toiletries. The corner room gave a view of the traffic so a higher floor would be better. I enjoyed the morning coffee and breakfast scones which were complimentary. My only problem was the curtains which were not easy to pull and would have been easier if remote controlled.Room had kettle, coffee and teabags plus a fridge. Rooftop bar gave a great view of the sunset. The doorman, Eric, organised our return car to JFK which had a lady driver and did the journey avoiding traffic taking back roads in only 1 hour.

I really like this hotel. I love the style and the atmosphere. The staff is so friendly. They make you feel welcome and like you're family. I like the design of the entire hotel. The lobby is relaxing. You walk in and you feel like you're at home. I like that it's different from all of the other hotels I've stayed at. It's very unique. I love their art. The place is just gorgeous. I was stunned when I saw how beautiful my room was. My room was a very decent size. The room was super cozy. Everything in the room was in good condition. The bathroom was nice. The rain shower was so amazing. I liked the custom robe and it was very comfortable. The bed was very comforting. I didn't have a problem falling asleep at all. The area was very peaceful and quiet which was a plus for me. I slept like a baby. I also like that the room had a Bluetooth alarm clock. I could have my phone charging and still use it from the opposite side of the room. I had breakfast at David Burke Kitchen and it was scrumptious. I'm glad I tried the Wake Up Carrot juice because it gave me a good boost and I felt great. The restaurant is beautiful and the service was exceptional. Can't wait to come back! Until next time ♥

A very nice, modern hotel in a great location, and helpful and courteous staff. Arrived early after a red-eye, and was able to check in and get a room right away. The rooms are small, but elegant, with a number of nice little touches, and a great view over the neighborhood. Very friendly services, with smiles and hellos from the moment you walk in. Joanne, who was in housekeeping, did a great job with my room, worth calling out. Would definitely come back.

The location is my favorite while at NYC (SOHO and Tribeca is at a walking distance). he service was amazing, the room was clean, spacious, and had a nice view. the bath was amazing. I recommend this hotel to everyone. Highly recommended!

Location is indeed excellent and although the staff were very friendly and helpful at all times, I found the room at the James Hotel in a bit of disrepair and not maintained in the condition it should be given the price. The restaurant was also average. Not what I was expecting.

Just spent 3 nights at the James hotel and couldn't ask for anything more. Best location in Soho and easily walkable to Tribeca, Chelsea , and Meatpacking district. You are surrounded by great shopping and restaurants and friendly staff. There is even a complementary car service if you are going within a few mile radius..the room is typical new york sized but clean and efficient and decently quiet. The price is very reasonable. Highly recommended.

Just fantastic. Upgraded upon checking in to a corner room with a serious view of the WTC. Absolutely deserving of it its stars. The hallway smelled like divine lemon cookies. While the room was a bit quirky as the bathroom is glass, there is a motorized curtain. Speaking of the bathroom, it had a relaxing rain shower head. The room itself was extremely well kept and appointed very nicely. We had a large bench and table to sit at to accomplish some work. Subway is a quick block away and shopping is all within walking distance. I wanted to stay in the room forever. Fortunately we had phenomenal weather and was able to take advantage of the $50 David Burke credit outside for brunch. The burger was out of this world yummy and hubs said the Bloody Mary was the best he has ever had. The Jimmy left little be desired because of the crowd, but the space itself and view is worth a trip up the elevator.

As you will read in most of the reviews, The James is a great choice. Every one of the staff from the front door to the front desk are very welcoming and helpful. The hotel has a very hip vibe and we are little older than most guests but never felt out of place. Good location for short walks to great eating and shopping. The lobby area was great to hang out in, the room was very nice, bed was really comfortable and the bathroom was quite big (I would recommend a magnifying mirror in the bathrooms). We opted for a room on the 15th floor to be high up even though they told us it was across from the elevator. There was no noise at all and the view out our room was amazing!

With so many hotels to choose from in NYC- The James stands out - location and staff make it a repeat hotel! Right in Soho - close to great restaurants and shopping yet intimate and quiet. The staff is amazing - from answering questions prior to arrival - to all during our stay. Knowledgable and friendly. The James feels like an extension of home ( a hip and cool home). Joy ann in housekeeping was charming. The room #1506 had a great view. Great beds and pillows! A definite keeper!

My wife and I stayed here the first part of November for 3 nights and 4 days. The experience exceeded our expectations starting with the room. We booked a corner king suite, and I asked for a quiet room on a high floor with great views. They put us in 1403, and it was all that we hoped for. Didn't hear a peep during the entire stay, and had amazing views of the Freedom Tower and downtown. The room was very clean, and well appointed, and the staff was very friendly.I can see how other reviewers talk about the noise (from the street or the elevator), and how it can be problematic, so I'm thankful I read the reviews before arriving, because our room was fantastic.If you look at the pictures on the site, it can feel like a bit of a fishbowl - but it's an excellent tradeoff for having windows on two sides of the room, and in our room, there was not a building that was really that close to be concerned with... and of course you have the privacy shades. It's essentially a non-issue.We went to the roof-top bar a couple of times. It wasn't our scene. We are laid back, and it was very trendy, very hip, very showy. The staff was nice - I think they could tell we were out of our element. So they were able to hook us up with drinks and we were on our way back to our room. It would be great if they had a "hotel guest" part of the bar aka people not into a scene part of the rooftop bar... it was a very cool bar setup, just not what we are in to.You are pretty close to the action in SoHo, so the location was good. We walked all over.We stayed at the Trump SoHo in a trip last year, which was also great. Because we were here as a couple versus a family, I prefer the James Hotel. If we were as a family, the Trump SoHo was probably more practical (and more expensive if I recall).The guys working the door/concierge/bell were all very cool... very friendly and helpful. All in all a great place.

I recently stayed for 3 nights at The James in Soho. The location was great (close to canal street subway, the village). The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The room was a little noisy at night due to the close proximity to subway and street traffic (It was also Halloween!).The décor was modern and calming. I would recommend this hotel for pleasure or business travellers.

The hotel has good location very close to Brodway and Houston bvds. The rooms are cosy, very clean, with a nice design and good functionality. A lot of restaurants nearby, some of them very famous. What really makes a difference for this hotel is the personnel: always helping, advising, smiling, they did our time there a very pleasant experience. We also enjoyed the 6pm wine & cheese selection complementary offered in the lobby. :) There is also a rooftop bar which is a very good option for evening with friends or just enjoying a drink.

I selected to stay at the James Hotel in NYC because they said they were in Soho; technically they are but on the very edge. The immediate surroundings are not so great as I state in the title of my review it is close to the Holland tunnel, within two blocks. This location made it extremely convenient arriving by car and departing by car. When I need to drive into the city I would possible consider staying at the James again. The property itself has that industrial concrete feeling. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful and the rooms were clean with nice bathrooms. The rooms were very small as typical for Soho but I did not find the price value to be in line with my expectations.

The staff was great. They let me check-out late so I would not sit in the airport for hours. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have slept in. Subway access is good for the AC and the 1 train. Mini-bar is well stocked but expensive. Dave Burke Kitchen has delicious food but be prepared for a slow wait staff.

Love this hotel, friendly staff. Is a great trendy hotel in the heart of Soho with a spectacular view of NYC skyline, complimentary Wine and cheese hour is a perk, rooms are nice and accommodating. Cannot wait to go back.
user_name:
Cari0ki
New York City, New York

review_body: I stay in SOHO often for business but this was my first time at the James and let me say i will definitely be coming back. Great check in experience, they upgraded my room for free and it was very spacious and comfortable. Beautiful views and the bathroom was exquisite. Location was very close to a subway stop but also complimentary car service for a small radius. Perhaps my favorite part was the complimentary wine and cheese in the evening along with hot cookies and free coffee in the morning. The hotel itself was gorgeous - great lobby and treehouse. Wish i could have tried the restaurant as it looked nice as well.

Love this hotel - rooms and location and pleasant staff.Great location in Soho and ideal for access to Newark airport - saves so much time compared to JFK! Rooms are great - we take the corner suite 1 bedroom which is a fabulous room with separate large living room. Excellent and busy penthouse/rooftop bar. Check in staff friendly. This was my second visit here in the past year and The James is my favourite hotel and room in NYC atm.

My husband and I escaped to NYC for a weekend and had the pleasure of staying at The James. Everything about our experience was spectacular - from the wine and cheese when we arrived late night, to the recommendations from Johnny, to the great drinks upstairs and the stunning views of the Freedom Tower from our room. The James didn't miss a beat.

It has a great location walking distance from the good shopping and restaurant area in Soho and not in the middle of the terrible traffic. The rooms have a good size and great comfort (good beds and bathrooms). But what is suppose to be a guest oriented boutique hotel was more like an impersonal and well care hotel. The reservation service is very impersonal, it is machine and computer orientated (there is no waiting list for guest that are already staying in the hotel). The GYM is dirty and there no one taking care of. Machine was broke for 4 days, no cold water no fruit etc… The coffee place on the lobby looks the same, always dirty and some time with half of cookies on the table. Last but not least the carpet when you arrive – there is a tape holding it, what kind of impression they want to give to someone who is check in? With the proper care the hotel could be much better. For the price and the actual condition you will probally find better places. The “good news” is that those complains were made to the general manager who seems to agree and promise to solve it.

The hotel is beautifull . Stylish decoration in any of the floors and facilities.Rooftop bar premium. Nice view of the lower part of Manhattan. Good bar and better service.Location is great. At walking distance of many interesting places.Watch out with traffic. At rush hours is almost impossible to move in the area surrounding the hotel ((Seems to be Holland tunnel traffic).Besides that, the James is worth a visit by all means.

This hotel has a very young vibe. The roof top bar is pretty cool but got very over crowded. The rooms were not particularly comfortable. No desk or club chair to sit back in. Pillows too soft. Nice spacious closets. Great view from a corner room.

My friends in NYC had raved about this hotel but since I'm only in new York on business I never really got to see and experience the magic the this hotel has. This summer in August my girlfriends and I decided to have a week in the city and tried out the James. All I can say is EXCELLENT!!! The location was perfect, we got to walk to such amazing places and when we stayed in the hotel it felt as if we were in an elite part of the city. the rooftop is to die for.. Not only was it so chic looking but the staff really made you feel at home, from check in to housekeeping to the doorman, everyone was so friendly and welcoming. I can defiantly see why my friends love staying here! i'll definitely be coming back next summer and maybe try this winter! Cant get enough.

I stayed at the James by myself in a Queen Guestroom for $405 plus taxes for 5 nights. It's pricey, but then it seems all NY hotels are these days. The room was very nice for one person – small but perfectly formed. The only slight annoyances were that there were no drawers to store clothes and the bed was very soft. There was a kettle and instant coffee and tea bags, so it was nice to wake up and be able to make a cup of tea in the morning. After the second day though, the teabags weren't replaced so I had to call down for more every day, which was a bit of a pain. One day I had to call twice as they obviously forgot. Also, the turndown service didn't happen on my last night. My only other bugbear was the service in the rooftop bar, JIMMY. The bar is lovely, with a tiny pool and great views over Manhattan. But these time it took to get a drink meant that we ended up leaving without one the first time we tried, and the second time we went we had to stand at the bar for 20mins to get a drink (there's no table service). When you're paying $16 plus tip for the cheapest glass of wine that feels like a rip off despite the view.These points aside, I really enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The free coffee and muffins and cheese and wine in the lobby were a nice touch and the location just on the edge of SoHo is lovely for strolling around.

I'm a little late getting this review out as we actually stayed in early July, but better late than never! My husband, our two year old an I stayed here for 3 nights in a "Corner Studio". This was our first time staying at this hotel, but we are former NYC residents and have stayed at many NYC hotels over the years.The room: it was quite large by NYC standards and very nicely furnished/decorated. Nice large bathroom and a great shower. Staff: all the hotel staff we dealt with were friendly and efficient. The gym: fairly big for a hotel, has nice equipment, and has lovely views out over the city. The rooftop lounge/bar: also quite nice and has great views (but unfortunately we only checked it out and did not get to enjoy a cocktail-such is traveling with the 2 year old). Food: we had breakfast at the hotel only one day and it was fine, but not great. We had lunch one day on the outside deck and this was a very nice setting and the cuisine was very good. Also in the food category, the hotel lobby offers free coffee in the morning (very nice) and homemade cookie/brownies in the evening (very, very, nice :)). Location: Really convenient. All the shops and eateries of soho are literally steps away, and the West and Central village are just a short walk. Also, the A/C subway line was right around the corner which is pretty great for getting up to mid town and also over to Brooklyn. Overall: it was a great stay, we would definitely recommend, and would happily stay again.

This past weekend we celebrated my daughter's 14th birthday with an overnight trip to NYC. We chose the James hotel based on location but could not have been happier with our choice. From the moment we arrived, the staff led by manager Christina could not have been more welcoming or accommodating to our group. Even leaving some awesome cheesecake lollipops with a Happy Birthday greeting for my daughter when we returned to the room after a long day of shopping. Rooms were beautiful and entire staff was excellent! Great Soho vibe at the hotel. Thanks to the James for a memorable weekend. We will definitely make the James our NYC destination of choice going forward.

This hotel did not measure up to a 4+ star hotel. Room was tiny (even by NY standards) and had no drawers in which to place clothing items. Sitting area shown in photos is basically unusable because it is the only area in which to place our full suitcases (unless we wanted to place them on the floor in front of the night stand and then trip over them each night). No coffee maker in room except for pot to boil water in for instant coffee (yuk!). Coffee available near reception area was never hot. Even in insulated cup, it was cool before I could get back to my room. Rain shower was so annoying. It was not adjustable so you had water running down your face the entire shower. Hand-held shower head was other option - but still not great.

Nice rooms, perfect customer service.I had a lot of nice advices from the concierge who was very helpful.The rooms have large windows so are very light.Opened bathroom, which give a nice feeling in the room and give an impression that the room is larger than it is.

A comfortable room with luxe details (heated floor in the bathroom, rain showerhead) and enormous windows. Convenient to two subway lines and walking distance to great food and shopping. Great lighting, comfortable bed. You can hear the elevator even while being in a an alcove.
user_name:
lisakfrnyc
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is extremely well designed and functional. The room is not extremely large at 315 sq. ft., however it is larger than many others in the city and it is so well designed it seems much bigger. We never felt crowded. The people that work there are extremely friendly and welcoming. The bellman (Ken) met us at the door when we arrived and stayed with us through the check in process and room arrival. He explained every amenity and volunteered to get ice for us. He was amazingly helpful and pleasant. Ditto all employees. Coffee and breakfast cakes were very good. Very well located in what I call the village. Others would be more specific. Safe neighborhood with good access to the rest of the city while being away from the madness of central Manhattan. Like most hotels the view from the room does not overlook green fields and trees. But to the comment somebody made regarding the Holland Tunnel, I suggest the look at the attached photo take from the hotel bar and roof swimming pool area.

it was my first time trying James hotel, the location is amazing the morning coffee was great the stuff are cool, Jym view is lovely, I like the idea of filter water and I like how tidy the closet was open it and you can find all you want :)

I spent 20 minutes in the room and left for another hotel--you have an appalling vista of traffic converging on the tunnel and the excruciating noise of the traffic. Finishes are tired and shopworn finishes; and the space is cramped. Go to the James instead.

I stayed here for two nights while attending a conference.Location is awesome if you want to explore Little Italy, China Town, Soho. Everything is within walking distance. There are also many shops and restaurants everywhere so regardless where you happen to be you can find something to eat on route back to hotel.Rooms are just right - nice size bed, table to work at, mini bard, coffee/ tea in room, nice shower and bathroom.WiFi Internet is free and available everywhere in hotel including the rooms.Staff very helpful and answered all "tourist" questions and cleaning staff equally helpful . There is a subway station Canal St right next to the hotel and that takes you right to Times Square area.Only negative is the traffic getting to the hotel from JFK airport but hardly the hotel's fault.

Very Soho, classy and intimate hotel. People are very friendly and make you feel welcomed. The staff all make you feel welcome and very personable. We moved to a Marriot in time square just for the weekend but quickly moved back after the weekend because I missed The James New York.

We liked the hotel, the room was clean and the rooftop nice to take a view of the surrounding area. Nice restaurants in the area would will be back soon. Staff was helpful and the food at the garden restaurant was good.

We took the A train directly from JFK airport (and the Air Train) to the Canal St. subway -- door to door service. We walked around in Tribeca and SoHo and could take the subway (mostly the E train but also the A and C) to museums and the WorldTrade Center. I liked the design of the hotel with 3 practical drawbacks: 1) A strong cold wind blew over the bed. We could turn up the temperature but we could not turn down the fan speed. Then the wind blew less often but it was still cold and strong. 2) We like to get ice but there is no ice machine accessible to the guests. 3) There was no convenient way to plug in electronic devices (phone and iPad). This seems odd in a new hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The little muffins and coffee in the lobby were a perfect way to start the day. The view from our corner King room on the 11th floor looked out on Canal street and the WTC.

Normally stay at The Crosby Street Hotel but when I enquired about the possibility of a late check out, approximately two hours, was informed this would be charged at half a day's rate + taxes, around £300 !!!Had a pleasant stay at The James Chicago so decided to give James NY a shot.First of all our taxi driver couldn't find the hotel and moaned that it was difficult to access because of the proximity to the Holland Tunnel. Hey ho, we arrived there was no-one at the entry hall desk, no front of hotel person, but worked out that reception was situated on the lobby level.Had a corner room which was a bit on the small side but pretty much standard for NY, and it was kept very clean by housekeeping. Room niggles, wood veneer was peeling off the closet and small table, no coffee making machine only a kettle with sachets of coffee/tea, no spoons only wooden sticks, knobs in the bathroom were wobbly and the shower door didn't shut properly so if you splashed around water escaped. Bizarrely, no drawers at all for clothes, the closet was small,ok for a short stay, there was a shelve at the top which if you are short, like me, you couldn't reach it. Sound proofing was an issue, the person/s occupying the room above could be heard clip clopping around.Having said all this the staff were very friendly, we had a nice meal at the Tree Top/Garden restaurant (?) but had a very inferior breakfast at David Burke …. one sullen waiter, one waiter who was completely clueless and didn't even know the name of the hotel to which D.B is affiliated.Didn't particularly like the location which is right at the bottom of Soho near the Holland Tunnel, but was nevertheless accessible for the shops/restaurants.I believe the hotel has only been open a few years and in some areas already looks a little tired. Loved the commuter keyboard wall art in entrance and Wifi is free.

My girlfriend and I were celebrating a birthday upstairs at the Jimmy and booked the corner studio at the James for the night so we could just sleep over and go to work the next day. We ended up checking in at around 1AM but the room we had reserved was no longer available. Instead of being offered a free upgrade, which I believe to be standard practice, we were downgraded to a guest room, with the difference in rates refunded back to me (duh). All the hotel did to make up for this was a breakfast voucher. We were indeed disappointed to say the least.The guest room we had was tiny even by NY standard, which I had intentionally tried to avoid by reserving the corner studio. The overall design was modern, sleek, and boutique. I appreciate the idea of elevating the lobby to above street level and avoid pedestrian traffic, but the lobby was again tiny and can get overcrowded easily, too. Overall, the James is a nicely designed, constructed, and decorated facility, but the way it is managed and the service they provide was simply not up to par, especially considering the rates they charge. There are a lot more alternatives to choose around the city for higher quality and more affordable rates, even among hotels of the same category and star level.
user_name:
Insight_ming
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I loved staying at this hotel. It's a bit too pricey to go to everytime we're in NY which is a lot, but the room was really beautiful and fun. I think the most interesting thing was the massive exposed bathroom. It was pretty sexy but don't worry- there is a remote controlled shade that can come down if you need some privacy. The shampoo and other body products are really nice and a good size so you don't have to keep asking for more! The rooms aren't huge but really clean and and the location of this hotel is awesome. The staff is also really friendly and there is a lovely little lobby where guests can get together for light snacks and drinks. All in all a great experience. We'd definitely go back!
user_name:
Nesa A
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This was a lovely stay. Very nice room, superb bed, great bathroom, and generally a very comfortable place to be. Also fantastically well located in a good part of town - easy to pop out for a run, get to the subway, get to the office...I had a 15th fl room with brilliant views; Jimmy's bar way up on the roof has a great, relaxed vibe and even more amazing views. It's pricey, but it's worth it. Oh, and the staff, from the concierge guys through to the reception desk through to the bar staff are genial, friendly and welcoming.

Stayed here for 3 nights, room was great we had lots of luggage but still had plenty of room. Staff were polite and helpful. We did notice it got very busy on the weekend, it was much nicer during the week. Great location, only problem was on Sunday we were up early to catch a flight but could not get breakfast as restaurant did not open till 10 or 11am. Great stay and would definitely stay again, pool was a great bonus for quick dip on the hot afternoons.

My wife and I stayed at the James Hotel for two nights while we were taking our daughter to school at NYU. While the hotel was certainly hip and generally well appointed, there were a lot of things that missed the mark if they are considering themselves a luxury property. 1. Robes in bathroom were tattered and missing belt loops. 2. While wood flooring is nice, the noise from above was disruptive and overall sound from neighbors was subpar for a four star property. 3. They are aggressively marketing the roof top bar however the elevators are shared and this makes it inconvenient for hotel guests. 4. Location is not ideal for cab drop off and most times we were not able to be dropped off at the hotel due to congestion from Holland Tunnel. Overall a very average stay for a more than average price point. There are many better alternatives.

Stayed here for one night with my husband as we were having some renovations done to our home and had to get out for one night. One of the main reasons we booked was because of the rooftop pool - which looked so amazing in the pictures. Unfortunately, the pool was the size of an extra-large hot tub and the sundeck probably couldn’t hold more than 20 people. The rooms itself are small. Clean for NYC standards but the floors are made of wood so any lint or spec of dirt was seen. I will say the staff was super accommodating and very friendly. Our room was the 17th floor which had a great view. However, it was so loud. Not sure if it was people going in and out of the gym or a laundry room for the staff was nearby but we heard so many loud sounds. Overall, it was a good stay and the beds were comfortable which was a huge plus in my book. Price was on point for what to expect.
user_name:
Marisa P
Long Beach, New York

review_body: Just had a great stay at The James. It's a wonderful little retreat in lower Manhattan. Easy access to SoHo, West Village, Chinatown, Little Italy and Tribeca. Their outside areas are like a little get away in the urban jungle. There was one little service issue and it was taken care of with speed and great apology. Little things happen now and then. It's the service recovery that makes the difference between a bad stay or a great stay. The staff at The James is clearly on their game. They were incredibly nice and helpful. When I checked out they offered to get me a cab before I ever made it to the sidewalk.I come to the city several times a month and have been loyal to The Palace, but would love to make The James my home base from now on.

Came for my husband's 40th. Held a private party at the rooftop. Service was awful. Elevator situation is annoying, waiting over 10 min at certain times. The room service food was pitiful. Was supposed to receive $25 in credit for a special promo for having other friends stay here…hotel staff had no idea what I was talking about. Hookers in and out of room on our floor. Bed is comfortable, room is nice. But for the price, go to Soho Grand or 60. Or Nomo (previously Mondrian). This won't knock one sock off.

A good hotel conveniently located in soho just a couple of blocks away from all the shops and actions. The hotel itself is nice enough with a lot of smart design touches (love the computer keyboard wall) and tasteful fine art display in public space. Great top floor bar and also gym with amazing view of the Liberty Tower. The room is on the small side but well equipped. Easy place to stay.

I recently stayed at the James. It is a wonderful hotel, large enough to offer great amenities but small enough to feel cozy and warm. The staff really make you feel cared for, particularly the concierge Morgan Kelly. He took me to my room, a gorgeous corner king with amazing views of the Freedom Tower, and then showed me the different dining areas including the rooftop bar. He even had a complimentary chocolate cake sent up for my birthday! The hotel’s décor is very hip with the works of local artists featured on the walls, the light fixtures, and even the furniture. To top it off the James is set in a perfect location for a mixture of shopping, site-seeing, and night life. I would definitely stay again.
user_name:
havilah1
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We loved Eric and our hotel Eric showed us the lay of the land and was so accommodatingWe enjoyed the first day's lunch outside We loved the free wine and treats We really loved our cleaning ladyWe loved our room
user_name:
Linda E
Winchester, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: The James is located in Soho near the corner of 6th and Grand... steps away from a number of wonderful restaurants and boutique shopping. The hotel is clean and comfortable. But the best part of this hotel is the staff. From the moment we arrived, we were pampered... The always smiling staff was helpful with everything from suggestions for dining & making reservations to getting us denser pillows. ...We were there celebrating our anniversary and when we returned to our room after dinner, we were greeted with dessert and anniversary wishes from the reception staff... Rebecca, Soraya and Keith. If you stay here, have dinner in the hotel restaurant... David Burke Kitchen. We visited during restaurant week and had wonderful selections from their set menu. Ask for Brian to be your server... he's both knowledgeable and charming. Have the crab cake as an appetizer ...AMAZING. Skip breakfast and go to the lobby for scones and coffee... it's free.Brian Morr was also a standout host... Thank you for the suggestion of the Aqua Grill!

I had the happy opportunity to stay at The James New York last week, only overnight (but I would have loved to stay longer!). I had a gorgeous corner room, with a great view of the city and the Freedom Tower. Very comfortable room and amenities. Possibly the nicest "minibar" ever--you could have a nice party in your room and never leave! It's a great part of the city and I would have loved to try out the rooftop bar but it was closed for a private event. The hotel has a very fun and hip vibe and the staff were fantastic and friendly...especially the doormen. I think this would be a great way to treat oneself during a trip to NYC.

We live in Manhattan and thought it would we fun to stay downtown to celebrate a special occasion rather than going back to our home uptown at the end of the evening. Needless to say, at this price point my expectations were high since it would have been easy to disappoint us considering we could have just gone home. But it did not disappoint.The room is small, as are many hotels in NYC, but makes good use of the space. The pool is a joke and is right in the middle of their trendy rooftop, but we felt the staff was very welcoming despite the scene. The breakfast items and snacks and wine they place in the lobby are a nice touch you usually only find in larger hotels.I love the design of the hotel and the location in the idle of soho and the cusp of TriBeCa. They really went all out to mark our special occasion and sent a complimentary bottle of champagne and later a birthday cake with a card. We were also upgraded. We did not have one doubt that our little weekend getaway had been worth it. It was a very good stay.

Fantastic! Friendly staff (especially Jay and Eric at the door), amazing roof top bar - Jimmy's (although it was closed for 2 of the 4 nights we were staying due to a private party). Awesome location, safe, quiet, close to metro, easily walkable to Ground Zero. Lots of restaurants (We recommend Balthazars for breakfast and the The Cupping Room Cafe). The hotel gave us complimentary champagne and strawberries as we were celebrating our 2 year wedding anniversary - this was a lovely gesture and we were so grateful! We were recommended this hotel by a friend and we would definitely visit again! Thank you The James.

Thanks so much for another amazing stay, my room was incredible and as always the views from Jimmy's were breathe taking - and I can't wait to come back. Eric was incredible and so helpful getting us taxis and helping us with our huge amounts of luggage - a total legend!!!

My husband and I didn't travel far to get here since we live in Staten Island, and since it was going to be a beautiful, sunny weekend, we were looking for a hotel with a rooftop pool. We found The James after reading articles online. What a gem! The lobby was small, yet bright, cheerful, clean and stylish, with floor to ceiling windows. They serve complimentary coffee and snacks. The couches were comfortable and reading material was provided. There was also a complimentary business center within the lobby. The rooms were on the small side but were very clean and stylish. Since we are paranoid about bed bugs, we lifted the mattress and did a thorough check...nothing to be found! The bedding was soft and fluffy (? down alternative) and the bathroom had an amazing shower. There is an outdoor garden restaurant on the 2nd floor and a fancier indoor restaurant on ground level. The rooftop pool has a bar/lounge area where drinks and snacks are served. It is open for hotel guests only until 12 noon. After that, it is open to the public and gets a bit crowded. The pool is cold, but refreshing! From the rooftop you could see The World Trade Center and Empire State Building. There is a DJ playing music during the afternoon and night and the rooftop transforms into a classy nightclub in the evening that closes at 2am. This hotel is close to the subway and public transportation with easy access to many downtown attractions, including The World Trade Center, Brookfield Place, Wall Street, Battery Park, The Staten Island Ferry and The South Street Seaport.The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I would definitely recommend this hotel on your next trip to NYC. We plan to return once a year, now that we found this hidden gem!

Having stayed in NYC several times in the past, we wanted to stay around SOHO and take advantage of what the area has to offer. The James is a great place to base yourself and do such a thing. The hotel staff are fantastic and the rooms fresh. The screen in the shower is an interesting feature, you'll either love it and keep it open or think it's strange and keepp it down. With plenty of restaurants, shops, parks, bike rental stations and places to walk, this hotel that is in an area where you can just relax and get a feel for NYC living. I enjoyed staying here and would do so again.Dined at the David Burke restaurant and my experience wasn't fantastic but did like the references to where their food was sourced.Overall would recommend this hotel for couples wanting to spend time in and around the SOHO area.

This is a super chic hotel. I felt the staff was incredibly friendly ! They have beautiful lounging areas. The rooftop at Jimmy's was so much fun. Another nice feature is that they have beautiful ART throughout the hotel.
user_name:
Ronnit1973
Westchester, New York, United States

review_body: I spent 5 nights in the James and i must say, really- New York living!The room was nice and clean and very tastefully decorated. I gotten a room on the 17th floor and wasnt bothered about the noise from the mechanical room. Didnt get any disturb from the rooftop bar either.The rooftop bar is a must visit!

The hotel is very nice and so was our corner room. Spectacular views. Sadly, the service was mediocre at best. We didn't get our room until 4 pm (!) and to make things worse, my credit card was charged twice for the stay. The shower was quite nice but didn't drain at all without help from engineering. Each time I showered I had to stand in an inch of water. The rooftop bar is nice but the real gem is the Garden bar and restaurant—a wonderful little oasis in the middle of the city with very friendly staff. I really want to root for this hotel. But service has to get better for us to come back.

The James was recommended to us by our U.S. based family and lived up or exceeded all our expectations.The staff were outstanding throughout our stay and this included a "fire" issue in the basement. During that time, when we had fire trucks and firemen all over the downstairs lobby, the staff remained efficient and friendly and helpful in all ways.Our room was well lit and very comfortable and the bathroom was excellent.Overall, we could not fault our time at the James and will certainly revisit.

The James is a very cool hotel with a rooftop pool and bar except as a guest of the hotel one is treated like a second class citizen. The hotel does not own the pool but fail to advertise this.One afternoon about 8 guests were by the pool at 4pm and were asked to leave because they wanted to prepare for guests. We refused, it became a little bit unpleasant. Once we gave up our sun loungers the staff did not want us at the bar by the pool. I said call the police if you want me to move. They left me alone. The following Saturday night we wanted to look at the view from the rooftop pool and were refused entry by a very burly security guard. Not very impressed.When you go to reception and are asked "Is there anything I can help you with?" as long as your answer is no then you are fine, otherwise they are clueless. The doormen are fantastic, we learnt to bypass reception and go straight to the doormen. The were very helpful and rolled their eyes when we told them about reception, they had clearly heard it all before.Very nice clean rooms, just ignore the reception satff

Stayed for one night. Had a corner king. Great bright room with comfortable beds and good linen. Get a high floor and avoid level 17 as the roof top bar opens to the public at night and gets very loud. Gym is small and hot and needs to be cleaned more often.

We could not rate the James hotel highly enough! From the moment we arrived we have experienced nothing but the best. The door concierge Eric was so helpful in every way, in fact all the staff from the lobby hosts to the cleaners and the bar staff at the fabulous JIMMY rooftop bar were friendly and delightful to deal with. The rooms were big and immaculate with great views. The bathrobes were really comfortable and the beds are like clouds. We took advantage of the free coffee, scones and newspapers in the lobby every morning,the cheese, wine and crackers at happy hour and cookies at night before bed. Everything was delicious! The rooftop pool and bar are great. I was too busy to see the gym but I'm sure it was just as great. Thanks to every at the James, my mum, sister and I had the BEST time. Oh and the location is great - lots to do in Soho and plenty of easy access points to the subway just around the corner.

Great hotel in a great location. Easy access to the red line on the NYC subway. Quiet rooms, great views. Good for kids. One complaint: The rooftop pool was rented out all three nights we were there so that was a bummer that the kids didn't go swimming. Would stay here again.

I booked the James in Soho as a last minute birthday present for my husband. we arrived early, but were still able to check in. I had booked a Deluxe room as I prefer a bigger bed, and I knew my husband would appreciate a better view. We weren't disappointed. We headed straight up to the rooftop pool and enjoyed the view and a drink and had a lovely chat with the hotel's sales manager, Daniel, who later sent us an unexpected delivery of cheesecake pops to our room. It was such a nice touch. We didn't get to enjoy the hotels's complimentary wine and cheese in the evening as we had dinner reservations. The room was nice and dark and quite, perfect for a good night's sleep! The only downside to the room was the coffee making facilities. I would have expected at least a proper spoon to stir rather than a wooden stick.... maybe that's being picky.... just a suggestion! Overall, we had a lovely stay.
user_name:
LittleStar28178
Lytham St Anne's, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed here this weekend on staycation. We are New Yorkers but wanted a mini-getaway with a pool. Let's start with the pool. It is the smallest rooftop pool I have ever seen. I am not sure if it is heated at all, but the water is freezing. No one could even use it all morning because it was so cold. Until, that is, it fills up with 23 year olds once the pool opens to the public at 3pm. When it does, hang on! You'll be inundated by heavy drinking frat types and they are shoulder to shoulder. They lay on every inch of the ground and take over the entire pool. Forget keeping your beach lounge--they few that they have are 'reserved' for those who have made reservations and are getting bottle service--mostly non hotel guests who I doubt could afford to stay here. When we complained to the manager he was kind enough to give us a $50 certificate to David Burke's Kitchen, which is part of the hotel. We proceeded to have an absolutely terrible meal there--do not go for any reason! There are lots of better places nearby. Now for the hotel. it is old and badly designed. The glass elevator from the grimy lobby is dirty, as are the steel girders and walls on the way up. The rooms are small (typical for NYC, so no problem there). The carpets are stained in the hallways--yuck. They put out pastries and coffee in the morning but no one pays attention so they were out of milk for the coffee the two times we stopped by. When we asked for a bagel shop we were directed to a bodega that happens to sell bagels. Come on! I would hate for tourists looking for NYC bagels to get this piece of bad advice! All this for $500 a night. Ridiculous. Look elsewhere.
user_name:
kathkel
New York City, New York

review_body: I felt like I owned the city. There was some deal where if you stayed for 3 nights, it would be the cost of 2, saving us hundreds. Gorgeously located in Soho, perfect for walking, yet so nice it made me never want to leave. I would go back in a heartbeat.

In town on business and The James was a great choice! The staff was very friendly and the hotel had a great vibe. Just sorry that I was unable to enjoy the restaurant and bar areas that evening. I did take time to enjoy breakfast in the lower level restaurant. The decor was modern but warm and inviting. Plan to return when my schedule is less packed!

I loved this hotel. It was very first time staying there (and I told them) and immediately got an upgrade to a corner suite when I checked in. Love, love, loved this hotel. The amenities, restaurants, bars, and overall ambience was extraordinary. Highly recommend this to anyone who likes staying in SoHo.
user_name:
Van Bich N
San Francisco, California

review_body: Good Hotel in a great spot. Friendly staff. Convenient for subway and buses. Plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance. Overall very good but the decor was a little tired in places, with scuff marks, etc, not what you expect for a hotel charging these rates. Room was great, just a standard room but all very comfortable not a huge amount of storage if you are there for more than a few days. Lots of good little extras at the hotel, i.e. cheese and wine, coffee and bagels in reception area, etc. The bars and restaurant associated with the hotel are very popular with non residents making the lifts very busy at times. The roof top pool is little more than a bath and is accessed through the bar.

I went to the james hotel a few years ago. It was so much fun! The beds are nice and the bathrooms were giant! The tv is nice and the view is great. The James is great and I recommend it! It was great and I recommend it! It was great and I recommend it!!!!

Exceptional service from the moment we entered the hotel and continued until check out. Loved all the complimentary extras offered in the lobby. Hotel accommodations were luxurious but family friendly too!

We have stayed in this hotel twice now, and we will certainly stay there again next time we visit New York. The hotel is modern and very laid-back, the staff are very happy to help and offer great service, but it never feels stuffy like it can do in other luxury hotels. As the hotel is in Soho with not a lot of other tall buildings around it offers fantasic views over the city or the Hudson river, depending on your room. The rooftop bar is also excellent. The rooms are quite small, but it's perfect for a couple. After our last visit in 2013 we loved the hotel so much that we decided to hold our wedding in the penthouse and were lucky enough to stay in it for one night. The penthouse is absolutely stunning with fantastic views over the city. A perfect location for an intimate wedding dinner and the staff couldn't have been more professional. We have never dined in the hotel resturant before, but they provided the food for the dinner and it was absolutely exceptional. Will highly recommend. The location of the hotel is also great, it's only a few minutes walk to great restaurants and bars and excellent shopping.

We stayed at The James for the third time in February as part of our wedding trip. Although our first two prior stays at the The James were spectacular, the hotel has lost some its luster and it prior consistency of delivering excellent service and product. We again stayed in a corner room like the two previous times. The rooms need to be touched up to fix scuff marks on walls, worn floors, sinking mattresses, etc. The service at Jimmy's, the rooftop bar, was also less than excellent and came with a bit of an attitude. The hotel is in a great location and close to everything in Soho. However, we may try a different place next time we are in the City.

The James at first seemed a pretty stiff place, little uptight when I walked in in the evening. Even though the restaurant was opened until 11pm, we arrived there at 10:50, due to the time it took to fix the tv which was not working. Still we were served untill late night with all the service we could possibly ask for. Very delicious ribs is what they serve here for sure!After that their rooftop Jimmy was fun, even though it was unfortunate the pool is not to be used at night, and the woman managing there is not very inviting and customer friendly. Though this is a different organization so not to be judged for here.Waking up in the James was amazing, at 6 in the morning the big man in the entrance was happy singing and dancing, making my grumpy morning turn into a great one. The coffee they serve in both the lobby and the restaurant is amazing, and the homemade cookies are definately worth out walking to the lobby for!On top of that the entire staff is more than helpful to any of the customers demands. Giving a professional but very hospitable type of service. Definately worth spending your night in New York at when you are interested in the neightbourhoods of SoHo, NoHo, TriBeCa, Chinatown and Little Italy!

One of my favorite hotels in the city. Love staying in the soho area, yet get an added bonus of being in a high rise hotel. I would love to stay here again the next time I visit.Location: While it’s only a slight walk to the shops in soho, there’s really not much of anything adjacent to the hotel itself. Also, the entrance was tricky to find (it’s off Grand FYI). Lobby is up the elevator/stairs. Once nice thing is that the hotel faces a “park” however when we were there it was fenced off, but helped provide some quit which was nice.Ambiance: very minimalist, clean, trendy. Beige is definitely their favorite color. Lobby is pretty small, but definitely come back in the morning for some complementary treats. Did not try the restaurant, gym or pool (if they have one).Rooms: The room we stayed in was very small (but probably on par with other NYC hotels). However it didn’t feel that small due to the HUGE windows in the room. Was a really nice touch having all that natural light pour in. The bed was extremely comfy, did not want to get out of it in the morning. We had a room that faced the “park” and it was very quiet, even though the street was below. The bathroom was a good size and the shower was really large. It had a window wall that separated it from the room, however a curtain could be pulled down to separate. Also, the hotel provides free bottles of filtered water in the room which is a nice touch.

The service from the hotel was one of the best I've had. The employees are very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is on the newer side but not brand new. It is located on the edge of Soho and Chinatown and is very walkable if you are in decent shape. The neighborhood itself is very safe.The rooms are small but it is NYC. Bathrooms are of ample size. The rooftop pool is nice. The hours are odd. It's opened to hotel guests before 5:00 pm depending on the day of the week and then turns into a bar/lounge.The Treetop restaurant is very nice. It's a garden oasis to getaway from the city. Food is good.I highly recommend the James hotel based on service alone. I've stayed at 5 star hotels with mediocre service and have been highly disappointed.

This hotel is very overpriced for what you get. The room is cold and uncomfortable, quite stoic in design. There is no soft place to even sit except the bed which was squeaky. When I returned home, I found that I had a jewelry bag missing. When I called the hotel to see if it was there, the girl on the phone was so rude and didn't help to see if it was there. She just said it wasn't on the list. She didn't offer to do anything more even after I had said that the bag contained some expensive pieces along with some very sentimental pieces. Yes, the bag could have been stolen via the airports, but this girl didn't offer to help at all and was very rude when I called. The hotel could have helped more. Two good points: the doormen were helpful and friendly to us when we were there, and the David Burke Restaurant was quite good. But again, the hotel was very overpriced for what you get.

We stayed at The James for 3 nights in June and would highly recommend this hotel. The staff are welcoming without being too over the top, the concierge recommended some excellent places for dinner, the room had a fantastic view, the rooftop bar Jimmy also has a great view (and is easy to get into before 9pm if you're a guest, after that you have to queue) and we loved the little details like complimentary water in the room and cookies in the evening. The hotel is very close to the Canal St subway (perfect for getting to the Airtrain to JFK, which I'd recommend as well instead of getting a taxi - the drivers from the airport are quite hostile!) and it's perfect for exploring Soho. Will definitely stay again!

Fabulous staff, fabulous hotel, fabulous restaurant. We stayed here for the first time this past weekend. This is our NYC hotel from now on. We spend 5-6 weekends a year in NOLA and we always stay at the Loews. The James is a much nicer place, but it has that same vibe. As far as the David Burke Kitchen ... I could go on for a while. And this review comes from a couple that are 20 years too old for the rooftop bar and struggle to stay up until midnight.

Stayed at the james with my wife for 4 nights on trip to the states.Great hotel friendly staff. We got a room on the 17 floor great views. Jimmy bar is on 18th well worth a visit cool spot. We had a corner room well worth the extra views are great. Beds are amazing very comfortable am 6ft no problems can roll about room to Spair. Bathrooms are very nice showers are great, rain water and a small 1 if the lady's don't want to get the hair wet. Products are gluten free and smell fantastic. Gym in hotel has all u need to keep on top of it. Free coffee and scones in lobby in morning and wine and cheese at night both red and white are worth taste. No issues with room cleaning or anything else good area right beside subway or can walk anywhere from hotel. Free bikes in lobby to. Will stay here again loads of places to eat within two streets.

I had the pleasure of meeting a long time friend in NYC for exactly 26 hours and chose The James New York because of the location and amenities on site. My friend and I wanted to enjoy the rooftop pool, the bar and the restaurants ~ By the time we checked in and had a bite to eat, we headed to the pool, only to be told that within a half hour of our arrival that we needed to leave the pool because of a private party. We, along with other hotel guests all had to leave the pool by 4:30. It was the most beautiful day and a gorgeous view with a terrific pool and pool bar……that we did not get to enjoy. So we ventured down to the bar and restaurant and found a nice spot to enjoy a drink until we were then again asked to move because a private party was about to begin. The staff were pleasant enough but lacked the professionalism of seasoned waiters, waitresses and hotel staff. The room was great ~ exactly what I had anticipated and as shown on the website. But the room was not why I chose the hotel. I chose The James Hotel as sort of an all inclusive place to enjoy time with a friend and was truly disappointed that the hotel was hosting private parties in two very prominent areas of a very small place. I would have appreciated advanced knowledge of the details of private parties and areas of such a small hotel being closed to the hotel guests prior to my booking. I booked directly through the hotel. I would have chosen a different hotel as there were many more less expensive hotels available in Soho for a one night stay. I would return to the hotel as the location and amenities are fantastic but I will most certainly be inquiring as to whether there are events planned at the hotel during my stay that would limit my ability to take advantage of the pool, the rooftop bar and the outdoor lounge areas.

We spent four nights at the hotel while we celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary. We were upgraded to a king corner room which overlooked downtown Manhattan and the Freedom Tower. We also received a bottle of champagne. The evening wine and cheese was a hit with us as was the morning coffee and muffins. The only really odd thing in this otherwise fine hotel was the shabby sofas in the lobby. I actually asked about them and was told that there had been a winter water leak. New upholstery was coming. Other than that our stay was wonderful
user_name:
Ms. Beth M
New York City, New York

review_body: I used to stay at other hotels in Soho area, this is my first time to stay at The James New York, I am quite happy with the friendliness of the staff of the hotel. The rooms are as shown on the internet, a decent size and comfortable.

Room was very good, all other areas were impersonal and un-welcoming.Staff just painted pemanently with fake smile, no real interest in caring for guests. Hotel staff lacked mature experienced guidence

You can't beat the location on Grand Street in Soho. Love Soho. Love the Villages, Tribeca and so forth. I wanna live on this street corner.Book the Corner King Studio if you're staying here. The multiple to-die-for-views is definitely worth it - we saw the whole of Soho in one direction and One World Trade Center and the financial area through the other set of windows. I could have stayed in bed and just watched the New York-vista all day.The room was probably somewhat smaller than similar room-types at nearby Trump Soho. And no bathtub was small minus.Service was really good all around. Most of all I would say it was friendly and helpful. The breakfast service was not as good as the rest of the hotel service but still ok.Also highly enjoyed the roof-top pool and bar, the outdoor tree-top restaurant and the bikes that you could use free of charge. I loved biking in New York by the way!

In just a few years The James is starting to feel worn. My room was tired, the bed was worn, cracks in the grout and tile. Curtains wouldn't close properly and there is no where to sit comfortably. Not sure I will stay here again.

I stayed for 5 days, the hotel was beautiful but the service was terrible. The service at the Jimmy and at David's were terrible to say the least and the food was just okay.Someone was checked into my room and given key while I was in there. Things went missing form my car while it was in valet. The hotel promised to remove charges from my bill at checkout for the inconvenience but did not.The pool was beautiful and Kenny the door man was great, but that is really all this place has going for it.

This was a very disappointing hotel stay, we stayed here a couple times in the past and loved it. This time around it just seems like no one has put any effort or money into the hotel since it was built. The rooms were aging in a ver obvious way, the paint was scuffed and chipped, the bedding was worn out, the curtains were dusty and worn. It needs serious repair to bring it back to where it was...

Rooms were a little small but typical for a nyc hotel. Very comfortable bed and really nice bathroom with a great rain shower head. Perfect location for getting around lower Manhattan went to roof top pool in afternoon on Sunday but packed with kids in their 20's. Gorgeous views!

I don't know what happened to this hotel.. So much good reviews and the rooms I saw was far different from that. There was dust everywhere: from the drawers to the horrific dusty-gray curtains. At some point, it looked like velvet, but really was dirt, and I'm not overreacting. The furniture was poorly maintained. The only reason we stayed was because we had already paid. The bathroom was greasy, the papers (menu, notes, coasters...) even had food remais! I don't think I need to say anything else, alone, each of those things are bad, together can be even worse. The only good thing was Kanye (sorry if I am misspelling his name), he did everything he could to make everything better! Oh, just one more thing: the manager opened another room for me to see if I wanted to move, but it was just the same mess. I thought after that he would ask to the housekeeping to give an extra care to our room, but it never happened. He offered some kind of vouchers to have dinner on the restaurant, but look, I'm complaining about the lack of cleanliness and how a restaurant voucher could ever compensate it?? Ok, maybe the 'dirtiness' is just another "eco-friendly" thing from their menu.

We decided to have an early Eve cocktail at Jimmy at The James Hotel (their rooftop bar) as it was just about to open at 5pm.I liked the look of The James hotel - and made a mental note to have a better look online - when we got upstairs to the bar , quite a few of the tables were reserved, but the bar staff were very accommodating and went out of their way to seat us . The bartender told my hubby it was a corporate event going on - so we did a bit of people watching and had a really enjoyable hour or so up there .

We stayed at the James for a two nights stand in NY in June. The building structure is extremely cool, every corner of the common areas is filled with art, the garden restaurant and the rooftop pool are uber-cool and the Gym allows a rare sight over Soho - a real boost for a good work out. Rooms are in line with NY standard sizes (e.g. do not expect plenty of space), very nicely decorated and pretty comfortable. The view was amazing!last but not least, the staff was top notch, we were treated with all regards, they gave us hints for restaurants and made our stay really great from the moment we walked into the reception to our exit we fell completely comfortable. Definitely a nice place to stay.

I had the pleasure of staying here for three nights on business. No complaints. I was booked into a corner room, which I highly recommend - floor to ceiling glass on two sides with commanding views. Love the heated tile floor in the bathroom - nice touch. The mattress was very comfortable as well. The room was quite small, but very efficiently laid out. Staff was friendly and helpful too. Not cheap, but you get what you pay for, especially in Manhattan.

We booked the James for a "staycation" over Memorial Day weekend with our main purpose of enjoying their rooftop pool. Unfortunately, our experience left a lot to be desired. The pool apparently is managed by the rooftop bar the Jimmy and apparently they are under new management which explains the service issues. First of all, there was no drink/food service at all at the pool (we had to track multiple people down to figure out how to order room service up there) and the bar itself did not open until 1pm! Additionally, we were informed that at 2:45pm, that he lounge chairs would be turned into benches for the bar and we could not lay out any longer. I understand promoting the night club however there is no reason this turnover needs to happen so early in the afternoon and prevent paying guests from enjoying this amenity. The management tried to explain that the pool area has different management but that is no excuse. We were extremely upset as this was not disclosed to us at booking or at check-in and basically ruined half the day. Also,there was no music at the pool during the day and the pool was not heated and freezing. I did enjoy the actual room itself, our dinner at the Kitchen by David Burke and the complimentary items in the lobby but will not be returning due to issues above.

This Hotel is for the urban turist.In Soho near to china town, little italy and tribeca,better location for design and epicurian food lovers.purist but with personality, the rooms on the coorner are cool.the sky Bar is unique.

The corner King rooms are pricey but you get a great view. The rooftop pool (in season) is small but fine for a few laps and the view while swimming is pretty unique. The Burke kitchen adjacent has a good menu and lots of nooks and crannies in the outdoor part for a nice breakfast, lunch or cozy drinks - a nice oasis in Soho. Hotel Staff are courteous and helpful. There is also complimentary wine & cheese in the lobby, or cookies - depending on the hour. If you get a breakfast included deal and book during the annual sale the value is more comparable to other hotels that would be on par - but I agree with other reviewers that it's on the high end of the scale. That said, I like the minimalist decor, service and location, so do recommend it.

We booked the James for 1 night as a getaway from our home in Brooklyn while our parents watched our daughter. We wanted to feel pampered and just relax. I found the James via my credit card points program and it was listed there as 5 star and most reviews looked good. But...we definitely picked the wrong hotel (my bad, should have done more research). I should have known things would not be up to our standards when I tried to call the hotel 3 times to get an early check in and not once did anyone pick up.I have many complaints but here are the top ones:1. Elevators take FOREVER. They reserve one elevator to go up to Jimmy's rooftop so the hotel guests are basically shorted an elevator. One ride up we noticed it smelled really bad, and another guest mentioned someone had puked in the elevator. So if you're in to that, I guess you'll like this hotel. Us, not so much. a few other guests seemed annoyed and complained that they'd never stay at the James again.2. The hotel is loud. You can hear the music pumping from the rooftop when you're in the hotel and when we tried to have a nice dinner outside, we had to ask to be moved because of the thumping music.3. The hotel itself is sort of dirty. Dirty hallway carpet, elevators, etcI kind of just got a weird vibe from the place overall. I actually told my husband I wanted to move hotels since we only had one night but he convinced me to stay. It was fine but I would not go back nor recommend it. The highlight of our stay was probably our server at David Burke Kitchen. He was awesome, made great recs and made sure we were attended to. The food was quite good as well.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
LizG311
New York, New York, United States

review_body: After you work your way through the confusing, sparsely-decorated entrance and manage to find the third floor lobby, the James doesn't disappoint -- modern, stylish, comfortable rooms with luxurious bathrooms, and generally great service from the front desk staff. And breakfast in the David Burke restaurant in the basement is consistently excellent.

This is a boutique hotel that relies on its good location and roof bar (if you can get onto it!!) The lobby reception is tired and the artworks needing attention!The staff are surly with the exception of the porters who were charming.Check your bill as you might get charged for mini bar when you haven't actually had anything.Stay at the Ludlow for a much better boutique experience in New York.

We have stayed at this hotel several times and it is now our default hotel in New York. The location in the heart of SoHo is perfect for great access to shopping and restaurants. The hotel itself is gorgeous, with high-quality amenities and decor. And they do a very good job of making you feel special and looked after throughout your stay. Definitely the place to stay in SoHo!

The James Hotel has a good location with lots of shops, restaurants, bars etc. around. The hotel is modern and clean, with great twists to the interior design, such as cool art pieces.Our room was comfortable and spacious, and the view was great overlooking other high rise buildings. It really brought it home to us that we were in New York.Breakfast was not included in our reservation, and perhaps we should have paid better attention to this, but I was surprised due to the hotel brand, which seemed so "inclusive": There is free coffee/tea and biscuits in the lobby area, and complimentary water in your room. The service was fine, although a little impersonal and we were not given much information upon arrival. For example, we received two complimentary drinks when we booked - but we were never offered these at the hotel. The roof top bar is well decorated and the cocktails are great (have the Moscow Mule). The view is just stunning, and there is a heated pool if you fancy it. However, the vibe at the roof top bar was a bit odd. The waitresses were wearing very revealing outfits and heavy make-up in the afternoon (which may have been more suitable for the evening), giving the place a bit of a cheap vibe. I thought that the James was quite stylish, but the services was not modest or courteous. Therefore, I would recommend going to the roof top bar at night, and not for before dinner drink.

we stayed at the james for 5 nights and gound it to be conveniently located and of a walkable distance to neighbouring areas such as greenwich village, the financial district, little italy etc. the rooms were a little cramped but luckily we were given rooms high up and the view of the downtown skyline was stunning with lots of natural light.staff were commendably helpful & great with suggestions for eating out, shopping etc.we would consider staying here again for future trips.

This hotel is outstanding. Great service and very friendly. Stunning roof top bar and restaurant. Very unique and the location is awesome in the centre of Soho and close to restaurants and boutiques.Really enjoyed the stay even so the night was very short for us as we had to leave early but the night portiere was so nice that he made us fresh coffee at 3AM.

This is by far our favourite hotel in NYC. Super modern, great design, small but perfect, sleek rooms. Great beds and bathrooms, toiletries, frette sheets and bathrobes. Luxurious and if you take advantage of some deals, the costs are not exorbitant. While staying in soho can seem a bit out of the way, it's such a great spot to walk and shop. And not a bad hop through Washington Square Park to Blue Hill restaurant or into 1st for Momofuku. And The James is only a few minutes from Dean & Deluca. So, basically, it's an urban paradise and we can't wait until next time.

Really enjoyed this property. The pictures found on line really do not show this property off very well, much better in person. Love the daily lobby amenities and water in the room. The pool is much smaller than the pictures make it look. Clean modern aesthetic, pleasant staff and really good location. Corner room is a must.

We expected more from our stay at The James. Checking in was difficult, the staff was not overly helpful, the rooms were well appointed but small even for NYC standards. If you do stay there, check your bill carefully - upon checkout they added a charge for room service we never ordered and then after we checked out they incorrectly added another charge to our credit card. They removed the charge when I called, but it left me with a bad feeling and wondering if this is a common practice of theirs where they hope they can get away with adding charges after guests check out. There are many other 4+ star hotels in NYC where the service is much better and consistent.

Hotel room is not special. Catagory *** \ ****. What the hotel makes it special is the rooftop bar. Soho area is great. A short distance there are many bars and good restaurants. Shopping street 5 minutes walk. Restaurant in the hotel is quite good. Much has been written about the rooftopbar. This is really great! Super stylish, incredibly New York!

Nothing horrible, but lots of small inconveniences that would cause me to think twice before staying here again.- Coffee and tea were not replenished daily, and there were no coffee stirrers or spoons, so we had to stir our coffee with the giant cocktail muddler. Also, the tray with the coffee maker was left out on the table which took up all the space on the table. Also, there was only one water drinking glass so one of us had to drink water out of a coffee mug.- At various nights, we were missing either a bath mat or washcloths- Housekeeping left two windows open so it was very cold when we got back to the room at night. (We had a corner room facing SE so it probably got very hot during the afternoon when housekeeping was in there.)- There was a strange item left on the bed after housekeeping. It was a long white plastic "plank" that ran the width of the bed by about 2 inches wide. We propped it up in the corner of the room. No idea what it could have been.- There were no luggage racks in the room...it doesn't feel good to put a suitcase with dirty wheels on top of pristine white bedcovers. There was a bench, but the location was not convenient relative to the closet and also there was a round table in front of it so we'd have to move the table.- One side of the bed had no outlet, the other side had a power strip on the bottom shelf of the nighttable. Not very convenient.- Also, to go outside required switching elevators. The lobby elevators either didn't go to the ground, or for the times when it did, stopped only at a "mezzanine" type area that required a short stair descent. It was mysterious to us when it would go to the mezzanine level or not. Swiping the key sometimes seemed to work, sometimes not. The alternative was to switch elevators in the lobby to the one elevator that does go all the way to the ground.Design -- hotel was very sunny and the design was pleasing to the eye, but the materials were probably not very high quality as things were a bit banged up and dingy.On the plus side the staff was very friendly, especially at the restaurant downstairs. We also thought the food there was quite good. Also, Wifi was free and fast.Overall, felt like a 3-star hotel at a 5-star price.

I was in town for the Tribeca Film Festival. This hotel was excellent proximity to the festival venue. The staff is excellent - helpful, friendly, and very efficient. I highly recommend grabbing a drink or a meal at the on-site bars and restaurant - the old fashioned I had at JIMMY was one of the best cocktails I've ever had. Concierge staff was incredibly helpful, particularly when my flight was canceled and travel plans changed.

If rooms at The James cost $200 a night, they would be a steal. But they're not. And that's the problem. For five-star prices, the service isn't up to par. Staffers seemed harried and not quite sure how to help. Simple requests (would you mind printing these tickets for us?) took three follow-up inquiries. Sometimes it quite honestly felt like we were imposing. That said, there is much to like about this hotel. The restaurant downstairs is excellent, the Soho location is outstanding (although the Sixth Avenue side of the hotel is loud -- be sure to request a room on the other side if you're a light sleeper). The fitness center boasts remarkable views -- but only two carafes of water, which were empty by the end of my work-out on both days I was there. The hotel makes a point of providing filtered water to guests, but then doesn't re-fill the water during turn-down. It's almost as if they have the right ideas about how to be a top-rate boutique hotel, but just can't quite execute all of those ideas. In the end, we had a very good stay -- what's not to love about being in a great spot on the edge of Soho? -- but it almost felt like it was in spite of the hotel, and not because of it. That's not the best feeling after paying such high prices for the privilege.

We had a great stay. It was our 10 year wedding anniversary, and were surprised to find a nice bottle of wine and chocolate/strawberries in our room. Great gesture! The staff at The James is extremely helpfull, and nice, and it made our stay fantastic. The rooftop bar Jimmy is a great place, and should not be missed!

As noted numerous times, the location is splendid. My interaction with the hotel staff was really good as well. Front desk, front door - both these departments are doing a great job. So, here is my greatest challenge - the place seems a little tired and just slightly tattered. I am assuming that many people stay here and it really shows. I can't really point at one glaring thing, but there were a lot of little things in my room that pointed to very very used - the toilet worked, but I always had to push the button twice, the rug at the end of the bed needed a thorough cleaning, the platform on which the mattress rested, was chipped, there was a strip of blue tape that painters use, in the crevice of the floor and baseboard. I know, I know, these all sound so petty when taken by themselves, but the overarching feeling was that the rooms aren't well taken care of, because they are moving so many people thru the system. Good for The James to have such great business, but I probably won't stay again - and if they don't have a regular maintenance program, I strongly suggest one. The public spaces felt the same way for me. Rooftop bar and pool - spectacular view, but I wonder if hotel guest get any special perks during the warmer season - it seemed as if everyone on the southern tip of Manhattan had decided to have a $20 drink there.

As other reviewers have noticed, location is outstanding, right in the middle of Soho (and a subway station is just around the corner). The rooms are quite small but well laid out: the bathroom is divided by a glass (but there's an electric blind that can be shut): there's a misterious gap in the glass that encases the showroom, so floods must be expected. Street noise is noticeable even on higher floors. Excellent and expensive breakfast. Very good service with attentive staff.

After reading all the fabulous reviews we decided to book our 5 nights accommodation at The James. Usually we stay at the Trump Soho and will continue too after this trip!The James was so noisy, dirty and unprofessional. To be honest we stay in so many hotels around the world for business and pleasure and never write reviews, however this one was not a comfortable hotel at all we would never stay here again.A few points you should be aware of when booking--The floors are wooden and u can hear the people on top of your room and also next door-The gym has only one old running machine as one was broken, and a few other old pieces of equipment. Terrible... Really only suitable for one person at a time -The walls are so paper thin we were kept up all night with the noises of the other room making plenty of noise....-jackhammers were going at 2am in the morning (this isn't the hotels fault however shouldn't they have double glazed windows?)-the bathroom was so dirty and covered in dust you could wipe your hands over it - the housekeeping and turn down was a joke.... Never seen anything like it. There idea of turndown was shutting the curtains and pulling the doona up. All in all we would not recommend this hotel and realize why the other hotel get better ratings!Just terrible and disappointing
