I wouldnt suggest anyone to stay here. I didnt know why but I never seen anyone here is helpful or know what are they doing. they wander around in the lobby when they should be on the ground floor helping people with luggages, some I even see flirting with the reception lady around 9pm. I dont want to see that.  we make a request to have a high floor and given low floor. with someone's laundry room as my view. So yeah my first impression is not that good. gym has no toilet too. The free wine and the free things is just so limited and the same in every day. Its free right? I shouldnt talk about it. The room is tight and small. There are alot of staffs walking around but seems none is interested with guests. I asked if they have hotel freezer I can keep my ice cream. they say yes, bring it down to the lobby. and the next day I asked for my ice cream and its... melted. I asked them again, so you have freezer? the other lady said, no we doesnt have freezer we only have small fridge. last day I asked for bell service, waited and waited none come.then I decided to drag my own luggage down. and asked where is the bell service? they were like oh, they wasnt there? sorry.suddenly I receive 100bucks extra charges on my bills, I emailed none reply. I contacted fb long time to reply. finally they get back to me telling me, its for MINIBAR CHARGES! when I didnt consume anything, and what is 100bucks for minibar? after complaining, they finally retracted it back to my account and I told them about currency exchange difference they added 10 bucks more there. good. this hotel price is around 400 per night, but it feels like 80 bucks per night. top up a little bit and go stay in trump.

I researched many hotels trying to find the perfect one in Soho. I thought the James exceeded my expectations in most ways. We booked a corner king room and when we first walked in, all we could do was stare out the windows at the amazing view. You could hear the street noise some from the tenth floor, but it was not an issue when we slept that night. Bedding was very comfortable, and the pillows melted your cares away when you lay your head down. The amenity bar had an outstanding selection of temptations to choose from, and the free filtered water was a nice touch. The bathroom was spacious for NYC and the shower had both a waterfall and hand held shower head. The hairdryer was actually a real hair dryer that works well.We did go upstairs to the upstairs bar "Jimmy" and were met with a fantastic view of the city. Freedom Tower on one side and the Empire State on the other. There is a plunge pool and outside space that is best when the weather is warmer. The bar fills up on a Saturday night, but it was very enjoyable, good music, and the bartenders were very attentive. The rest of the staff were always helpful and very prompt to help if you asked them to assist. If you are staying in Soho, it is a great place to stay and convenient to exploring Soho, Little Italy, and Chinatown. I would definitely return.

The employees were very helpful and seemed generally happy. They took our bags and even in a brief conversation picked up on the fact that we would need to be at the airport at a specific time. When we got back to the hotel car was waiting for us with bags already packed.

The best of New York, in a contemporary setting. Wonderful rooms, wonderful staff. The beds and pillows are to die for and little details, like filtered carafes of water in every room, not to mention the view, are priceless. Traffic could be a bit noisy for some, but didn't bother me.
user_name:
Mimiviajera
Key Biscayne, Florida, United States

review_body: We stayed in the James due to a company event that was taking place mainly in Soho and Brooklyn. The rooms are very narrow even for one person traveling with a big suitcase but the room is well laid out with a nice bathroom that can be visually shut off with an electric blind - nice touch. The breakfast is outstanding. The roof top bar Jimmy upstairs is a phenomenal bar with great and attentive staff, the 360 views of the city really let you arrive in NYC. The location has a lot to offer in walking distance.

We had 4 outstanding days at the James hotel in the perfect SOHO location. In the middle of an extremely frozen winter, coming back to the most beautiful designed hotel was an important part of our perfect vacation. The beautiful most convenient room, the on-going, free lovely refreshments (Balthazar muffins...)We were impressed by the excellent service of the staff (especially the lovely most professional Amy Adams!!). Don't miss this hotel..!

Admittedly, we do not stay at a lot of hotels, being somewhat homebodies. But we've stayed at enough hotels to know when there's a winner. The bellmen were efficient and helpful...and friendly to-boot. The check-in staff (Deb, Juliette and others) -- well, unbelievable. It was both my birthday and our anniversary -- chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of Prosecco awaiting us in the room. The room? Clean and minimalist/modern décor -- no reproduction "oil" paintings on these walls! Very cool bathroom (although gaps at the bottom of the glass-encased shower made for some leaking -- what??). We're already planning our next visit there -- June some time, we hope. Highly recommend if you're looking for a wonderful, non-cookie-cutter hotel.

Quiet hotel with a small loby and somewhat of a "boutique" feel. Rooms were a little too small comparing to other hotels in that area. One definite con are the floors. Coming back from outside, dark hardwood floors definitely get dirty right away and evening room service did not clean them.Other than that, the James is close to a lot of soho attractions and complimatary happy hour (limited to just wine and cheese) is a nice touch.
user_name:
Slavyana S
New York City, New York

review_body: Now stayed their twice. The staff is incredibly lovely, friendly, helpful, professional.Jay, one of the bellhops. And Sean (I think that's his name) at the front desk.But they're all wonderful, refreshingly unstuffy.And the hotel itself is pretty and modern and well-run. Lots of little perks that make it extra nice. Free easy wifi with no passwords, free car service below 14th street in the weekday mornings and evenings. Free newspapers, bottled water. Complimentary wine/cheese every evening in the lobby.These are things that SHOULD be standard but aren't at most hotels.Great David Burke restaurant downstairs, always open. With complimentary delicious peanut brittle. Really quiet.And so reasonably priced.Great SoHo location. Easy to get cabs or subway.I will always choose this place when in New York, and look forward to their opening their West Hollywood hotel.

We had the best time at the James Hotel during our Wedding Anniversary weekend. The staff was awesome. The really took care of us and made our weekend special. Special thanks to Kristina, Luis & Edgar

I wanted to like this hotel much more than I did, mainly because they really like dogs here and we were traveling with one. First, I will say the greeting by John -door man- was very good he explained the room and details about the hotel etc. The young woman that checked us in offer to upgrade us to a suite- since we had the doggie and perhaps may want more room for our two night stay- at $300.00 extra per night, we declined. I mentioned a gratis bump to a slightly bigger room would definitely be welcome however it was promptly declined. Hard to believe the hotel being full on a subzero degree weekend, but understood. Our room was indeed small, fortunately for us we had booked a corner room which offered wall to wall windows. We visited Jimmy's roof top bar for after dinner drinks and overlooking the rude women attending the lounge we had a pleasant time, specially since it was snowing and we could not find a cab to go elsewhere. A "shout out" to the gentleman working as bouncer who help us get a sit - go figure, the bouncer was nicer than service staff- Bottom line, there's a lot of loose threads in this hotel, the likelihood of us staying here is small. This hotel seems to be better suited for warmer months, which brings me back to.. Wouldn't you want to woo me in the winter so that I may return on high season?  We had a better experience at the Tribeca Grand Hotel.

As a first time visitor I missed a lot of the lovely dining experiences on offer as checked in very late. However, the staff were helpful, friendly and very welcoming. The bed was so comfortable I wanted to buy one for home immediately. Next time I will stay longer.

The rooms were big and spacious. High ceilings, floor to ceiling windows, king bed, huge bathroom. Luxurious. The only gripe i have with this hotel is that even though it is in soho, its a little more out of the way than i would have liked.

Stayed here with a few girlfriends for a quick girls trip. I stayed in a corner king studio - while the double windows did make it seem larger than it was - I wouldn't recommend staying in anything smaller than this. Hotel is nice and I would recommend it but next time I will be trying out another Soho hotel!Pros:Great locationPretty ViewsSuper nice doormenComfortable beddingComplimentary treats throughout the dayYummy restaurant on siteCons:Bathroom amenities were not up to par Room service got my order wrong one morningBland room decorThin walls - could hear every door slamOne of my girlfriends rooms wasn't ready on time Another one of my girlfriends rooms didn't have a door to her shower so she froze every time she took a shower

I came to the James almost a year ago now and am still friends with one of the doormen, Jay.That says enough about their staff. I just opened a new tripadvisor account, and although I've been to many others, this will probably be the only hotel that I'll give a review on - even though I went there a year ago! I'm sure everything will have been covered in others' reviews, but I did especially love the terrace/restaurant (I also rather enjoyed a massage...). I find the rooms fantastically designed and the big windows are a nice addition.Thanks again, N

I recently stayed at The James in Soho on business, and had a great experience. The room was large, comfortable, modern and clean, and the bathroom was spa-quality. The James attracts an international clientele, and I could see why - it's got a great vibe that's appealing to diverse audiences, and is in a wonderful location. Staff was attentive and hospitable, and the "treats" offered at different times of day in the lobby are fantastic - especially the a.m. coffee and pastries.We also enjoyed a delicious dinner at the hotel's restaurant - David Burke Kitchen. I only wish I could have spent more time exploring Tribeca / Soho, but I was there for work.

the james is located in tribeca/soho area close to the soho shopping and restaurants. the hotel is modern with lots of glass... We had a cornor room on the 15th floor with an awesome view of freedom tower and the wallstreet skyline. The windows do push out some to allow fresh air into the room. the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was wonderful, clean and even had a shade that could be raised to see the bedroom as well as the incredible skyline.the staff were friendly and room service was 24hrs and promptthere are no ice machines but a call downstairs had ice in hand within 5 mins.the hotel has a beautiful rooftop bar and pool. the lobby is attractive with plenty of comfortable and private areas to relax

Came here for Valentine's Day weekend and had a good time overall. The King room was nice with a decent view (8 floor). The price was a bit steep but that was expected due to the occasion and long weekend (All Star Weekend + Presidents' Day). I probably wouldn't pay that much again but would love to come back if I got a deal or on a cheaper weekend. Staff was friendly and helpful. Food from David Burke's Kitchen was great as well.My only complaint was about the request I made for a weighing scale before checking out. I had to wait for about 30mins and the one they brought me was not in working condition. Minor complaint but it was quite a hassle.

Arrived yesterday at the James for a 3 night stay. My agency messed up the booking and I wasn't in the system. They could not have been more accommodating - found me a room for my whole stay at a lower rate than my agency had quoted. Room is quite small but fine for the city and really well laid out and designed so it does't feel cramped. And the bed...well I sunk into it. Sooooo comfortable. Nice bathroom with nice amenities. No view from my room but the rest made up for that. Small gym but great equipment and a 17th floor view over the city. I'm really glad to be here and am looking forward to the rest of my stay. Highly recommended.

I stayed at The James Soho on a recent business trip, and had a wonderful experience. The room was beautiful (and large), with comfortable, clean, soft bedding. The bathroom was top-notch, reminded me of the spa at Kohler, in Wisconsin. Complementary coffee and breakfast pastries were delicious, and the hotel's onsite restaurant (David Burke Kitchen) is fantastic. The hotel's location is great - lots of interesting shops and restaurants nearby, though work kept me from partaking of those as much as I would have liked. Overall a great hotel, with fantastic staff and beautiful amenities.

I Want to start off by saying that my stay at this hotel was nothing less than superb!!! I want to thank Manager Kristina who was very friendly and provided me with helpful information...Always comforting to speak with someone who is willing to assist you. Keep up the good job Ms. Kristina. SR

What a lovely hotel... rooms aren't huge but the very clever design means they feel roomier than they actually are. Excellent views of the city, nice little treats in the lobby - cheese & wine tasting, afternoon tea ... Did we mention the shower & yummy smelling toiletries? Highly recommended hotel!

We have just returned from 4 night in the James. Perfect location in Soho. We had a corner room on the 8th floor with fab views towards the Freedom Tower. The staff were all really friendly and helpful and arranged what ever we needed without any fuss. The weather was unbelievably cold and all the doormen, but particularly Eric and John, were great at assisting us with cabs, directions etc.We loved all the coffee, wine, fruit, cookies etc in the lobby. It made for a particularly great holiday and I would really recommend this hotel to everyone.

From the minute you arrive you will find that you are warmly welcomed and treated like family. The treats in the lobby throughout the day is a nice touch. The rooms are very modern which is to my liking. I wanted to say an extra thank you to Juliette at the front desk. She was so helpful and sweet! We will definitely be returning to The James.

We've stayed at The James a few times and have always found it to be the very highest quality but in a small enough building to feel really special. The restaurant, bar and rooms are all beautiful, and the staff is great, too. Perfect place to stay if the price suits your budget...you won't be disappointed.

My second time at The James, having tried out other hotels in the area in the meantime - and I'm so glad I went back!The rooms are fine, very modern and well stocked with a mini bar, snacks and a kettle - we Brits love a kettle! - but the very best thing about this place is its staff. They're efficient, which is what you'd expect, but they have so much warmth and character, and enthusiasm for what they do, they make the whole experience very special. Everyone was great but special praise for the in-room dining team and the doormen, exceptional.I visited the rooftop bar for the first time on this trip and loved the relaxed vibe and great views.Oh and the location is great too, a step away from all the shopping and dining you could wish for.

Great location in Soho. Very convenient to walk around where the shops are and to get to the subway. While the rooms are very small, they use the space very well. Definitely a modern take versus traditional.This hotel is next to a busy street. If you are a light sleeper, probably not the best choice...it's loud. Ask for a room as far away from the elevators as well. Each floor is not very big, my room was right outside the elevators and I could hear everyone come and go.Service was outstanding. Wifi runs very well too.

The James is a small friendly hotel which is right on trend. I had a corner room - small but well equipped. Had everything you could want. I was there on my own for mork and it may have been a little cramped with 2 people. Beautiful sweeping views. Very friendly helpful front desk staff and doormen. I thought the attached restaurant was a bit ordinary and would suggest there's lots of alternatives nearby for a better quality and value for breakfast. Fast free wifi. Ultra cool roof top bar. Lots of lovely outdoor "sky garden" areas which would be fabulous in spring, summer and autumn - but not winter!! My only critisim is that there was a broken water carafe beside my bed when I checked in - very dangerous as there were glass splinters on the floor next to my bed. I reported this to the front desk and it was cleaned up, but somem glass splinters still remained - a little careless. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and definitely stay there again.

we stayed here 2 years ago- my husband and i for a weekend get-away even though we are new yorkers and live in manhattan.the room was a little too generic... nothing special, bland decor, may as well have been a marriott actually.the minibar was good with dean & deluca snacks.best part of this hotel: the patio dining in the summer months. although the food mediocre. we ordered a late- nite dessert room service - very drab, like chocolate cake you might get at the airport. but as i said we are new yorkers and foodies.service was nice and staff friendly.room was quiet.i would probably like this hotel much better if it were in South Beach (miami) but on second thought south beach hotels have WAY better food!
user_name:
RosieCreamer
New York City, New York

review_body: We loved our stay at The James! It's a little funky the way it's designed with an elevator to the lobby, but we loved it. Very contemporary building. The rooms are very nice, but a little on the small side. We had 3 suitcases and were tripping all over them. We enjoyed the view from our room very much. We used the gym and had it all to ourselves. It had everything we needed, plus a beautiful view of its own. The lobby has coffee, tea, cookies, and fruit, which we loved. The restaurant is absolutely wonderful, too! All the best of SoHo is right out the front door.

The hotel is great all around but for a seasoned travelor like me it's often comes down to one person that really blows you away. This person is a front door man named Kenny. He was truly amazing. Thought of everything. Wow

Great staff, very nice lobby amenities. Wonderful room. We love the location of The James and view from our room was really nice. Coffee in the morning is such a nice touch and our friends stopped by for wine in the evening.

This hotel has everything! Modern rooms with quirky finishes, huge windows with City views, a wonderful restaurant downstairs, and snacks in the lobby! I was so sad to leave, so wanted to highly recommend the place so others can have the same expectation-meeting experience.

Beautiful hotel, great location!Went there with my boyfriend and we absolutely loved it.From the moment we got out of our taxi to the moment we left, every staff person that we interacted with was friendly and helpful.We requested a room on the upper floors and facing South in order to see the One World Trade center and were not disappointed. Rooms were clean, bathroom very nice and modern and the beds were very comfortable.Can't wait to go back!Note: The usual rate for the king corner room may be a bit pricy but they had a promotion on their website with 20% off which made it totally worth it.

Visited on a very cold winter day. Felt warm and welcomed at the door. Clean, sharp lobby with great check in ease. Comfortable room, great bed. Turn down service. Lobby with coffee in AM, fruit in afternoon and snacks in evening. Used their complimentary car service in late afternoon for a local trip. Surprised by a birthday cake in room in the evening from the management. Location in middle of TriBeCa. Great shopping and restaurants walking distance. Would like to come back in the summer. Rooftop bar (Jimmies)with great views at night. Restaurant (NY prices) on ground floor with good food and long hours.

This was our 4th stay at The James and it continues to be fantastic. Super convenient location, nice modern rooms (beds are very comfy), windows properly sealed and soundproofed... All of the staff were really helpful, especially Kenny at the door - he remembered us from previous trips and organised our ride to the airport, even getting our luggage into the trunk of the cab which was ready to go right when we needed it. Will happily stay next time.

Just returned from two weeks in New York, no white christmas as hoped for but sensational weather regardless in a sensational city, thank you NY.Stayed Soho, researched for boutique experience, found The James Hotel. Stayed corner studio first 3 night's north/west facing and not south as requested however, rm 1008 did not disappoint. Exceptional bed, pillows and amenities but far too small for us. Upgraded to Penthouse 1601 with sweeping views to east, south and west. That is, morning sun looking out to Brooklyn Bridge, Freedom Tower south and the impressive Hudson River to east. Views are worth the money for the Penthouse except, the Penthouse came with many defects perhaps through neglect of maintenance and repairs and or, that the Penthouse generally gets booked out for corporate functions and photo shoots, either way, no excuse. The defects included but were not limited to, the smart house electrical system totally useless so no blinds working but who would want to close the blinds with such fabulous views? Leaking bath, one blocked sink, lights not working and left over food in fridge from who knows! The worst feature and one we were perplexed by as far as design goes, was the fact that the Gym's treadmill is directly above the Penthouse bedroom and a runners pounding vibrates through the whole apartment, a huge problem which should be addressed without delay.However, non of that stopped us as we spoke about our grievances with Juliette, Front desk and as she had assisted us to transition from corner studio to Penthouse, Juliette promptly with professional enthusiasm, sorted out and had fixed what she could and even ensured that the discount room rate was further reduced. In addition, we were told, if we wished to extend out stay, we could do so at the reduced rate. Bravo Juliette! for a relative newcomer to the James she turned our experience into something wonderful. Never sighted nor spoke to a Manager which did surprise us however, with staff like Juliette,Samara, Erica and the excellent door staff, we thank you and the James is very lucky indeed. We did extend our stay and loved it even with the pounding but if you are thinking of the Penthouse, it's not worth the published rate but it is well worth the 25% of the published rate. Importantly for this hotel, they did what you expect of a hotel when you have a problem, they addressed it and turned what could have been a nightmare experience into a fabulous one.The James is directly above David's Restaurant which is an added bonus plus in the city that never sleeps, Soho is full of diverse cafes. restaurants and bar's and of course shopping. And keep in mind the crowds, if you have experienced a Mac Store upon release of a new phone or computer well be ready because everywhere you go it just like that although Soho offers some reprieve.

Had a wonderful visit to NYC recently. We stayed at The James Hotel because the location was just right to see, shop, and remember. We had a nice clean comfortable room, the hotel had a great vibe and everyone who we interacted with was happy to assist. Much more intimate than a big midtown hotel and it made the weekend even more special.

My daughter recommended the James to me for my first visit in New York. I happily accepted her recommendation, as it’s next to impossible to choose from all the hotels in NY if you do not know the city, and I did not regret it a second!The James New York is what I guess is called a Designer Hotel, whatever that’s really supposed to tell you. I had a standard room. Spacious, nice furniture (with a sitting group, sofa, chair and table). I like my hotel rooms to have somewhere to sit down apart from the bed. A spacy bathroom, with a glass wall (you could drop a curtain if you preferred to do your business of take a shower without the rest of the party watching you. Nice bed and a breathtaking view out over New York, Soho / lower Manhattan.The staff was extraordinary pleasant and helpful, as seems to be the norm in New York.The James is quite expensive, as I understand most ok hotels in NY are. But you must be prepared to spend quite some money if you want to stay there, more than $ 500 a night.The only downsides I can think of was that the Jimmy bar at the top floor with the beautiful view was closed several evenings because of privat arrangements. In addition, I did not get used to the breakfast they served at the David Burke Kitchen in the basement. I like a Scandinavian or Continental Breakfast, but that was not to be had. But I guess this is an American thing. Give me the breakfast at the Sacher Hotel in Salzburg! That’s my kind of breakfast!All in all a very pleasant stay at a nice hotel!

We spent 6 nights at The James in a Corner King Studio facing the South of New York. The room was beautiful with massive windows which had a great view both sun rise and sun set.Jimmy Roof top bar on the top floor (think it was the 17th) had an outside area with an outdoor pool which also had spectacular views.We choose the James hotel as it was in Soho for shopping and near the subway to get to uptown and other parts of the city.The hotels staff did their upmost to ensure we had a good stay and any issues were addressed.Many thanks,

Very nice hotel room with a fantastisk bed (we slept so well!!) and a nice bathroom with a big shower. Great location with walking distance to shopping areas, restaurants and bars! We will definitely stay here again!

Room was shabby, soiled rug, curtain, peeling paint, etc. Staff was very nice and did their best but condition of room was sad. TV had terrible reception..didn't realize till 11 at night when trying to watch the ball drop in Times Square. None of this would matter if the cost of room wasn't 700 dollars. For this price I would expect much more. Too late in day to change and had to pre-pay for room so couldn't change reservation anyhow. I hate giving bad reviews but this hotel was a great disappointment. I would not recommend. Much cheaper and nicer hotels in the area.

Stayed for two nights in a corner king studio with my girlfriend and we both absolutely loved The James. It's a beautifully decorated hotel with phenomenal service and our room was top class. Make sure to check out the views from the roof! Highly recommend.

We looked at quite a few options around SOHO and settled on The James for our 3-day family excursion to SOHO. Our choice turned out to be a great one on all fronts -- service, rooms, location, and comfort. The James is perfectly located for our food & shopping-focused itinerary. We were able to walk to most of our target restaurants in the LES, Chinatown, and Little Italy, and SOHO. Of course, the bounty of SOHO shopping was at our doorstep.The hotel itself is very modern and beautifully appointed. Bell service is prompt and friendly on the ground floor, and you're quickly directed to the front desk on the 2nd level. We were a bit early for checkin, so they took our bags and we were off. We booked two rooms for (2 parents, 2 teens), and the hotel was nice enough to give us adjacent rooms (even though I forgot to request that!). The rooms were very nice, though definitely NYC-small -- great bathrooms, super-comfortable beds, and generous closet space with a safe. The views are excellent, even from our fairly low 9th floor perch. The bar on 15 is amazing -- a beautiful setting wrapped in 2-story glass with stunning NYC views. The service was outstanding, the vibe fun, and the setting was very chic. It was too cold to hang out by the pool, or on the outdoor patios on the 2nd floor (Christmas time), but those looked like great fun in warmer weather.Even when we hit a snag, the James shone. When we returned around 4pm on our first day to finally check-in, one room was ready and we were told the other would be "ready in just a few minutes". It took more than an hour to get into our 2nd room and to get our bags brought up, despite several requests. Finally the manager came up, apologized, and resolved everything -- we got into our room, got our bags, and he offered a very generous $150 credit to the restaurant. Upon checkout, we had not eaten in the restaurant but we had spent $120 in the bar and through room service. I asked at the front desk if I could use my restaurant credit against my $120, and they quickly said "certainly". They went above and beyond to resolve a fairly minor issue, and that attention to service and detail was very much appreciated!!! Job well done.I will definitely return to the James for our next Soho stay!!

I stayed here for business a couple of years ago and really enjoyed it so I returned with my wife for a weekend away. The big difference was, whereas the room was fine when I was alone,as a couple it felt somewhat small. Not uncomfortably so but a little bit more size would have made the stay virtually perfect.It's an interesting hotel in a good location with bars and restaurants in easy reach. Canal street metro is yards away with good links both uptown and into Brooklyn. The views from the rooftop bar are superb and its a fantastic place to drink and just enjoy being in a superb NY setting.We had a lovely time and if the rooms were a little bigger this would be my regular NY hotel for both business and pleasure.

Great location, great staff (especially the doormen David and John!), great rooms with spectacular views on the higher floors. Overall an excellent experience and I can't wait to visit this hotel again!

Beautiful, modern and architecturally impressive! Excellent location in SOHO, NYC. Staff is warm, friendly and go out of their way for you! VERY personal! We had the family suite. The rooms are beautiful but small ...the design of the rooms are impressive making a very small room look much larger. Excellent on-site restaurant.
user_name:
Elisa S
Jenkintown, Pennsylvania, United States

review_body: Wonderful stay. Nice and friendly staff, clean rooms. Great location. Parking price $76 not mentioned anywhere at hotel, found 3days later. Charged 3 separate times. Caused my Credit card to be stolen.

If they were honest about the weekend noise issue on then 17th floor I would have given them more stars, as the hotel itself is good. We read the reviews and asked not to be on the 17th. However, because they put someone else in our assigned room, when we checked in we were offered a downgrade (for one night, and then having to change rooms) or the 17th floor. We were there from Thursday through Sunday and didn't want to change rooms, so we took the 17th (the bar/club is on 18). The noise on Friday and Saturday night was louder than I could have ever anticipated. I'm no stranger to noise - I've been to Burning Man many times so I'm used to being someplace where the music is going all night long. At Burning Man I might use earplugs, depending on the noise level, and that's all I've ever needed. The noise on Saturday night was so loud that I gave up on earplugs and used my Bose noise cancelling earbuds. While that reduced the noise somewhat, the base was so strong that my whole body was still thumping. In addition to the music, there's additional noise coming from the hallway. There's a small rooftop pool, and on 17 there's a door labeled pool maintenance. What the sign doesn't tell you is that there's also a dishwasher in there (and a fridge or two) and you're also going to hear people carrying racks of clean glasses past your door and up the stairs to the bar ( I wonder if the health department approves of pool chemicals stored with food and other such items). I complained to the hotel the next day and did get a reduction in my room rate, but they really should be charging 50% or less of the quoted rates if you're there on a Friday or Saturday night. If you're going to be out partying yourself until after 2am, then you won't hear a thing. We got back to our room around 12:30am and were't able to go to sleep until just after 2am.

Kenny was fantastic. He was sweet, accommodating and got us a great ride to LGA.The rooms are nice but you don't get much despite the price. Very small room at $600 per night but with a fantastic view. The rooftop bar was very nice but also small. The food was very good.

I am a hotel snob and have high expectations of the locations in which I stay. On this particular trip to NYC, I opted to try The James SoHo. I have stayed at The James Chicago, and I thoroughly enjoyed my time there. From the get-go, the staff was so sincere and learned my name immediately. They checked in each time we passed one another, and I felt very "at-home."The rooms are understated, but I enjoy the pared down chicness versus the ostentatious sort. The cleanliness was good, but I think there could be some further attention here. But that has not and will not dissuaded me from staying in the future and raving about my time here. This truly is a gem in the heart of bustling SoHo.

Just left the James Hotel today after a 2 night stay. Its our second time there. Love this spot. So many restaurants and shops to walk to. If your into shopping on Canal Street, its right there. Rooms are small, but plenty big enough with small table and built in setae. Beds are so comfortable. Pillows are incredible. Not a lot of storage space for clothes. Love that they put bottles of still water by the beds and fill them each day. They do have a full minibar - but you'll pay for it.Great little lobby with coffee and biscuits in the morning - complimentary! with computer set ups and fee wi-fi. Love to head down early in the a.m. while my husband sleeps in and get coffee and read paper. Hotel isn't that large so your not that far from all rooms. The shades do not allow for total darkness in the morning - but not bright.Very attentive staff. Jay and Kenny at the door were so polite and helped with everything. Concierge help was perfect. Always pleasant. Everyone just makes you happy to be here.Rooftop bar is an incredible spot for a late night drink. Very trendy - but comfortable. View is sweet. It is a bit costly for a drink, just be aware. We didn't eat at the restaurant this visit, but have done so before. Very good. If you're looking for something in the Soho area, that is a special spot - this is the place.

I went to New York with my girlfriend over Thanksgiving and was planning to propose on the trip. While I had originally planned to do it outside, the cold weather made this impossible. I contacted the James Hotel as I was scrambling to find other ideas, and the staff there (particularly Keith Zytowski) was extremely accommodating. Just hours before the proposal, they secured private access to the rooftop deck and a table reservation in the rooftop bar. They also got me a beautiful corner room on the highest available floor. The night went perfectly. Thanks everyone at the James Hotel! We'll be back!

The James Hotel is situated more than perfect in the very heart of NY's vibrant SoHo district. All kinds of shopping options - whether really high-end or rather underground NY style - are right around the corner. Also, an overwhelming range of the best dining possibilities NY has to offer are very nearby or within reasonable reach. Same for the bar and nightlife scene. The rooms are mid-sized (given a NY standard) very tasteful and feature great views with wide glass front windows (ask for a corner room). Also, there is a mid-sized gym on the 17th floor with incredible views and everything the casual 1 - 2 times a week gym-er needs. On top of that, the hotel offers an awesome rooftop with a smaller swimming pond, which especially during summer time should be an invaluable asset if one wants to tune out the NY hassle and chill in the sun for some time. The lobby is just as tasteful as the rest of the hotel and personell is both professional and friendly. The perfect spot for all those who primarily want to visit NY and enjoy a convenient stay in a hip, well designed place - less, however, for those who emphasise Spa, big rooms treatments and Ritz-Carlton alike service treatments.

We travel a lot, and this is one of the best hotel experiences ever.Every staff person( especially Camilla) was beyond cordial and professionalThe room, view, amenities like cookies, fruit, wine and cheese etc were appreciatedThe location is an easy walk to Soho, Noho, Chinatown, Little Italy, ground zero, and less than 2 blocks to 10 minute subway ride to theater districtWe will always stay here when we visit NYC and so should you

Pros:Once I fixed it, bed was maybe the most comfortable I can remember sleeping in. I seriously thought about stealing the sheets and pillows.Staff and check in were flawless.Room was terrific, not huge but with a great view, very clean and comfortable.Internet was great.Room service was terrific.Gym was okay but had an incredible 17th-floor view of Brooklyn Bridge and Freedom Tower.Cons:Bed was made up oddly each night where I couldn't get the sheets up around me. I had to finally get up both times, rip the sheets out of the bottom of the bed, then get back in. After doing this it was such an amazing sleep.

Stayed overnight to for a business meeting with clients. Hotel was great. Staff was excellent and very helpful. Rooms are on the smaller side but immaculate. No complaints. Would absolutely stay here again.

The location is great considering the agency I was visiting. There are plenty of shops and resturants. The room was very clean and comfortable. The fitness room on the 17th floor was nice with a great city view. The second day of my two day stay, I wasnt able to use the treadmill since one of the two machines was out of order and the other one was being used (it happens - no worries). The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. I enjoyed a drink on the roof top (great views 18FL) at Jimmy's my first night. It took some effort to get their attention to order a drink even though there were only a few guests - I think/hope they were just busy preparing for a big group expected later that evening. Overall, a great first stay experience.

We had a fantastic stay here at The James, the staff we extremely helpful & accommodating to our needs, In particular Kenny & Jimmy.Love the rooftop bar, has inside & out to cater for the cold weather, AMAZING VIEWS!! David Burkes Kitchen had great food & good service, however the music was "very loud" (We love our music & by all means) therefore we opted to take our wine up to our room to finish.Walking distance to many great restaurants & shops.The rooms are small, good enough size for our needs, however modern & clean with great views. Will definitely stay again.

I stayed at The James for a weekend in late October and I really hoped to be blown away by The James. This was not the case. The hotel had come highly recommended to me by several colleagues. The location is great, no complaints there but the hotel is just mediocre. Its lacking any of the bells or whistles which to make a hotel special. My biggest issue with the hotel was the lack of staff. The front desk was often unmanned and there was never anyone at the concierge desk the entire time I was there. The room was ok, nothing special although it was clean. In any event, if you are looking for just ok in a great location, then this is your place. If you are looking for somewhere that will exceed your expectations, then I would stay somewhere else.

The James is great - well located in Soho and an easy walk to the West Village, Tribeca and near a subway stop that makes it easier to get uptown if need be. Great shopping all around and a safe neighborhood. One big negative was the attached restaurant, David Burke's Kitchen. My family and I received some of the worst/ rudest service I have had in the city. There are so many good places to eat in Soho that it was truly a waste of time and money to have gone to David Burke's Kitchen, needless to say I will not be back.
user_name:
Armani K
New York City, New York

review_body: The James is really great. it is located in the South-West side of SoHo, about 2 minutes walk from the subway, and 4 minutes walk from the west river. The Hotel is a tall building looking at most NYC directions (depends on your room view). The room is very good, not huge but modern, equipped and comfort. the staff are really helpful and nice.in the lobby there's always a nice snack - coffee and cupcakes in the morning and some whine and cheese in the afternoon. The James has an amazing rooftop bar with a pool and it's mostly party time whenever you're there.All in all, really good hotel choice for whatever business or pleasure.

Great location & our room had a lovely view. Love the free wifi and filtered water. However, the AC / heating roars on and off all night. "Free breakfast" is disappointing. Service feels impersonal. Overall an average experience for a lot of money.

This hotel has a great downtown location on 6th Avenue & Grand Street, within easy striking distance of all the great shops, bars & restaurants in Soho. The lobby & rooms are discreetly hip, not screamingly trendy; furnishings are elegant & minimal but also very comfortable. I would return for the sleep quality alone - rooms are well insulated, beds extremely comfortable with gorgeous Frette bed linen. Bathrooms have generous bottles of great-smelling toiletries & lots of thick white fluffy towels; good power showers.Staff are eager to please & friendly, but efficiency can fall short of the mark; on more than one occasion reception seemed under-staffed & struggling to cope with demand.We had breakfast in the separately-run, but linked, David Burke kitchen in the basement, which was excellent.I would return because I like the location & the hotel; if it smartened up the service a little, it would be even better.

In summer we could find 4* and 5* hotels for half the rate but if you really want to treat yourself to a hotel that ads something extra to your stay, consider The James in Soho. The service is just perfect, so friendly and helpful. And the location really feels relaxing, very different from the business hotels up town. And we had so much fun with the orange bikes that we could just borrow for a couple of hours. We enjoyed a lunch and a dinner in the restaurant, which was also really nice. We did have a laugh about the size of the pool, but nothing beats the view from there.

This hotel was recommended to us by friends who raved about it. The hotel is beautiful on the corner of Soho. The rooms were for the most part, clean and beautiful views. However, had some issues with the staff. Arrived at check-in and our room wasn't ready so checked our bags and walked around. Came back to check in and our keys didn't work. Were let into the room and told that the new keys and our bags would come shortly. Waited 2 hours in total for the bags to arrive. Requested shoe-service and left shoes outside of the door for four hours (called and reminded guest services). They were never picked up nor cleaned. Upon our bags finally arriving, inquired about the advertised in-floor heating but were flatly told it was broken in a few of the rooms including ours. Ordered room service ($25 sandwich) staff was short and not helpful and we asked for an additional condiment that never came. Lastly, came home during the 'turndown service' to the door left open to the room on the hook but without anyone in the room, leaving our personal items exposed. Nothing was too severe, just small careless problems. But considering the price point and our expectations, this was not worth the price point.

A primo impatto potrebbe sembrare un po' strano, a causa dell'entrata un po' vuota e non molto accogliente. In effetti però la lobby è situata al primo piano ed è molto carina.Le camere sono ok, pulite, arredamento gradevole. L'unica cosa che suggerisco è di NON prenotare la camera ad angolo, perchè all'interno vi è un pilastro con dei tubi un po' rumorosi.Lo staff è molto disponibile e cortese.La palestra è molto ben attrezzata, al diciassettesimo piano con una bellsisima vista.Posizione: non la mia preferita tra la Sesta e Grand, ma comunque in Soho.At first it may look a little odd due to the entrance a little empty and not very welcoming. Actually, the lobby is on 1st floor and very nice.Rooms are ok, clean and well furnished. The only thing I suggest is NOT to book the corner room: it has a pillar inside, which contains some plumbing, a little noisy.The staff is very nice and helpful.Nicest gym so far, great equipment, located on the 17th floor with an amazing view.The location is not my favorite between 6th Ave. and Grand but still in Soho.

Some friends of mine were in town recently and we all stayed at The James in Soho - what a great property! Great lobby and super fun bars/dining right there in the hotel (although venturing out in that area is definitely a must!) Morgan Cohen at the Concierge desk recommended us a fantastic brunch AND the perfect lounge for all of us - she really knows her stuff! Kudos!We'll definitely be back and will recommend it to our friends and family!
user_name:
FireFly2727
New York City, New York

review_body: We spent a Saturday night in NYC and this was recommended by our daughter who lives in the area. Friendly greeting, easy check in and out and a great location. We loved our room! compact but very comfortable and warm. Well laid out bathroom, nice towels and a great shower. The lobby level was a nice place to read the paper and have a cup of coffee on Sunday morning. We missed the wine in the early evening Saturday but arrived in time to get some yummy cookies before we went to bed. My only criticism would be that the couch we sat on in the sky lobby was wearing out and should have been replaced by now.

Stayed here with my wife as part of. Virgin Holidays package. Lovely hotel well- located for getting around NYC with a subway station a minute away.Lovely room with great bathroom and skyline views. Staff was amazing: genuinely friendly and interested and very helpful. Lovely touches like pastries, wine and cheese etc available at different times of the day. Jimmy's rooftop bar was lively with great nighttime views. Food in the restaurant exceptional: beware mammoth portions, though!Although we were in NYC largely for business, the hotel experience made it feel like a holiday!

I've enjoyed my stay at the James New York although it was a short one, rooms were spotless, staff were very friendly and willing to help and the overall stay was relaxing and comfortable. The location is perfect for us, as we didn't want to be within Timesquare but it was only 30 minutes walk away. Amenities, triple-filtered water and free wifi are some of the perks you'll experience at this hotel

We didn't stay at this hotel, but we visited the roof top bar for a drink and to take in the amazing views. It was late afternoon and the skyline looked awesome, but clearly everyone had the same idea and the bar was bursting with people trying to be served! To give management the benefit of the doubt... Maybe they were short staffed, but they definitely had a problem the day of our visit!The 2 bartenders were working flat out, there was a girl waiting on tables but then gave her orders straight to the 2 bartenders who were working their way through the customers who were 4 deep at the bar! There was another girl,(manager?), who had a phone to her ear most of the time, when really she should have joined the bar staff and helped out..Many people left without drinks... 20 minutes later we got our drinks but couldn't face the ordeal of queuing again so cut our evening at The James Hotel short. Shame, because the views are wonderful... Maybe we'll try again on our next visit to New York.

The James is a hip, sleek Soho hotel with nice amenities and penthouse has an awesome birds-eye of the Freedom Tower. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Rooms are sparsely decorated and very small but adequate.

Everything is very good. The room and views, the location, the staff. I got it on a package and thought for the location and boutique feel it was worth much more than I'd paid. Will definitely go back. Love NY and love the Soho area. Fabulous shops and restaurants are on the door step and it feels so much better staying here than up in mid town. The only shame is the entrance/lobby arrangement on different floors which makes you feel you're coming in and out of the back door. Also the huge road junction could put you off the garden. But I got used to all of this. Roof terrace views are mega !!

Great location and service. Have no complaints whatsoever. First time on this hotel but definetly not the last! Next time we are in Soho, we will stay at the James. Try the bar at the top, it has a great view

Cannot beat this location. Staff is absolutely the best ever!!Don't let outward appearance deceive. Inside it is warm and friendly!To a person, the staff went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating!

Wonderful 24 hour anniversary trip in NYC due to the great location and service of The James. We arrived in NYC via train at Penn Station and quickly hopped on the 123 red line to a metro station within a block of the hotel. Very convenient. Even though we arrived before check in time, we were quickly shown to our King corner room which had a magnificent view of the new world trade building - gorgeous at night! Ken had placed our bags in our room before we got there! Check in was very casual and very efficient. The concierge Amy asked us about Soho dinner preferences. By the time we came back down 30 minutes later to shop in midtown, she had 3 options for us and made a reservation for us. Green line metro travel to midtown was just blocks away and very convenient. When we returned, we discovered a chilled bottle of Piper Heidsieck champagne and chocolate covered strawberries compliments of the staff!! True celebration! Our dinner at Kelly & Ping was amazing. The best duck we've ever had! We checked out the rooftop bar Jimmy's before going to bed. Jimmy's has beautiful views of the city - especially at night. The next morning we walked to the 9/11 memorial and had a great breakfast at Edwards on the way back. We shopped in Soho (huge outdoor mall) before returning to Penn Station and home! Our stay was too short to enjoy all the amenities of this great hotel! Loved the bathroom that opened to the city! We will return!

What almost was a very lovely 1 week stay for my wife and I ended poorly when we discovered the night before check out that our entire bag of dirty clothes from the week had been removed from our room even though it was not earmarked for laundry service as we didn't use the hotel's laundry bag nor fill out any forms. the front desk staff was apologetic and promised to investigate with the housekeeping manager and outside laundry service and call us within a day or two. we had agreed that our credit card would not be charged for our stay until their investigation was complete and we had a resolution. on the next day, they put through the credit card charge yet we did not hear back from them on what happened to our clothes. i would tend to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt that it was just a housekeeping mishap as they predicted, however, based on the fact that they charged our card so quickly when they said they wouldn't and they didn't contact us nor reply to our subsequent email, plus the fact that the other couple we were traveling with also had an article disappear from their room, it's hard not to conclude that hotel management is aware of a housekeeping theft issue. We're hoping it's all a misunderstanding and the James does the right thing and not attempt to sweep this under the rug, but our faith in this establishment is waning.

The James is a favorite of mine when in New York. The location is exceptional, and the staff there is always gracious and welcoming. From the moment you arrive they greet you and offer assistance. Just the right amount.The facility is perfectly located in SoHo, and some of the areas best restaurants are only steps away.

My stay was very bad we was made to feel like bad people all because we was black my guess kept getting stopped at the door and disrespected telling us we didn't have enff girls with us then we was told it to many black boys....never ever again I've been sending out email to everyone about this night all Yvette hottest blogs, news groups and permoters a d nobody's HAPPY...

From the moment you arrive The James is well managed, in great condition and in a good location.Reception is a relaxed environment unlike many of the more manic hotels in this area.Breakfast is ok, it's a bit quiet on the breakfast floor and a little lonely, I'd advise leaving the hotel for food.Also, don't stay on the 17th floor. Very noisy and next to an ever busy service lift where staff congregate and move food etc around whilst also being directly below the roof top bar.I recommend this hotel

This was my second stay at the James. Terrific location and very attentive staff. However I paid more for this trip for the room but got a smaller room! Fabulous roof top bar with sweeping views over lower manhattan. I would highly recommend this hotel. Location is second to none, you are right in the heart of Soho.

The James is a perfect location, right between SoHo and TriBeCa. We had to stretch our stay one night, die to United (natch), but the front desk staff was wonderfully helpful in making the best of a bad situation for us. The room service is, to an astonishing level, the absolute fastest that I have ever experienced anywhere on this planet. This is a great home away from home. Stay here. You will not be disappointed.
user_name:
Jared L
Houston, Texas, United States

review_body: We stayed at the James for one week in August. We were in a King Corner Studio Suite with a nice view on the Soho roofsThe room was nice and so was the bathroom, very NY style The atmosphere at the James is super cool. The position is absolutely strategic, at least for what we wanted to do in our NY week: theaters on the Broadway, shopping, waking with no real destination! :)We were closed to everything and the walk back to the hotel was never too muchVery special note for The James is the roof pool bar, for amazing sunsets drinks with stunning views of NYStaff is super friendly.This may really become "OUR NY HOTEL" for next visits!

I agree with most reviewers that the location is excellent, and the service from Eric couldn't be better. My room at the James was clean and functional, if not a bit on the small side. If staying in Soho again, I'd happily return but would probably seek at least the next tier of room size.
user_name:
TransConFlyer
New York City, New York

review_body: I have stayed at The James a few times and I am always pleased with the hotel staff, great service and strategic location. The design of the rooms amazing, clean and very comfortable. Love the view from the corner rooms!
user_name:
Isabela B
Rio De Janeiro, Brazil

review_body: If you really want to spoil yourself, book a few nights at The James. Amazing views, excellent service, comfy beds, oh! and chocolates in the room :) You will feel spoiled from head to toe. There's also a cool roof-top patio and bar area to chill. It's right in the middle of all the good stuff down town, so you can walk or take a short cab ride to wherever. I would stay there again when I can afford it :)
A nice stay in a good hotel in Soho. Close to all , a lot of nice and cosy small resturants nearby.The Dutch is great, Baltazar as well.David BUrke at the hotel is also very god, he is å good chef !

Spent two nights here for our first anniversary. The rooms are small but excellently designed and my favourite, heated bathroom floors!! Would recommend a corner suite!The staff could not be more helpful and are possibly the best I have had the pleasure to encounter.My only negative is access to the roof terrace being dependent on whether or not there is a private function. But with so many other fabulous places nearby this is not a huge negative!!I would definitely stay there when next in NYC!!

We spent 10 days at The James Hotel Celebrating our 10 year wedding anniversary…we couldn't have wished for a more perfect stay. Great location….!! Close to all fab shopping and amazing restaurants. Apart from the location the staff were sensational. They couldn't have made our stay anymore enjoyable and easy.The rooms were well equipped, comfy beds and pillows, no outside noise could be heard from our room.Jimmys bar on the roof top was a great place for a drink and views were spectacular!!A special thanks to the staff at The James, especially Kenny, Iris, Debbie & Jai.

My wife wanted to stay in Soho for her birthday trip to New York and we chose the James, based on friends recommendations. The rooms are small (think Paris), but artfully designed to feel luxurious. The amenities are lovely; coffee bar in the morning, wine and cheese in the evening, free newspapers and turn down service. The bathroom was fine; good products and a great shower. We really liked the location. A morning walk south took us to the 9/11 Memorial and we were a block from the subway. Several good restaurants are nearby and we walked to Noho for my wife's birthday dinner at the Gotham Bar. We will definitely stay at the James on our next trip to New York.

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights and loved it! Perfect location and we walked everywhere. Loved the views from our room & awesome staff. Coffee in the morning and treats from Balthazar/wine and cheese in the evening.
user_name:
Ms. Erin Mcderm... W
New York

review_body: The James is one of the better hotels I have stayed in around Manhattan. It is located near the mouth of the holland tunnel in SoHo, far, far away from the more touristy areas of the city. For its location, it is realitvley quiet. Lets be honest, there is no place in NYC that is completely noise free, but I was able to sleep without earplugs. Entering the hotel itself can be offputting because the main lobby is actually on the second level. The entrance itself is on the ground level. Upon checking in (if after 5 pm) go directly off to the right and you will be greeted with a free wine and cheese reception. This is a nice touch. The lobby's decor is amazing and styled in a modern organic look. Sort of like a country estate without the kitsch. The rooms are excellent. I stayed in a corner king, which had a great view. I think it is worth the extra $100 per night. The amenities are top notch. The minibar is actually a scaled down version of something you may have in your own home. There are 375ml bottles of liquor and minis as well. A cocktail strainer and muddler are part of the setup. Awesome bathroom with a real rain-shower. Beds are very comfortable and pillows are plush. The real hardwood floors are also a great touch. The best thing about the James is the service. One particular individual I would like to recognize is Eric the bellman. He was prompt, courteous, and quick to hail a cab. He went out of his way to make things convenient for us. The other guys were excellent as well. I dont think Ive seen a hotel crew in the last 2 years that runs as fast as them to get things done. One caveat is that I did not try any of the dining ventures at this facility nor did I try the gym. I did go to the rooftop bar Jimmy, and the views are spectacular. The bar itself was too packed with non guests to get a drink in a timely fashion, so I opted out. Plus they were serving drinks in plastic cups because they had run out of glassware! Please refer to other reviews of Jimmys on Yelp or TripAdvisor. It almost seemed as if the hotel staff (awesome) and Jimmy's staff (not so awesome) were two different groups of people in no way related to each other. I will definitely be back. The service and location cant be beat. There are a lot of "boutique" and "luxury" hotels that claim to have a singular experience only to fall short. The James is the real deal and I think for what I paid (a weekend splurge), I got my money's worth. The only thing I didnt really like was the pretentiousness of the rooftop bar-my suggestion would be to go very early in the evening before the non guests start crowding the bar. Otherwise, there are some very nice bars around Soho.

My girlfriend and I spent Friday night at The James for a spontaneous weekend in New York.The hotel was fantastic. An excellent location -- very close to all the cool shopping, fun bars, etc. in the Soho neighborhood. (We had brunch at The Dutch and dinner at Estela, both in walking distance of the hotel). The service and amenities were also great (we particularly enjoyed the coffee from Colombe and pasties from Balthazar both mornings and the cookies from David Burke every night). The room was beautiful. And the staff was attentive -- Eric, in particular, was super helpful in showing us around the hotel, bringing our bags to the room, providing neighborhood advice, etc.The hotel was really great and we'll be back. Just one complaint. Our only complaint concerned the elevators and Jimmy. The hotel is a bit of a maze. This was infuriating late on Friday night, when we got back to the hotel at about 11:30. We tried to check out Jimmy, the nightclub on the roof. Although we were in the lobby -- where the elevators can access the roof throughout most of the day -- we were told we had to go back outside (which is a hassle, because the hotel is a maze), walk around the block, show our IDs to a bouncer, etc., to get to the nightclub. When we left the nightclub later that night, neither of the elevator girls felt like working, so we had to wait for a bouncer to escort an elevator full of guests. And yet again, we couldn't access our floor from the elevator! An insane policy that doesn't put hotel guests first.

The James is an exceptional hotel.The room is visually appealing and comfortable.The staff is professional and friendly.Visit the Jimmy a bar on top of the hotel for atmosphere and a great view of the city.

I absolutely love this hotel . stayed her with my husband without our children . The location is awesome for young people you are steps away from all the awesome shopping and bars in soho. The hotel design is sleek and modern. The room we stayed was small but super functional . They had a glass barrier between the bedroom and the shower. Very sexy for couples but not so much for any other purpose. They have a pool terrace which seems to have a lot of action so we steered away from it for more privacy . I just cant get enough of the location this was my first time staying in soho and its such a breath of fresh air being away from the crazy tourist in time square. there is such a laid back cool vibe in this area that i love . It is also very inexpensive for the cool location and high quality amenities.

The rooms are small and quaint, and I love the fact that the floors are wood. It makes the room feel clean and fresh. I have stayed here 3 times and each time the staff has been great and the service top notch. The room service food is solid and the restaurants in the hotel are great. Recently I had a nice corner room with a beautiful view of the new Trade Center.Some drawbacks are that the elevators are very slow and there is a pretty large weekend party crowd that can be a bit of a nuisance when trying to get back to your room after a night out on the town.Overall, it is a clean, fun, comfortable place to stay. It is centrally located to great shopping in SOHO and is worth checking out.

Great location, friendly service, fun bar scene at Jimmy's, easy walk to WTC area, TriBeCa, West Village and Chelsea. Lovely but typically smallish rooms that feel larger due to floor to ceiling windows. And quiet.

The location is good: close to good stores, bars, restaurants and two subway's lines.The Wifi and the staff is excellent.But, the pool parties makes the hotel a little bit noisy and the elevators slow.

I went to NYC to accompany my wife for her business trip. We had an amazing stay with staff like Jay giving us his recommendations on where to go in other borroughs. Kenny was uber accomodating with getting transportation to and from places and holding our luggage so we can enjoy New York till the moment we left. Look forward to the next time! Stayed August 2014, traveled on business

Great location on Grand Street in SoHo. Cool look and feel. A tad too cool for comfort (with second floor lobby and elevator issues to accommodate rooftop bar.) Rooms are small. Clean. Could use touch-up. Mattress was soft. Very quiet considering we were on 4th floor facing 6th avenue. Very pricey.

My husband and I spent the weekend there for the US Open. Large rooms (for NY) and even better bathrooms! Big enough for two. Lovely in room bar and toiletries. Check in (12:30am) was a breeze and they were waiting for us! Continental breakfast was perfect to grab on way out. Restaurant was top-notch. Rooftop pool and bar were so fun with old school hip hop and fantastic view of city and water! Location was the best-SoHo! Shopping, bars, cafes all within walking distance. Beds were super comfy and they even have a pillow menu! Would def recommend and stay there again!

The James hotel is a recent addition to the SoHo landscape in NY. It is a quaint hotel, very conveniently located in the heart of SoHo, close to excellent dining, the Metro and smack in the middle of lower Manhattan. Everything about the hotel can be described as minimalistic, small but not too small. The rooms have a wonderful view over SoHo, are well appointed, beds are comfortable, the bathroom has both a rainforest shower as well as a hand held shower head. The hotel furnishes luxurious amenities in very generous presentations (shampoo, conditioner and body wash are invigorating and refreshing, the hand soap is lathering up clouds of comfort while washing your hands). The rooms have a very well appointed Mini Bar with lot of well chosen snacks, all very healthy. Yes, the prices for the mini bar are not cheap, but they are commensurate to the offering.The hotel has a small rooftop pool and adjacent bar that gets lively in the evenings, parties go all the way to two in the morning, but guests do not feel or hear any noise as the rooms are well insulated.The best feature of the hotel? With out a doubt it is their Concierge team: knowledgeable, friendly and very efficient. They got me tickets to an off-Broadway show, recommended great restaurants, gave very precise instructions on how to get to the tennis arena via the Metro.

Stayed at the James hotel for a quick getaway with some friends. It was fantastic. The concierge Morgan Cohen was so helpful. She assisted us in getting tickets for the 9/11 museum and recommendations on where to eat. She was great! The hotel was in a great location. Would definitely go back.

Every single staff member was extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms were small but contemporary & smart design far outweighed this. Beds were comfortable and room quiet. Book a high floor- views are excellent. Roof top bar is fantastic. Walk to shops, restaurants, Ground Zero. Canal St. Metro right around the corner.

Stayed here on our last night in the US before flying home. After a hectic couple of weeks I wanted somewhere I could relax and just chill out for the last 2 days. The hotel advertises itself as having an amazing roof top pool which I thought would be perfect to catch some last minute sun. Upon checking in on Sunday I was told the pool was now closed as it was out of season but we could still sit around it !! Not sure what season it is open as it was 30 degrees and perfect pool weather!! Also could not get near the roof top as after 3pm it is open to the public as a uber cool bar with DJ. The next morning before checking out I thought I would catch some last minute sun but again could not access the roof top as it was privately booked out!! The whole reason people book this hotel is for the roof top pool and terrace but they seem to be more interested in getting the public up there than providing for the hotel residents. All in all very disappointing and felt the hotel is deliberately miss selling itself. On the plus the hotel is lovely with beautiful rooms. The restaurants are amazing too with some usual dishes being served up ( Carmel donut with chopped pancetta for example). All the staff were very helpful and polite as well.

Very cool hotel but ... despite the fact that New York is renowned for small hotel rooms - ours was exceptionally small. We didn't realise until the day before check out that we actually had the smallest room in the hotel (I think it was 603). It's on the third floor next to the cleaners closet which makes it noisy in the mornings. Perhaps the hotel is understaffed because the rooms don't get cleaned until late in the afternoon (to allow for check-ins I guess). Also although it's not advertised the hotels allows dogs. The afternoon free drinks in the lobby and biscuits for supper are often not available unless you are one of first guests there. After 5pm each day the rooftop bar is actually not run by the hotel and becomes an overcrowded noisy bar. And the restaurant is overpriced. It's difficult to find something positive to say but the doorman was helpful...

There are some reviews on this site saying that the service was indifferent, inefficient and rude. These people must have been staying at a different James Hotel NYC. The one I stayed at was beautifully presented with impeccable hospitality and service. Everyone went so far and above an expectation of a hotel to be courteous, efficient and welcoming. The place is obviously well managed because everything was wonderful. The room was great and comfortable. I will stay there again for sure. thanks alot.

We booked into this hotel for a week as we liked the sound of Soho and also because this hotel had a swimming pool on the roof for relaxing.Soho was a great location with great restaurants, shops and bars in the area. It had a great vibe and is definitely a great place to go for more of an 'American' holiday! The hotel was close to the metro so it was easy to access to mid town Manhattan, only 15 mins on the A,C,E line.The staff at the hotel were extremely nice and the rooms were spacious and modern (we booked a guest room king deluxe). We especially liked the morning complimentary coffee and scones in the lobby and the complimentary cookies at night. There are great local stores nearby which you can go to in the morning for breakfast and snacks.The pool area on the roof has stunning views of the surrounding area and world trade centre, but the pool area is small and only has a few sunbeds available which means you have to wait for the beds to become available when it is sunny! It was also disappointing to be told that the pool closed for summer 2 days after we checked it. We were advised this is state law, but not being locals it is not something we were aware of and the website does not advise this. Also be aware that the pool area closes early to accommodate the very popular Jimmy bar. We were moved at 2.30pm at the weekend so the pool area can be prepared for the general public visiting the bar. This was disappointing as it did appear that the Jimmy bar took president over the hotel guests. We explained to the receptionist that we were disappointed with the pool being closed so soon after we checked in and they offered us a generous voucher for the David Burke kitchen which is situated within the hotel. We managed to visit it for brunch which was very nice and we have reviewed this separately. Overall, we had a very good experience but would recommend you check the pool opening times/dates if this is important to you.

Second verse: same as the first!Helpful staff, well appointed and conveniently utilized rooms, with great location at very Southwest tip of Soho. I liked the free wifi, coffee and miniscones for breakfast, 24 hour gym on 17th floor, convenient access to David Burke Kitchen, etc.Only area for improvement: TV channels on exercise equipment need to include "real" stations: CNN, CNBC and the like....

My husband and I just spent 3 glorious nights at The James, with the Freedom Tower as the first and the last thing we would see each morning/night out our wall of windows. Talk about a view! Try to get a corner king studio facing south......you won't regret it. SoHo has everything, and The James is walking distance to all of SoHo/NoLita; in addition, the subway is around the corner. So, from a convenience standpoint, it's a winner. But it's the hotel and it's staff that truly stand out. From an architectural and design standpoint, there is something unique and entertaining. The glass elevator from the concierge street level to the lobby, the Urban Oasis garden/restaurant, the artwork on each floor, the 17th floor gym with windows galore (did I mention the view?!), the rooftop pool/bar, and Thursday morning yoga.....yes, YOGA on the roof of a hotel, overlooking the Freedom Tower, in NYC.....it was an experience I'll always treasure. Our room was not large, but very comfortable. The heated bathroom floor was a great feature, as was the complimentary triple-filtered water (love those bottles!). I don't want to spoil the surprise of the bathroom window, so you have to go see for yourself! The staff was all great, very helpful, professional, and competent. They greeted us and always inquired as to how we were enjoying ourselves, but they respect your privacy. The complimentary muffins and morning coffee were appreciated; the late night cookies were worth every calorie! Special thanks to the concierge staff....Morgan and Lewis can make anything happen. You need your luggage taken to 30 Rock, have yourselves picked up there, then taken to LGA? No problem! They follow through, they communicate with you, and they make you able to do what you came to NYC to do....explore and have fun! We will definitely return, thanks!

Stayed in April 2014. Had a "family suite" on an upper floor. Rooms were spacious enough. Doors to hallway did not lock. Engineering came up promptly to repair. Got one door to close but never locked. Not too thrilled that we had to wait and wait when full elevators kept opening in the lobby full of people not staying at the hotel and just going to the rooftop bar.All in all, not the luxury feel that we prefer.

Ever since I saw the James New York being newly built from the ground up over 5 years ago (after staying at the James Chicago), I've always wanted to try it out. Flash sales and what not kept me from staying here until now, almost 5 years after its opening, although we have eaten at the restaurant David Burke Kitchen during several past Restaurant Weeks. I was immediately attracted by the hotel's design--a standard rectangular building with a curvy glass-walled lobby beneath it, and cleverly planned elevated urban garden beside it. It has become my Soho hotel of choice, besting stays at Trump, Mondrian and Mercer, although Crosby Street and the Broome are still on my radar (Soho Grand and SIXTY Soho never have been).For frugal-minded travelers like ourselves who don't mind shlepping their luggage on the AirTrain and subway from JFK airport, the James is very convenient from the Howard Beach AirTrain and A metro line, as the Canal St. exit is just behind the hotel. The street entrance on Grand has bowls of biscuits and water for dogs, and the bellman desk, which I noticed during my stay was not always staffed. Luckily, it was staffed when we arrived, and Kenny promptly escorted us to the glass elevator to the Sky Lobby, and later to the room. The hotel is chock-full of art, and 2 of the largest pieces, a gold-hued tapestry by textile atelier Hechizoo and a mosaic-like piece made entirely of scavenged computer keyboard keys by Sarah Frost are in the ground floor lobby. The hotel has a house car in the mornings and afternoons that goes downtown and as far north as 14th St.The reception desk in the Sky Lobby was a small counter just large enough for 2 staffers. The lobby itself, with its aforementioned curvy glass walls that overlook the Urban Garden, is furnished with unique modern pieces. I particularly liked the wooden benches with small terrariums embedded in them. Two computers and a printer are available for guests, and there is a small table that offers treats throughout the day: pastries and coffee/tea in the morning, fruit throughout the day, wine and cheese/crackers at happy hour, fresh baked cookies in the evening, filtered water all the time. When I booked online, I was given the opportunity to upgrade my room on a space-available basis for a reduced rate. I accepted the offer, and we found out at check-in that we had been upgraded from a Deluxe King (king room on a higher floor) to a One-Bedroom Apartment. There are four such rooms, all facing north (and east/west), one on top of the other, on floors 12, 14, 15, 16. The largest room, the Penthouse Loft, is on floor 16 and faces south (and east/west). The top floor, 17, has a few standard-sized rooms, plus the gym and mechanical room for the rooftop pool. Floor 17 supposedly gets a lot of noise from the rooftop bar, Jimmy.Our "apartment" on floor 12 was not set-up exactly like the photos on the hotel website, although the floor-plan was the same, extending the entire width of the hotel. There was a living room in one corner and a bedroom in the other, separated by a large marble bathroom. The living room held a large sofa, chair, table with 2 chairs, flat TV mounted on the structural concrete pillar in the corner, closet and expansive minibar, complete with accoutrements necessary for complete cocktail making--you just call room service for the necessary fixings. The bedroom held the king bed with a unique headboard (but not as unique as the wooden one on the website), a desk, another pillar-mounted TV, and a bench with storage below and a variety of packaged gifts items available for purchase (some at great cost) in a box. The bathroom had but one sink, a large dual-head shower, a separate tub, and a windowed wall into the bedroom with a unique privacy screen (designed by Nienke Sybrandy) that lowered with a switch. Lighting in the bathroom was great, but decidedly inadequate in the living and bedroom. The living room had but a single naked light bulb above the table, plus a dim light above the minibar.
