Housekeeping told me the bulb was supposed to be naked (it's shown as such on the website), but said other apartments have another light fixture above the sofa. Perhaps that is the fixture I found tucked behind the corner pillar, leaning against the window, inoperable. I discovered it when I heard a dripping noise on the wooden floor by the pillar during a rain ( I called the front desk, and the hotel's solution was to place 3 towels on the floor--ingenious!). The bedroom had a headboard that lit up 2 ways, plus reading lamps on both sides of the bed, but no lamp for the desk. The full walls of windows in both rooms afforded great views, but the curtains were difficult to close at night. Higher floor rooms probably get a glimpse of the Empire State Building to the north and the Hudson River to the west. Our housekeeper actually wrote thank you notes for the gratuity we left daily. Wifi is free.The James' Urban Garden and dining areas have a lovely design. The main restaurant, David Burke Kitchen, is partially underground, but still has windows near the ceiling for lots of light--you can see the feet and lower legs of passing pedestrians. A lot of the menu is available through room service. We dined here once again for Restaurant Week; it is consistently good, and somewhat unique in that pretty much the whole menu was available (some restaurants have a separate Restaurant Week menu).Above the restaurant is the Treehouse Bar, and the Garden at David Burke outdoor restaurant, part of the multilevel Urban Garden. We didn't get a chance to dine here, but did explore the garden-- full of seating areas, art, and foliage. Plus you are above the sidewalk level, so it's much more private. Beautiful.The rooftop holds the small pool and deck, and the Jimmy Bar and Lounge, which I think takes over the pool deck as well in the evening. The pool deck affords great views of Soho, the Freedom Tower, and a glimpse of the Hudson River, plus the Holland Tunnel entrance. Jimmy is rather small, and has a velvet rope in the evening. Hotel guests have a rope indoors next to the Urban Garden, while non-guests have a rope outside. There is a dedicated elevator to Jimmy at night. The guest room elevators require a key scan to operate. I don't think there are staff elevators, judging by the number of staffers I saw using the guest elevators.While not perfect, the hotel's location, art and design, and appreciation of the outdoors have made it my current Soho hotel of choice.

Stayed here one night with my daughter and we loved the room. Very clean and sharp. Had a corner king with an amazing view of the Freedom Tower. People complain about the noise but we had our windows open and slept great. I highly recommend this hotel. We went to the Jimmy around 7:00 until 9:30 and the crowd was fun and friendly. Lots of people taking photos up there. No problem getting a table. The view is breathtaking. A great group of people were dancing and the dj music was perfect. Kept wondering if someone was going to fall into the pool. Just out there in the middle of everything..haha. The drinks and food were good. Not outstanding but no complaints either.The hotel bed was very comfortable and I slept like a baby. Close to shopping and eating in Soho. The staff is attentive but didn't hover which I appreciated.Great space. Glad we stayed. Though it could have been snobby there is no pretense here. Friendliness abounds. : ) We felt very welcome.

My boyfriend and I stayed at The James for two nights and found the hotel very pleasant. The décor is stylish and I loved the wooden floors in the room and the eco-friendly products in the bathroom. The service was good and even though we did not use the minibar – I was pleasantly surprised that the prices were very reasonable. I always appreciate when I don’t feel like been ripped off! I liked the ‘happy hour’ for the hotel guests – free wine and nibbles in the early evening. Nice touch. The rooftop bar was cool and very handy for a drink or two.  Overall I enjoyed our stay and cannot fault the place. It is fairly pricey and at times, you had to wait a long time for a lift as the roof top bar guests were using them too. Minor things though. I would recommend if you want to stay in Soho and want to stay somewhere trendy and comfortable.

Our experience at the James was great. My wife and I had a couples weekend here and enjoyed everything from the massages to the rooftop pool bar. The doormen (Eric and Mark) and bartenders were great!

The James hotel is a perfect gem. Unfortunately we didn't get to use the pool. the weather wasn't cooperative. I definitely will stay at this hotel again. Close to shopping and dining. You don't need a car. I love to shop in nearby Soho and the West Village. There are countless restaurants and cafes to dine and have a cocktail.

I stayed here for a few days in May and really liked it. This is a pretty cool/modern hotel that is very conveniently located in the SoHo/Tribecca area. Now if you're not from NYC or not used to the hotels there I should point out that the rooms are pretty small for the price, but at least here they're nice. Plus, the who wants to spend tons of time in your hotel room when you're on vacation? They have a really cool rooftop bar with an amazing view and another lower level outside area where you can grab drinks and food. Side note: hit up Joe's Shanghai in Chinatown for some awesome dumplings or walk down to Locanda Verde for some great Italian food.

I recently stayed at The James NY for a business trip.The staff is amazingly helpful and efficient. Location is great and it is very close to amazing restaurants.Lastly, Jimmy's is the place to hangout!

We regularly come to NY for a few days every year.We just discovered the James - brand new built 4 years ago.Perfect Soho location.Amazing views - tip: get a CORNER room, it's definitely worth the little extra price.Nice spa and restaurant.Definitely to be tried !

This hotel has all the potential in world. It has a great location, as it sits on the edge of Soho. There is a fabulous roof top bar with a view of One World Trade…BUT…the service is abysmal. Rarely was there anyone at the concierge desk or front desk. I had tried to make reservations through the concierge via email and never received a reply. It was only thanks to a few friendly doormen that we were able to get directions and subway assistance.

Great location, easy walk to restaurants, shops and subway, fantastic roof top bar, brilliant sunset views, but can also head up for a swim or just a morning coffee. Room was clean and not tiny for New York standards. All the staff were very helpful. Even the gym had a lovely view!

The hotel was understated and trendy with great service. Every morning we collected our complimentary coffee and teacakes before starting the day, then in the evening after a long day of sightseeing, meeting in the lobby waiting for friends we were offered cheese and wine, which was an indulgently wonderful nice touch. The boys were more than helpful and took their initiative to make things work for us - especially Luis and Eric. They were very friendly and most helpful, guides in a big unknown city. The cleaners are definitely worth a mention, the rooms were kept immaculate and they fell into our pattern and routines rather than following the hotels. I would certainly recommend The James.

Short stay in The James. Superb location in the heart of SoHo. Expected a bit more of the hotel itself. I know space is scarse in NYC, but our double room was extremely small. The bed was not even Queen size and therefore quite cramped for 2 people! Hardly any space to put suitcases so all our stuff was kind of all over the very tiny room so we had to tiptoe and jump over bags to get from bed into the bathroom. The latter was very nice and practical with a great walk-in rain shower. I particularly like the glass partition betweeb bathroom and sleeping area. Am also a big fan of hardwood floors in hotel rooms. Overall impression of corridors and rooms is that everything looked a bit tired already although the lobby and general areas where still very nice and modern. Check in staff : very impersonal. Worthwhile to check your bill at check out as mine had quite some considerable mistakes. Also we learnt upon check out we did not get all the relevant info regarding breakfast options upon check in. Our room rate included continental brkfst, but nobody told us we weren't supposed to have breakfast in the restaurant but in the lobby. Who would have known this ?! So we were charged for full breakfast - however this was rectified upon our departure, the point is that we should have gotten co'plete info upon arrival.The open air restaurant seemed lovely however very busy and unfortunately we could just have drinks. It took forever though before anyone noticed us ! Food looked great and would have loved to have dinner there. I think this will be my only stay in The James particularly because of the extremely small room that definitely was not meant to accommodate 2 people.

We stayed here for 4 nights in July. Everything about it was fantastic. We arrived tired off a red-eye flight and they allowed us to check in early, select our room and even offered for us to change our room to one on a higher floor if we wished (all of this unsolicited by us). We got a king corner suite which had a surprisingly huge amount of space for NYC. Rooms were serviced twice a day with an evening turn down service, and there was always chilled filtered water on hand in the room. Beds are super comfortable, the bathrooms are great (good lighting for makeup too, which is always a bonus). They try to be eco-friendly and environmentally sustainable where possible.The interior design of the hotel and the rooms is attractive and well thought out.There is coffee and biscuits available in the mornings, fruit during the day and wine in the evenings, in the lobby. Wifi is free and fast. All staff (reception, cleaning and doormen) were really friendly and always helpful. There is a great variety of bars and restaurants only a short walk from the hotel, though the rooftop bar and the restaurant (David Burke Kitchen) next door are both fantastic if you want to stay in. Soho shopping is among the best in Manhattan. There are subway entries to all lines within a short walk (from across the road, to a block away).We will definitely stay here when next in Manhattan, it was perfect for us in every way.

Exellent location, nice rooms, friendly staff, especially the "bellboys" - they fix whatever you need of transportation, tickets, dinner reservations etc.We had a Deluxe King room with fantastic view - and waking up in the morning and take our morning coffe with us up to the pool bar on 17th floor - amazing! Having a drink at the same spot after dinner - not a bad idea either :)

Stayed at The James for one night, so I will summarize my first impression good and no so good aspects. GOOD- Great at reception. - Nice ambience, definitely hip and fancy. - Good location. - Great rooftop pool bar with impressive views. - Trendy and very good restaurant (David Burke Kitchen), a sort of hot spot for the "a la mode" crowd. - Complimentary beverages and snacks throughout the day. - Good views from room. - Good for solos - Close to subway and Soho shops and restaurants NOT SO GOOD- Queen room small and inconveniently laid out. - Small closet and practically no drawers - Furniture needs some updating (minor scratches here and there) - Strange location of lobby on the first floor - I pre-paid for a late check out and got no housekeeping though specifically asking for it.

Unique small boutique hotel with little number of rooms, compared to other massive hotels in NYC. This brings a very personnal service. Hotel staff was excellent.It was situates closeby very nice shops, bars and restaurants.The rooms are clean and very modern but cosy at the same time.Only minor remark is that for working, a desk is missing in the standard rooms. The table in the room was not really convenient to work at.My room was on the 8th floor, so I haven't heared any of the rooftop bar noise some people complain about.Conclusion: I loved the hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Pros-Great location, close to SoHo shops, numerous restaurants and within walking distance of the Highline.-Large bedroom, with small lounge room (although we paid for the privilege).-Rooms had streamlined decor, with a strong minimalist influence (if you like traditional hotel styling you probably will not like the decor).-Large and well designed room.-Great design elements throughout the hotel (art installations, furniture, lights).-Small gym, but fantastic view (helps with the hell of running on a treadmill).-Helpful staff.-Complimentary water.-Complimentary herbal tea (nice quality tea bags) in the room. -Complimentary coffee (although disappointingly instant) in the room. Given the high price tag of the hotel I expected higher quality coffee.-Complimentary coffee and snacks (scone like buns) in the lobby area every morning.-Fantastic bacon (maple syrup smoked), possibly the best I have ever had (and I am a connoisseur) served with room service hamburgers and in basement restaurant.Cons-My main issue is the price tag. Given the cost (+US$800/night once you include all the taxes) I expected it to be near perfect. It wasn’t. The interior is looking worn, with the normal wear and tear one would expect a high volume hotel, but not definitely not in a 5 star hotel. -Busy roof top deck available to the public impacted elevator availability.-Shower had mold, likely impossible to remove, but still unpleasant.-Instant coffee! Need I say more?To Be Aware Of-Price vs quality.

Great location, nice views, rooftop bar is great, garden is fantastic too, restaurant (David Burke) soso but reasonable, rooms are comfy and well equipped.Top floor rooms can be quite noisy, plus they don't have any twin rooms.All in all great choice and reasonable value...

Was offered preferred guest list status to get into Jimmy's that evening. When we went to go up there. The security would not let us in. Made us stand away for 10 min. and let 3-4 groups of 4-6 people ahead of us even though we said we were on preferred list and showed our room key. We walked away just after midnight. We were treated very poorly by security.

I visit NYC often for business and as a PR pro with experience representing high-profile hospitality clients (e.g. hotels, resorts, chefs, restaurants, travel destinations, spas, etc) and after having lived in NYC for almost a decade (moved back to the DC area in 2010), I enjoy experiencing new hotels each time I get back up to visit. My three day two night stay at The James New York in SOHO was outstanding. After arriving and having to deal with a nightmare with various representatives from Citibank after learning my bank card had been compromised, the staff at The James did whatever they could to make sure that I was taken care of. As I stood in the lobby stressed and frustrated and on the phone with multiple representatives from Citibank, the front desk manager provided me with water and a glass of wine, until I was able to get everything sorted out! After the debacle, I finally made my way up to my suite and was blown away the second I stepped foot into the room. The room was crisp, clean, contemporary, and have sweeping views of the beautiful NYC skyline - my second home! It was my first time seeing the Freedom Tower complete and shining in the distance. One of the former PR agency's I worked for actually did the PR for the architects/designers for the Freedom Tower so I was lucky enough to work some of the events including the groundbreaking. So again it meant a lot that this was the view I got to fall asleep and wake up to. The bed and linens were luxurious and I slept well. Room service was quick and service was extremely friendly. The bathroom was gorgeous and I loved the electronic shade that you had the option of pulling down for privacy or lifting up so you could see the room. I also enjoyed flipping through the book left in the room - 'Humans of New York' - and ended up buying a copy when I returned to DC to remind me how how amazing NYC - my second home is. The day I checked out, I was able to get a late check out and head up to the rooftop pool to enjoy a cocktail and a quick dip. I ordered lunch up there as well. It was the perfect way to end my trip!This hotel is also well known as a see and be seen property. I learned while lounging poolside on the rooftop that the entire cast of Orange is the New Black had a party on the rooftop the night before. I also heard Derek Jeter had dinner at David Burke - the hotel restaurant - one of the nights I was there. Ahhhhhh NYC :)
user_name:
Kyle S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: A perfect 4 night stay in great room. Helpful and friendly staff. Understated, tasteful luxury in excellent TrIBeCa location. Bathroom with huge size organic shampoo, conditioners and wash creme. Crisp white cotton sheets in lovely bed. Loved The James!

Not only is the hotel beautiful and full of amenities (one of the few hotels in Manhattan with an open air rooftop pool), but the staff is first in class. Every single person I encountered was extremely friendly and accommodating. I felt like I was the only person staying at the hotel. I had a party at the JIMMY for 30 or so of my closest friends and then it moved down to the Penthouse. The Penthouse was spectacular. It was was one of the best events I've ever hosted. Perfect way to turn 30!

We took a 24 hr business trip to SoHo. Contacted the James Hotel and felt right at home. Would highly recommend. Personalized and friendly service. Egger at the front desk was fantastic and Eric in valet/transportation very helpful. Location of hotel made walking in the area easy with many options for dining and snacking.

The James Hotel provides an amazing hotel experience in the very cool, hip SOHO area. The hotel itself is clean, modern and has a great outdoor patio space, a pool/roof deck area, a lounge and various restaurants. The staff is absolutely incredible…from the concierge, reception, bartenders to deck staff. They go out of their way to help in any way they can. We didn't have time to take advantage of all their other services (bikes, spa, etc). I was there for 24 hours with my best friend and they made the experience such a pleasurable one that we plan on making it an annual trip. I truly haven't had this quality of service since my honeymoon at the Four Seasons in Nevis!
user_name:
Mrs. Marni B
New York City, New York

review_body: The stratospheric Tripadvisor ratings for The James in New York led us to reserve a room during our most recent trip to NYC at this establishment.Would agree with reviewers that lobby staff are friendly and helpful, that the hotel is clean, rooms are small but nice with good views, and location is great.Be warned however that come 3 PM on weekends, the staff opens the rooftop pool to general public. The staff evict hotel patrons from their lounge chairs to make way for the subsequent onslaught of visitors to the pool and bar. The staff unceremoniously also walk around with obnoxious "reserved" signs and place them next to hotel patrons to complete the eviction process. Really poor form for a hotel of this cost. Probably won't be back.

Visited last september and was an amazing stay! The hotel welcomed us with a luxury feel with a hotel assistant helping us to our room with our bags and they were efficient and great! The view from our room was great especially as we were high enough to see pretty much all of NYC, and loved waking up to see all the yellow taxi's. We visited a bit of new york but were quite tired from the jet lag that day. We went to Jimmy's the next morning for some breakfast and experienced my first pancakes and bacon! We stayed overall for 4 nights and the room was spotless and lovely designed with super cool rolling down blinds to separate the glass bathroom to the bedroom. I would highly recommend the James and also would also say to check out the mexican along the road on the right, they do the best enchiladas!The pool on the roof was amazing and the views are breathtaking!

I live in the neighborhood but had construction going on in my apartment. So I went down the street to The James. It was amazing, staff, etc....I felt pampered and like I had just been on vacation~~~~

What makes the James so special is not only the great neighborhood that it is in but the amazing people that work there. Everyone we encountered was friendly, helpful, and so welcoming. The rooms are well equipped, the shower and bath products are amazing!The 24 hour complimentary treats in the lobby are an extra treat. Coffee and pastries in the morning, fruit all day, and wine and cheese in the evening are such a nice touch. There are tons of hotels in NY, but I won't search anymore. The James will be my go to hotel in NY! Keep up the great work.

I've been to the James on several occasions. The first stretch was through work, and later, I stayed there with my wife. Their customer service is top notch. For example, upon pulling up to the curb, the staff immediately helped with the bags, and while unloading the car, gave all sorts of useful recommendations on what was happening in the area - restaurants to try, places to visit if I had time, etc. Upon check-in they welcomed me back to the hotel. (Nice to see they keep records and then acknowledge their return guests!) I left a nice tip with housekeeping who did a flawless job in the room, and they responded with a handwritten note of thanks.The rooms are clean and modern and the dining is outstanding. You can''t go wrong with David Burke Kitchen - I know because I've tried virtually everything on the menu!I highly recommend The James for business and for couples!

Liked my stay in this hotel. Rooms were very modern and functional. Room size was OK for me solo, but may prove a little tight for a couple. Elevators are terribly slow and ground level lobby/foyer had a continual sewer smell which I assume was due to plumbing problems but was a horrible first impression every time I re-entered the building. Really needs to be attended to ASAP.

My wife and I decided to take a quick getaway to NYC and had heard great things about The James. We were not disappointed. Kenny took great care of us at check-in. The front desk found us a room even though we arrived early. Throughout our stay the staff went out of their way to pamper us. As a frequent business traveller, this level of service is rarely found in the big chain hotels. Our room was a nice size with a great view of lower Manhattan. It is nice that the windows open slightly, Sometimes I actually like to hear some of the big city sounds of NYC. Otherwise the rooms are super quiet, great AC and comfortable beds. I asked for extra pillows and promptly received 4 nice fluffy ones. A nicely stocked pantry and roomy bathroom with excellent rain forest shower. I enjoyed having the pump bottles of soap, shampoo, and conditioner in the shower. Very fast, free internet. Being a small hotel, it is a short walk from the elevator to any room. An amazing rooftop bar and outdoor deck with a small pool (not big enough for swimming, but good for a cool dip). Be sure to enjoy at least one meal at the David Burke kitchen on the lower level. This property has many unique outdoor areas on different levels. Be sure to explore. My wife and I continued to find these areas throughout our stay. A truly special property in SoHo with great access to many local shops and restaurants.

We booked the larger corner room here, which I would say is essential. Even this larger room is only 400 sq ft in size. In any other city, this would be tiny. In New York it's just about ok. The service was great and friendly. Staff were always helpful. The rsstaurant on the first floor has a great garden dining area which is really nice to have in the middle of town. The hotel is in the heart of soho. 5 min walk to all major shops, including Bloomingdales. The pool and bar upstairs is really for hanging out rather than swimming. The pool is tiny. I've seen bigger jacuzzis. But, again, this is manhattan. You can't expect an Olympic five lane pool! Nice views with cocktails and a trendy 20&30s type professional crowd at weekends. Overall we had a good stay. It offers what you would expect on the basis of the hotel website. At around 600 per night it's not cheap...but Soho never is.

This hotel was so clean and up to date on their décor. All the staff were very friendly and helpful to all our needs. The rooftop bar was awesome. The amenities within the room was very well stocked with snacks and beverages. I would recommend this hotel to everyone who wants a well rounded hotel

In all ways a fantastic hotel. We loved our stay. Great location in an area filled with shops and restaurants - and also close to the Hudson River Park. Nice staff and the most wonderful views from the rooftop and our room (remember to ask for a room high up). David Burkes kitchen was also a big experience. Really good food.

An NYC local colleague recommended we stay here on a part romantic part business trip with my husband, mainly due to the pool! Unfortunately it wasn't really such a memorable hotel and I do love to travel and find great boutiques... Of which NYC has a few gems. The rooms were larger than normal for NYC and the desk staff lovely enough. Unfortunately it just didn't have anything that special going for it. The interiors were fine but not unique, the views of manhattan nothing like those you can get elsewhere and it just didn't have a standout vibe or style. my biggest issue was that downstairs they were more concerned with playing bouncer in regard to the private party upstairs than letting in the clientele of the hotel. This meant at one time when the crowds were lining up we actually had real issues even getting into the hotel. As my colleague initially recommended, great to head up for the pool parties on a hot day in Manhattan,but perhaps there are better places to stay where their greater concern is the hotel guests.

The James was a very warm and welcoming hotel. The rooms were relatively large (by NY standards), bright and sunny, and had an attention to detail. The surrounding area is nice and relaxed with plenty of great shops, cafes, and restaurants close by. The rooftop bar (The Jimmy) has incredible views of NYC although the pool up there is very small for use in the day. Hotel staff were friendly, helpful, and accommodating without being intrusive. Would definitely recommend The James for a great place to stay.

I have stayed at over 30 different NYC hotels in many different neighbourhoods over the past 30 yrs. As you can imagine there have been a lot of changes to NYC and to the hotel scene over this period of time. Some hotels have figured it out better than others. The James scores high in it's delivery of customer experience. The hotel is modern, cool but not too hipster cool, it is clean, staff is friendly and efficient and there are some amazing amenities that all help to make the value factor work for me. Amenities such as; rooftop lounge and pool, gym with a view, great food on premise, complimentary bicycles, complimentary (limited hours) town car.The wine/cheese and the Colombe coffee with Balthazar pastries at breakfast were a very welcome complimentary treat! One of the things I loved (and is a huge personal pet peeve) are the 'quieter-closing' hotel doors. HATE when your neighbour or the cleaning staff continually go in and out of rooms with those loud-slamming doors. I still think that ALL hotels including the James could train their staff to let room doors close quietly behind them. It is a small refinement that speaks volumes about the respect a property has for it's customers. Location is amazing - heart of SOHO and close to West Highway for a bike ride or jog - steps from A train subway etc. Gourmet Garage is 2 blocks away.Morgan at the front desk was amazing and aided me in moving to a higher floor in an effort to catch the 4th of July fireworks and the staff was very helpful in mailing items and laundry - thx. Kenny was also very helpful in assisting with cars/cabs, bicycles and suggestions etc - incredible asset to the hotel - loved this guy.The one negative was having to take the slow elevators to the ground floor in order to get back up to the rooftop at certain hours and deal with 'nightclub-type' attitude - suddenly I felt like I was no longer a guest at the hotel.I would definitely recommend this hotel and will return again - something I rarely do because I love trying new 'hoods and hotels!

From the moment we arrived, we felt the personalized service. The rooms are a bit small but very comfortable. The David Burke restaurant downstairs is very good. You must head up to the rooftop pool for great views of the city and the people. Nearby Soho shops make this a very convenient destination.

The manager did nothing to make up for our horrible stay. The pool was so small it looked like a large bathtub. There were only 7 lounge chairs. The staff told us all wrong information. Food is so-so.

My wife and I have stayed at the James each of the past four years for a brief getaway from our kids (although we brought a couple of our daughters with us this trip for one night). If you prefer the style of Soho to midtown or the 5th Avenue shops, then this is the place to stay. The staff is always very friendly and accommodating and we love the little touches like coffee/muffins in the morning, wine and cheese in the late afternoon, and cookies at night. The fitness center has a nice view of the new World Trade Center, the rooftop pool/bar is a great place to hang out, and the David Burke Kitchen restaurant is terrific. It's not really a place for kids. I think the only rooms with two beds are the high end suites, and the pool is really an adult hangout. We made it work with our girls for one night with a rollaway but I wouldn't recommend it.

Having tried a few properties around the SoHo area with mixed results, I was hopeful that the James would be more positive experience. And it did not disappoint.Like so many other SoHo properties, design and aesthetics play a key role. The James was clean, neat, and modern. Rooms were a little on the smaller side but the space was highly functional and didn't feel cramped at all. But the service is what made the difference for me. From the turn down service (with ice and chocolates) to the snacks in the lobby (fresh cookies, wine and cheese, pastries), they did the little things really well. And always greeted with a smile.Definitely will be coming back.

We've stayed at The James before though was very disappointed in our recent visit. Although (most of) the staff seem to be helpful, most don't listen which results in asking for things multiple times.

I knew the hotel would be beautiful but I was pleasantly surprised to also get really great service from everyone I met there. I thought the food from room service (DBK) was amazing too!! Visit Jimmy - the rooftop bar for awesome drinks & views!

My wife and I were given a night at the James Hotel in NYC as a Christmas gift 2 years ago. We were not disappointed. When we arrived, the first thing we noticed was a small dog bowl and treats for our furry family members at the front door. This made my wife and I wish we had brought our small Frenchie with us. Check In was a breeze and when we walked into our room, it just gave off a clean and refreshing vibe. The bed was and still is one of the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in (this is true of the other James Hotel locations we have stayed in). The concierge was extremely helpful in making us reservations to Fatty Cue and pointing out some great bars to visit along the way. I look forward to visiting other James Hotel locations as well as visiting this one again with our dog!

After staying for 10 days at this wondeful hotel, it is sad to leaveExcellent hotel, staff, room, roof top resturant and pool.Great view over New York, close to litle Italy, Chinatown and much moore.Realy nice area for shopping , dining +++

This hotel is, by far, the best hotel we’ve ever stayed at in NYC. Upscale appointments and room amenities are surpassed only by the quality of its staff and the services they provide, always with a cheeriness that is genuine. Chris Westerman, their front office manager regularly went beyond the call to see that arrangements that we needed were well seen to. Kudos to the entire desk staff in responding to our questions and needs for the almost three weeks we were there.
user_name:
Otto B
Croton on Hudson, New York

review_body: This was our first time staying at the James. The location is ideal and easy to access by taxi or subway. We walked a lot into Soho due to excellent location. The room was spacious, enough, and very bright. Comfortable beds and a great bathroom. I'll go back.

We stumbled upon The James when looking for accommodation in the Soho area, and we are so glad we found it. It was a really funky place to stay, with quirky decor and amazing outdoor spaces for dining and drinks. The location is really convenient, super close to shops, restaurants and the Subway. Our room was on the smaller side but was really well fit out, the bathroom was a good size and we had a great outlook with huge windows. We would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend to others.

Our first stay in Downtown NYC. The James was a welcomed change to the impersonal, hotels of Midtown. The hotel is well kept and the rooms clean. The staff is outstanding, particularly the concierges.

We were staying for a girls weekend. We loved the rooftop bar and the restaurant that were right in the hotel. There were tons of other great places to go out and shop within a few blocks as well. The staff was all very helpful and the service was great. The bartenders at the rooftop were super nice and quick with the drinks. Kenny at the front door was also extremely helpful and went out of his way to see if there was anything that we needed. Overall couldn't have asked for a better place for our get-away.

Excellent property with unique features (treehouse bar, roof deck bar). Great in room dining. Superior service - really excellent staff. Love the location and neighborhood. Tons of options for walking

A wonderful hotel in the heart of Soho with great cafés, bars etc all around and a fab rooftop bar of it's own. Next door to Canal St metro station so you can hop straight up town in a matter if minutes. Highly recommended!

Great location. Near Metro. Jay,the "bell captain, and Kenny, the "doorman" were very very helpful and made our stay a pleasure and easy to navigate. The rooms are on the small side but the roof gardens and rooftop pool make up for that.

The staff was amazing - especially Amy and Eric. The room was terrific and comfortable. We held our small wedding ceremony there and couldn't have made a better choice! We were treated like royalty and would recommend The James NY highly.

First time visitors to New York.We had thought about staying in Times Square but based on friends reccomendations decided on staying at the James in Soho. Great choice! Very nice hotel, beds are awesome, view from the room amazing (corner unit) Eric, Jay, Kenny and John, make you feel at home.We are used to 5 star accomadations in other cities and like to feel safe. Everyone made us feel that way at the James. Room a little smaller than what we are used to but very confortable.No surpirses on the bill upon check out.Ventured out on the subway everyday ( which is something we have never done) very easy and a stop within a half a block of the James.Shoppers paradise!We will be staying at the James again at our next visit because of the people and the location of the hotel (away from the crowds)

We recently stayed at The James In Soho and had a great experience. I arrived after my husband and was greeted by the friendly staff at the front desk. They remembered my husband, and let me know what a nice guy he is and how he upgraded our room to a corner suite as well. The corner suite was nice. We had views all around. It was not huge, but big for New York standards. The decor was comfortable and simple. The bathroom had a nice shower with heated floors. We were on the fifth floor and the noise from outside was not bad at all. We stayed at the Gansevoort in the meat packing district recently and had to wear ear plugs at night. Another bonus at the James is the location. The train station is right across the street. We were able to easily take the train to many places and avoid the street traffic. They also offer complimentary wine and cheese in the early evening. After walking around the city all day, it was nice to come back to the hotel for the free wine and cheese. It was not a big selection, a simple set up, but still appreciated. They also had a fun roof top bar that gets pretty crowded at night. My only complaint was that our pillows were really too soft. We requested firmer pillows but were told all four nights that they were all being used. Other than that, our stay was a positive experience and we would definitely stay here again!

If you want to experience an alternative side to New York then stay at The James in Soho. Soho has some great bars and restaurants. If you want to visit the attractions there is a hop on hop off bus service that has a stop nearby. The hotel itself is very functional. The rooms are quite small as compared to some hotels but everything you need is there. The hotel was also very quiet so we had a great nights sleep. The staff at the James are very friendly and welcoming. Special mention goes to Julia in the Garden bar. Excellent service during all the times we had evening drinks there.One low point was the rooftop bar Jimmys. We went up there twice and due to very poor service we waited and waited. In the end we gave up and returned for good service in the Garden bar.To finish on a positive. In the morning there is fresh coffee and pastries. In the evening there is wine and cheese followed by cookies and coffee. All provided free for guests. We had a great stay and would not hesitate to return.

This hotel is easy to miss at the corner of Thompson and Grand streets at the edge of Soho. My room, on the 4th floor, was small but exactly what I needed. It had a great bed with nearly floor-to-ceiling window the length of the room looking toward the Hudson River. While I couldn't see the river, the goings-on on 6th Avenue were almost always interesting, with a small park across the street. The room itself had just the right amenities for my business trip and would have been fine if my wife were with me. The room had wood floors, which I have not seen in hotels previously. That was cool, though the one downside was that at quiet moments I could hear people in adjacent (or above) rooms walking on their wood floors. Overall it wasn't a big deal and I had no trouble getting work done, relaxing and getting to sleep. The gym on the 17th floor was just right for a little exercise (weights, elliptical, treadmill, etc.) and had terrific views south toward the financial district and east toward Brooklyn and the rest of Soho. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall I was very happy with this hotel.

Well, this is our third review of The James So Ho and this hotel and staff simply get better and better. While the hotel and the location is great what makes The James special is clearly its staff and we thank The James management team for working hard to keep this staff in place because honestly this staff is committed to total customer satisfaction as we experience this each and every stay with ourselves and observe the same with other guests. Eric, John, Kenny, Amy, Christine, Morgan…… and the list goes on and on ……… Truly exceptional hospitality professionals. Then to the James Burke Kitchen with E Thomas at the helm and his top notch team delivering incredible food and service - you just simply cannot go wrong with this package.  We will back time and time again, there is no doubt - The James So Ho is one in a million.

The staff is friendly. The rooms are hum drum. Nothing special at all. Worst is the people working the garden bar and pool area. They seem new and have no idea even how to bill something to the room or basic things on the menu. Dumb. More egregious the pool bar is nasty. All the garnishes from the lemons, limes to the leaves they muddle look rotten. I even commented to bartender that I hoped he was serving any of that and he said it didn't matter if they werent that fresh because it was being muddled. Who says such a thing. If you like high end hotels like I do id definitely pass on this place. It is not high end in the least and would better appeal to holiday inn clientele.

I stayed in this lovely, incredibly well run hotel for 5 nights with my 14 year old daughter. First visit to New York, felt very well looked after, nothing was too much trouble, staff incredibly knowledgeable, efficient and kind.The food and drink was delicious. The bed so comfortable! Soho is a great location as a base and great for shopping. Would definitely return.

I have to say these hotel its The Surrey of Soho. Great service the personal where super welcoming and helping. The room was nice but still a hotel room. I do like that the bathroom has a courting not that you always want it open but it does make the room look bigger.

This is a special hotel in a great part of Soho. The rooms are exceedingly well done--they feel more like studio apartments which is what I first thought they were when I saw the building for the first time from a room at the Soho Grand. The rooftop bar is quite a scene, with spectacular views of the Freedom a Tower. Wine, cookies, coffee in the lobby that sits a few stories off the ground. David Burke restaurant on the ground floor handles room service. Decently outfitted gym with great views.
user_name:
TuhonTraveler
New York City, New York

review_body: The actual hotel, rooms and views are stunning. I will not say that ALL staff were unfriendly, some were very willing and helpful. However, at the Jimmy Pool the servers seemed constantly annoyed when you placed an order and the service was incredibly slow. Upon attempting to return that evening for after dinner drinks as hotel guests, we were made to wait in a line to the rooftop for just my husband and I, while waves of 10-15 outside patrons went up at a time. The security at the elevator was extremely unwelcoming and unaccommodating - we ended up leaving and going to another bar outside the hotel. Finally - when checking out, we had several charges to our room that were not ours and had to be reversed. Overall, we had been excited to enjoy a beautiful location and it's amenities and everything just felt like an uncomfortable intrusion. We definitely will not be back.

Stayed for a week in a corner room with a great view of the city. The hotel management run a club at the rooftop starting early evenings. So no “chill sunset ending a hard working day” at the poolside. That suck big time!

Just finished a fantastic 3 night stay at The James hotel in Soho, New York. We had a tricky first night with rowdy neighbours and the front desk staff could not have done more to help by immediately upgrading us to a better room on another floor. Eric and John on the door also were absolutely fantastic with phenomenal courtesy and great local knowledge. This is our third trip to NYC and we would definitely come back here. Great views, top location for exploring downtown, funky rooftop bar and exceptional staff.

Our stay at the James was part of our honeymoon trip. We had stayed for 3 nights earlier in the trip in midtown but decided we also wanted to experience the bustling areas of Soho and TriBeCa. We were thrilled with the James! We arrived quite late and were greeted with a red wine and 2 friendly staff members. They both helped us get 100% settled in the room - talking through the amenities of the cleverly designed room - electric blind, openable windows, storage seat, coffee and tea making facilities and mini bar. He also talked us through the hotel amenities and things available to us. The James is full of unexpected surprises that aren't advertised. They make you feel like royalty or a VIP. One of the surprises is complimentary cheese and wine at night before dinner! The rest - I'll leave as a surprise! The room was clean and hotel in a great location with everything within walking distance. The only thing I would say is that our room was a little close to 5th avenue and thus was a little noisy. A room higher up might reduce this issue. The pool, gym, restaurant and bar on the top level were also very impressive! There's nothing this hotel didn't have! Would definitely stay there again although would spend more time discovering the restaurants in Greenwich Village and the East VillageThanks to all the staff at The James for making our trip so memorable!

We stayed for 5 nights and loved it. The corner room we had had a great view of the city looking east but it was really small with nowhere to put bags. Saw another room which was bigger but with less of a view. 11th floor had no traffic noise. Kent and the other staff were always helpful in getting cabs and navigating around. Rooftop bar is awesome on a nice day or clear night. Priority entry to the bar for hotel guests. Great location close to all the shops. Go across the road to the deli for great breakfast food including a bacon and egg bagel for $3.00. The hotel free breakfast is no good so make your own plans.

To say that the staff at The James Hotel in NYC went above and beyond the call of duty is an understatement with my stay and experience. I set up a surprise engagement with the hotel manager and the staff. Everything I needed was there for me and my now fiance (she said yes). They let my photographer up early to their rooftop bar so we were able to capture the moment. They helped make sure everything was a surprise and truly made our engagement that much more special. The views from the rooftop bar are breathtaking and those views alone are worth a reason to stay at the hotel. I highly recommend The James for their customer service, their great rooms, the neighborhood(s) and their high regard for excellence.

Just wanted to write about this great hotel. We have just returned from a 3 night stay. From start to finish this hotel delivered all we needed. The concierge Lenny was a great help and always had a friendly word. The reception staff were equally helpful. Efficient check-in was done with a free mimosa! Great start to our trip. The hotel offers free nibbles during the day. Coffe/pastry at breakfast through to cheese and wine in the evening a nice touch.The room was modern and clean and not too small for a NY hotel. Some people have commented about the glass bathrooms. Not an issue really if you drop the blind to give some privacy. Although as a married couple it wasnt an issue anyway. Very comfortable bed!The Jimmy roof top bar is the best spot for an early evening drink. It is obviously a locals in place to go as it was always busy from 5pm onwards. There was even a private party while we stayed - For 200 fashion models!! Its got a great vibe and the view of the city is great.

Stayed here for 3 nights. Great location for us. Staff couldn't be more helpful. Comfortable bed, room as described, nice and clean. On 6th floor traffic noise fine, quite near lift but still quiet. Would stay again and recommend.

After calling to obtain a bill for a past hotel stay I was left speechless. Crystal, the "customer service" rep that answered the phone was rude, nasty and then hung up on me. I immediately called back, where Crystal greeted me with her smug attitude stating "I've already spoken to my manager, do you want to now?". I was then transferred to Christina Perez, the Front Desk Manager. She told me that she was next to Crystal during the whole episode and she's sorry. Unbelievable! We USED TO do a lot of business with this hotel, after this experience, I will advise anyone to choose elsewhere.
user_name:
Jessica B
New York City, New York

review_body: The people made this hotel great. Kenny and Eric went out of the way to make us feel welcome and help us find places and things to do. They were really genuine in their approach and sent us to some great spots we may not have found on our own.The room itself was beautiful, decent space and you can't beat the location. The hotel is well maintain and clean while still being comfortable and inviting. The rooftop bar was a great spot to have a drink after being out for dinner although it was quite busy sometimes and not exclusive to hotel guests. Spectacular views and a great drink list.I would definitely stay here again.

We always stay at The James whenever we're in New York, which we frequently are on business. The hotel is gorgeous; light, contemporary and stylish but with a relaxed feel so that guests always feel at home. The rooms are compact but very well appointed with a kind of zen design, with good storage, lovely city views, and the location - on the edges of SoHo and Tribeca - is just fantastic. You're completely spoilt for choice when it comes to restaurants, bars and shops but equally the hotel restaurant and bar are very nice, although the bar gets a little too busy for us on the weekends (because the views are incredible so it draws a crowd!) There's even a small rooftop pool and sunbathing area, open seasonally from about May till October. Again, the views are fantastic. The hotel's lounge area in particular is wonderfully bright and spacious, very comfortable, and with a number of free to use computers and complimentary refreshments served throughout the day. This is a real plus point for us, because New York hotels can be extremely expensive, and yet at The James you do get great value for money because the wi-fi is free (and very good) and at breakfast, lunch and dinner there are free teas, coffees, fruit, scones and even wine, cheese and biscuits in the evening! On one stay we'd had a rather eventful journey and they brought up a free bottle of wine, which was a very nice touch. The staff are great, in particular the energetic front of house team who work on the door. Kenny is an absolute legend; a great guy who can't do enough to help you during your stay - we would literally come back to The James just to hang out with him, he's awesome. They make a great first impression for The James that's for sure. We'll always keep coming back - six plus times a year - because it feels like a home from home, more than just a hotel for us.

The place is built cheaply. And not well maintained. It feels like you are staying in a high end hotel in Eastern Europe circa 2000. It has a veneer of chic but it's so short on quality and service. It's several notches below IKEA in the quality of its furnishings - including cheap lowThread count sheets and the least plush comforter I've seen in a hotel. Hallway carpets have large disgusting stains. Floors in room are scratched up badly. Towel wall hook is dangling off the wall. Wood casework is really cheap and not installed evenly. Hallways smell of mildew. Restaurant is in the basement It was very difficult to tell if room service had actually been to the roomGym has water leak from the ceiling and big bucket on the floor. The one exercise bike has a toe clip on one side with no strap, and no clip or strap on the other side. I tried to ride it but had to stop bc the left crank arm is wobbling. Restaurant had no English Breakfast tea so they just served Earl Grey with no comment on this. Playing loud lounge music at breakfast Had do not disturb sign up when they tried to deliver a package at 9am. So instead of holding it at desk they called the room to say, hi we see you have a do not disturb sign up but we just tried to deliver a package. Of course this woke us up. No doormen preset to great you or help with luggage Staff seems indifferent.

Really enjoyed our two night stay at The James. The rooms are on the small side, but beds are comfortable. The lobby is well-designed and there are snacks available for guests throughout the day, along with a nice little business center. Most memorable was how helpful, warm and professional the staff were. Everyone was great, but Kenny really stood out in anticipating our needs, remembering our names and making us feel at home. A total rockstar – I would stay here again just because of him!

Stayed in this hotel on business, and was extremely pleasantly surprised by the modern decor, the friendly staff, the artistic touches, and the open atmosphere. My room was absolutely gorgeous, and the view was amazing. The pantry was stocked to the brim with interesting food and beverages, and even a little something more! Thank you for making this trip as comfortable and memorable as possible.

We had a wonderful weekend stay at the James. They took me to four different rooms before I settled on the two I wanted for myself and my friends. Although the rooms are a little small, the views, particularly on the higher floors, make them feel very spacious. Anything we asked of the staff, with one exception, was met with a cheerful and efficient response. For example, there was no decaf coffee set out in the morning, but after a short wait, one of the staff brought me a fresh brewed pot of decaf coffee. I also needed hot water for tea (again, none set out in the morning) and they were very accommodating fetching it for me. (Would have been nice if they had a bigger selection of teas - they only had one black tea. Luckily, I had brought my own herbals teas.). Cookies at night in the lobby and the chocolates in the room were absolutely divine! The one glitch is that the mini-fridge in my room was not cold, which I noticed right away. In spite of asking twice to have it taken care of, it never was and the food I put in it spoilt. :-( The elevator access is confusing, particularly if you're trying to get to the rooftop bar at night. But, overall a great stay.
user_name:
Mary Ann B
Westchester County, Ny

review_body: Had an amazing time at the James. The location was fantastic - so close to shoppping, bars and restaurants we wanted to visit. The staff were all extremely helpful and knowledgable of the area. I will stay here again if I visit New York again!

Just returned to the James for the second time and it was great. The location is perfect and the staff was very accommodating. Thanks to the gentleman downstairs-Kenny, Michael and Luis were always very helpful in getting us cabs and sharing their tips for SoHo and beyond. Had a corner suite and it had great views from the 17th floor. The rooftop bar-Jimmy- was always packed and for good reason. It had the best views and great drinks! Definitely will be returning to the James again!

Visit to NYC to with my wife and 17yr old son to tour NYU. Close to campus. Visit NYC 2-3 times year and always stay upper east or west side-not anymore! This is simply a great hotel in a great area of NYC. Incredible shopping and dinning minutes from hotel. 2 subway stops steps from hotel, easy access to east and west side of Manhattan. Rooms incredible. Ask for high floor for the most breathtaking views. Gym on the 17th floor with wonderful views. Visit Jimmy's on the roof for cocktails and lite snacks-it is happening here. Luis Vargas the Concierge loaded with suggestions and will easily point you in correct direction-it can be a little confusing down here. Staff cannot help enough. Courtesy car available certain hours. This is our new hotel to stay at when visiting NY

The staff --that greeted us at The James-- was outstanding. They could not have been any nicer, more accommodating or more professional. Michael, Kenny and Morgan were most helpful and kind during our stay at The James. It was my first time there--my husband has been at The James several times before for NYC business trips.I am certainly hoping to be able to go back. The accommodations were lovely and dinner at the restaurant delicious --but, it is the people on staff that truly make this hotel special. Loved the Soho/Tribeca location--in the vicinity of great shopping--Kenny, Michael and Morgan made sure I found my way!

Great location- very nice staff! Very good restaurant and bar.Would stay here again. Great location. amazing views - stayed in family suite and it worked out very well. Beds were great, nice linens and towels.

One of my best experiences at a New York Hotel. Definitely the friendliest staff I have ever encountered in New York. In fact, one of the best staff experiences I've ever had at any hotel I've stayed at around the world.

Had a really great stay here. We thought the room was very comfortable, quiet (we were on an upper floor), staff very friendly, and facilities generally very good. Also great location for soho and tribeca and away from the in your face commercialism of mid town manhatten. Does mean its a bit of way if thats what you want (we didnt). Kenny gave us some great advice on local facilities and travel so big thank you to him, but everyone was actually very friendly and helpful. Would definitely come back.

Fantastic place to stay. Service is the best. Location is fantastic - close to everything - shops, eats, sights. Would definitely recommend and will be returning to this hotel. Thanks Morgan, Amy and Kenny!

We just spent 4 nights at the James. Overall a very good experience.Modern/slick design corner studio that was also very functional. Special mention to the floor heated bathroom and the large shower.The jimmy roof top bar on the 17th floor with amazing views on lower Manatthan and whose access is granted to guests of the hotel is a blast. Only minus point is that people are queuing in the hotel lobby during weekends to get to the bar, using the lifts of the hotel. So if you want to go to your room at this specific time, you might end up being stuck. But this is a rather minor detail.Location is perfect as it is literally 5 mins away by foot to Soho and Mercer, Spring streets…The staff is great, with the exception of the the guys working at David Burk kitchen, who were not really sympathetic. Perhaps they had a bad day when we were there.But the 3 doormen who also work at the lobby, Kenny, Eric & Jay are truly stunning and amazing guys. We will come back to the James just because of these 3 guys.

The James is clean, stylish and fairly priced. It is very similar to the Standard East Village in mood (hip) and bedroom size (small!). The rooftop bar is quite exceptional, and well worth checking out. The dining room, literally set below street level, was a somber and unsatisfying place to start the day with breakfast. Not a place I wanted to hang out. The James is also on the far western edge of Soho. I thought it would be a good base for walks west to Nolita, but you'd have to cross several large and busy thoroughfares first which didn't seem too inviting.After 2 nights I felt I "got it", and wanted to find something cozier and more energetic. I found this in the much nicer (though slightly more expensive) Crosby Street Hotel on the other side of Soho.

I wish I could stay here every time I come to New York. So far, this is my favorite hotel in this city and I've stayed over the years in quite a few. The bed and pillows were so comfortable, I wish I could order them. The stylish staff was great and extremely accommodating.Your rooftop bar was a perfect place to stop by for drinks and a snack. Also, the treats throughout the day/evening (and by the bed) are the small things that make such a difference!Also, my sister left something valuable in the room when we checked out, and the housekeeping staff had turned it in. That honesty and trust is a wonderful thing to take home and we won't ever forget. It's also a reason to come back.Plus, the room, though small, was gorgeous and I loved just being in there. Since we had rain all weekend, we enjoyed lounging around the room and relaxing inside a bit. The decor was perfect for the space.

I stayed in those hotel for a weekend. The location cannot be beat. In the heart of SOHO, you are surrounded by the best of everything. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a lovely gentleman at ground level - he escorted us to the lobby level, where an equally friendly woman checked us in. The Room - we had a spacious room (by NYC standard) with floor to ceiling windows. I want to mention cleanliness. This room was immaculate and very well appointed. Roof Top Bar - we headed up to the bar on the roof. It opens at 5pm, at 5:15 this place was busy. Wonderful cocktails and AMAZING views.Breakfast - there is a David Burke Restaurant associated with the hotel. YUM! Even in NY, there is no need to opt to head out, when you can have such a fantastic breakfast in bed. Overall, this was a wonderful experience! If you are looking to stay in SOHO - stay here!

Super Zimmer (alle Eckzimmer), nicht günstig aber tolle Ausssicht, gut gestylt und nicht zu cool und very helpful and friendly staff! Die Lage ist ideal für Soho/Tribeca/Meatpacking District zu FussNext time a stay at The James for sure!

The James is small and pleasant. The room has a glass wall separating the bed and the shower, very sexy! Great outdoor space for a drink and a snack, the Treehouse, I believe. We didn't try the restaurant but enjoyed a late night drink at the rooftop bar with an outdoor lounge and pool. The doorman Keany was sharp and attentive. He went out of his way to help us arrange comfortable transportation and made sure the driver knew EXACTLY where to deliver us. It was a refreshing change to the local taxis and the English-challenged drivers.

A very good New York hotel. Great location for Soho but also convenient if you are flying in and out of Newark. Light filled rooms. Great views. Walking distance to walking/running paths along the Hudson River.

wonderful experience. Highly recommended. FIrst time there and they could not have been nicer. Centrally located to all the wonderful galleries and restaurants in Soho. Helpful with recommendations. No hesitations

I stayed at the James SoHo for a business trip last week and my stay was awesome. From the moment I stepped out of the car and into the hotel it was pure pleasure. The welcome received by the doorman to the friendliness of the check -in staff to the welcome on the floor of my room as I got off the elevator by a room cleaner who was walking by the corridor. Everyone was all smiles. I stayed in a king size room which was well appointed and veryWell kept up by maintenance and housekeeping. I stayed a total of 3 nights and I slept like a king :) All the street noise stays on the street , I guess the windows are very well sealed that you can not hear any sound. My room was in the 5th floor which I thought was going to be a problem because of how low it was. I was wrong :) The James club which is in the lobby offers coffee and cookies in the morning, water and fresh fruits during the day and wine cheese crackers and grapes at night. Amazing!!! I will for sure be returning again and again to the James SoHo.
user_name:
LirioC
New York City, New York

review_body: Loved this place -- have stayed in many hotels in NY and the service and location were just great! Perfect for families -- either the suite or the corner king with an adjacent queen made for a nice family NY vacation.

This hotel has beautiful decor... However seemed unorganized and there seemed to be miscommunication. However, Kenny did a fantastic job making our stay at the hotel. He took care of our car, luggage and was very helpful.If the rest if the staff and stay were as good as him... This would have been a 5 star review!

We are staying at the James and so far the place is beautiful and just what we needed. Staying in nyc can be very concrete so this hotel built a luxurious full size garden where you can get lost in thought. The rooms are very nice and they even give free Internet and wine on the check in floor. Very hospitable. Loving it here.

We loved the service, the location, the staff and the room. We got a king corner studio and it was definitely worth it. The bell men were all amazing, especially Kevin! The restaurant downstairs and the bar were also great. A superb option for staying downtown!

If your looking for elegance and excellent customer service, The James New York is where you want to be in New York City. Thank you Crystal Smalls for all of your attention to all of our details. I especially want to thank you for finding,holding, and returning our lost personal property.Nestor R
user_name:
Nestor R
New York City, New York

review_body: We were expecting a very nice property but were disappointed. The rooms were not pristine and the staff was not up to par. The condition of the room was noticeably not cared for in terms of quality. Floors were scuffed up and marked, dust in corners were noticeable. It was strange that some things I the room were really 5 star and yet others were not.

This hotel is an oasis,friendly, attentive staff, wonderful rooms with lots of natural light, extremely comfortable bed and spotless housekeeping AND the food at the David Burke restaurant is excellent.
user_name:
Mr John Willam B
Columbus, Ohio

review_body: We had four days here in early March for our first trip to New York. The location was excellent, right near amazing shops and restaurants. The room was fine- the glass wall between the bathroom and the bedroom was a bit weird but there is a blind.Staff were helpful and the doorman was wonderful.The worst part of our whole stay was the taxi drivers- none of them knew where the hotel was and on our trip home the driver didn't know where JFK was!!!

I've stayed at The James several times now and always enjoy the wonderful service and the great location! I love my room every time and their bed feels like mine at home where I can get a good night sleep after enjoying the city! Everyone is very helpful and all smiles and the room service is fast, efficient and delicious! I will continue to stay The James whenever I visit NYC!

I have stayed at the James twice in the past four months and had an outstanding experience both times. The staff is very warm and welcoming. The rooms, especially the corner rooms, are nicer than what you'd expect in NYC. Location halfway between midtown and Wall Street and walking distance to SOHO and the Village are a plus. Nice rooftop bar with good energy and vibe. Olivier the bartender makes a killer custom bourbon and citrus drink that was a blowaway. Restaurant is unique and differentiated from the normal hotel fare.

The location of the hotel is very good. The lobby is bare and soulless. The staff were very friendly but it felt understaffed.The rooms were tiny and while they were new, they felt that they were down cheaply.The shower door hit the shower head when opening, the full length mirror on the inside of the wardrobe door didn't open fully, the docking station didn't work to play music. Very few plug sockets available.

I stayed here on a business trip as it was close to my meeting and I thought the location would be convenient for shopping and dining in nearby Soho.Check in was fine, they were very nice and efficient when I arrived.My room was tiny and pretty basic. When I got into the room at 5pm, the digital alarm clock read 100am and the date was January 2009!Bathroom was appropriate size to the room size, but the towels in the room were worn and had threads hanging from them.My bathroom sink was clogged and when I left for my dinner meeting, housekeeping came into the room, but did not replace or clean up any of the towels that were laying on the chair, they just closed the curtains and put some chocolates by my bed.

Just arrived from London exhausted after flight and put in Room 17-09. Fell into bed exhausted but there is a continuing dreadful racket as the central heating starts up ever few minus and makes a huge noise and whine and there is no switch that works to switch it off. I feel cheated that I have come to this hotel and paid in advance only to be put in a room which they know is substandard because when I complained just now they seem quite aware of it, and they had other rooms not having this fiasco associated with them, but allocated me and my poor wife to this deadfall situation where we have arrived exhausted after a 12 hour journey from Europe only to be subjected to standards so low as to be wholly unacceptable. There is also a huge racket from the restaurant clearing up.They have done this deliberately. A big fuss was made of seeming to welcome us, but the reality is that by allocating me and my wife to this room on the 17th floor, they were really shafting us.They've got our money in advance - so stuff us with the worst. Dreadful. Despicable. Don't come here.

Had a great stay at The James for business travel. Would love to return for business or leisure travel though. The staff was very helpful, I was in quite a rush when checking in due to a meeting I was running to and they were fast, efficient, kind and the doorman hailed me a taxi quickly. The room itself was gorgeous, large windows overlooking the city, the bathroom was very cool, all glass with a privacy shade, the shower had nice hot water and good pressure. Loved the bathroom amenities and full sized products. Bed was large and comfy, gym is big with great view, the mini bar in room was very well stocked and prices were reasonable. There were robes and slippers. I did not get to use any of the in room dining services, bars or lounges but menus looked nice. The lobby had nice complimentary breakfast items and cookies in afternoon with wine. Phone or ipad chargers for guests use would be nice (front desk did not have one). Walked around area in evening with a friend and it was young and funky. We ducked into a great place to grab a cocktail. Overall a fantastic stay!! I felt a bit like I was staying in Europe while in NYC.

OFF SEASON STAY: I stayed while the outdoor spaces were still closed (March) so many of the negative issues others have cited in association with those and the upstairs rooftop in their reviews were absent during my stay. LOCATION: The location and architecture of the hotel make staying here a real treat. Easy walk to SOHO, Tribeca and subway stations to everywhere else. Access to main lobby is by one single small elevator which got busy during morning departures but otherwise was fine. ROOM: Room was small but modern, highly functional with very nice amenities (see pictures). Bedding and linens were very comfortable. Intelligent Nutrients bathroom amenities and snacks and minibar in room were top shelf. Housekeeping/room cleanliness was excellent but was disappointed to have housekeeping doing their evening turndown rounds after 9pm. Only room complaint was no sockets by bedside (extension cord provided did not function) and there wasn't great light for working near the area with a table. FOOD: David Burke Kitchen's food at dinner was whimsical and delicious and although the restaurant was busy service was smooth and professional. Would have liked to see a dedicated "bar" / "lounge area" with more chair/table seating by the bar instead of tables set for dining as there is really no other place in the hotel to sit for a business meeting (lobby upstairs is unsuitable due to sloping chairs and loud guests!).STAFF: Some of the friendliest staff I've encountered in many stays in NYC. Check in and out were prompt and friendly, bartenders in the restaurant were also helpful and knowledgeable not only about the restaurant but about the hotel and surrounding area.

I was in NYC for a week and for the first 4 nights I stayed in a big-chain "5 star" hotel and that was utterly disappointing. So naturally, I was quite excited to try out an independent boutique hotel with rave reviews. And it definitely lived up to my already high expectations.The excellence started from entering the door. Check-in was swift and personal; details like addressing me by my name, instead of "sir", etc. Room was ready when I checked-in. Whole process was 3 mins flat.Room was clean and doesn't look worn in. Bed was very comfortable. Expansive windows with good views. Location is really good. Close to Soho shopping area and generally walking distance to Tribeca and most subway lines. Also it's a 5 mins walk to Dominique Ansel Bakery of the cronuts fame. Definitely worth the wait. Sky gym affords nice views of lower manhattan, i.e. Freedom Tower and waters. Housekeeping was in no way invasive and rather anticipatory; cleaned without rearranging too many personal items and they seem to know when to turn down your room.Upon check out as I was really rushing for a train at Penn station as a result of lining up for the cronuts, and I haven't packed my luggage, I asked them to prepare all the check out procedures, get a cab at 9.30am sharp, and provide me small bills for a 100. All was done and ready waiting for me. I was out of the hotel in 2 mins after i left my room. Now that's what I call service!The highlight of the stay were its emphasis on design and art and the service. It doesn't hurt that most of its staff are good looking too. I would definitely highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit new york and break away from the big chains.

Best location and beautiful hotel with the most helpful staff that attend to your every need. everything in the room was of the highest quality and most comfortable with great views of the city. We didn't have a chance to go but the restaurant looked very enticing with gorgeous outdoor terraces.

Pros:Excellent location in Soho, close to Tribeca, Noho, LES and everything great that downtown has to offer.Great staff: the NICEST we have ever experienced in a NYC hotel. Great breakfast and terrific room service.Great amenities: coffee in the lobby w/ scones and snacks throughout the dayLots of choices, bars, David Burke Kitchen, nice outdoor spaces, etc. Comfy bedsCons: THE ANNOYING 21 YEAR OLDS at 5 pm, DRUNK, LOUD and PUSHING YOU AGAINST THE ELEVATOR WALL to get to Jimmy's Rooftop Bar.They are loud and rude, and DRUNK in the lobby. Awful scene. We are in our 40's (ancient, I know), and could not believe there was no security around. A few other guests were bothered by this scene too. Also, lots of yelling in the hallway at 2 a.m. Maybe it was just because it was a nice warm evening, after a long winter, or I am just old.Also, wish there were 2 chairs in the room instead of one, but no big deal.I will give The James another try because the staff was just so accommodating and kind, and I love being downtown.Maybe I am just no fun anymore. :(

Very helpful and friendly service, cool location which is very close to broadway and many other shops, boutiques in the surrounding of Soho, clean and stylish rooms and lobby, fantastic sky bar with a great view and a relaxing athmosphere,

The staff here is the nicest anywhere in NY. Every request we made was accommodated. The rooms are very small and other than the very comfortable beds, the furnishings are less than adequate. Only one straight chair for sitting and other than that you have to sit on the bed.......not much moving around space. The bathrooms are very modern and nice.

Lovely, friendly service with fantastic access to true New York. It has a great bar with breath taking views and equally good gym. You're in walking distance of the shopping district abnd bars. I've been on a lot of business trips and this combined work and relaxation perfectly.

Myself & my husband chose to stay at The James mainly due to location. We prefer the Soho/Greenwich Village area of New York - away from the hustle & bustle & more 'touristy' area of Times Square etc. This was perfect - a short walk in either direction to Soho or Greenwich Village - the walk gave you time to really appreciate the areas and especially walking to Greenwich Village the opportunity to view possibly some of the most expensive properties in NYC.The James offered though so much more than just a dream location ....The staff were extremely friendly & nothing appeared to be too much trouble for them . On arrival John at the concierge desk quickly welcomed us & took care of our luggage & called ahead to the reception that we had arrived - the check in process therefore took from arriving to being in the lift taken to our room 5 minutes - ideal after a long delayed flight & a quite 'scary' taxi ride from JFK. All requests made by us to the staff were warmly received - we asked the concierge for the best way to get to the Diamond District one morning & were told instead that the in house car would be able to take us instead for free.When the in house car was not available the concierge had no issues in hailing taxi's for us - never appreciated more than when we were running late for a theatre performance seemingly at the same time as the whole of Manhattan decided to also take a cab - without help we would never had got there on time !!The little touches provided such as coffee & fresh baked scones in the morning, cheese & wine in the evening & the most amazing cookies in the evening all provided free along with the provision of free WiFi throughout the entire hotel really made in our opinion this a stand out hotel - its still shocks me that some 5 star hotels still try to charge for WiFi or any grade hotel really!The rooms were simple & well designed - we stayed on the 14th Floor - views of a bustling NYC were a real 'wow' factor & the large windows allowed you to really appreciate the change in the skylight from morning to the evening - also on a personal note even though the room was air conditioned I really liked the the windows could be opened slightly - nothing beats a blast of fresh air in the morning to clear the cobwebs.The bed was super comfortable and the storage space was well laid out - additional drawers were available under the settee area along with a small table and chair for sitting to dine in room or do work at. The walk in shower in the bathroom was spacious with huge bottles of premium shampoo, conditioner & shower gel provided - I hate the small bottles often provided. Lots of fluffy towels, robes & slippers & an innovative privacy screen in the bathroom ( the bathroom was only separated from the room by a glass screen) made the room a pleasure to return to after a long day walking around NYC.One morning we treated ourselves to breakfast in bed - delivered hot & on time by a lovely lady - the breakfast was gorgeous , nothing missing on the tray & a plentiful supply of tea. My dream morning - in bed eating breakfast watching numerous 'Housewives of ...' on Bravo whilst from the window being able to see NYC waken up.We also treated ourselves to a few late night drinks at the rooftop bar at Jimmy's ......again the staff were attentive & the cocktails were fab - ordering off menu was no problem & again the view was breathtaking .....I would have been happy to spend every night at Jimmy's. For such a luxurious looking bar - almost like a private members bar it did not give off any airs of exclusivity - the staff made everyone feel so welcome that you were not intimidated at all which sometimes I feel when you go to extremely high standard bars.
