The outside terrace and pool though they looked amazing we could not appreciate fully as it was minus 0 in NY during out stay but I could imagine in the summer you would have a blast at Jimmy's ...that pool with that view .....we're booking to go back in the summer just to try it out !All in all what works about this hotel is the little touches & everything has a real thought behind it - from the extra magnifying mirror in the bathroom to the in room duty free bar (Patron,Grey Goose,Makers Make......you could have a field day by not even leaving the room) to the lovely bottle of red wine & hand written note we received from guest services to the chocolates left at turn down to the staff whom nothing was too much trouble - this hotel should be a great pride to all who work there as it is amazing & I think we've just found 'our NY hotel.' Can't wait to return !

My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The James. The Hotel is well kept and perfectly located in the heart of Soho. I would especially like to commend Morgan Cohen for assisting under extraordinary circumstances . We would definitely stay there again.

The staff was great on all levels. The room was perfect! We ended up getting a free room upgrade and getting the most beautiful view of the city. It's pricey but well worth it if it's a special occasion.

Good location for business easy to Soho and subway. Excellent facilities and amenities. Really like the view and the design. Staff very attentive Look forward to my next stay. Is now my 'go to' in NYC.

We stayed at the James for my husband's work. From the moment we arrived we were spotted and ushered to the check in desk. The staff was genuinely warm, pleasant, and helpful. We had an awesome view from the 6th floor and the room was modern and clean. I loved the glass elevator that brought us to the check in desk. The bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows and a down comforter. The bathroom is enclosed in glass with an electric shade for privacy. The amenities in the shower were large bottles as opposed to the small towelettes. The flat screen tv was a bit on the small side, however, there is plenty to do in this part of town, so the tv would not be getting much use anyway. Awesome place to stay and we cannot wait to go back here soon.
user_location: Three Bridges, New Jersey, United States
user_name:
karenm245
Three Bridges, New Jersey, United States

review_body: My two night stay at The James was a stylish pleasure from start to finish. Located downtown just north of Canal St, it is proximate to the A/C/E, 1, and 6 subway lines within a 1-5min walk. The first thing you notice about The James, besides its discreet, modern entrance with minimal signage, is that it is tall and essentially perched on stilts, putting it higher than many of the nearby buildings. The lobby itself is a short elevator ride from the street level reception area where the doormen warmly greet people.The lobby, and all areas of the hotel, are modern and filled with contemporary art (carefully marked with signs, like a museum or gallery). The staff I dealt with at the front desk were all uniformly friendly and helpful and, while I can't recall all their names, they were kind enough to remember mine the entire time I was there. Also in the lobby is complimentary computer terminals and a variety of light snacks (scones, fruit, cookies, crackers, cheese, coffee, wine) throughout the day. The ability to grab a little snack or drink on my way in and out of a hotel is always a much welcomed plus with me.With a prior request, I got 1606, a high-floor room on the with an open western view of the Hudson and distant planes landing at Newark (and the approach to the Holland tunnel, but in a good way!). With dark wood floors, high ceilings, large windows and a glass wall between bathroom and bedroom (more on that momentarily) the smallish room was striking. The desk & chair area looked mid-century modern, but probably wouldn't be well-suited to doing serious hours hunched over a laptop. The platform bed had crisp sheets and down bedding for a very cozy, restful night's sleep. I will say the dark wood shows a bit of wear that a lighter color might not, and there were some definite signs of food traffic on the area rug. Not horrible, but a clear reminder that lots of people had been there before you--which is never a plus in a hotel.Now, the bathroom with its glass stall shower, high end fixtures, and clear dividing wall could be seen as a selling point or a major repellant depending on your sense of privacy, style, and with whom you are traveling. Though there is an art-covered screen between bath and bed you can raise or lower with the push of a button, it is still quite translucent and may not be to everyone's taste. I was traveling solo and my room didn't face any residential buildings, so I wasn't too concerned. Others might be. This high-style spot was great for me, but I think it would be suited most to fashion-forward sorts who want visual stimulation, a downtown location, and aren't shy with any traveling companions they may have. Though the staff is certainly friendly, it doesn't strike me as a good place for families.

I stayed at The James only for one night, and the service and facilities were simply amazing! I asked for a special request of champagne and rose petals for my room, and it was exactly what I wanted!.

We stayed at the James for 4 days. The location is perfect in order to discover SOHO and take advantage of the great restaurants in Tribeca. Our room was nice, not too small and very well designed. The roof top bar turned into a night club on Friday night which was nice! The staff are very friendly. Interesting feature is the breakfast in the room which comes complimentary.

i had to travel to nyc for work this week and had an amazing stay at the james. it's a beautiful hotel with all the class of a $500/night place -- at half the price. the rooms are perfect and the service is incredible. erica in room service was a real standout employee. highly recommend this hotel for discerning business travelers.

We recently had a wonderful weekend stay here. Having been to NYC too many times to count, but usually staying in Mid-town or the Upper East Side, we found this the perfect launching pad to explore Soho with all it has to offer. The staff was genuine without a hint of stiffness which is often present at comparable boutique hotels. The room had amazing views and was not only comfortable, but the unique art both in the rooms and in the public spaces really sets this hotel apart. We look forward to staying here again soon.

Stayed at the James with friends to wine, dine and visit the theatre in NYC. The room was small but perfect. Clean, sleek, and modern. Great complimentary coffee in the AM, free wifi and a phenomenal bed with a soft, fresh down comforter will get me there again. Staff was very friendly and made us feel welcome.

fantastic upscale hotel experience, great location, great view from corner room, clean, prompt, great service, david burke kitchen is amazing. would definitely recommend and would definitely stay again next time.

Felt pampered the entire stay! Hand written notes, chocolates, fruit and cookies brought to the room on the regular! The staff was VERY friendly and always was trying to accomodate. The rooms are a good size and everything felt very clean and well kept. Beds are VERY comfortable.

I love this hotel. It's lobby is unassuming but quite comfortable with great views, making it a nice place if you don't want all of the hustle and bustle that a lot of NY hotel lobbies have. They have a lovely wine & cheese complimentary happy hour, as well as scrumpious scones and coffee in the mornings. The rooms are hardwood floors with minimal, modern decor. The bathrooms have a great design and layout, including a glass wall between the bathroom and bedroom with an electronic shade to let in light or allow for more privacy. The beds/pillows are VERY comfortable. Great views every time I have stayed there as well. Good location - right on the edge of Soho and Tribeca. Friendly and accommodating staff. I highly recommend this hotel.

My sister, niece, and I were excited to have a girl's weekend in NYC. We usually stay at the Trump SOHO but decided to try staying at the James Hotel and had read many positive reviews about it. However, it was a disappointing stay at the James. On our reservation, we had ordered a roll away bed. Unfortunately, it was not delivered to our room and we had to make three requests from the front desk and when it finally arrived, the sheets were never put on the bed. The television was not working properly and when we called the desk we were told there was a signal problem with many of the televisions and only certain channels could be viewed. The staff was unfriendly and argumentative when we brought concerns to their attention. We had ordered the Winter Special package which included breakfast and drinks, but later found out that we were charged for these on our bill. When looking for additional outlets for our cell phones, we discovered a plate with chocolates in a night table drawer-not sure if these were left from the previous guests.This hotel has great potential and it is a shame that the service left such a bad taste for us. I hope the hotel will improve for future guests.

I had a fantastic experience, my girlfriend and I spent valentine's day at the hotel. I planned to propose to her and the hotel staff (in special Samara Speller) setup every request I asked of from rose petals in the room, to restaurant suggestions and reservations. I was very impressed with their excitement and support towards setting everything up. It was truly a special experience for the two of us.

In the city that doesn't sleep, finding a place to escape it all makes your experience of NYC all the better. The James delivers in spades when it comes to a pleasant destination, comfortable hospitality and good value. I have stayed at the James multiple times for an extended period two years ago. The staff, especially in-room dining and styling, remembered my like of almond milk, making sure it was available, my need for two bottles of water in the evening and my like of a particular white wine that was always put in my room. Two years later I am back and delighted to find many of the same faces who remembered the almond milk, water and wine, not to mention were very enthusiastic to welcome me back. The design of the hotel is perfectly appointed and understated. All that you might need and nothing more. The art is unique and well presented. The amenities perfectly satisfying without being too "studied" or too "standard". I will say that the rooftop bar and pool make for the only counterpoint to the quietude of the rest of the experience especially when eager goers find their way clamoring through the lobby to find their way to the roof. And, if you are on the highest floor, you will find yourself irked by the noise. So, make sure to book yourself in a room no higher than the 15th floor! And, when you're ready to head back into the city, you will find Soho and TriBeCa at your beck and call, not to mention in one of the city's most accessible points. Though tucked downtown, you are a stone's through from the main access points to everywhere in the city. As for the food, David Burke's cuisine, both in the restaurant and in-room dining is really stand out!

Stayed at the James 1/23-1/26 & could not have had a better experience. Location, location, location! We wanted to do a lot of shopping, so this hotel is ideal for walking to all the premium shops that have moved into SOHO over the years. Also, some of the best food spots are in the area like Ben's Pizza, La Esquina, Blue Ribbon, Balthazar, etc... The concierge, Morgan, was kind & helpful- she helped get us in to some pretty exclusive clubs & also went above and beyond to celebrate our birthdays. Our first evening we came home to a chocolate covered red velvet cake that said "happy birthday" with a sweet note from the hotel. The rooms are nicely decorated with an awesome bathroom- see through optional (you can close the shade if you don't want the person in the bedroom to see you in the shower), and super comfy bed. Even though this was a girls trip, I would HIGHLY recommend it to couples, as they have some "fun" items on the mini bar & again the "see through bathroom". Lastly, they have a wine and cheese happy hour from 6-8 with good wine & cheese- which you don't always get when it is "complimentary". Then of course coffee and pastries in the morning. I can promise you we will be back & I have stayed at other "top" 4 and 5 star NYC hotels, but it is hard to beat this location and customer service. The A,C,E train is right there as well.

Stayed at The James in December for a combination business trip mini vacation. Loved the location. So close to shopping in Soho and really great restaurants as well. Easy cab ride up town to Rockefeller Center and more shopping. Staff at the hotel very friendly and very accommodating. Loved that they had coffee and snacks in the lobby in the morning. The lobby area is very bright and comfortable and a nice place to gather. Restaurant is really good too. Wish we had known it was dog friendly. We may have brought ours.

Location convenient to SoHo, Tribeca, Greenwich Village make this excellent choice for exploring lower Manhattan. Hotel is attractively modern in feel. Staff first rate, amenities only average for its cost, room was fair at best. Arrival was smoothly handled by pleasent staff. Received Strawberries/Champagne for our anniversary. Burst pipe had taken out passenger elevators and lobby a major inconvenience for entire stay but no price accommodation offered. Table and single chair small and uncomfortable. TV viewable by two only from bed. Bed comfortable but pillows very small and poor quality. Storage barely adequate for two people for two days. King Deluxe room had little room for anything other than the bed. Room was for sleeping and showering, don't plan on doing any work, dining or lounging.
user_name:
james c
New York City, New York

review_body: We were in the city just for a fun night. And from the time we checked in until we checked out we had a great experience. The shopping was close and less crowds than staying near times square. We stayed on a very cold day and it was still fun. It helps that they have wine and cheeses in the evening. And restaurants in the hotel, so you don't have to leave if you don't want to.

The James was a fantastic experience. My boyfriend and I stayed one night in a deluxe room and enjoyed the accommodating and friendly staff, delicious David Burke kitchen located right downstairs and in room service. There were also complimentary snacks and beverages in the lobby throughout the day which was lovely. Scones and coffee in the morning, fruit and water in the afternoon, wine and cheese in the evening and cookies for dessert. The room was clean, bright and had a simple and modern soho design with fantastic bath products and rainfall shower as well as comfy robes and slippers. Overall it was one of the best hotel experiences I have had yet.

Stay here. This is an excellent hotel situated near fun shopping and dining in SoHo. The staff, the views, the design, the location... all are excellent. The rooftop bar, "Jimmy", offers amazing views of the city and even has a pool. We are still raving about our stay here!
user_name:
Mr. John P D
New York

review_body: We stayed at The James for 5 nights shortly after a storm had caused damage to several rooms and the guest elevators were inoperable. There were several unhappy guests as the only working elevator was the staff elevator. While it was frustrating, every single staff member we encountered had a smile on their face and were incredibly helpful. The hotel is in a perfect location with a subway station around the corner. There are endless shops and great restaurantsnear by. We especially liked the big, fluffy towels and the heated bathroom floors. I would like to especially thank Samara for all her help. We would definitely stay at The James again.

A nice alternative in lower Manhattan, feels more like private studios than a hotel as the facilities aren't extensive but the restaurant and gym work well. The rooms aren't spacious but comfortable and blessed with glass walls giving great views of Manhattan. Nice quiet sleeping conditions with an almost silent AC. Location wise, surrounded by the great eateries of Soho so worth a go.

I cannot wait to go back! Room was amazing, staff was super friendly and helpful. I would love to go back when the weather is nicer to enjoy the outdoor seating and rooftop bar. Kudos to The James Hotel!
user_name:
Ms Leigh Anne M
Shavertown, Pennsylvania

review_body: Room was small but cozy, Service very friendly and Accomodating. BEST SLEEP I HAVE HAD IN MONTHS... They can't do much about the traffic around the hotel-that would be my only complaint-getting dropped off 2 blocks away could save you 35 minutes around rush hr/dinner time

We loved our stay at James Hotel, Soho!!! We found the hotel was vet beautiful and stylish, the service was excellent, the rooms were lovely and with great views. Overall it was comfortable, clean and all looked brand new. Also it has a very nice rooftop bar!! Finally, we found the location to be perfect and very close to nice shops and restaurants in the beautiful Soho! Overall, excellent and highly recommended!!

After a less-than-perfect stay at the James Royal Palms earlier in the week, I was hoping a return visit to their SoHo property would be better. And it was. The location in the southwest corner of SoHo is good for walking or subway access, comfortable room, and despite proximity to the elevator - quiet. A King room is still pretty small so if you've got two people, corner rooms are better and have fabulous bathrooms (three cheers for heated floors!). Only design concept I don't get at both the MIA and NYC properties is the whole bench-instead-of-chair concept -- it's rock hard, small and just an uncomfortable place to sit. Service here far surpassed the MIA experience.

Fabulous hotel with great service located in SoHo. The staff and service were A++. I had a corner room on the 9th floor and the view was fantastic. Rooms are somewhat small but it's NYC so this should not come as a surprise. The food at the David Burke Kitchen stellar. The fried oysters appetizer was a real treat and the short-rib main was so tender you didn't need a knife. There's also a neat-looking contraption at the bar which they use to heat up yummy apple cider and is fun to watch. I would come back here in heartbeat.

What a wonderful staff -- filled with enthusiasm and a comfort with being "of service." From Eric at the door, to Chris who walked us up 15 flights of stairs after the pipes burst in the recent "polar vortex," the staff was exactly as the management would wish. Speaking of management, Amy was kind and upbeat and no one seemed overwhelmed or frustrated by the challenges they faced. The rooms are cool looking, clean and restful after rushing through NYC.

Cool hotel, with attentive and very friendly staff. We were there during a 'hundred year' cold snap which caused pipes to burst, creating a fair amount of confusion. The staff was brillantand showed continuous grace under pressure while dealing with a sudden, and untoward, situation. The lobby is nicely done in what I'll call 'casually chic'. The rooms are a nice sizefor NYC. Incredible views from the rooftop bar and deck. Tasty treats in the lobby throughoutthe day, as well as WiFi (which actually works!) are complementary. Small but nicely appointedgym also has great views, particularly for a gym. The on site David Burke restaurant is attractive, cool, and our meals were superb. Two different subway lines are a 3 minute walk from the front door. Have already booked again for later this year, and would certainly recommend to those who wish to stay in this part of town.

My wife and I stayed at The James for a weekend in December. The staff was extremely attentive and friendly. Whenever you hear "I have good news and bad news", you never expect it to be good overall. However, the good news was that we were getting a surprise upgrade, and the bad news is that we needed to wait 10 minutes for them to finish cleaning it. To pass the time, we partook in the happy hour free wine and cheese that was available to us.Our room had a great view of the city, the picture of which is now my wife's screen saver. Overall, an excellent experience.
user_name:
Jeff R
Mahwah, New Jersey, USA

review_body: The hotel is very cool in my opinion. It is the opposite of a sweet or girlie hotel. Love the bathroom amenities; shampoo, shower gel and conditioner, they are all very special and not in those small bottles neither in attached to the wall dispenser.We got the corner room and it was pretty, optimum view because of the glasses walls. New York hotels are famous to be small so we cannot really complain about the size. One thing that I didn't like about the room was that it was freezing, it might because that the corner room used glasses as the walls.I was expecting more from the bar on the top floor, it was more like a place to work for some people when we tried to go there in one afternoon, no music, a pity as we got free cocktail voucher for two. In-room dining burger was very good. We tried once to have lunch in the hotel but could not find the restaurant, it might be that the patio area which we went to for that lunch time was not opened in October, fair enough. Breakfast was fantastic, it was inclusive with the room for us, but since it was à la carte you can see how much they are if you have to pay, and that makes you feel good :)

This hotel was a great value, especially given it's location in NYC. I was impressed with the room ammenities..coffee:) The bath products were great and the room was very comfortable and well appointed.

My first review on tripadvisor as I have never been impressed enough to write one before.An excellent hotel. Reception staff and concierge could not have been more helpful.Excellent rooms and the food and drinks available in the reception are a nice touch.Good views from many of the windows and a very good gym.Can only praise this hotel, made our stay very special.
user_name:
Mr Douglas R
Inverness, United Kingdom

review_body: Second time in three years at this spectacular hotel with excellent service and location in Soho.And we will be back. Staring the mornings at the Gym just below the rooftop pool and taking the morning bath, enjoying breakfast at the poolside overlooking the south of Manhattan. Well, that is a real top notch urban vacation.

Great hotel great location great staffWe would recommend it but we don't want you knowing about it because it's too good !Kenny on the door is magnificent, Eddie, Amy and Morgan are fabulous in fact you won't find a nicer more helpful bunch in NYC :)

Please note I have not stayed at this hotel. I am sure it is wonderful, but I can tell you I am not impressed with the treatment I am getting. I am desperately trying to order from amenities for a guest that is staying at the HOTEL, celebrating! I have ordered through the hotel ....as per their requirements, Champaign and Chocolates, and a special cake. I am on day two dealing with this ...it is the end of day two...everything was to be delivered by 4pm today..still my cc has not been charged and my e mails are not being answered. When I call the hotel, I get excused...if this is how they operate, for something as simple as this, I would hate to stay there.
user_name:
brightonnyc
New York City, New York

review_body: Very good location on 6th Avenue with Greenwich village and Broadway 5 minute walk away. Canal St subway, corner deli within 2 minute walk.Suite was spacious, quiet, equipped with desk and complimentary internet.Good security particularly after hours.

Loved our stay here. Hotel was lovely and so were all the staff. The staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful; trying to help us with tours and answering any questions. Jimmy's on the roof terrace is amazing too. Can't wait to return!

We satyed twice at the James in December 13 and had a great time everytime. Rooms are small but huge window make them feel bigger. The service is great: they would provide complementary scones and coffee each morning and wine and cheese and night. Toughtful and convenient!Jimmy's, the bar on the rooftop is an amazing place to have a drink as well!

This is our 4th time staying at The James. We feel so welcomed by the staff, they remembered who we were after the first stay. The outdoor spaces are restful & beautiful. The artwork is a special edition. We are ceramic artists so we really appreciate the architecture, decor & extras the hotel offers.

Overall excellent experience! I am changing an upcoming reservation to be at this hotel, based on this positive experience. Eddie at the front desk especially was terrific - very friendly and helpful, flexible with a room change at our request. Love the free water (and eco-friendly versions), love the free wifi, coffee and printing, etc. Lobby and the bar Jimmy are great, and we enjoyed DB Kitchen.Minor things - we had to bring up the upgrade option I had booked online, rather than have it addressed proactively at check-in. Would prefer different scents of bathroom amenities instead of the peppermint or other ones available, but this is not a big deal.

Stayed Dec 19-23 in the one bedroom suite. We loved our room and the corner views in both the living room and bedroom! Wonderful hospitality from every staff member we came across. I'm not sure how many rooms the hotel has, but it felt like a very small intimate boutique hotel with all the amenities of a full service hotel. Location was superb. Walking distance to all the shopping in Soho and plenty of restaurant choices nearby. I especially liked the convenience of a small Deli next to the hotel for a quick (inexpensive) bite if needed.I recently stayed at the Trump Soho in July and there really is no comparison. The James wins hands down in every aspect. Attention to detail in their rooms, hospitality and friendliness. I would return to stay here on my next trip in NYC.

The James is the only place you should consider staying if you're traveling to NYC. Amazing location, amazing decor and the friendliest staff at any place in the city that I've stayed!!!! Amazing food and drinks as well.

Had to travel up to NYC to see my daughter and wanted to stay near her, in SOHO. I found The James on line and the price was very descent - considering its NYC at Christmas time.The city was pure chaos, but the Hotel was quiet, and well run. A little thrown by the casual door men, but once inside everyone was very professional. Clean room, very simple - wouldn't want to live in it for a week but for a few days it was just fine.Modern, cool. Would not bring little kids - not the atmosphere for that. Everything was really small - no running around space.Overall very satisfied and will stay there again.

My wife and I had a short stay in SOHO. We informed the James that we would be arriving early and hoped for early checkin. Well, we arrived even earlier than we said we would and they still were able to happily accommodate us. The doormen and front-desk staff are simply exceptional.

I had a very pleasant stay there on a business trip.The rooms are well equipped and the bedding is excellenthowever the common reception area is a bit small.I did not try the restaurant that is in the same building as the Hotel,although the menu looked tempting.

Two night pre-holiday getaway. Things I like about The James- the location is fantastic. SoHo is such a great neighborhood. Restaurants and retail galore. Yogaworks yoga studio nearby. The design of the hotel remains unique. The public spaces are intriguing, inviting, eclectic. The staff- friendly, efficient, available. David Burke kitchen- food was good, service a bit uneven in that they kind of leave you alone to linger which is fine if you want to linger, but just check on us every once in a while because eventually I need the bill and to get going. Valet parking cost a bit steep. If you are there on a weekend you just might find some on street parking which will save you a bundle. View from our room (which was incredibly well designed and while small did not feel small because of the excellent design). Didn't make it to the rooftop bar because when I was inclined to go it was closed for a private party. That actually bugs me that spaces that are supposed to be available to hotel guests are suddenly not available, but it's not like my mentioning it will change anything. I will enjoy the rooftop pool when I return. There is something otherworldly about being able to swim while lofted high in the sky. If the pool was heated and open I would have done it in December, but, alas, the pool is closed for the season. Room service was prompt. Room was very clean. There are a lot of boutique hotels in NYC- The James is right up there at the top. I will return!

The manager and front desk attendant are really fantastic and went out of their way to make my stay more pleasant. We were placed in a noisy room even after my reservation clearly requested "quiet and away from the eleveator." They did eventually move us to a quieter room when one became available but packing up and moving to another room was annoying. Condition of the rooms? Could use a little refreshing, as they are beginning to show signs of wear. Our bed was comfortable but the base had missing paint, and there were broken/missing tiles in our shower. After two calls to Guest services about picking up another guests dry cleaning that was mistakenly left in our room, still no response. Whoever it was that asked for rush service to have their shirt cleaned must have been quite upset. The shirt was still in our closet four days later when we checked out. Also, the doorman kept telling me the driver of the car service was not available when the driver was clearly sitting right out front on the street. Perhaps the doorman felt the tip we left him was insufficient and blacklisted us.

Came for some quick fun, shopping etc. Happy hour wine and cheese, AM coffee bar with scones. The Roof top bar was great, the bartender was an A+ with a great Sazerac. Great dinner at David Burkes Kitchen(sans bday candle). And Kenny the bellman totally rocks the service!! Thanks

An amazing service - stuff went over their way to help, best location (in Soho), beautiful view to the Hudson river. I was even able to go jogging by the river! Jimmy bar was hip. Too bad no Twin rooms but the KIng size bed was big enough!

My recent stay at The James was great. My room had a beautiful view, tons of light and was extremely comfortable. Loved the privacy shade in the bathroom. Bed was great, everything was clean and would return again. If you want to stay in the SoHo or Tribeca area, this is a great choice. The only thing I didn't love were the toiletries. I know they are organic, but the smell was too strong for my personal taste, especially the lotion. If you're picky, just bring your own.

November 2013Every square inch of the hotel is covered in hard floors so if you so much as whisper, it reverberates up and down the hallways and into the rooms. I was on the 17th floor, same floor as the gym and bar. With my clock set for a 4am wake up for an early flight, I attempted to turn in around 10p. The cleaning crew started banging around at 11p in the gym and then moved to the bar at midnight. Finally I got so fed up I went storming down the hall in my underwear and asked the cleaning crew what the hell was going on. They were vacuuming, cleaning and yucking it up in the gym with the doors open to the hallway. I called the front desk afterward to complain and the little dude patronized me by saying he would come up there right away. When I hung up, I heard the little front desk dude on the two way radio telling the crew to be quiet (the two-way radio exchange was even louder than the crew on their own). I called right back and got the same little dude and he had the nerve to tell me he had already been “up there” and spoken with the crew. I yelled and asked, “Do you think I am stupid? You didn’t have time to come up here and I just heard you on the two-way radio!”Finally got about two hours sleep as I was so hyped up. Also when you take the elevator during early hours of the morning, it won’t stop on the lobby floor. You have to go to ground level and then take a separate elevator or stairs back up to the lobby.Horrible experience, would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to sleep.

Really cool hotel, from decor to friendliness of entire staff. Perfect location for checking out soho, TriBeCa, entire downtown area. Very convenient to subway lines going uptown as well. Highly recommend this hotel.

When you reach the hotel, you are in the heart of Soho, but you don't feel the hechtic of the comercial área. The hotel architecture is modern, simple, lighted all over, the views from the studios and the big apartments are beautiful. The location one block away from the A,C,E Metro lines is perfect and also 2 blocks away from the USPS. We'd like a more generous offer of complimentary drink and food during the day and evenings, and more personnel at the ground floor.
user_name:
Ms. Laura Irene R
New York

review_body: My partner and I stayed at The James for one night and we really enjoyed it. The staff greeted us upon arrival and called up to the check in desk. Once we took the elevator up, we were greeted immediately. We were allowed to check in several hours earlier (wonderful). The room was small but awesome. The view was excellent, the room quiet, the bedding divine - we both had excellent night sleeps. The shower is great as are the bathroom amenities. We had free wine and cheese in the lobby as well as cookies at night. In the morning, they had strong coffee and crumpets free, too. The energy of the space is very good, the staff very nice, and the location easy access and good for surrounding areas. The only thing where they could have been more helpful is the doormen - they did not help us hail a cab in the rain nor offer up directions. Regardless of that, we would stay here again and highly recommend the hotel. It is a really beautiful place.

Very nice hotel, with the warmth of small homey hotel, but the elegance and amenities of a full service luxury hotel. The rooms are both rich and warm, while being clean and simple. Great location, and the staff are intuitive and helpful.The rooms have lots of windows with feels so great in a city like New York. The hardwood floor and free filtered water delivered to your room every day, is a nice perk.

wonderful hotel, rooms were nice and open. Iris was great, Crystal not so friendly. Rest of the staff amazing. a few minor hiccups but definitely a top hotel and very modern. Great rooftop bar and super clean hotel. highly recommended

Stayed here on a visit with friends in the area. I had placed an earlier request for a King room but was assigned a Queen. After a few minutes I was given a new room, with a smile and keys brought right up. Great views from the room, and one of most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. Enjoyed both the rooftop bar for drinks with friends and the David Burke Kitchen for breakfast. Hotel room was very quiet, and the large shower was lovely. Very friendly staff, casual but chic, and so helpful to out of towners.

Although virtually all my business meeting were in MidTown, I like to try different hotels and neighbourhoods and selected The James in Soho and a stone's from Tribeca and a three minute walk from the heart of Canal Street.Great location, friendly service, wonderful corner room and free wi-fi (that's really important) - highly recommended.Just one moan - the toiletries were absolutely brutal. Definitely not mild or gentle.

We love this hotel! It's chic but friendly, hip but not pretentious. Loved the decor! The room was small but perfect. The space is used so efficiently and it was very comfortable. We would definitely stay here again!
user_name:
Ms. Randy Sokol S
New York

review_body: Stayed here back in August for 6 days. The James offers luxurious rooms which are so clean and comfortable, they allow you to awake with the perfect energy to tackle whatever you need to do in busy, busy NYC. The Staff, from the doormen to the room servers, are extremely personable. Perfect everything... And I have the ability to criticize the smallest imperfection

Julio is the best part of the hotel!Actually, the whole staff is super friendly and very helpful! Thank you.Instead of going out one of our nights because I was exhausted (breast cancer) my niece came to hotel and they brought up all the fixings for a magnificent margarita!
user_name:
Lolly B
Santa Fe, New Mexico

review_body: Great hotel and service was very good! Only downside was the David Burke restaurant and was disappointed that they didn't seat you on time with your reservation. However, the hotel itself was great and room service and Treehouse were wonderful in providing services for eating!

Come here for husbands birthday in Oct. We came in early from a red eye. We notified the hotel we would be getting in early and they were able to accommodate us immediately upon our arrival. It was so unexpected and made for a great start to our trip because we were able to settle in and nap. Our room was small (as to be expected) and the bed very comfortable. We ended up in our room everyday to nap so therefore spent a decent amount of time in the room and felt very comfortable. We were able to walk to all that soho has to offer so we really didn't need to take as many cabs as we used to. The upstairs bar Jimmy was perfect. We went up there almost every night to finish of the evening. It had great views and not too crowded. We would stay here again.

Let's just say the James SOHO exceeded my expectations. The little things and the attention to details is what makes this hotel stands out. Finding a bottle of champagne as a thank you gesture in my suite was simply brilliant! Thank you for having us, and will definitely stay at the James next time.
user_name:
madridista420
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Everybody made us feel welcome and it was never anything that was too much trouble to do , service on all topics was excellent, people play a huge part in making the experience special and The James got it right, thanks.

A greatly located, modern, comfortable hotel on the edge of Soho/Tribeca. Walking distance from the Canal Street Train Station. We enjoyed our five day stay at this hotel; dined and had breakfast at David Burkes' restaurant several times; and went to Jimmy's, the bar at the rooftop which was buzzing with good music and fun people.

Awesome view for certain, just the overall size of a corner studio was pretty cramped. Definitely don't book a couples massage in room - you'll barely have room for the masseuse to work around one another. The view was the highlight.

A thoroughly modern, grown up and comfortable hotel which reminded me initially of a few other NY competitors, notably the Standard East Village, which are frankly a little more affordable. This place does justify the extra $$ however: a wonderfully located gym, on or near the top floor, with great views over Manhattan; very warm and perfectly pitched service throughout my stay.

Just got back to the UK from NYC and 3 nights at The James. Excellent hotel and would most certainly recommend. Staff, especially Kenny, are great, location is superb, views from the room are amazing and when you step outside the luxury you are in Soho! Perfection. Will definitely return.

We stayed in the Deluxe King room on the 12th floor. Very roomy, very classy. The bed was so incredibly comfortable, the bathroom was spacious and clean. Loved everything about this place! The nightly wine and cheese reception was delightful, as were the nightly chocolates left in our room. We will be back!

Stayed for a weekend at the James. In many ways this is a great property - location, stunning views, well designed, two superb outdoor places (terrass and roof), low key charming service, beautiful and well planned room, great shower etc. It was all set out to be a perfect and very comfortable weekend. Unfortunately, in the end the hotel seems to miss that final touch / attention to detail to ensure perfection:- stayed in a room on the 17th floor, just below the bar. Was warned there could be disturbance during the bar service. Sure - DJ, music and a lot of people but actually not that bad. However, once the bar closed it sounded like the demolition crew had moved it and it lasted until early morning. The clean up of the bar was done in a way more appropriate for a building site than a hotel. Simple fix - am sure the clean up could be done with some more care and everyone would be happier ...- upon check out we asked to have our bags picked up and we would collect them from the door man in 2h time. Leaving for the airport, the bags were nowhere to be found. A 5 min turn around became a 30 min chasing frenzie and in the end they were found in our room, not yet picked up ... Small things but those are the ones making a difference between good average and excellence. Thought of sharing these experiences with the General Manager in order to help them improve for the future, no response was ever received to my email ...All in all, the fundaments for an outstanding hotel are in place but still not there.

Our stay at The James was unforgettable! The rooms are well appointed, they think of every detail (our fav was the late night snack). It was the people of The James that made the biggest impression. We felt instantly welcomed and our evey care was anticipated. Eric was the best! He took a genuine interest in us and made our trip very memorable. We will be back!
user_name:
Carolyn B
Chicago, Illinois, United States

review_body: Have stayed at The James twice and it is by far my favorite place to stay. Service, rooms, all the employees, food, location are just the best. It is definitely five star in my book. I feel as if I know all the staff personally and they do everything to make you comfortable. They even have drivers available to take you to locations when asked. The hotel is perfectly situated for just about all locations we wish to go. Can't wait to go back. V Hoover

Good things:- Great staff and service- Coffee in the morning in the lobby- Morgan the concierge is amazing!Could be better:- Rooms are SMALL. Not sure how they quote 29sq.m on their website. What I experienced was much less than that. I have stayed in so many hotels in my life, and I was shocked by the small size of the room. I was in a Standard King room, and there was no place for the luggage. We had to put them on the small couch... and there is barely any space to move around. The bathroom is of decent size though.- Hotel entrance is not impressive, its from the side of the hotel, with the reception on the 1st floor. Not a 5 star experience.- Room service was very poor. We ordered the margarita pizza and the burger. Definitely nothing to remember, especially when it comes to the pizza which was tiny, with poor toppings, and was crunchily burnt!For the rate this hotel was charging, I had high expectations. For such high rates, many other options exist in New York, with bigger and nicer rooms...

Hands down the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in... at least that I can remember anyway!The James sure know how to do accommodation and service. Our room on the downtown east corner was drop dead divine - see the pics I took after we arrived. Loved the bathroom - so good I got over the fact there was no bath (and that's big for me). The toiletries were beautiful. The lobby has a lovely vibe and it was great being able to wander down and enjoy the complimentary food and drinks. The staff were great. The concierge chaps and doormen we dealt with were warm, friendly and super helpful - with zero hipster attitude, which is always a risk in upmarket, downtown NYC establishments. I wish I'd gotten their names to mention them here. The front desk staff seem to work very long hours - they'd be there late at night and again early the very next morning, but managed to stay cheerful and professional. Our room was beautifully made up each day too. Overall the service was wonderful. Where The James missed the mark for me was the hospitality side of equation. The restaurant was a major disappointment when we tried it for breakfast. The rooftop bar Jimmy has a great fit out and is obviously very hip but it was not a place I wanted to spend time in because it was a hassle to access and not very comfortable. Also tried the garden bar one evening but it was late and full of young drunken city workers so wasn't conducive to having a relaxing glass of wine which is what we wanted. They had the most impressive in-room snacks/minibar - a unique opportunity to sample some amazing products. Happily being in such a great location it was easy to walk out the door and find great places to eat and drink, particularly with the station for the ACE subway line around the corner. And the shopping! I thoroughly recommend The James to anyone. The location, comfort and warmth of the staff make it a delight.

I travel to New York in December most years. For the last 3 I've stayed (due to the preferences of others) in Soho, last time out in The James which, I was promised was the coolest new place in the area. Well, maybe. The rooftop bar is certainly a plus (although less so in December than in July I guess) However, beyond this, I just find I still resent the room being marginally smaller than my bathroom is at home and the service being distant / detached when in a hotel of this size and price bracket it should be a real strength. There's nothing terribly wrong with The James, but don't buy the hype, there's nothing terribly right about it either.

I recently booked a stay at The James and I have already recieved offers of help with my transport from JFK and resturant reservations. Also I have been enrolled in their eStandby upgrade programme.....really looking forward to my stay!!!S Emmett

I went with my mother and father who are 78 and 76. We had a perfect stay at the hotel. The staff was wonderful- (Peter <3 did a fabulous job). Maria did our rooms so well. The rooms were tasteful and clean and had wonderful views. Perfectly situated in Soho, walking distance to Tribeca, Chinatown, Little Italy etc. Great shopping area. Cute small restaurants. I will go back to this hotel, next time with my daughters and husband. All generations can enjoy this hotel, the pool on the roof is wonderful if you want to relax!

Dear Morgan & the James team,I wanted to sincerely thank you all for making this trip a memory that Natalie and I will never forget. Your attention and genuine attention to each of us made us both feel like we were staying amongst friends and family. From beginning the plans with Morgan to a heartfelt goodbye from Kenny, it was again beyond all expectations. Please give my thanks to everyone and I look forward to seeing you all again soon. Best,Sam & Natalie
user_name:
Sam S
Santa Monica, California, United States

review_body: We stayed for a short 4 day break and it really helped to make a special holiday. Great location in the trendy Soho area with some great amenities. Definitely worth trying the restaurant, although a touch pricy the food was great, try the Surf and Turf special if you can.The staff were generally very friendly and the concierges, Peter especially, went out of their way to help.

We spent a week staying at The James. We had a great leisurely lunch in the courtyard in the garden on our first day.. great food...lovely ambience. The rooftop bar, Jimmy's - has amazing views. We had a corner king room which was roomy by New York standards... sleekly furnished..nice big bathroom. Best part was really the staff. Incredibly friendly - addressed us by name and were lovely about engaging with us. Our pup appreciated the water and treats that are at the front. The combination of the modern stream line decor and spaces in combination with a really caring staff was a home run!

Awesome roof top bar ambience. Modern, neat, cool and with a great restaurant below.Too far south for us.Staff at roof top bar pool area, reservations, room service and front desk - all lacking alacrity, initiative, supervision, etc.Concierge staff - great!, very helpful and willing.

I have stayed at The James numerous times. The service is wonderful and the rooms are beautifully designed. The location is terrific to all downtown destinations. The concierge staff are always eager to help with hard to get reservations. We love the morning coffee and pastries set up in the lobby in the morning and the wine and cheese in the late afternoon.

Wanted to stay in the Soho-Tribeca area and thankfully came across this hotel. Rooms are adequately sized with beautiful views of the city and the bathrooms have a wholly glassed wall overlooking the room and outside.In the morning coffee and small pastries are provided free of charge in the hall, one of the small touches that make a difference. The best thing after an exausting day in the City was to get a nice cocktail on the rooftop bar which provides beautiful views of the skyline, and these's even a small pool. Don't forget to post on facebook that you are staying here, you will get a 25$ voucher redeemable at the bar. It's located only steps away from Soho, Tribeca and Chinatown so there's lots to see and to do in area and the subway station is right behind the corner. Free wifi connection was very appreciated, something that's not so easy to find in New York. Will definitely be back.

This is now officially my go-to hotel if I am going to NYC for business or pleasure. Great location - Soho, Meatpacking district, etc are all nearby. Room - Very well organized and proportioned for New York hotels. Excellent price. Clean and updated bathroom with great fixtures and comforting rain shower. Free Wifi too ! Amenities - Gym is 24 hours and very well equipped. The rooftop pool is definitely a plus with to die for views of the NYC skyline and the Hudson river. David Burke's restaurant offers consistent delicious food.Service - Both Brian Morr and Anna at the reception were more than accommodating, friendly and hospitable. The doormen always greet you with a smile. I have not used the concierge so I cannot speak for it. I had everything booked from my iphone.

This hotel was a great find. It's in the heart of Soho. Near shopping, great restaurants, and all the scene. The staff is excellent. the rooms are a good size for New York. Stayed here for a girls weekend. Two in large kibg bef, 1 in roll away bed very spacious and comfortable (even our 3rd floor room was super quiet from any outside noise). the windows even open to let in the fresh New York air and sounds (yed air was frsh). Requests are dealt with fast. Roof deckbis a great scene late night. We all agreed we would definitely stay here again.

Our arrival at the hotel was easy thanks to a super friendly smile from doorman Michael andIris at reception. The room was spacious, stylish and had great views of the Hudson and Soho. We also loved the bar on the rooftop - great views. We will definitely be back.

truly a surprisingly excellent stay at this lovely hotel. staff made us feel completely at home and could not do enough for us.would return in a heartbeat!! Planning a trip to the south beach location next.

I booked with the James because of their "Lil James" kid-friendly claims and location. The location did turn out to be great!I have a toddler son that constantly travels with us and its nice to find a place with a few perks for him. This was not the place as advertised. Once our crib arrived to our room we discovered the mattress did not fit the crib and no crib sheet or special blanket (per website) were provided. No kids menu at the restaurant. No carseat offered. No space to play. Big disappointment as far as being kid friendly. If you're looking for a place to stay without the kids this would be an option...but not my first choice.

The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is great if you want to be in SoHo. Just remember that SoHo is very far south - so for tourists Chelsea or Midtown might be better. Unless of course you are about nightlife, in which case this would be a good choice. Rooms are nice but nothing special. They have that annoying glass bathroom with the huge shade that goes up and down. I happen to hate that. The outdoor areas (there are a few of them making this very unique in NYC) are lovely and almost worth the price of the hotel. There aren't too many choices in the area - and this is a good one. It did seem a bit nondescript and boring but besides the glass bathroom had no issues with it.

We selected The James Hotel for its location and I'm glad we did. It was within walking distance of most of the places we had on our list. The staff went out of their way to make sure all four of our rooms were on the same floor. The views from our corner King studio were amazing and our one bedroom apartment had plenty of room for our family to gather in before we headed out to dinner or shopping. We loved our stay and would definitely choose The James when we return next year!

I always stay mid town and this trip I wanted to shake things up so I booked 4 nights at The James. I booked it because I love the area and always end up down here for dinners and meetings.I checked in on the second floor and loved the layout of the lobby. It was around 5PM and they daily happy hour was going on in that area. They bring out wines and cheese plus some crackers and other treats. I think it's a great way to unwind and meet people. Loved it.I went to my room and they had given me a corner room facing the freedom town that was small but very nice. The bathroom was just great with a view of the city from the tub. Nice!I think if I stayed a little bit longer, I might upgrade for more square footage, but this worked fine. Staff was so nice and by the time the next morning rolled around, they called me by name. I like that personal attention. Who doesn't??? The area is typical SoHo and such fun to walk and discover. Great trendy shops with tons of bars and restaurants within walking distance. if you haven't stayed down here, grab a seat on the subway and walk around. Your coolness factor rises with each step you take.I tried to book the hotel on my last trip and it was sold out, so maybe I'm on to a great property. I'll try again.

This is a super friendly hotel in a great location with many great bars and restaurants close by. Chic hotel rooms with great storage space and delightful bathroom products to wake you up! As a tourist you can easily get to Staten Island Ferry, Brooklyn Bridge and jump in a cab to access Midtown and further north. Would definitely stay here again.

On my last to visits to NYC, I've had to forgo staying at my all-time fave NYC hotel (Trump Soho) due to avails...and have found a nice little gem in the James NYC. This boutique property has a distinctive style that really gives it a true feeling and character seldom found in NYC properties. My most recent trip was a week long stay for work. PROS:--extremely friendly and accommodating staff--spacious rooms with a nice design. Contemporary. Clean lines.--HUGE windows and no views of a building wall (my biggest pet peeve in NYC)--location is convenient to most things--they believe in added value. Complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings. Complimentary coffee and scones in the morning. --food was quite tasty. Good selection. Of course overpriced...but hey--it's NYC. What do you expect?CONS:--indoor common space is small...the lobby area is the size of a small library. So, if you're wanting to meet and mingle, but indoors, may not have much option besides the restaurant--I was a bit disappointed in the cleanliness of my room when I checked in. They were at capacity the day before, and I think they rushed cleaning. I had to have them come back and do some things over...but they were very accommodating--thin walls...you can hear everything going on in the hallway, and that's with people speaking at average volumes. I didn't run into issues sleeping, but I was also VERY tired every night. Overall, a nice 2nd choice for a soho/tribeca area stay. I definitely recommend the property
user_name:
ATLHotelLuva
New York City, New York

review_body: Well priced hotel for the service and room. I stayed in a king room and it was well maintained and great amenities. Staff were very helpful always friendly and location is fantastic :-) room service was quick and meals were hot and high quality! From the doggie treats outside it seems pet friendly too.

The James hotel has an enviable location in Soho, within walking distance of all the shops, bars and restaurants in the area, close to TriBeCa and West Village, and steps away from Canal St station which can get you pretty much anywhere.It's a modern hotel, opened about 3 years ago, and has some nice touches whether you are on business or, like us, on holiday. We spent a week there recently, and it was an amazing experience.Our room was on the 17th floor, with amazing view of the Hudson across to New Jersey. Very comfortable room, with everything we needed. There was a well stocked bar (at minibar prices) robes, and an exceptionally comfortable bed. The bathroom had a glass wall with a curtain that descends at a flick of a switch and a large walk-in shower.One small downside was that we were directly below Jimmy's (see below) and at the weekend there was the faint sound of music above and lots of banging of doors outside (the floor seems to be an access for staff going up and down). The 17th floor is also where the gym is located with great views across towards the East River.It's the little touches that make The James special. Complimentary filtered water and ice in the room. Helpful and friendly staff.The James club is an area in the Sky Lobby (light, glass walls, comfortable, relaxed) where guests can sit and read the papers and have complimentary coffee and fresh pastries at breakfast, fruit during the day, and cheese and (very nice) wine in the early evening. It was great to have the option to get coffee in the morning, whether sitting and planning our day, or 'grabbing and going'.We didn't make use if the hotel's two restaurants during our stay, as there are so many in the area, but they looked pretty good.Now, onto the perhaps the biggest draw. The rooftop pool and bar. The views are simply stunning. You can just spend time sitting and looking across to the Hudson in one direction, towards The WTC in another, and across the city towards Manhatten bridge in another.The pool itself is a great addition (we were there in summer during the humid heat) but be aware that it has restricted hours. At 4.30 the staff ask guests to start vacating loungers ready for opening of Jimmy's (the bar) which is open to the public. That's okay - we didn't come to NYC to sit by the pool, but it's worthwhile knowing this so you don't plan on a refreshing dip after a hot day's sightseeing. Best to go there in the morning when it's open before heading out.Also, while we were there, at the weekend it was opened for a a very busy pool party. Not much room, lots of people strutting and a DJ playing loud music. All exciting stuff and very Soho (if a bit reminiscent of a Spring Break).After 5pm, the rooftop area is transformed to Jimmy's, the bar, which itself has amazing views out towards the Empire State building. It gets very crowded, as can be expected with these views and location, and the drinks err on the expensive side (plastic glasses of course - we are on the 18th floor), but the bar staff are experienced and you don't have to wait long. The James is a great hotel in the heart of Soho. It's both relaxing and vibrant and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. We were so impressed that we've booked to stay at The James Royal Palm for our next visit to South Beach Miami in March.

As close to perfect as possible. Amazing room, fabulous view, superb location.I dined at each location on the premises and every experience was memorable. I will be back (very very very) soon!!!!!!!!!

The rooftop swimming pool is wonderful, at least while it is open for the season.But the service has been terrible.When we arrived in the room, which was an apartment suite, three bulbs didnt work, one of the two TV sets didnt work, and the speaker for ipod or iphone and music didnt work (the latter was never fixed). In the living room there was only one naked bulb, without any screen, like in a prison cell (at our request another lamp was added, but the naked bulb remained there for the four days), One day we went to swimming in the pool while left some coffee and juice from the breakfast for our return, but it was taken away. Meanwhile, the room was not done, beds, etc. At my request, more coffee was served, but the last day they pretended to charge an entire extra breakfast,Another day one of the bathrobes was also taken away, which made our visit to the pool delayed for hours. On Sunday, the elevator to the rooftop was blocked still at 11am. At 6:30pm the room was not yet done.As the last day we had breakfast in the restaurant, the order was mixed up (sausage for bacon, no bread).My impression is that the staff doesnt care at all; they might be working there just for a little while; may it be that this carelessness has become typical newyorker?
user_name:
Hello b
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This was my 2nd stay at The James, and it mostly lived up to my expectations. The first visit was three years ago when they had first launched. At that time, the food and beverage operation was yet to open, as was the garden and rooftop pool. They have since opened these and added further services, such as a courtesy car service for the local area. So this was a return full of excited anticipation. As per first visit, the door staff do not offer to take your luggage – I'm still confused by that, but no big issue. They direct you to the next floor where you check-in. This is friendly and welcoming (although the comment, "You're staying for one night only" seemed unnecessary. I'd actually booked for a 2nd the day before. Perhaps it wasn't displaying in the system yet). As a morning arrival, the room wasn't ready yet so I was invited to help myself to their complimentary pastries and coffee in the sun-drenched lounge area, where you can read papers and have the use of two Apple Mac desktop computers. At midday, reception called to inform me the room was ready – two hours before the nominated check-in time. Some attention to the issue of hotel guests accessing Jimmy, the rooftop bar in the evening would be a step in the right direction. After 9pm, hotel residents must use a different elevator to reach Jimmy. God help you if you happen to leave your room key with the (superb) hostesses in the bar. Because the doorman below will refuse to believe you. As a result, you are unable to enter your room, unable to retrieve the key which is 17 floors above with the bar staff. You are effectively stranded. And the doorman is not interested in your explanation. Now, the best thing about this hotel is that – built from the ground up, and with no neighbouring buildings of equal height – you get a decent view of the Manhattan skyline no matter which room you're in. I was on the 16th floor (so no noise from the rooftop bar) and, despite being the entry-level room, was afforded magnificent views up 6th Ave, down Tribeca and across the Hudson. Full height windows emphasise the panoramic views. The rooms have a decent height and this really enhances the rainforest shower in the well-proportioned bathroom, complete with Intelligent Nutrients cleaning products. The bathroom and generously-sized bed are definitely my personal highlights of The James. The complimentary wi-fi, plus morning pastries & coffee/ evening cheese & wine define this establishment’s premium credentials. Its location, at the quieter end of SoHo, bordering onto Tribeca, is ideal. And, whilst it is just beginning to show signs of wear (and someone else's hair in the bath towels), I will continue to return. Thanks for a mainly pleasant stay (4.5/ 5).

My husband and I spent our first night as husband and wife at The James. We didn't have time for a real honeymoon so we decided to make our wedding night special with a night at The James. It was perfect! From the ride to City Hall (my husband dropped our bags off at the hotel before our ceremony and got a lift from the car service the hotel offers), to the warm greeting when we arrived (everyone is SO friendly) to the virgin mojitos at the pool (made special for me since I can't drink - I'm pregnant!), to the complimentary non-alcoholic champagne-like beverage delivered to our door with a note congratulating us on our marriage, to the incredible service at dinner (with a to die for toffee/chocolate bread pudding for dessert!) we were made to feel special. We loved the decor and the whole vibe of the hotel. The beds are super comfortable and the bathroom shower a highlight( I even loved all the products like the soap and shampoo -- green and eco-friendly!) It all felt luxurious and wonderful. We only wish we could have stayed longer!
user_name:
Adelaide M
New York City, New York

review_body: We recently returned to The James as our hotel of choice. The people traveling with us with work stayed elsewhere, however we stayed here last year with our son and had the best time. The people are very polite and helpful. The property is beautiful and tucked in a nice area. We will be back again! Thank you to the manager Kristina for making our stay AWESOME!I would highly recommend this hotel.

I was looking for a way to celebrate my birthday last weekend, so I decided to stay at the James Hotel again. I loved it last time. This time was even better. I think they just renewed the beds or something. They were awesome. I loved the wine in the lobby in the evening. A nice start to the evening. The person at the front desk was super nice knew the area. I got put into a room on the 15th floor and the view was great! Im a little disappointed i didnt get to eat the David Burkes Kitchen. I wish i stayed longer.

I called ahead to mention it would be a birthday celebration for my daughter. After being mislead on the website that the hotel had a Lil James package we were expecting tickets to the Childrens Museum, Paul Frank pyjays and whoopie cookie turn down. What we got was shrugged shoulders claiming no knowledge of the above. Time to update the website! The room was gorgeous but it wasn't until we had showers that we saw big black clumps of hair all over the shower and bathroom floor. There was also black hairs all over the bed. (We are a family of blonde hair). The rooftop bar was closed for a function, so no trying the famous "Old Fashioned". The pool gets busy from opening time 8am and smokers delight in the rooftop pool. Staff were models with no check in skills. When I asked for our room to be cleaned I was told "But you are checking out this afternoon?" On the website it states twice daily room cleaning and since our room was NOT CLEANED IN THE FIRST PLACE, I did not think this was too much to ask! The overnight staff are way more efficient. The day time staff looked good but had no knowledge on the area. There are two bikes for use, you need to book these as soon as you check in as they are popular. They offer an in house chauffeur which I booked, and then confirmed a second time by phoning the front desk, for a 9.30am pick up. When I went to the lobby I was told the chauffeur had taken another ride and that he would be knocking off at 10am and we'd have to find our own way to the High Line. Again, do not confirm the booking if you cannot follow through. The rooms are stunning but the wood floors are showing serious signs of wear and tear for a hotel that has only been open for two years. The David Burke kitchen is amazing, staff are wonderful, cannot praise this restaurant enough. It is set in one of NYC's best rooftop gardens. The two operating lifts are slow. People going up and down to the rooftop get preference over hotel guests. The waiting area is lovely with complimentary wine, cheese, grapes and mini scones and coffee in the morning. The wifi is fast and there are complimentary computers with printers in the main lobby. I have to give this hotel one star because of the clumps of black hair... it still makes me dry reach just thinking about it!

A real treat - this hotel is both fun and comfortable in a great location. It is between Soho and Tribeca and a couple of blocks off the river greenway. The service personnel are exceptional especially the guys at the door. My wife left a bag in the cab when we arrived and one of the bellman chased after the cab and miraculously we got her bag back. The rooftop bar is hip - they were filming (with some very well know actresses) a movie one late afternoon when we were having a drink. We will return!

Our second stay at this perfectly located for Soho hotel was as good as the first. The modern room on the 16th floor had a great view, very effective layout while holding a very comfy king bed, with complementary wifi and coffee/pastry for breakfast, all at a reasonable price for this level in NYC. The 24/7 gym on the 17th floor, while small has a good mix of aerobic and weight equipment.

My bride and I got married in Manhattan and had a few days for a short honeymoon. So we stayed at the James...What a great way to start our life together. . What a magical place. I mean we were treated like royalty. Everything form the room to the food was wonderful and the staff was fun, not stuffy or uptight like other boutique hotels downtown, . Please go to the James it is a slice of heaven in Manhattan!!
user_name:
playhrd
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed at the James for 4 nights before Labor Day weekend, and for someone who is a native NYer, now living across country, what's most important to me when visiting my hometown is LOCATION. Then comes service, then amenities, and then food.This hotel has it all! The views from the rooftop pool, amazing! Room service and David Burke Kitchen, delicious! Staff - friendly and eager to help without the aloofness of other boutique properties I've stayed in. Also, awesome bathroom amenties, and heated floors?! But above all, the location is what makes this hotel so perfect. Easy access to the A-C-E train, Soho shopping and nightlife at your finger tips, and just off the beaten track of the craziness that is Canal Street.Comp wireless, fresh coffee, scones, and turndown service are just added bonuses. Love the James, would absolutely stay here again, hopefully soon!!!
user_name:
Sonia L
San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: Beautiful hotel and perfect for a pre-wedding weekend get-away. The amenities were luxurious and the staff was responsive and thoughtful. They'd turn down our beds and draw the blinds every evening. They even sent complimentary champagne for the soon-to-be-married member of our party! The overall experience was very indulgent... Favorite features from the group: the clean, comfortable bedding, the steady A/C, and the awesome hand shower + rain shower set up.

Overall the hotel and staff were quite nice. But a few glitches ruined the lux feeling. With so many other options available in the area I wouldn't recommend this hotel given the price tag associated with it.Everyone was super nice and pleasant, but for us it was the actions (or lack of) that spoke louder than words. The main frustration stemmed from a de-evolution of the lux experience over our 3-night stay. Simple things from a plush bath rug on day one to a simple bath mat towel on day two to the cold tile on day three. Another example was two bottles of their "triple filtered water" and a fresh bucket of ice on night one to only one bottle on night two to no ice on night three. Even though we kept the room neat and tidy, maybe housekeeping had it in for us? They turned the AC off on one of the hottest/muggiest days and our last night was quite uncomfortable. When we turned the AC back on it only intermittently blew cool air. We didn't bother calling the front desk since an earlier service call regarding the TV not working went unresolved. It's too bad we were left with the feeling that things went south after check-in because the property has a terrific design and many of the staff were very helpful in other respects (luggage, transportation, etc.). We travel frequently and typically enjoy our hotel experiences immensely. Even though we made the best of it and still had an incredible visit to the city we would definitely stay somewhere else next time.

Four of us stayed for a week in August, two adults and two teenage kids and generally speaking we loved this hotel but for a couple of niggles.I booked adjoining rooms, one double and one twin through Virgin Holidays and when we arrived we found that they don't have any twin rooms. No problem, they upgraded us to a room with a very large double bed and a second slightly smaller room which were connected by their own enclosed small hall, so perfect. They also kindly gave us breakfast for our first morning by way of an apology.CleanlinessWhatever you've read about this hotel being dusty is just untrue, the floors look dusty but I have to say that the hotel was spotless throughout and I am very fussy, just ask my wife!Food & DrinkWe ate once here for breakfast (our comp breakfast) and once to try the David Burke Kitchen. The breakfast was ok and the food at DBK was overly complicated and a little bit up itself with not a lot of substance but ok. Beware of the cost though, it ain't cheap!We did have some great cocktails and the wine list is also not bad.RoomsRooms are great and excellently looked after by the maids both sides of the day, with some great views out over Manhattan.Swimming PoolThe main reason I chose The James was because it had an outdoor pool and to be honest, if that's your criteria too, then you'll be disappointed.As with many other people, this is where the issue lies. The pool is small and cold but ok for a quick dip to cool off and there is somewhere, albeit very small to catch a few rays (if you get up there early enough to bag a bed). The drawback arrives with the members of Jimmys. You are told that you have use of the pool until 5pm and this just isn't true. three out of our seven days, we were only able to be there until 2.40pm because of 'private parties" the rest of the time, we were allowed to be there until 5pm but at 4.30 everyone is moved and made to feel very uncomfortable so that the sun-beds can all be lined up and stripped of your towels in readiness for Jimmys' members. Hotel guests are made to feel like second class citizens falling a long way behind Jimmys' members and this smacks of greed on behalf of the hotel.Jimmys is popular and The James is proud of this fact but as a hotel guest all that means to you is that you will find it hard to get in the lift after about 3.30 in the afternoon and generally you just won't have any access to the pool whatsoever.I've found this a very tough review to write because I really wanted to be clear in my views, the hotel and most of the staff are great and happy to help but Jimmys and one or two other small gripes left me sure that I would not return.

Very disappointed with the James hotel. We had a very bad experience with the James. The night manager Christina was rude to the level of being abusive when we complained about the filth in our room. The dirty room was bad, but the response about the complaint was even worse. Christina was not willing to help in any way other to say "I'm sorry." The was no ability to clean the room, change rooms or help in any way. This hotel was a huge disappointment.

Loved this hotel!! It was a great experience and the staff was wonderful! The room was a good size (for NYC) & the bed was super comfortable! Can't beat the location! I will definitely be staying here again!!

Few hotels get it, but The James hotel in New York gets it as far a superior service, quality of amenities and general all round great feel.It started even before our arrival. All e-mail correspondence and reservations were attended to immediately. I did a lot of research on booking websites but the best rate was still from the hotel itself. I booked restaurants via the concierge, Morgan and they were dealt with efficiency and she also gave great recommendations to local activities in the area.Our arrival: a sincere and friendly welcome from Michael who assisted with our luggage. The check-in by Chris was smooth and after a long flight from South Africa, he gave us early access to our room. This was really appreciated as we wanted to freshen up before we hit the streets at midday.We had a King corner room which was spacious and clean with a beautiful view of the surrounding area. The bathroom was large with a huge shower. The mini bar was of maxi quality with very reasonable prices. Various snacks were also offered. The safe, iron and ironing board was appreciated and used. There is also a gym on the 17th floor with all the proper equipment needed with a beautiful view of the city. Housekeeping was friendly and all requests were addressed immediately. The hotel has an amazing bar and pool on it's roof. This gave a welcome relief in the summer heat with fantastic views, great cocktails and beers. Rolando, the barman was friendly and efficient... and made great cocktails. This spot turns into a energetic night club at night with brilliant DJ's and dancing...at our age we did feel slightly old but it was a load of fun. The hotel serves complimentary muffins and coffee in the mornings, fruit and water during the day and wine and cheese with biscuits during the early evening. We really loved this as in the mornings you can plan and kick start your day and in the evenings you can come back and relax and reminisce about your day. Alternatively you can start your evening with a glass of wine before going out to your restaurant. The best is that they have freshly baked chocolate chip cookies during the late evening and we had our fair share of those. The wi-fi was of good quality and fast for our purposes.The location of the hotel is great. You are walking distance from Soho, TriBeCa and the Meat packers district with numerous shops, boutiques and restaurants. The subway is also very close and you can get buses and taxi's in the main road alongside the hotel. The porters are very helpful and a taxi stops in no time.We also enjoyed a great dinner in the hotel at the David Burke Kitchen restaurant. Check out was quick and seamless and we had no surprises in our bill.We had the time of our life in New York and The James played a big part in achieving that. Thank you for the great memories. Keep up the great work.We will definitely be back.

My spouse and I have stayed at the James in Chicago several times and it's one of our favorite hotels, in any city.
