With that background, we were really looking forward to our first stay at the James NYC. The hotel is a beautiful property, in an incredible location. Within 3-5 blocks of the hotel are some great shops and restaurants, and there are 2 subway stations very nearby (the A/B/C and 1 (with a nearby 2/3)) which made for easy and convenient travel to other parts of the City. A little farther away (5-10 blocks) is an incredible stretch along and around Greenwich Street, with even more (and more amazing) bars, cafes and restaurants. It was very easy walking around the entire area. It was even easier to navigate back to the hotel, as it towers over most of the surrounding buildings and has a distinctive design on the roof which stands out. We loved the Citibike station right across the street from the hotel as well.Our hotel room was amazing - it was a corner room with floor to ceiling windows and a breathtaking view of WTC 1. It really was a stunning room & we couldn't have been happier with it.Unfortunately, we couldn't shake the feeling for most of our stay that the main focus of the property is on its bar business (especially Jimmy) and not on the needs and comfort of its hotel guests. While there is an exterior, separate elevator for accessing Jimmy (but not guest floors) we were confronted every evening with Jimmy staff using the interior elevators (which access the guest floors) to take bar-goers up to and down from Jimmy. This led to three main problems for hotel guests - (1) having to wait for a long time for an elevator to stop at your guest floor; (2) even then, not being able to get onto the elevator because it was crowded with Jimmy patrons (who were most often clearly annoyed at the interrupting stop on their way to or from the bar) and (3) being repeatedly asked to "prove" we were hotel guests by showing our room keys to the Jimmy staff at the elevator doors on the ground floor, making sure we were actually on our way to someplace we were allowed to be and weren't trying to sneak onto the roof. To that last point, I have to admit it was disturbing that bar-goers could stop on our guest floor, since the hotel staff would swipe their key to allow the elevator to travel travel, which then allowed anyone riding the interior elevators to stop at any floor along the way. Meanwhile, as hotel guests, we were often reminded we could only go to Jimmy during their off-hours. We were told we could ask the front desk to put our names on the list and "most likely" go up (by the exterior elevator only, we were told.) We didn't experience any big problems - we just really disliked feeling that we weren't as important as the people the hotel allowed (and wanted) to go to Jimmy.I should stress the Garden & Tree House bar were really nice - we had great food and drinks in a really cool setting many different times throughout the stay, including brunch and late-night. We never ate in David Burke's Kitchen, but had drinks there several times and really enjoyed them and the setting. Also, the doormen and concierge were always very friendly and the housekeeping staff were exceptional. With the quality of the hotel and the incredible location, this property has every opportunity to be as special as the James Chicago. Unfortunately, to do so, it first has to make its hotel guests feel like something other than a necessary nuisance to their bar business.

Very disappointing and surly service - spent too much time waiting for lifts or wifi to connect. Told breakfast wasn't included when actually it was. Housekeeping was very poor - most days they only did a bit at turn down when we had been out from 9-3 each day. Not any attention to the needs of the overnight guests. unpleasant attitude in elevators in the evening when it turns to party central. my advice - book some place else.

I have stayed at the James three times, for extended stays each time, and this is the first time I was disappointed. The reasons are as follows:1. guests were unable to use the facilities such as pool, roof top bar, restaurant because they were continually booked out with private parties...........and I mean continually!!! That is not Fair, as one stays at hottels for these ammenities.2. the knowledge of the staff was very poor if the conceirge was not on duty. Quite hopeless even with questions about nearby subways.3.There was not one day in two weeks that housekeeping did not forget something.......bath towels, soap, tea-bags........basic items. Plus she/he kept throwing out my newspapers and magazines which were neatly piled in the bedside cabinet.4. General cleanliness and upkeep, definitely lacking!!! Holes in the bed sheets, stained carpet right off the lift, garbage in the hallways (dont use the stairs because you wont be able to get down with all the garbage piled up )broken chairs, stained walls and generally disappointing.It always surprises me that hotels try so hard to build up their reputation, and as soon as they get favorable reviews, they drop their game.The James is definitely NOT what it once was.
user_name:
naomi T
New York City, New York

review_body: The James was a really pleasant hotel. Light and airy, both inside and outside. Fresh design, decent sized rooms (for New York!) and the best hotel beds I've ever had! Very friendly service at the entrance and reception. The room service could improve though. It promises a bottle of water per day, and a turn-down service at night. This did not happen more than once in our three-day stay. Other pluses: complimentary coffee and scones in the reception in the morning, and wine and cheese in the afternoon. With a great location, right in the middle of SoHo, all kinds of shops and restaurants at your steps, this hotel makes a great choice. I'll definitely consider the James again.

THis is a real find in SOHO. It's right on the subway,easy access to Times Square, and no touristy crowd jamming the street. Cools, hip hotel, with a hot restaurant - David Burke's Kitchen. The serve a continental breakfast in the morning and wine in the afternoon. Remarkable Jimmy's on the Roof for cocktails and they have a roof top pool. Staff is great. Felix and Sydney were teriffic in helping getting us around the area. They know the places to go and were a great help. Actually, everyuone of the staff could be mentioned. The front desk folks were really nice and accommodating, the evening dorrman at the hotel door was congenial and like the rest of the staff, willing to give advice and assistance whenever you asked for it.Typical NYC rooms - but not overly small. Overall a great place to stay.
user_name:
GregC1948
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Everything was great from the wine hour, roof top pool (only for guests until 5 pm) great cocktail list, and outside bar at Jimmy's. I can't wait to get back to NYC to stay at the James hotel again. thanks!

The location of the James is grate; it is in the heart of Soho, in walking distance to Greenwich Village, little Italy, China Town, Chelsea and Tribeca.The Hotel is beautiful; the decoration is modern, with lots of light. It´s really pet friendly.The corner studio has a pretty good size for NY standards.The Cons, personally the pillows were too soft I rather more orthopedic pillows. The service at their restaurant and Bar Jimmy´s is really bad, the staff couldn´t seem less interested in the guest.There was a lot of dust behind the TV.In my experience I think you pay a lot for an average service.

Wow! This is a fabulous luxury hotel right in Soho. Treat yourself to a fantastic experience. I was so stressed until I arrived...just looking at the beautiful view from the rooftop pool carried me away.

Having stayed at various hotels in NYC over the years, we picked the James this time round because of its rooftop pool. Having read the reviews I didn't expect it to be huge and it wasn't. I actually only used the pool once after the complementary Wednesday morning rooftop yoga class which by the way was fantastic. The hotel itself is great, has the right balance between modern and chic without being over the top achingly cool. Staff are friendly and go out of their way. Rooms are great in design as well as function. No complaints at all really. We will definitely be back.

I booked the james for 5 days just a few weeks ago and had a fantastic stay. After moving from other accommodation It was a relief to feel some serenity from the constant hum of NYC. The staff were helpful on check in and throughout our stay. While the rooms may not be large they are ultra modern finished well with ipod doc, super high end mini bar and bathroom soaps and gels. The beds were super comfortable but the pillows are way too soft but the James even has a note mentioning order whatever pillow you would like if the standard ones are not to your liking. From 6pm the have wine and cheese in the lobby which while very basic and for a while they were out of glasses it is a nice touch. The James has a very popular roof top pool/bar which pumps on the weekend and considering how many non hotel guests are trying to get in its the place to be. It was nice on a Wednesday to have my friends join me for sunset drinks before we headed out in NYC. Cocktails are a bit expensive but as you could expect with views of the Hudson river like that. NB: The pool is small so not really one for swimming. The location is good with many good bars and restaurants within 5 minuets walk away. Check out was at 2pm which helped for our late flight back home. The only one disappointment was that one of the concierge staff didn't seem to be able to acquire tickets to a show which from later knowledge should have been manageable. Overall I can recommend The James, you get what you pay for as the extra $150 a night over basic hotels is worth while.
user_name:
JetBenji
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: First of all, I would ask that the management please not comment on this, I generally enjoyed my stay at The James, the issues I have are ones that many people have commented on here, so assuring me that these will be taken care of does not make me feel betterThe hotel is very nice and in a great neighborhood. I booked this solely for the fact that is has an outdoor pool which are few and far between in the city. The pool area is very nice, but rather small so if you want a chair plan ahead and get up there early. We had a woman that had managed to snag three chairs for her friends not staying in the hotel and she managed to have the pool boy back her. Ultimately the manager did the right thing which was good. The bigger issue is the fact that the pool becomes a club at 3PM on the weekends, no where on the website does it tell you this. Guests are sunning and suddenly the place is inundated with party goers, so full you can barely walk around the pool deck. I understand wanting to make the hotel a happening spot but at the expense of your guests is a questionable plan. The other issue stems from the nightclub, they have elevator monitors that are supposed to keep club goers from the hotel elevators. The issue is they have one person monitoring this at the bottom of the elevator, so when the party ends and people need to come down they pack on the hotel elevators making it had for guests to use. The rooms are nice, small but what you would expect for NY. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and luxurious. The staff was helpful when you had a problem they generally would work to fix it, again most of the issues stem from not enough control around the rooftop parties

Very modern ultra chic hotel with very friendly and knowledgeable staff. The room size was what I was used to in London so I had no complaints. The rooms where very clean with an ultra modern feel to it. The hotel is also nicely located away from the noise but still close enough to everything. My only disappointment was the pool which can be described as a plunge pool but certainly not a swimming pool. I will certainly be staying here again when I next visit

I stayed here for a weekend in August as a change of pace from the Hamptons. I couldn't have been happier with the staff -- my room was upgraded, the facilities are great and it's fairly affordable in comparison to other hotels such as the Dream Downtown, Gansevoort. I had an issue at the pool with chairs (as there are only about 10), but the staff was super-friendly, and quickly resolved the problem. The food was great, as were the room and the amenities. I'd definitely come back here.

A friend I were trying to find the perfect way to cap off a late summer night when we thought of trying something new -- the rooftop at The James.While some of the stairs and doorways create a bit of a peculiar path to the rooftop, once there you'll find one of the nicest views in Soho. The tranquility of the shimmering water of the pool against the backdrop of funky, vibrant music, and a 'chillin' crowd --- is priceless.The drinks are good --- not necessarily spectacular. The view is exceptional.The service is a treat. We were greeted at the door by a gentleman named Chad. Very friendly, with none of the overbearing 'goon' demeanor you can encounter at some places. He greeted us politely, let us know when the place would be closing (so we wouldn't be surprised later), and even came upstairs later and asked whether everything was to our satisfaction. Hey, who does that !!Upstairs, the service was great. Attentive, prompt, no bull54!t and with none of the staff pretending to be too busy to be responsive --- an otherwise far-too-common behavior.I can't say enough good things about Jimmy ... we arrived on a wonderfully warm evening with perfect weather for a rooftop experience, and we left happy and eager to return.

This is a good almost boutique hotel, a little big for boutique but high service and lots of extras. Free coffee and pastry in the morning, wine in the evening, snacks, internet. The pool upstairs is good, it is small and cold but there are not many outdoor pools in the city. The staff is excellent and bends over backwards to help you. There is a glaring problem! There is nightclub on the roof that makes the elevators (already slow) PATHETIC from 3:00 PM until al hours. The hotel assures that the nightclub people go up a separate elevator but they come down the same ones the guests must pack on to with drunk partiers. The pool deck has only 10 recliners and so the land grab becomes extremely competitive, we had a mother who tipped the pool boy to reserve 3 chairs for non hotel guests then went to brunch, people sitting all over on cement with 30% of the chairs empty so the pool boy could get a tip. Only after complete protest from all the pool guests did the problem get fixed, and it did get fixed. At 3:00 PM the pool becomes a party place for outsiders so if you are planning to swim or sun you are doing so in the middle of a nightclub with 100 young drunks dressed to party.One last thing, I know that someone from this hotel needs to answer every review, I wish you wouldn't. I think that except in extreme cases it cheapens the mission of trip advisor and individual reviews.

Stayed here for 3 nights in may. The location is great and it is near a few subway lines. Staff were all friendly and helpful, though the doorman was too obvious in ordering an expensive cab to get a kickback from the driver. The rooms are excellent - we were give early checkin (at about 8am) on the highest floor. I am not sure the bedroom needed a glass wall with the bathroom, but there was a curtain. The room had iPhone charger as well as the usual amenities. The minibar was more than fully stocked, including a full sized bottle of whisky and of wine, but there was no price list to be found - I assume they weren't free. Reception had free coffee and tea (when not run out) and pastries and fruit at certain times of day.I would definitely stay here again. I stayed this time because of a special offer but would look at it first on future visits.

Great property. Quiet and close to all of Soho. Easy check in and out. Staff were friendly and helpful. La Colombe coffee in lobby in morning with good free Internet access. Nice bath and shower which was fresh and new.

Got in with two adults and two kids. While not really kids friendly, we enjoyed the location, the rooftop bar and the garden restaurant. The design is superb. Price for money is good, our corner King has enough space, while the closets are not very helpful. Fast WiFi for free at all areas, except rooftop bar. Will come back.

Consistent excellence!This is my second review for The James Hotel in So Ho. My Wife and I frequently stay at the James and when we leave we are already planning the next stay. Consistent excellence at its best and the team members at The James never let us down from the executive office to the floor staff - the James has one heck of a team. From the moment you pull up to the front door and see the ever smiling Eric with his amazing upbeat attitude and impeccable service, you just know you are in a great place. Louis and Morgan are always there to head you in the right direction with so many great restaurants in So Ho and then up to the front desk where Amy and the team welcome you so graciously time and time again. And what is a great hotel without a great Restaurant? The David Burke Kitchen fits the bill with Mike and Jamie leading the way and what is the David Burke’s Kitchen without David Burke? David himself was there and chatted with my Wife - she was so thrilled! Want to see Consistent Excellence at its best? At the James’s it is an everyday occurrence!Keep up the great work!

My husband and I booked in for just shy of two weeks for our first trip to New York. We loved New York and our experience was made all the more special with our stay at The James. The staff couldn't do enough to help us with all our special requests and queries. Thank you to Louis, Kenny, Morgan and the house keeping and in room breakfast dining crew.Our room was awesome. We can highly recommend the corner king rooms. There was enough space to comfortably live for our lengthy stay.The location we found perfect for us. We were just minutes walking distance from the Subway, great little restaurants and boutique shopping of Soho. Best of all was that we were so centrally located to Nolita, Greenwich and West Village which was the New York we wanted to experience. A short subway ride and we could be amidst the touristy hotspots of Mid Town and Lower Manhattan.A lovely touch is the wine and cheese in the foyer area in the afternoon. Definitely a nice way to retreat and reflect on the days activity.

The service was amazing – staff were attentive and very knowledgeable about restaurants and shops in the SOHO area. Location was perfectly central – a few blocks to all the best shopping in Broadway. The rooms are beautifully designed and included many little luxuries – pillows from heaven, high-quality hair and skin products, Starbucks instant coffee, comfy robes and slippers. Went to David Burke's Kitchen the first afternoon and the food exceeded expectations. Also recommend walking 1 block over to Aurora an upscale, authentic italian restaurant.

My partner and I booked a room at the James for a combined business/pleasure trip. We should have known something would be off at check-in. When we got to our room there was a gift for another guest. Upon returning it to the front desk we learned that we had been given a lower grade room than what we reserved. We were given keys to our new room and more service problems persisted the rest of our stay. Safe did not work and could not be fixed, not enough glasses, etc in the room. Overall poor service. The rooftop is nice, but too small, too "I'm trying to be hip", replete with drunk fighting couples who take their arguments to the room above you, and frankly overly loud if you are trying to sleep at night on the 15th floor. The James is trying to live up to its competition in Soho but has a very long way to go.

After dinner, we headed up to the rooftop bar and had a good margarita (albeit small) - it had better be good for $17 pricetag per drink! Dark-skinned man who served us was not friendly and quite brusque. I presume they are not relying on repeat business??!!The views are just spectacular. I would definitely highly recommend this place for the perfect way to top off an evening! Rooms are just OK.
user_name:
annarchynyc
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at The James because it was recommended by friends and it had received positive reviews. We purchased a package through Luxury Link. Overall, the hotel did not meet our expectations. While it was conveniently located on the edge of SoHo and the staff were generally friendly and helpful, this is a hotel that is trying to dress itself up as 'boutique luxury' and does not manage to pull it off. In my experience, other hotels in NYC at the same price point (or less) are far superior. While we appreciate that NYC hotel rooms are generally not spacious, the "deluxe guestroom" was tiny. The "complimentary bottle of wine" we received as part of our package was undrinkable. The glasses of wine we ordered through in-room dining were 'off', and when we called to let in-room dining know, they brought us two new glasses which were just as bad. Although the hotel's rooftop bar has a great view, its existence seems to permeate the hotel with the result that the elevators continually smell like booze and rather than feeling fresh, the hotel continually feels like it is recovering from last night's hangover. Our next stay in New York will not be at The James.

Outstanding hotel in every sense. Staying for a week while my daughter is at Joffrey and they are truly making us feel like VIP's. The service is top notch and the staff truly goes out of their way to make sure that you are taken care of. We are hotel snobs and I am so glad that I chose The James. Perfect location away from from the craziness but close enough to be convenient. Terrific concierge and bell services! Rick (with their car service) has been exceptional in making sure we are to Joffrey every morning and picked up each night. He has made a world of difference not having to clamor for a taxi in rush hour. Facilities at the hotel are superb, housekeeping is spot on and even the in-room dining has exceeded our expectations. Skip the big name hotels and head to The James. You wont be disappointed!

After dinner, we headed up to the rooftop bar and had a great margarita - it had better be good for $17 pricetag per drink! The views are just spectacular. I would definitely highly recommend this place for the perfect way to top off an evening! Rooms are clean and hotel is gorgeous!

We really enjoyed our weekend stay at The James NY. The rooms not only look great - but are comfortable and I got a great night's sleep. The rooftop pool is beautiful but beware it is open to the public and can get overly crowded. David Burke's Kitchen is a good meal and the outdoor seating is a perfect location on a warm summer night. When my sunglasses went missing, Michael the Doorman, found me a replacement pair that saved me in a pinch. The James' location means that you are within walking distance to shopping, dining, bars, etc. We loved the location and will definitely be back again to stay at The James.

I will def be doing this hotel again!The view, the setting of the room and how pleasant the staff was was def up to par. The hotel def. met the standards. Glad I chose The James. Be sure to experience it on your own

We stayed in this hotel for a week in June, our room was on the 7th floor, with a queen size bed, it was comfortable but a little on the small side to stay in for the week ,no complaints on the room or the bathroom (complementary toiletries were also of very good quality). The staff were very attentive, pleasant and approachable, the complementary coffee and muffins in the morning and wine and cheese in the evening were appreciated and it was nice to sample some of the local wines. We enjoyed using the rooftop pool during the day - views of New York were simply amazing - comfortable loungers, the pool itself was more of a plunge pool, it was quite cold but we did not mind since the weather was so hot during our stay. We also made use of the small but well equipped gym, again a real plus for us. The hotel is in a really interesting part of New York with lots to do in the immediate area, shopping, restaurants, bars etc. Not to forget the High Line which is walking distance from the hotel. HOWEVER, during our stay we found out that Jimmys Rooftop (including the pool area) apparently does not belong to the hotel and that therefore they have not control over what goes on up there. Bearing in mind we chose the hotel because of the pool we were disappointed to find that the pool would be closed at short notice because it had been hired out to companies filming commercials or for other private events. in addition the Rooftop and Jimmys Bar would regularly hold party events on evenings and weekends, this made it impossible for hotel guests to use the area as it was packed with people not staying at the hotel, it was difficult to get served to drinks, there was nowhere to sit and only one nervous looking security guard trying to make sure that no one or no glass fell in the pool (one morning the pool was closed as it was full of broken glass resulting from the partying excess the night before). I was disappointed as I expected the rooftop to be more organised and comfortable in the evenings and also because the hotel had not been up front on the website about the fact that the rooftop is a separate operation. I would recommend this hotel for couples or groups of friends, definitely not for families BUT the hotel must be up front about the limitations on the use of the pool and rooftop as well as the fact that Jimmys Rooftop is a separate operation sometimes not accessible for guests.

From the time we arrived our interactions with Kenny the Doorman, Cameron at the front desk and Morgan at the Conceirge things could not have been better. We were upgraded to a King Corner Suite with spectacular view of both the East and Hudson rivers. The entire staff was extrememely knowledgeable about the local area and very helpful with decisions shopping and dining. The only negative during our stay was related to an incident with the manager of the Treehouse and all I will say about this incident is that I will in no way ever spend another nickel in the Treehouse. I heard directly from another employee that this guys talks down to everyone he interacts with and I was certainly no exception. Can't believe this guy has a job, let alone in the service industry. Other than that The James is a great property with incredibly well-trained staff who seem to be really happy in doing their jobs.

We live in New York and decided to come to The James to enjoy the pool with our kids. We booked 2 nights and checked in 10 minutes before check in. They said the room would take a little bit to be ready. I said fine and went to the roof to enjoy the pool. Lets start with the fact that the pool is TINY and FREEZING!!! There are only 10 lounge chairs and most of them are reserved by those 'in the know' Apparently if you book the pool package, you can reserve loungers. However, there are only 10 of them so I am not sure that it is a guarantee. I think though they were reserved for those who give the biggest tip. Two hours in, I had heard nothing about our room. I tried calling downstairs and nobody would answer the phone. My friend was meeting me there the first night so I had her ask about the room and 3 hrs in, they finally gave us our key. Not sure they would have ever called us if we didn't ask. So, at 5 pm they had us get off the loungers to re-arrange them for the evening crowd and removed all the cushions. We left soon after. We got up on Saturday and went to the pool at 830 am. We were able to get 2 loungers. On Saturday, what they don't tell you is that the rearrange the chairs at 3, leave the cushions on and open the pool to the public at the doorman's discretion. It gets extremely crowded with no room to even move around. It's fun if that's what you are looking for but had I known this in advance, I would have not come here with the kids. Also to be noted is how terrible th service is. We had to go inside to order food/drinks while the server sat behind the door engrossed in his phone. This happened both days. Also, there were never any towels and they would only bring out 5 at a time. Perhaps there is some sort of shortage. The doormen are very friendly. Otherwise, the rest of the staff is useless. Several times when I called downstairs, there would be no answer. I just think that it's a decent place for the 18-25 crowd but honestly there are better places to stay in this price range with exceptional service! I would definitely not return and discourage others.
user_name:
cd290
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is perfectly located, even thought the noise of canal street is a disadvantage compared to some other hotels like the Mercer or 60 Thompson, where I stayed beforeThe pool on the top floor is a nice to look at, but far too small to get into it. As the showers at the pool aren't working, the cleanness of the pool remains doubtful. The fact that from 17:00 the sun deck area is open to the public (first arrivers at 16:30) results in a rather unfriendly change over. Hotel guests are asked to leave the sun beds in order to open this up to the public....Apart from this experience it is a clean hotel with a perfect location and friendly staff .

my husband and i stayed here for a few days in july. when checking in, we received a free upgrade (without asking!) to a higher level room with a bigger bed and more space. the view was to die for. all the staff was very friendly and the rooftop bar had a great few and a hip crowd. the restaurant was delicious although our waiter could have been better.

Booked corner suite big windows with lots of light and sun and great views. The best king bed, linens and pillows very comfortable modern room. All staff were extremely polite and friendly and went out of their way to accomodate requests. Nice roof top bar and small pool area, great spot to relax. Restaurant on site also very good, eating there twice. This hotel is in a really convenient location to metro excellent shopping and lots of very good restaurants and bars, so easy to get around from here. Only complaint is we booked tickets to see a show through concierge, being told they were very hard to get because it was a very popular musical, however they later told us they had got us 2 very good seats and although they were expensive we were very lucky and would be very happy. They cost around $450 and assumed that was the box office price however when we arrived at the show we were seated in second last row and later checking the tickets we saw the price stamped was $77 a ticket We queried this later with the hotel concierge and they said they had booked through a broking agent who charges more. We said we thought we had been misled and ripped off. They did apologise and said the normally advised guests of the booking arrangements but in our case there had been an oversight due to a new girl handling our booking.I must say the did give us a restaurant voucher for part of the misunderstanding. My advice would be to only book tickets through the theatre as I think a lot of hotels use agents/middle men.

Fun weekend-break hotel. Cookies in the evening - what an awesome idea! Rooms quite small though, which is why I didn't give it five stars. I liked the gym - fantastic view - but it had fairly limited equipment. So wouldn't stay here for business, but for a short girls weekend, it was ideal.

Great hotel in soho.Easy and friendly. Couldn't hear any city noise. Rooms are amazing (for 300 sq ft that is)Staff is great but Doorman outshines everyone else.  Perfectly located In soho. Hotel rooftop bar is fun. Inside bar plays fun music mix.

i had the most amazing stay while at The James. The rooms were clean, beautiful, and the bathroom was impeccable. Everyone that was working at the hotel while i stayed there was super friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone.

I would recommend The James New York to anyone staying in Soho. It was the perfect place for a long weekend vacation. It is within walking distance of all of the great Soho shops and restaurants. The room was very nice with a comfortable bed and sexy bathroom. The roof top pool area and bar were ideal for lounging and enjoying the views with good drinks and food. Overall the service was very friendly and efficient! We'll be back.

Just returned from spending five nights at The James and it was fantastic! special thanks to Michael the doorman for reminding me to check the safe.....passport inside. Also for all of the wonderful e suggestions for restaurants. A wonderful experience, hope to return soon.

This is the first time i have stayed at The James. I was very pleased with the level of Service the attention to detail and the coolness of the whole place. Loved the area. The only Place to stay in NY

We stayed at the James Hotel during our trip to New York City for our 10 year anniversary. It was nice to stay at a location that had easy access via public transportation to all the sights but was in more quaint and personable neighborhood compared to Times Square. The staff was personable and friendly. They also gave us an upgrade on our room (maybe because it was our 10 year anniversary). It may be more expensive than some other hotels in New York City, but for us it was worth it.

Just got back from a 4 night stay at the James Hotel in Soho. Had room 609 - corner queen room. Small but everything was well placed and had just enough space for what I needed. Shower was great - but I was wishing for a bath when I was hung over on Saturday. LOL! Anyways - the bed so so comfy, just having a 2 angle view out the window was really great. I think with that kind of view the room feels bigger. I ordered room service several times and each time it only took 15 minutes and my man - Michael - he was the bomb! Too fun! Front desk staff was very helpful - the one thing lacking in the room was actual info about the hotel other than in-room dining. But as I said the staff was great with all of my questions. Loved the wine hour from 6-8, missed the coffee and pastries in the morning and the cookies at 8pm. And bonus - I booked a massage in the garden cabana - its was the best massage of my life. No joke. Total zen. Bogdan Stoia - you are the man! Thanks James Hotel for bringing that guy in to do my massage. Completely worth the price!! And bonus - check out at 2pm. YES!!!! Love that!Now - I have to say - I really enjoyed the hotel. However, the hotel pool - I tried to go on Wednesday afternoon - but there are barely any lounge chairs and the rest of the chairs are upright chairs. Very stiff for a pool setting. So I decided to get a drink at the bar Jimmy since there wasn't really any place to lounge outside. It was 4pm - and honestly the staff was so rude to me! I was the only customer (aside from a few guests in the outside lounge chairs). When I sat down at the bar the 2 bartenders looked at me like I had 2 heads. It's a hotel! Why shouldn't I get a drink at 4pm?? Anyways - so I took my $16 glass of wine and sat by the window. Meanwhile 3 staff for the evening rolled in and were so loud and obnoxious that I left. So odd! I did not go back to Jimmy. Not worth it at all. The staff sucked.So I went to the Treehouse bar thinking that might be a better place to chill. Same thing. Getting a drink at a hotel at 5pm on a wednesday is just somehow weird I guess. Don't get it. Again - I honestly felt like I was bothering the staff by making them wait on me. Annoying. So I took my drink up to the Urban Garden where apparently the bar staff can't serve and hung out there before the party I was due to go to. Somehow - The treehouse bar is completely separate from the hotel as is Jimmy (rooftop bar). Personally, and I told the bar staff at Treehouse - isn't it better to all work together? There definitely was a divide between the resturants/bars and the actual hotel. And the Hotel Staff was MUCH more friendly. I'd love to go back to that hotel but I will steer clear of the restaurants and bars. Not worth it. Honestly go to the Cafe Noir across the street. Much better atmosphere - just cash only. But very hip and the staff was actually friendly. Go figure!!

My wife and I had one night in NYC on July 4, 2013 and we wanted to stay in a part of the city where we could get a comfortable place to stay, great shopping and great food. We were referred by friends to The James because of their excellent reputation for providing great rooms and a cool, casual atmosphere with access to SOHO, Tribeca and The Village. We were not disappointed!When we arrived, Amy at the front desk was very friendly and offered to give us information about the hotel, amenities, the area and that we should contact her if their was anything else we needed. I had mentioned that my wife and I had been married about 6 weeks prior and without even wanting anything, when we arrived in our corner king room, there was a bottle of champagne as well as some snacks with a hand written card from the staff welcoming us to a mini-honeymoon. The room itself was amazing. We were on the 12th floor and had a unobstructed view of the new World Trade Center "Freedom Tower" - which was lit up Red, White and Blue at night. The beds were fantastic (and we have stayed in Westins, Four Seasons, and Ritz's). I think they had 5 different types of pillows and they were all very comfortable. They have an fantastic mini bar with great Alcohol and compliments and we loved the bobbysue's nuts! The bathroom has a fun see through window (that can be shut for privacy) and the shower head comes down from the ceiling and has plenty of room for two :)After a great lunch at Osteria Morini and some shopping in Soho, we came back to The James for some free wine and cheese in the lobby. Chris from the front desk advised us to get to the roof top about an hour before the fireworks because he wanted to make sure that we would have a view. He also warned us that we might not be able to see the entire show because a building might be in the way. We got to the rooftop about 30 minutes before the fireworks and we were able to get a great spot on the railing. We were pleasantly surprised with how much of the fireworks we could see - our view was only slightly blocked. They had a DJ playing party music before the fireworks, but then switched to more traditional Americana (Sinatra, etc) for the show. It was awesome!The next morning we woke up around 10:00 thinking we would check out and grab a bite to eat. I called down to ask about check out time believing it would be 11:00 and Chris said, "anytime between 12:00 - 2:00". That was perfect! We were able to get food, do a bit more shopping and come back, shower and still check out by 2:00. It was like we got two full days and only had to pay for one night. One side note, as we were walking out of our room to breakfast, we pasted a housekeeper who was very pleasant and said, "you don't have to check out until 2:00 - enjoy your day". We just felt like the staff wanted us to feel comfortable and to enjoy the hotel for as long as possible.When we left, my wife said to me that although we had only stayed one night, it felt like a long vacation. We will definitely be back to the James!!!

The James could be an amazing boutique hipster hotel. Unfortunately, I literally waited for 5 hours to get into my room. I had to ask them to cancel my reservation before they actually fixed the problem. Big time bummer.

We stayed at The James for our honeymoon trip to New York. The price for the James in Soho is actually cheaper than many other hotels in the area which are not as nice. The corner King Suite was magical with an amazing view of the new World Trade Centre. The bed and pillows were so comfortable we literally wanted to find out where we could buy them for our own home. When the young lady at the front desk found out we were on our honeymoon she was very sweet and congratulatory...later on that night when we arrived back at the hotel we had a bottle of champagne and chocolate strawberries waiting for us. A beautiful and unexpected surprise. Thank you so much for that! We received so much help from all of the staff, front desk and doormen (Kenny and the rest of the guys) who constantly gave us input and advice on where to visit, how to get there, nice restaurants, etc. Their help and assistance was very greatly appreciated for 2 Torontonians who had never been to New York. The city is truly awesome! But back to the hotel...it is literally steps away from the Subway which is a great way to get around the city. Clean, cheap, friendly, air conditioned and no graffitti. (Nothing like the movies from the 80's). The hotel is in the beautiful neighbourhood of Soho which is full of galleries, restaurants, shops and home to so many beautiful cast-iron buildings. The neighbourhood is a treasure and you could spend a whole day easily just wandering around there. We loved the unique design and look of the hotel - from the glass elevator, to the unique lobby, the beautiful gardens and the lovely outdoor restaurant David Burke's Kitchen which is attached to the hotel. We tried to get up to Jimmy at the James (The Terrace Pool by day - for hotel guests and happening club at night for the public) a couple of times late at night but were unable to because of private parties or because we were just a little too late. Hey - I thought New York never sleeps! Anyways we had a chance to go up during the day and enjoy a coffee on the top floor for an hour and totally enjoyed the amazing 360 view of the city. Add to that the friendly Lifeguard who sat and chatted with us and gave us a bit of a "guided tour" of what we were looking at. We sadly left after 3 nights but not before realizing I had forgotten our Ipod on the Ipod player in the room. I called the hotel from the airport and spoke to a friendly Guest Services Woman who informed us it had been turned in by Housekeeping. Two days later it arrived by FedEx at our house. I am sure I speak for many who have visited Trip Advisor when I say we have all stayed at beautiful hotels with lousy service, crappy hotels with great service, mediocre hotels with mediocre service. Well I can honestly say The James is an amazing hotel with an equally amazing staff. A great hotel is not just the location, or the amenities, or the room, or the food, or the neighbourhood - which The James all has - but it is made great by the wonderful staff who are the ambassadors and curators of the hotel. We were made to feel welcome and appreciated and for that we will always be grateful. Our beautiful stay at The James put the icing on our Honeymoon. Cheers to all of the staff who made our stay memorable! F&V

loved the room/surroundings/location. Jimmy's staff rude to hotel guests when the pool bar transitions from hotel guests only to being open to the public. hotel guests made to feel like they are in the way, as they are kicked out of lounge chairs to ready the pool area for the "open to the public" hours. guards in lobby hallways act like nasty bouncers at a club treating hotel guests -- not as guests. when concern raised to hotel manager, no attempt was made to correct the situation. i was aware from the website that the pool area was open to the public in the evening, but my expectations did not include 3pm forward on the weekends.

Overall very positive. We specifically chose the James because of the roof top pool. The room was great except for the loose tiles on the floor of the shower. The location is great.We arrived at 10 am and were able check our bags and go up to roof top pool area to enjoy a hot sunny day. The pool attendent Coffey?? was GREAT. He has tough job to manage the severe paucity of lounge chairs and the various guest personalities. They could get a few more lounge chairs into the available space by changing the rearrangement.Everything was great until...Unfortunately, at 3pm a group of workers came around to announce that the cushions had to be removed and the lounges rearranged in anticipation of a party of 200 people. Next the revelers arrived, clearly not hotel guests. There was no mention of this in any of the literature or information that I had. The entry staff and front desk staff could be more congenial and friendly.

Choose a corner bedroom, the views are great.The hotel has some Bikes which are very useful to wonder around the villageThe view on the rooftop is fantastic, have a cocktail and look ate the soroundings

We stayed here for three nights and it is rather confusing when you first arrive as the porters at the entrance are dressed so casually that we didn’t think they worked there, but we liked their style! The reception is actually on the first floor, so you then have to go up in the lift! We got the friendliest welcome we have ever had in any hotel though and the receptionist was really lovely, very chatty and so helpful telling us all about the hotel and its facilities – if only all hotel receptionists were like that!Our room was on the 17th floor and was quite large by NYC standards and had great views over the Hudson (and also great sunset views!). It was clean, modern and bright and there was clever use of space with a lot of storage being under the sofa. The bathroom had a great shower and I loved the ethical toiletries too.I used the gym which was located on the same floor and it too had great views – this time of Brooklyn Bridge. It was well equipped, very clean and well maintained and never too busy, so I really enjoyed using it.In the lounge which was very bright and comfortable, there were delicious pastries and coffee every morning and also wine and cheese in the early evenings (although the cheese had usually all gone!) and cookies later on, which was a nice touch.We ate breakfast in the David Burke Kitchen the first morning but didn’t bother again as although the food was good when it eventually arrived, the service was appalling. We also had drinks in Jimmy’s, the rooftop cocktail bar; it is so good up there, great cocktails and great atmosphere. The rooftop pool looked good too but is rather small. The hotel also has lots of fabulous artwork all around it and a nice outside area.We thought the location was brilliant, Soho is a great area with all its art galleries, boutiques, restaurants and bars which are all so easy to get to from the hotel, as is the subway. If we go back to NYC and Soho, we would definitely stay at The James again as we really enjoyed it.

Stunning hotel perfectly located in a cool neighbourhood for wondering, away from the madness of uptown but with excellent subway links to everywhere. Service and staff very good as well. Could not have been better.
user_name:
Mr. David D
Newcastle Upon Tyne

review_body: Our corner king on the 8th floor had a magnificent view. The room was amazingly comfortable especially the bedding and bed. The corner room is more spacious and the bathroom is glass with a screen that comes down for privacy. I would definitely return to stay here.
user_name:
Joan S
Kendall Park, New Jersey

review_body: We spend 9 nights in The James and we had a good time. The hotel is very nice. It has the best location you can be in NY, SoHo. There are heaps of nice restaurants and shops near to the James. The staff and service is very good. Kenny is the best ! ;) BUT the rooftop bar is terrible. It doesn't belong to the hotel, probably that's why. The staff is very unfriendly and it feels like there is a private party everyday. That's very sad because you have an awesome view from the 18th floor.

I stayed at the James on Sunday for a night. It was amazing. The staff was incredible and the in house dining was amazing. i def cannot wait to go back. Oh and the view in 1608 is to die for! If you can request that room you should!
user_name:
lizs816
New York City, New York

review_body: Perfect location, incredible staff, great rooms, rooftop is sensational-well worth the rateWe have stayed in NYC many times and decided on a different area-although in Soho there is a subway 10 seconds from the hotel-10 minutes from Times Square.

The James is a hip stylish place in a great location with generally friendly and helpful employees. However, the rooms are tiny (you won't want to spend any time there awake) and sometimes you will encounter an attitude that can be condescending. The food is very good, the food service is spotty, the bell and front door staff are terrific - as good as it gets in NYC.

My girlfriend and me stayed here just after the storm in November. The trip was full of uncertanity especially as the hotel were not sure if they would be open. At the last minute they told us that we would be put in another hotel near Grand Central at first we were horified as we had taken so much time chosing the James. The replacement hotel was nowhere near the same standard and would have been a huge dissapointment. However upin arriving at the sub std replacement hotel we were told the James had been re opened and we couldn't have been happier.We arrived to a fantastic hotel in the most amazing location right in Soho. In my opinion the restaurants and shopping is far superior to central Manhattan where I have been lots before.The hotel i simply amazing. We had booked a corner suite and two sides of the room are glass giving you the most amazing views towards Freedom Tower.We decided to eat and drink in the hotel on the first night of 4 and the restaurant is totally awesome a little pricey but worth every cent. The fish was freshly caught by the chef that day on his boat and the steak that my Girlfriend had was simply amazing ( I had some of it ).The wine list was great and the desserts well the dessert is still memorable for the right reasons now.All in all if you want a great hotel with great views and a great restaurant and roof top bar then chose the James. However please be ware the staff are typical new yorkers in the way they deal with you but what else do you expect when in New York. The bathroom are so awesome as the bathroom is glass and the room is mainly glass walled so when you are in the shower or doing anything in the bathroom you can see right out across the city.The guy who runs the door I forget his name but he has worked and lived locally for many years is so knowledgeable and happy to help with anything and he is well worth tipping for his help he can help you out with just about anything you need and has some great local knowledge.So I guess the real question is would we return again and the answer is yes :- the location is perfect, the rooms are spotless and so well cleaned, the hotel is funky, the restaurant is great if you want to keep it simple and eat in and the roof top bar with the little pool outside is a great little place to finish the night off in.

Amazing space, beautiful and comfortable rooms, great amenities and location. Overall the staff were excellent, great food, could be the perfect hotel. The main problem is that the James cannot decide whether it is primarily a high end hotel or a hot-spot for local night life. The pool is open to the public and every evening cushions are removed from lounge chairs to "protect them for guests" and there is constant monitoring / surveillance and checking for your status (appreciated, but inconvenient and impersonal). Frequent private events close the facilities to hotel guests. Very popular night spot with locals which could be wonderful depending on your goals, but leads to huge streams of loud and drunk revelers. Though a separate elevator exists for visitors to the rooftop and hotel guests, there is constant confusion leading to overcrowding, very long waits for elevators, and frequent attempts to direct traffic by stressed out staff at these times who bark instructions and try to redirect people rather than asking "are you a hotel guest?" first. If you are looking for a lovely hotel and vibrant party scene this place is utterly perfect. If you want to separate the two and enjoy a luxurious and tranquil experience this is not the place to go (though it really could be as the rooms and facilities are spectacular!).

Agree with comments made by kt9388; great boutique hotel and location Downtown in really interesting part of Manhattan. After staying Uptown last time we visited, this was a good place to explore Soho, Greenwich Village, Little Italy and Chinatown on foot, with some good restaurants, diners and shopping nearby. Hotel staff were helpful and courteous and some nice touches of pastries in the morning and wine in the evening. If you are under 30 and body beautiful you will feel at home in rooftop bar, which does attract members of the public for private parties and pool parties, as the hotel is open for non-guests there is a slightly complicated way of getting in and out which we had mastered after 4days but you do feel a bit over-run by the party scene at night and more so at the weekend. Our one and only visit to the garden bar was also mobbed by some private function, obviously a magnet for twenty something Newyorkers. On the whole, we had a nice time but not the personal feel of a boutique hotel we were expecting.

We stayed at this hotel a week ago and were pretty disappointed with our time here, having had such high expectations.First, the good points. The hotel's in a great location, in SoHo, close to several shops, bars and restaurants, and with a Subway station just around the corner - this made it easy to get to and from pretty much everywhere.The hotel and rooms are beautifully decorated, modern and airy. The rooms especially are very spacious and clean with great views, and the bathroom too was great. Reception staff on the whole were good and willing to help.Now for the bad... The hotel has a terrace bar, gym, rooftop bar/pool and a connection to a restaurant, all of which are open to the general public, and this made our stay very frustrating; every time we entered the hotel, we were asked by the doormen if we were staying as guests/visiting one of these areas (as members of the public). We would then be asked the same question at the lifts by different people who would generally be loitering by them, probably to direct members of the public to the area they were looking for. Then we would have to wait ages for a lift, because these public clients were using them, and when they did arrive, we'd have to share them with often pretentious and quite vulgar people.This might not seem like such a big deal, but as my partner commented, you really get the impression that, despite the money you've paid out to stay at the hotel as a 'guest', you're seen as a second-class citizen, and this grates after a while.Overall, the hotel would be exceptional if it was just a 'hotel' - perhaps they could have a separate lift/entrance for hotel guests? For that reason, I wouldn't stay here again and will likely stick to hotels that are more concerned with their guests than their money-making amenities geared towards to general public.

Everything about this hotel was amazing! It was my birthday and get sent me a delicious chocolate cake the first day we arrived! Kenny was just so sweet. The treehouse manager gave us great advice every night on what hot spots to go. We saw celebrities at the hotel. Cameron Diaz was actually filming there. The David Burke cake pops are delicious! The room service was great! Pool was a bit small and crowded but we had a fantastic time! The view is amazing!!! Can't wait to go back.

The staff were wonderful. Very friendly. Helped with subways, food, flights. A little more expensive than some other hotels, but well worth the extra. Turn down service every night . Clean towels daily. Lush robes. Truffles left by bed every night. The most comfortable bed ever. Rooftop plunge pool/bar. If we return to New York, we will definitely be staying here again. Soho also has fab shops and use the subways to get around. You won't regret staying here.

Really liked this hotel, the location was great, service excellent, nice room with comfortable bed, large bathroom/shower. Nice amenities including coffee/pastries for breakfast in the lobby, free wifi, filtered water in room and car service. Would definitely recommend to others and will return during my next visit.

A great window into the downtown scene. The staff is exceptionally friendly. The location is a tad too far downtown but the Soho vibe is super cool. Great eats and shopping close by. Heated bath floors!

The James is a well located, chic hotel at the edge of Soho. It's less than a block from the subway and is a walk from a number of attractions/sites (eg Brooklyn Bridge, Soho, Little Italy etc). We had a corner king room which was a decent size (for NY); had a comfortable bed; good shower etc; and a good view of the new WTC (we were on the 14th floor). The hotel has decent bars at the top and bottom. In-room breakfast was of a good quality and arrived promptly at the right time. The pool is very small and most people just used it to dip their feet in. Jimmys, the bar on the roof, has good views and a decent selection of drinks, but gets very busy/noisy in the evenings. The concierge team are very helpful and did a good job booking various restaurants.

The James is a very welcoming hotel, with a very pleasant design. All personnel was really friendly and helpful, despite the hotel being fully booked. The rooms are of a decent size and had a "home away from home" feeling, as opposed to a hotel chain. The bed is very comfortable and the view from the room is very nice, with a massive window overlooking the city.Unfortunately, I was there during the winter and couldn't take advantage of the swimming pool or the roof-top bar.

Great area, nice quiet hotel with amazing staff. Exceptional service and thoughtful details, enjoyed our evening glass of wine in the lobby and the coffee service in the morning. We arrived early after a red eye from Vancouver and they upgraded our room to get us in far earlier than check in, we were in our room at 10am and greatly appreciated being able to sleep!

Enjoying our 3-day stay so far! Great location and amenities. Our toddler daughter loves all the attention (& her Paul Frank pajamas!) Michael from guest services has kept our bellies full and thirst sated, both in our room and at the rooftop pool. Great job, Michael.

This was a very nice place to stay. The room was a good size and very stylish. The staff were very helpful. The neighborhood has great bars and restaurants. This is a fantastic place for a romantic get-away.
user_name:
Mr. David Willi... W
New York

review_body: The James delivers in every way, from the attentive staff in the lobby to the room service mac and cheese ordered at 3 am. The suite was perfectly done in modern elegance without being precious. The panoramic views from our suite were just as good as from Jimmy, the hip roof-top bar with a pool. An added plus: Jimmy is open to hotel guests only before 3 pm, adding to the aura of exclusivity. It was hard to go home after a night at the James!

the room was this very comfortable space both modern and simple with a great view of new york city. the staff are just excellant. the location really works for walking to the hot spots, easy train access and the easy cab catch. the restaurants really spoil you for not wanting to leave the hotel. well you really enjoy yourself why would you leave it??!!.
user_name:
Francis G
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed at the James for my best friend's Bachelorette party and as a seasoned New Yorker I can say this is one of the best spots in the city. Great location, close to everything, friendly helpful staff and Jimmy (roof top bar) and other in house amenities were awesome. Rooms were super comfortable and plush and quiet! Not always a given in an NYC hotel.
user_name:
Anon317
New York City, New York

review_body: Had a fabulous time at The James. The staff makes this hotel. Kenny at the door is friendly, helpful and gave us great suggestions. Michael at the door was also warm and outgoing. The Jimmy roof top was a lot of fun. Security Man named Cio was outstanding. A real gentleman who looked out for us. Excellent experience from all the staff at The James. Sophistication without the snootiness. We will definitely be back.

We payed $ 2000 for four nights. But it was all worth it !! Highly recommend The James. Absolutly loved it. Staff is supernice, the rooftop bar(Jimmy) is one of the hottest spots in town. Location could not be better.

My wife and I stayed for Memorial Day weekend and had a fantastic stay. The hotel is well situated - it is a couple of blocks from the center of Soho, the riverfront Westway Park and promenade and a short, pleasant walk to Chinatown and the Financial District. The hotel is new and rooms are modern, well designed and furnished. The bed and bedding was very comfortable. Full clear glass wall between the bedroom and the bathroom is interesting, but can be made less so when you realize there is a power shade (switch in the bathroom) to give privacy. There is a rooftop bar and a pool area with comfortable lounges and a great view. Room service is prompt and excellent food, and special mention to servers Julio and Mo, (all the staff was very helpful and knowlegable). The second floor lobby has a view of Tribeca and downtown and has complimentary snacks (delicious scones in the morning and wine before dinner) and newspapers. Also, if you like to work out in a gym, this one is a wall of windows on the 16th floor, looking out over the Brooklyn Bridge and the lower Manhattan skyline.If you're staying downtown and looking for a place near Soho, Tribeca and Chinatown, stay here. We will next time we are looking to stay in this neighborhood.

Beautiful modern hotel on a good location.Staff was very friendly, especially Eric at the door. He can stop any taxi in NY !Thx for a wonderful stay in a very very rainy NYThe subway is very close to any direction.

Thank you so much for such a wonderful weekend at your hotel. I own a company that relies on customer service, Kenny and Chrissy, along with the rest of the staff are top notch!!!!!!!.We will see you again soon.
user_name:
john k
West Palm Beach, Florida

review_body: We loved this hotel -- they even called before we arrived to see if we needed anything during our stay. We stayed just one night but every detail was perfect. The staff struck just the right balance of being attentive without being over-the-top. The doormen, Michael and Eric, took great care of us and the front desk staff were super helpful and gave great advice. The location couldn't have been better -- easy access to the subway and easy walk to SOHO.

The James Hotel is a great location close to subways, restaurants and shops. We have traveled to NYC many times before and mostly stayed in the midtown area. We LOVED being in Soho where it was much more quaint, less touristy and a great selection of restaurants and places to shop. We also had traveled with our four year old son and it was such a pleasant surprise to see that the hotel had sent up a welcome package for our son that included paul frank pjs, cookies, and cranyons!

We had the first few nights of our honeymoon at the James in Soho and it was amazing.We had a room on the 16th floor with great views. The staff were really helpful for everything we asked of them.Couldn't have picked a better hotel.

We picked this hotel due to its location to Soho/Tribeca/West Village and weren't disappointed. Location is just across from the subway and on the vibrant Grand Street which offers a wide range of eateries and boutique shops off from there. We booked a corner room and paid extra for a higher floor (we got the top floor). Positives: Good sized room and bathroom. Views from the corner help add to the NYC experience. Coffee and cakes for free in the morning was enough to keep you going till lunch. Nice size gym with fantastic views towards Brooklyn. Friendly staff. Roof top views and location are superbDownsides: Slightly confusing entrance/lift to lobby area. The roof top bar is very popular with locals. We quite often shared the lift with merry non hotel guests going to / from the bar which may not be to everyone's taste.Overall great area/location, room and views but may be tempted elsewhere for a second visit
user_name:
Jump32
Royal Tunbridge Wells, United Kingdom

review_body: Had a fab time at The James! Nice, modern, clean rooms with great views from big windows (even on lowest floor). Large bathroom. Gym with great views. Nice roof top bar incl swimming pool. Very good food in their restaurant as well as at the room service. Very nice people that work there. For instance Eric, the door man - always helpful, happy and very nice.

Stayed there for 2 nights, great location, very clean and a modern feel to it. The staff was friendly as well.Only weird thing was the lack of a proper lobby.Don't expect to swim on the rooftop pool, it's tiny but great bar in the evening!

The James gets boutique New York well, with its cool communal spaces and lobby, great rooftop pool and bar, 'small hotel' feel and funky rooms. The area of Soho feels real and local, making a stay at this place even more special. Free wine and cheese is a good idea, albeit quality of both can be improved. The staff are delightful.

We stayed at this hotel May 23-28th 2013. My first impression it was not what I was quite expecting. They certainly have done a very good job with their website and photography to make this hotel look far more glamourous than what it actually is. For example, the rooftop pool bar looks amazing on their web page but in reality its just a few wooden sun loungers around a pool no bigger than an oversized bathtub. We stayed in a king room. THe room was very small. Enough for a double bed and an ensuite, but it was clean and modern with a nice double shower. The service in the hotel was pretty good, although we were not very demanding. We ordered room service and the food came within 20 minutes, was good quality and was hot. The rest of the staff were also very helpful and friendly. THe best thing about this hotel has to be the location. Its a 2 minute walk to the subway and you are right in the middle of a very sophisticated nightlife with trendy bars and restaurants at your finger tips. This is definitely what you are paying the premium price for. However, just around the corner is The Soho Grand, which had much more glam than the James, I would give that hotel a try next time. Overall, this hotel is over priced for what you get.

A perfect mix of luxury and trendy! Great location (if you want to be in the heart of Soho and TriBeCa)! Easy access to the subway for midtown theatre access. Room was spacious for NYC and refined. Staff was so helpful and friendly --especially Eric at the door! Concierge made fabulous recommendations! We will be back!

Took my teen daughter, for her birthday, for a day/night in Soho to shop and dine. Upon arrival at the hotel we were greeted immediately, wished my daughter a happy birthday, and checked us in quickly. The concierge was extremely helpful in directing us to great shopping. After checking in, the concierge remembered us every time we came and went from the hotel which made our stay that much better.The room we stayed in was a corner unit with great views of the Freedom Tower. The room was light and airy and very comfortable. The location was great- right near the subway and Tribeca. Highly recommend.

We spent a week in May and were impressed by every facet of the hotel. Nice large and well appointed rooms with modern furnishings and a light cheerful decor throughout. The young staff are friendly and helpful, and there are numerous pluses that make up for the NYC prices: free internet, coffee and muffins for breakfast, the airy gym on the 17th floor and the rooftop Jimmy bar all come to mind.

We stayed in NY for five days and had an amazing stay at The James. Last time I was in NY, I lived there, so it was a bit strange to be a 'tourist'. The location is perfect: close to the A,C as well as the major hubs of Canal St. It's right on the border of TriBeCa, SoHo and Chinatown, so there is a ton to do in the area if you wanted to just stay close to 'home'. The Staff at the James was outstanding. They were all truly professional, yet friendly and approachable. Upon check-in, we were pretty early, but the Staff managed to get us checked-in and also upgraded us to a corner Queen. If you know NY, then you know a view is something you pay for, but who really wants a view when you're in the middle of NY: you'll be outside exploring, so don't really need a view. The room was always well-kept and tidy. Yes, it's a bit small, but they do a great job of maximizing the space in the room. Again, this is NY. I've lived in a room that size with three other people, so this was perfect! There is always someone around and we felt very secure. We did not go to the restaurant or Club--just not something we were into. When we checked out, I got into the elevator at 4:30 AM and three revelers were heading down from teh rooftop bar. They were dressed extremely posh (Guys in suits and ties, girl in trendy attire), but absolutely reeked of booze. They looked like they had a good time. So, if you're in NY to explore, hang out and be treated well, stay at the James.

I have stayed at the James in NY a number of times since shortly after it first opened. I continue to be most impressed by the views of the city from even the lower floors. I also very much like the understated simplicity of the hotels design and decor. The staff continues to be friendly and helpful.I also appreciate the willingness of the management to receive and respond to feedback in a meaningful way.

The staff at the James sports an extremely low-key yet maticulously accommodating profile both as individuals as well as a group at large. My stay was mandated by a need to vacate my apartment during the remediation of a water leak that led to some mold growth, and already senstive for some time now, I needed a place short term that wouldn't challenge me further with uneccessary chemical exposures to artificial fragrances etc.Thankfully, the James is of an ilk whereby it prides itself in being "organic" and I have to say, this carries through to the personality of the staff as well. As such, the service went way beyond the usual professionally polite and courteous service to something intuitive and personal whereby I felt not merely well served, but cared for. Each individual member of the James staff, from manager to room attendant, was unabashedly helpful and sympathetic, which left me feeling like I was being treated with real understanding and not merely a show of professional courtesy, Quickly into my stay I felt as if I were surrounded by family, which I find remains highly noteworthy.(Just an observation for those of you who are mold sensitive; the location was subject to Hurricane Sandy and could be a bit of a challenge if you are so disposed.)
user_name:
Bluepoptraveller
New York City, New York

review_body: The James is a pretty special place..We have stayed at a number of properties in New York which allows us to make some pretty fair comparisons.This is our first time staying in Soho and we selected The James Hotel to experience this location.There are a few things that make this hotel pretty special.The service is spectacular.From the moment you meet Eric the bellman,you are confident you made a great choice.We then proceeded to check in and met Chris Westerman and Jessica. I have never received such extraordinary service.Every associate of the James is thrilled to be serving guests and it shows.We also loved the amenities coffee and scones in the lobby,breakfast at David Burke's(sensational food) wine and cheese late afternoon,and late night snack..all pretty special.The decor was very modern and zenlike and the views were terrific.Top it all off with a rooftop pool and it is the perfect hotel.If I have one observation indicating improvement,it would be that the rooms are a bit small and there is very limited storage space..That limitation is far outweighed by all the special touches at the James.I want to send cudos to hotel Management.Although we have never met,I guarantee you are great to your employees.There is only one way to maintain employees who are so wonderful to guests.The James Management must be wonderful to their employees!!They have created a spectacular work culture!Have Fun! Cookie Z

The James is a very classy modern hotel. The rooms are very well equipped and bright. The roof top bar and pool are a nice place to rest during the day and a cool place to have a drink with a superb view on lower Manhattan. The location is almost perfect between Soho and Tribeca.

Stayed in January 2013 and enjoyed it then (see previous review). Returned in April 2013 and enjoyed it again. Central reservations (which are off-site) are a bit of a nuisance (especially if the reservations agent/clerk does not have great familiarity with the hotel) but, apart from that slight hiccup, the experience was very good indeed. Lobby staff are excellent, welcoming and do everything they can to help. Rooms are a bit small (unless you go for a corner room) but altogether good. Location (edge of Soho) is good. Recommended!

The location is good - close to great shopping, good restaurants and sightseeing as well. The service is great - very natural, spontaneous and easy. We have stayed 5nights and found the whole stay amazing. The rooms are not big,but very comfortable, stylish, with great shower and nice views... Since there's so much to offer in NY, we have preferred to taste the best out of NY restaurants and the concierge (Crystal) was amazing. All the suggestions have been a success! Even by walking the city and calling the desk for a spontaneous restaurant advice was a success! The more we stayed in the hotel, the more we liked it - and the personell especially. We have done a lot of shopping - and some goods delivered out of the store to the hotel... I have managed just at home there was missing a blazer (not delivered from shop to hotel) > just one call and everything has been settled down! I like the James hotel team and spirit... When coming back to NY, the James hotel will be still on my list! PCH.

We stayed for a romantic weekend and loved the room, especially the bed and view. Very chill atmosphere (the Jimmy is awesome on sunny afternoons with a craft cocktail). Staff was friendly and effective. Floors are very quiet and the overall experience is intimate.

The thing about The James NYC is that it's simple, elegant and extremely comfortable. The hotel is located in SoHo so it's just a few short blocks from everything cool. Little Italy, Chinatown, Hell's Kitchen, are all close by. The hotel has everything you need to just feel comfortable. I found it difficult to leave the hotel to do anything because my room was so homey. The beds are very comfy, the shower is amazing, the views from the rooms are incredible. There's a turndown service that's such a nice surprise each night. They deliver packages to your room, rather than having you go look for them. They think of the little things that might annoy guests and take care of them. See, simple. I love this hotel. I highly recommend this hotel for stays short and long. The food is great, the art at the hotel is compelling. I find myself walking the halls just to take in the art on each floor. The pool on the 17th floor offers an amazing panoramic view of Downtown NYC. This hotel is an experience to remember. Definitely worth a stay for anyone!

I booked here for a long weekend at end of November based in its web site. The images are very deceptive making you think it is far more spacious than it is.The stay didn't go well as I booked through the web site and it asked me if I wanted to put the booking through outlook into my diary. Big mistake. It recorded the address as mid down at thier corporate HQ so my wife ended up stranded at ten pm on a Friday night in the wrong place, wrong area and no taxi free for ages. We explained this to the hotel the next morning and they honestly didn't give a damn. It was if it was our fault. Surely we knew the hotel was near SoHO? Well, I did as I booked it but no my wife didn't. The least they could have done was offer a free drink or something for their fault?I booked a high level room which ended up on floor 9. When is floor 9 high level in NYC????The room was average, nice bathroom but nothing special and a lot of traffic so noisy. The best bit of the hotel was the breakfast. This was to be fair really good quality.I emailed the hotel and the HQ after our stay and they never replied to my email about the issue with their web site so we complained, in person and via email to the GM and their Head office. They could have apologised and said come again and we will upgrade you or do something but no. The silence speaks volumes. They didn't care and it showed throughout the hotel. Just because you are busy does not mean you treat first time stay guests like this. We won't be back and The James Group are my worst hotel group of the year 2012/13. Period as they say in the mighty USA!All in all very expensive for what it is...

We stayed here for five nights and could not be more pleased with our choice. The SOHO location was convenient for shopping and eating, and there was an excellent playground four blocks away for our four year old. The Canal St. subway station is just a block away.Rooms are clean, new, nicely designed, and a decent size for NYC. It's not a large hotel, but there's a beautiful lobby with a useful business center and a small gym with a killer view. It's really nice when hotels offer free wifi in the rooms and in public areas!What really made our stay enjoyable was the excellent staff who were always friendly, professional, and went out of their way to help us with transportation and logistics. Their service compares favorably to any of the five star hotels I've stayed at in the states and abroad, but with the intimacy of a boutique hotel.

CHIC - the interior designers get high marks for coming up with a contemporary ambiance that is both chic and comfortable. (Yes, the rooms are quite small but the space is used so well that they are very comfortable) Super convenient for so many fun neighborhoods. Very welcoming and helpful staff. No suggestions for improvement (and I often do have suggestions!) - the whole experience was impeccable for us - absolutely delightful. Highly recommended and we will be back.

I cannot really fault The James, although I must confess that I did not come away with a feeling that the level of comfort was always commensurate with the cost. Our family of 3 adults and 1 teenager stayed for 6 nights in what is marketed as a “family suite”, being two adjacent rooms (a “corner king studio” and a queen standard guestroom) which are not inter-connecting but which have (a rather flimsy) outside door which closes off the two rooms from the public corridor thus allowing some privacy moving between the two adjacent rooms.
