The concierge and doorman were very helpful in directing you where to go and recommending restaurants and other things to do in the area.Finally, after leaving the hotel, they sent me a survey. When I told them that my room service breakfast did not arrive one morning (you can conveniently leave your order on a hanging menu on your doorknob) they responded immediately with a very nice and thoughtful email, offering me a credit to the restaurant and an invitation to visit the hotel again. I thought that was really personalized service that you don't receive everywhere you go.

Stayed here a few times and recommend it, esp if you're traveling as a single, as the rooms can be pretty tight. That said, they're well-designed and very modern. Smarty layed out. There's coffee on the lobby level. And the location is hard to beat. Interesting shopping, galleries, restaurants, bars, all within walking distance. Close access to the subway. Piece of advice: close the blinds before heading out for the day because the rooms can get very hot with direct sun.

Had not stayed in Soho area before so wanted a change of scene. Took ages to decide on The James and was looking for somewher that offered a bit of personality as well as good location and high quality rooms. Overall The james ticked these boxes. Rooms were well furnished and my deluxe king was adequate for one and probably squeezy for two if you have lots of luggage. Beds sensational bathroom shower good. I had paid for deluxe because it offered higher floor ( with views) but on checkin was given a lower floor with no view and quite dark. Request to move was unable to be met that night but was moved next day. Hotel has small guest area in foyer that offers basic tea/ coffee and pastry in morning. Staff were pleasant and answered requests promptly but they werent looking to offer assistance. Some were not as knowledgeable as they should be when informing visitors of attravtions, sights to see. Used the free area car service once and this was great service. Rick the driver was really helpful. However dont rely on this being available as they werent able to offer if on two other requests.Doorman Christopher set the tone for really impressive welcome but sadly some of his colleagues were less than pleasant and quite off hand. Cant comment on restaurant but couple of room service meals were ok however menu could do with few more light and healthy options. One visit to the rooftop bar was enough. It was crowded with younger set, and not comfortable for a solo traveller. Location is noisy, busy and a real eclectic mix of high end shops mixed in with low end cheap and cheerful. It is interesting but a bit gritty. Transport options make getting around pretty easy. Generally a pleasant stay but really need to take more care with the small details ( carpet in hallway needed a good vaccuum and vaccum cleaner was left in hallway two days running) if really want to justify the prices charged.

Had a wonderful overnight leisure stay at this hotel. The staff was wonderful, friendly, and helpful. The room was spotless clean and filled with all sorts of nice touches. The in-room dining was delicious.Car was waiting for me at check-out with yet another friendly doorman wishing me well and my receipt came via email before I made it home.The hotel is beautiful and well-kept with great touches throughout.Will definitely return and recommend to others.

I've stayed in the Rivington and the Thompson LES, but keep coming back to The James. I can't wait to cuddle up with The James again soon! The impressive yet relaxing atmosphere of the Sky Lobby, with complimentary cheese, biscuits, wine, cookies depending on the time of day - or maybe you are just sitting there and checking your emails and a staff member will offer you a coffee. The rooms are very stylish (James signature), toiletries are lush, lovely big bed, and the room is immaculately cleaned each day (someone even took the trouble to fold and organize my ties I'd left lying in a mess on the table) Again the James shows a deep understanding of true luxury - never over the top or intrusive, extremely private and comfortable, plus nice things just happen.

Stayed 2 nights at The James and we were pleasantly surprised. Location is perfect for access to Soho and Tribeca, rooms were nicely done and comfy, and service was top notch. Staff went out of their way to ensure we were satisfied.

This was our 3rd stay at the James. We booked a room on the higher floor and paid quite a bit for a view we did not get (we were put on the 10th floor, the hotel has 16 floors and rooms start on the 3rd floor)...when I asked the receptionist why we were put on this low floor, I was told that high floor rooms start on the 10th floor (I wonder if they always say that higher floor rooms start on the floor they put you in). Rooms were clean and spacious (for New York stardards). Was not at all impressed by the service: concierge on the ground floor never greets guests (although they see you walking pass they act like they do not see you) or will not open doors. Does it take so much to offer a better service? It's not that we are talking about a 2* hotel here and the hotel is quite pricey.There were some good points at the hotel: we received a complimentary later check-out (but the downside was that the cleaner knocked on our room 5 times from 1.00-2.00 which was extremely annoying since we wanted to shower before our long flight). Guest services was OUTSTANDNING: Christie and Nicole went out of their way to answer all our questions and resolve any issues (I would have rated this hotel as "poor" if not for both of them) and if not for the excellent guest services, I do not think I would book this hotel again.

My husband and I traveled to New York for the NY City Wine and Food Festival Roast of Anthony Bourdain. I am very particular where I stay. With much research under my belt, I choose The James. When we arrived - the room we had reserved was on a lower level. I wanted my husband to have a great view of lower Manhatten so we took the upgrade to a suite on the 15th floor. With the corner view from our bedroom and corner view of the sitting area we were on top of the world. The bed was so comfortable, and doesn't do the giggle like some beds do, so our movements did not bother the other. The soaking tub was great to relax in. Could the sink area have been larger? Yes, but who cares. The towels were large and thirsty. They did run out of wash clothes on Friday night.With two temperature controls, the rooms are whatever temperature you need them to be.We ordered room service on Friday night from Mimi. She was very informative about the soup of the day- Lobster. I wanted a hamburger, but with frittes. She easily substituted and asked how I wanted it done. And when the meal was delivered, the voice sounded familiar, so I asked if she was Mimi. Yes she was Mimi, and I told her how professional and helpful she had been on the phone. Keep her on your payroll! The burger must have been over two inches thick. Could this be done to my liking- oh yes! Great Stay- will stay again..

I stayed for 5 nights in October, originally booked for queen cnr. Unfortunately none were available, and was given a normal room (1504). With a little persuasion was upgraded to a king cnr (1202). The view was so great I woke up early every day + came home to see the changing light + view!! Bed was comfy + rain shower luxurious. Daily changing chocolate truffles was a nice touch!Staff, especially Tenille + Alfretz, were cheerful, accommodating + on the ball. Alfretz helped w my Internet + printing problems. Tenille remembered my name + followed up on how u was going on day 5, after I hadn't seen her for a few days! That's nice!Location was great in terms of <2 min walk from subway station; shopping + chinatown round the cnr. Perhaps a 15-20min subway ride to midtown sights. Easy access to WTC,Brooklyn line.Good for business needs as their Internet is sound (even in the lift); 2 macs in lobby in case u forgot ur laptop; free printing; space in lobby to meet guests. Great morning coffee from la Colombe + moreish berry scones to start your morning! I never made it back for evening wine + cheese, but did make it back for supper = yummy chocolate cookies.

We've just got back from a 3 night stay at The James. After a 16 hour journey, we were met by - I think Chris at the ground floor entrance. He was amazing... the best greeting I have ever had. He quickly made us welcome, he got us checked in and said 'I bet you need a glass of wine?' he brought us a complimentary glass of wine each to our room along with our bags and said he would be down by the door if we needed any help on where to go, where to eat etc as David Burke Kitchen and Jimmy were both closed that night for private functions. He wasn't just polite and helpful, he was charming and funny too and stood out head and shoulders over anyone else.The room is compact - but this is New York, if you're spending too long in your room you have a problem - there's plenty to go and do!! There was ample space for us and my overpacking and ton of cosmetics. We had a corner room 1109. The views were spectacular and it was so quiet. The bed is really comfortable, the bedding is really luxurious and gave us both great sleep!!The bathroom - it was a bathroom, luxuriously furnished so can't complain. They have shampoo, conditioner and body wash in the shower, all organic products with a really zesty/herby fragrance perfect for waking you up.Complimentary tea and coffee in the room and also in the lobby with scones. I did read a review when someone complained about the coffee and pastry's in the lobby??? It's free how can you complain - no one is forcing you to eat/drink it! However the savoury scone was really tasty!The lobby is nice and relaxed and is equipped with 2 mac's which were great for us to check in online for our return flight.The location - great, really close to restaurants, bars, galleries and boutiques. FAR FAR away from the jam packed sidewalks and tacky souvenir shops, it felt relaxed and friendly and welcoming a far cry from our last visit.I have read reviews where people said they weren't acknowledged much. Well we weren't either, but I really preferred it that way. There were always staff present who were more than happy to help, but I don't need someone to constantly follow me around and want to do everything for me or kiss my behind for me just for renting a room. They were laid back, relaxed and professional.I have to say Jimmy was a bit of a let down. The view is great, the pool as someone else mentioned is more of an ornamental bath. I think it just doesn't fit with the rest of the hotel, the hotel is effortless and the staff are just really pleasant... but up there, well the bar tender was just plain rude. He had an attitude and we witnessed 2 heated exchanges over just 2 drink. It felt so different, like really pretentious actually and that was just the staff! Maybe I just thought they would be like the hotel staff, actually I hoped they would be like Chris (I hope his name was Chris) We did however get to witness a beautiful sunset from the terrace which made the cocktails worth their price.Next time, if I get chance to go back to NY, I would stay at The James, but I would stay clear of Jimmy.

My husband and I just stayed 4 nights at The James. The staff's warm and welcoming attitudes make this hotel. We would like to give special recognition to Chris, the big guy at the front of the hotel. He was an absolute ray of sunshine, extremely helpful, and so friendly. We liked the hotel because it was modern, and well maintained, and has so many tucked away areas that feel like a green oasis in a city full of concrete and steel. The bed was very comfortable, great view from our windows, and great location for shopping, restaurants, and access to adjacent neighborhoods. Will absolutely consider staying here again while visitng NYC. Gail Seay

Thank U for making our stay in NY so memorable. We couldn't have asked for anything more. It was the staff that made the the most difference, laid back yet so aware and service minded - thank you! The location is also superb.

Very cold atmosphere even though the very polite and helpful staff makes you feel welcome.The concierge (Morgan) will do her best to make your restaurants reservations.The room size was ok (I had a King Deluxe) but for this type of room, you expect a larger surface. And again, it’s not cozy at all.The rooftop bar needs a BIG refurbishment and was not clean at all.A simple anecdote: the 1st day of my arrival, I needed to smoke.I had my cigarettes on met but no light. I went to the reception to ask for matches (or a lighter to borrow) they did not have any, went to the restaurant same thing, then went to the bar…no matches no lighter…I mean come on (how do you light you candles?!)! I know that it’s a non-smoking building but a 5 stars hotel could at least have matches or anything that would help you light a cigarette since they have a special terrace where you can smoke! At the end, one of the bellman was kind enough to go to the next-door pub and brought me matches.Anyway as an overall experience it’s certainly not a 5 stars hotel but an ok 4 stars.

Just got back from a weekend at The James. I was greeted very warmly by the hotel staff...they promptly stored my bags, issued me two tickets for a welcome cocktail ...and promised to call when my room was ready...which they did. My room was a king corner, and the views were fantastic!! My bed was super comfy, the shower was spa like..I could have stayed all week!!The only problem as another review commented on..was the service and attitude on the rooftop bar...felt pretty much ignored, but I will just skip that next time:)

The James is in a great part of the city, a lot more relaxed than the usual hot spots in Manhatten but still really close to some great bars and restaurants and fantastic shopping. From the moment we arrived the service (in the hotel) was exceptional and felt very personalized. The only let down in the service are the staff at the rooftop bar who were generally disinterested and made you feel they were doing you a favour letting you drink there. That said it was still a nice place for a late afternoon drink, particularly facing the north and watching the Empire State and Chrysler buildings light up at sunset. We stayed in a King corner room and although a bit small it was really nicely finished. It was nice to be able to open the windows to get some fresh air in and they did a great job blocking out the city noise when closed of an evening. Yes it's pricey but not a huge amount more than the big 4 star chains and well worth paying a little extra IMHO, would definitely stay again.
user_name:
Clouttsy
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My husband and I stayed at The James for five nights in September. The Hotel is nice enough, but the price tag is beyond what you get for the money. We paid $500 a night, so when the bathroom sink clogged (and stayed that way) for two days and I had to repeatedly call for hand towels (all this AFTER the room had been made up) I began to think we made a mistake. Also, the bar on the roof has become popular and on Saturday night we could hear the party up there until well after midnight. The staff is friendly enough, especially the door men. The continental breakfast is nothing more than two (pump) thermos coffee dispensers and a plate of small scones. We had to ask the staff when the coffee and scones were gone, which was quite often. They also advertise that fresh fruit is served every afternoon....this is a bowl of oranges or apples.We probably would not choose this hotel again.

The James Hotel in Soho is perfectly located. Walking distance to so many great restaurants, the Hudson River, The Highline and always very easy to pick up a cab. The doormen on the front desk were always super helpful and gave so much detail with directions and recommendations. The hotel itself was always spotless and clean and our room was an exceptional size corner suite. The addition of the roof top bar was funky and provided great views over New York. A touch on the expensive side, however the hotel did tick all the boxes.

The hotel is fine and has some good points...but for the nearly $500 + taxes so it should be. It's quite trendy with artworks on all floors and has a nice garden a level up from the street. The bar on the top floor is a nice place to hang out but don't expect too much in the way of service...and the plastic glasses are a little downmarket (I understand about the pool area). The pool, if you are planning to use it, is better described as a large ornamental bath...good for hopping into but that is it. The rooms are well enough appointed but quite compact (not ridiculously so) and the walls are quite thin. The hotel's dog friendly ...which is great for dogs and their owners...not good if you are within barking or snuffling distance. The windows would also appear to be single glazed so it can get quite noisy from the street. Rooms were clean, food was very good, Lobby staff helpful. Would I stay again? Don't think so. Would I eat in the adjoining restaurant? Absolutely. Would I go up to the roof for a good view over SOHO and a sundowner? Yes.

Stayed at The James with my husband for 2 nights while he was in the city for business. Really enjoyed our stay. Location is terrific-how can you go wrong with SOHO! Room was clean and loved the floor to ceiling windows. I really can't say enough about the staff-so friendly and helpful. No attitude or snobbiness that can be found at other boutique hotels. Definitely look forward to coming back again!!

Jessica is the bomb! I will come back just for her. The perfect front desk person. Cute, Nice, Sweet, Helpful, knows her business. I wish every hotel i stayed at had a front desk person like Jessica. And the hotel is nice too

Inside and outside area on roof. Also a terrace bar downstairs. We had a great time except the doorman wouldn't let one of our guy friends in. He probably showed attitude to the doorman and deserved not to be let in. ;)Next to cool bars and restaurants. Hot people.Swimming pool on roof.$700 a night for a room that's not large.... welcome to NY.
user_name:
CharityLiveHK
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I spent 8 nights at The James last August. We are 71 years old and was our first time there.My daughter indicated to us and we enjoyed it very much. We used to stay at some big hotels in Midtown NYC and The James at Soho is a nice place to stay. We prefer to travel by bus in NYC instead of Subway. In a short walk from the hotel we use to take the M5 bus to Midtown at 6th Avenue and we returned back taking the M20 bus at 7th Avenue.We recomed that hotel.Aries Borges, from Brazil

My wife and I celebrated her 70 birthday spending a week at the James and at no point did either of us regret it. Close to all the major subways, terrific SOHO restaurants and neighborhood buzz. The James' staff are the friendly, personable type we've come to expect from a boutique hotel. They really do seem to have genuine smiles and offers to help. Morning coffee in the lobby, evening wine and cheese, and bedtime cookies give this modern high design hotel a home-like quality. Last but not least: one of the most comfortable hotel beds ever and definitely the best pillows! Wow!

The James is breathtaking from start to finish..........the stylish decor, the very wonderful staff, the views, the bathroom shade (so inventive), Jimmys Rooftop, the Urban Garden and Treehouse are amazingly designed and so tranquil amongst a city that is bustling! The neighborhood that hosts The James is one that offers plenty of inviting galleries, pubs, restaurants, and shops. Upon arrival, we told the staff that my husband and myself were staying the night for my husbands birthday - we went to our room, then to Jimmy and when when we arrived back to our room - there were cookies and a birthday note left for him on the table! HOW THOUGHTFUL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Love this place - can't say enough. You took my breath away James!!!!!!!

Second time at The James and we will come back. This hotel definitely has it´s own charm and it feels very homely as it´s not too big.I stayed there for eight nights with my son and daughter and we all loved it. The staff are really friendly and professional and you really like them all.We have stayed at several hotels, like The Meridien, The Alex, Thompson 60, Thompson Les and Soho Grand,but.this is the best..

Me and my lover had a wonderful stay at the James New York. From the amazing views, to the really cool bathrooms I just could not stop smiling. The James is a great place to stay for business or pleasure. I stayed there recently and purposed to the love of my life right in the bedroom! She said YES!! The James New York will always be a part of my life. Thanks James NY!

My husband and I stayed at The James for a weekend over the summer and loved it. All the positive reviews about the rooms, dining options and amenities are true. The reason I am adding to the reviews is to praise Chris who works at the desk in the lobby on the ground floor. He greeted us warmly, introduced himself, had our bags and car taken care of quickly and we immediately knew we chose the right place to stay. He was upbeat and pleasant despite the intense heat. Later in our stay he gave us some great recommendations on things to see during our visit that were not on the normal tourist route. He is truly an asset.

It goes without saying, you have a choice of where to stay in New York. We've both been to a fair number of the stylish options but this is currently our favourite. We won't go into detail on the decor etc, suffice to say it's imaginative where it needs to be, it works and doesn't try too hard. One of the great things here is the place isn't trying to force its concept on you the way a place like the Ace does. this trip was for pleasure but we'll both return for business no doubt. They coped very well with our determined pleasure seeking, even being kind and chatty when we went down to the terrace in various states of disarray and at various unspeakable times of the night. Truly it's the staff that make this place. And what it is is a canavas for your own ideas and needs in New York City. If you're after a quiet night in after a loud one out it's calm and comforting, in other moods it's the perfect springboard to more energetic times. The reason for all this is the staff. Whoever does the recruiting is a genius and we left with warm fondness for all the people we interfaced with; Mike, Jessica, CJ, Chris, Alfie. We've already planned our next stay - Thursday 13th and my regular New York business haunt of 10 years The Bowery has been supplanted, all because of the warm welcome we had at The James. The rooftop bar is good too, although the staff there are more interested in their haircuts than their customers - apparently it's a separate business so we don't hold it against the James crew.

My wife and I spent 6 nights at The James hotel when we were in NY a couple of weeks ago...it is simply the best! Its position in Soho is A1, the staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful, restaurants are great and drinks at Jimmy's on the roof was out of this world. It was my wife's first visit to NY and she will be coming back (probably to shop without me) and neither of us would hesitate to stay at this wonderful hotel again and again.

We stayed at The James for a night having got off the Cunard cruise. Our room was ready at 12.00 and we had a lovely view. The Champage and macaroons were a nice surprise as we were celebrating a special bday. Staff at reception were really helpful. We had breakfast and staff were not as attentive . we would stay there again as the location is great and we loved our room.

This hotel and restaurants are great the staff is nice. Outside areas are a good plus and the location is perfect if you enjoy lower manhattan. We ate at the restaurant nice service good wine selection.
user_name:
nicole A
New York City, New York

review_body: The best hotel that I have stayed in in NY but it does come at a price. The staff are friendly and efficient; my room was clean and fresh.As the public have access to the roof bar the elevators do get crowded in the evenings, especially as one of the elevators was out of service during my stay. The surrounding location feels safe and is lively.My excellent breakfast was delivered to the room every morning but I was unsure about the tipping protocol. Service is shown as a separate item to the breakfast cost but I gave the lady who delivered the tray a couple of dollars in any case. However I had the feeling from looking at her face that she expected more but, with the service already added, I thought I might end up tipping twice. It was a slightly uncomfortable moment as of course I wanted to do the right thing.All in all, finances permitting, I will definitely stay there again.

I took my wife and myself here on our 2nd anniversary in mid july and enjoyed the stay. My only gripe was the location was hard to get to with the traffic that day. We stayed in a deluxe king room on the 17th floor. I enjoyed the view of the city and we were able to look out over soho from our room. The bed was very comfortable and we had a nice nights sleep. The staff was very helpful and helped get us a ride downtown to catch a show. All in all we enjoyed our stay.

We loved everything about the James. Far and away the best aspect of it was the people who work there, particularly Felix (one of the front doormen) and Michael (a manager). Both of these gentlemen, as well as many others, went out of their way to take good care of us and to make sure we had everything we needed to make life as easy and pleasant as possible. The rooms are gorgeous. We started out in a deluxe room, which was so nice that we thought about not transferring at all. But when a corner room came available the next night, we moved over for the duration of our stay. Even though it was on the same floor (15th), the view was several orders of magnitude better! We had a view of the Woolworth Building/new World Trade Center and of the Hudson River, and it was so amazing that we never closed the blinds once. Wonderful to fall asleep to that and wake up to it again.I wasn't a big fan of the rooftop bar, as it's a little too hip and loud for the likes of me. But it was clearly popular and attracted a very beautiful crowd. The outside cabanas and afternoon cocktails were more my scene - great sangria. Very close to everything. Be sure to walk to the Blue Ribbon Cafe, which is open until the wee hours of the a.m., and have the special cocktails and the fried chicken.

Upside: Attentive staff, modern and trendy environment, great neighborhood, nicely decorated rooms with luxury bath products, very good restaurant for lunch/dinner. Downside: Rooms were small, even by NYC standards. The gym is small, dirty, and not kept up well. The restaurant seemed very different for breakfast, including lower quality food and less attentive wait staff. Overall: Very nice hotel. We'll be back.

Where do I start?The welcome was great, we arrived rather early (10am) from SFO and within an hour our room was available - a good start.The coffee and croissants in reception are a lovely touch, as well as drinks in the early evening. Really great if you want a quick complimentary wine and cheese and cracker before you go out...All of the staff are great fun, attentive and nothing was ever too much trouble, down to earth real people with a great smile and * my kinda people * ...The room whilst not huge, was awesome. Wooden floors were nice too. Toiletries all organic and funky!The gym, used once, was super fine.Roof Top bar: Nice touch, in mid summer it was just great. Gin and Tonics up there middle of the day in an oasis! Then, late at night, the Roof Top bar is a very very cool spot to be. You know you are alive up there, with views down town and beyond.Other: Town bikes available, which was a lot of fun one morning, biking around the neighbourhood and out to Chinatown, etc.As for location, super central in Soho, great shopping, I could go on, but won't!All in all a great 5 nights at The James. You wont be disappointed.

The location of this hotel was the first draw for me and it totally delivered. The rooms were very cool, lovely bed, good audio and visual equipment. Bathroom very modern and cool. Roof top bar was the place to be the Saturday night I was there. Breakfast very tasty. Expect to pay top new York prices here. Worth a visit.

charming boutique hotel in soho with a roof pool/garden terrace, nice room design, but some drawbacks.- service was very person dependent, from average to good, staff usually nice but not always efficient (no water offered at table, delays for simple order, etc,)- room servicing disappointing, certainly not up to a four star hotel standard, with dust left, shoes and used towels left were they were. sleep quality was good against nyc standards.- food really disappointing from breafkfast to dinerwould have put a better ranking if hotel was cheaper, but there are so many other good places in nyc.it seems to me to be this kind of hotel where your satisfaction can vary a lot depending on staff attitude, from average to good.to sum up, might be worth considering if want to enjoy the pool, and hotel design essentially.

The James is located near Little Italy, Chinatown and Lower Manhattan. I enjoyed walking to Fulton Street and up to West Village. I am not an affectionada to the modern look, but the James had some interesting and recyclingable ideas, like the keyboard wall. I found most of the staff friendly with an exception to one doorman who messed up our bags and had to deliver one bag to us oversea. The James could have better accommodations for visitors with small children. Michael the Doorman is fantastic. He made a difference on our last day of stay. If you visit the James, ask for him.

We just got back from our first visit to The James this past weekend. Let me just say that it was a wonderful visit but had a few very minor hiccups. First impression was good. I don't like modern and really loved the "look" of the hotel. You walk in street level but that's the bellman's desk. Had no idea that check in was two levels up. No signs and upon arrival the desk was unmanned so a staff member happen to walk by and showed us where to go. I must say staff is incredibly NICE, polite, courteous, across the board. Check-in was smooth and quick. We were early but were still accommodated which was great.The lobby is nice. They have two computers and a printer that you can use. There are comped refreshments throughout the day - scones and coffee in the AM, wine and cheese in the PM.The Urban Garden is phenomenal! Loved it! There are three separate sitting areas. A lower loungey area with couches. An upper level with cabanas and tables for dining and then the bar area with high boys off to the side. Wish we had more time to have a couple meals there but we just had drinks. I imagine it gets very busy for dinner.The Rooftop views are fantastic. The "pool" is tiny and unimpressive but Jimmy's (the bar at the rooftop) is still a cool place to hang out. If you stay at the hotel, you can put your name on the list so you can get in hassle free after 9PM.Room: Tastefully appointed. Views were pretty awesome. Bed was WAY too soft for me. Closet had a lot of room. The bathroom has a glass wall separating it from the room. There is a screen that blocks the "view" but still see silhouettes so please consider if you're bunking with friends or work colleagues. Rainfall shower head was AMAZING! Amenities aren't little bottles but big refillable bottles of shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. Nice touch for me. Also get the NY-triple-filtered tap water in a bottle free of charge. They come to clean rooms late in the day (5/6pm) so plan accordingly. Turn down was done and chocolates left (with wrappers on - see previous review).Here comes my ONE con - the parking. Hotel reservations are done through a central location that handles both NY and Chicago. I asked about parking. The rep said it was $55 - per DAY - (outrageous in general, pretty norm for NY I guess) no in/out privileges. She neglected to mention that the price depends on the kind of car. We rented a Jeep Grand Cherokee (SUV) and apparently there is an upcharge of $10 per day for a bigger car! Granted that is only $20 more but it still pissed me off. Right hand should know what left hand is saying/doing. The front desk was polite but bc it is a "third-party" garage there was little they could do about the charge. They were nice enough to upgrade us to a king corner. Still super annoyed.Hotel: Very modern, boutique hotel with personality, green as in environ-friendly, clean, small rooms but this is NY folks and I am not part of the 1% to pay for the extra SF. Has the David Burke restaurant (highly rated) is a HUGE plus.Staff: Courteous, super-nice, knowledgeable about practically everything I inquired about.Location: It's on the edges of SoHo just North of TriBeCa. Close to the subway stop that takes you directly to the Empire State Building or South to the 9/11 memorial.It is very unfortunate that if we ever come back to NY we'll be bringing our 3 little (under 8) kids and probably not going to be staying at The James. It's just not conducive for little ones. I really did love this hotel and wouldn't hesitate if we have the chance to escape alone for the weekend.

A very cool place, funky like the area, rooms are nice and new, good size and layout. But it doesnt quite work 100% like a ritz or four seasons. Door staff are friendly and helpful. Front desk staff are friendly after you get to know them but a bit to cool for school when first meet. Staff dont exactly know whats going on in the place, call asking for a power adapter they say will bring up now - an hour later call again and someone else says come down pay deposit and collect. There is a gym but no showers or bathroom to change there, not handy when need to check out late. The one toilet in lobby was blocked and no staff knew and took ages before they cleaned up Very nice hotel but think staff need extra training to make it a good hotel. By the way nice garden abd roof top area.

My husband and I spent this past weekend at this hotel and it was not a good experience. Positives- Most of the staff was friendly and the rooms were okay I did however notice hair in the sink.Negatives- When you first walk in there is a nasty mildew, wet water like gross smell. It was really bad I was terrified that the entire hotel may smell this way.We received no turndown service and chocolates were left out on the desk with no wrappings on them at all. Like straight out of the box and they had fingerprints on them. Who in the hell did they expect to eat that?We were told we had until 2pm to check out and here comes the front desk calling at 12pm to see if we would still be leaving today. The parking is $55 a night and we tipped very well but the appreciation we got for it was items stolen out of our car. They stole our brand new cell phone car charger along with a cord to our cell phone and rummaged through our belongings. I am so pissed about this and for this reason we will not return. I was so close to staying at the trump soho oh how I wish I had the decision to make all over again.P.S. If the manager responds to this please do not bother trying to offer a free room upgrade along with a discount on dinner at your restaurant for my next stay. This offer was already sent to my email like clockwork once we checked out. However I wouldn't mind reimbursement for my belongings that were stolen by your staff.

suffering under successive changes in management. still beautiful rooms and a great downtown location. the rooms have great views. the arcitecture is very modern. if you are not a VIP you might want to look for a hotel more suited for the 99% of us.

We came here for our 1 year anniversary... we live in NYC but wanted a nice hotel to stay in...The rooms are very small so don't expect too much. Service was great and very friendly.They have a rooftop pool that is the size of a pool table lol, but people were laying around it and swimming in it. Good for business trips...

My wife and I recently stayed at the James in SOHO. We usually stay on the upper west side but wanted to try a new area. I was staying in two locations because of a business meeting; the first three days I was at the Standard (Meatpacking district) and the subsequent four days we elected to stay at the James. Both hotels are relatively new but our stay at the James was significantly better. The James manages to successfuly integrate modern design without sacrificing the comforts and service that one often seeks when traveling. We were staying in one of the corner kings which I highy recommend. The layout of the room, the lighting and the details make the room feel much more spacious than the actual square footage. The rooms alone would convince me to stay at the James; however, the real amentiies at the James relate to the multi-level garden environment at the lower levels and the rooftop bar and pool. Both provide a relaxing escape from the pace of NYC - especially the garden. We had drinks and dinner out there and it was fantastic. I wish that the terrace/garden was available more frequently for dining - that is my only negative critique of the hotel. Finally, the staff at the James is extraordinary. Whether it was helping us get checked in, accomodating our room needs, finding cabs or attending to our specific requests, the staff was friendly and helpful - houskeepers, conceirege, service staff and bellhops always greeted us with a smile and an offer of assistance. We will definitley be staying at the James the next time we travel to NYC.

This review has taken a year, mainly due to me being too lazy... The James is simply amazing.We (my fiancee and I) decided, on a whim, to go to New York for a week. No one mentioned it would be the best experience of our lives.Our crazy cab-ride from JFK introduced us to the busiest city in the world, and we arrived at the hotel and were greeted by a very friendly man who, in England, could pass as a passionate hotel manager. He was just the bag-man. We were checked in by the polite and helpful desk staff, and then sent to our room, which needs a new paragraph.I'm running out of superlatives, but we were blown away by the quality of the accommodation. Our agent in the UK had said this was a 4*, but the James is easily as good as a 6*, right down to the unique artwork in the corridors and little touches like comfy pillows! The bathroom is very nice, with lovely smelling products to use. We were left alone by the attentive staff to settle in, but it was a nice surprise to find a hand-written note welcoming us to New York.The bed (can't remember if it was queen or king) was huge, and very comfortable, and we both enjoyed a lovely night's sleep after eating at a restaurant recommended by the desk. You MUST order breakfast from the hotel - not because there is nothing on offer (pastries in the lobby), but because it is extremely tasty, and innovative for a hotel to offer such well presented.I could go on and on about the friendly staff, the clean room, the comfort, the style, convenient location and did I say friendly staff? They're helpful too! But I'll finish there and say I'm saving to go back as soon as possible - If I win the lottery, I'll book a suite for a long, long time.

Just left The James and I am already missing the wonderful staff. Without question, the team there is as genuine and upbeat as any I have come across in my travels. I loved the location...walked everywhere for wonderful food and shopping. The rooftop bar and pool were great...again, very upbeat atmosphere and service. The beds were very comfortable and surprisingly quiet rooms as well. I will definitely be back!

I come to NYC quite a bit for work, and have historically stayed in hotels a bit closer to Times Square...Empire and Dream. The only other time I stayed in Soho was at the Soho Grand. Can I tell you that The James has been my best NYC hotel experience to-date?!?! The staff is very pleasant, the contemorary decor is refreshing the complimentary lobby treats are tasty, and my room was very clean with a beautiful view of the city....oh, and the water pressure in the shower was exactly what I needed after a long day and the perfect start of another! Can't wait to stay again;)

Only wish we could have stayed longer. Next time :) The staff is kind and accommodating...awesome location...lovely surroundings...all the necessary amenities packed into a great aesthetic. We enjoyed a bit of almost everything in the hotel in the (regretably) short time we were there. What is there not to love about this place? We will be back.

We have been to New York many times, and look forward to trying out a new hotel on every trip. As a relative 'newcomer' to the New York hotel scene we chose The James based on its central SoHo location and were intrigued to see if it was a good as all the reviewers say! For such a large hotel it still feels quite intimate. Service at every point during our stay (with the exception of breakfast one morning) was first class from the moment we stepped out the cab (charming door men) through to check in, with staff helpful and courteous throughout. We had drinks in Jimmy’s every night, and even though we entered after 9pm - when the bar is no longer accessible from the guest hotel elevator - we were given immediate access and didn’t have to queue with non guests. Perhaps not the most inexpensive bar in town, but worth the premium for the views and ambience. On our first night we decided to dine in at David Burke Kitchen - terrific food, buzzy atmosphere and just a short stroll to the elevator and our comfy bed...perfect. When booking we debated on whether to upgrade on the room and opted for a Corner King Studio room. I’m glad we did as this afforded us a great city views from its sleek modern and fully equipped interior. Sadly, it was just too cold to use the roof garden space, but we shall have to return in the spring to play some crocket on the lawn! Another plus was the complimentary coffee and pastries served in the Lobby, nice little touch that belies the size of the hotel....smaller ‘boutique’ hotels should take note. A perfect stay, aside from the poor service we received at breakfast one morning...down to one particular member of staff who disappeared for long periods of time (20mins) and didn’t offer us refills or appear particularly bothered in providing a service, which was made all the more apparent by the efficiency and professionalism of his colleagues. Shame. But despite this ‘hiccup’, we would return. This is a fabulous hotel and rates as one of one of my best hotel experiences in this great city.

Super location, superb service, nice rooms. Hip area that is great to walk around in. Unique rooftop pool. Interesting out door restaurant and garden. Overall a very good experience from friendly check in to a check that made sure we were happy.
user_name:
Ken K
Northbrook, Illinois, United States

review_body: Nice hotel but they are unresponsive to their guests complaints. I emailed them twice about a problem with m bill and they never answered! I would think with what they charged i would have the courtesy of a reponse

My wife and I were in New York for the well worn first trip away from the kids and we spent a great deal of time researching hotels in an attempt to get the right location and the right hotel. I am pleased to say that we succeeded. The James was fabulous. Welcoming door men (CJ) who warmly escorted us to the sky lobby and then to our room. The front staff could not possibly have been more accommadating and professional. Crystal in particular was helpful and made a number of excellent suggestions and recomendations for our time in NYC. The room was clean and bright and everything worked as it should. The pool is refreshing for a cool afternoon dip and if you are younger and hipper than I would be great fun at night. Things at the hotel just worked as they should and the location is excellent. I would heartily recommend the James hotel in NYC.

The James was the final hotel in the round-the-world trip my wife and I took as our honeymoon. We got back yesterday. We only stayed in The James for a day but it was one of the better experiences of our trip. To be greeted with a genuinely (if he'd been practising then he should be on Broadway) enthusiastic and proud, "Welcome to The James" by the doorman who lugged our bags to reception asking of our trip and where we'd come from. It was the Hotel Americano as it happens and, to our surprise, this chap actually knew where Sweden was (not Switzerland, Americano!). A nice start. The services manager checked us in nice and swiftly, with no word of incidentals (which is great) and free internet, which we expect being Swedes. There's free coffee and pastries in the morn, water and fruit in the afternoon and some cheese and wine in the eve, a nice touch, while the rooftop bar has cracking views and a suitably arrogant bar man. Room was spacious, bathroom had the plats du jour glass wall (seriously, this has to stop) and the view, again from our 15th floor room was great. Also well insulated from noise from the bar at the roof or hallway noise. Concierge was exceptional. We asked in the previous hotel for a table at the Hudson Clearwater and came up with nothing. Apparently (as my wife spied) The James prides itself on having decent contacts and, about an hour after asking, we had our reservation. Was an interesting experience but not sure if it's really a boutique hotel. Too large and a little soulless but as a luxury hotel it's a good one with all the bits in the right places but I would be tempted to agree with others that emphasis must be placed on hotel guests where bar access is concerned. They are the ones with that oh-so-easy to say phrase; "Ah, sod it; put it on room XX!"

We go to New York a lot and normally stay at The Greenwich which we absolutely love (see my review if you like). This time, the weather forecast was predicting extreme heat so we made made the foolish decision to try and find an alternative hotel that has an outdoor pool area. We chose the James based on this and the location. We actually booked some kind of poolside package so that we had reserved seating by the pool (didn't happen). The package also included a massage. If you book a massage at this hotel don't, whatever you do, choose to have it at the 'spa cabana'. This is basically an army tent on the lower roof deck (second floor) which is boiling hot. Due to being in a tent in the middle of NYC it was basically like having a massage in the middle of the street with all the accompanying beeping horns and ambulance sirens. Good things about this hotel: The restaurant. Food great. Roof garden (different from the roodtop pool) was beautiful.The rooftop pool: Great but very limited seating and absolutely no shade. The staff up there seemed very confused about what food we were or were not allowed to order. They said the rules keep changing.The locationBad things about this hotel:The lobby bar was pretty much the only communal area that felt integrated into the hotel. It had seating for 10 people and was just soulless. This may well be a taste thing though. As I said, we absolutely love the Greenwich which is just totally different.Our room was TINY and just had absolutely no character or interest whatsoever apart from a strange screen which divided the bathroom and the bedroom!All in all, despite the sunshine, and the slight price difference, we very much regret not sticking to what we know!

We picked the James based on the reviews on here and were not disappointed, in fact it exceeded our expectations. We didn't use the pool area or jimmy's bar because when we went to check it out soon after our arrival on Saturday evening it was unbelievably busy with New York's party crowd and not for us even if there was space to get a drink. But that wasn't a problem for us as the hotel was well worth it without that and with so much to see and do in NYC there wouldn't have been time to enjoy it anyway. But the James excelled in customer service - I have to add my praise for Jessica to what's already on here. They also provide fantastic additional extras, coffee and pastries in the morning, cheese and wine in the evening and the most amazing hand made chocolates every night as part of the turn down.We will defunately be back.

The hotel is nicely design, decor and very good location but I think is overrated from what it really is. Rooms are small too clouded with furniture not much space for clothes we had to keep our clothes on suitcases as not much space on wardrobe. Airconditioning failure too noisy impisible to sleep with that noise. Roof terrace was nice lovely views but then again way to small that was a swimming pool for me it was a bath tube. They had a useless handsome safeguard up there which he just was so into himself that he foegets to do his job. We asked him for towels and a place to sit and he just turn said we don't have any and there he went. How can they give preference to pple who are not staying in the hotel than the actually guest. Pool was full with drunk teenagers at 3pm u can't go up to the roof terrace cos is pack with pple as they open the bar and roof terrace to every one. At 11.15 on Sunday night we came back and we wanted to go up to have one drink in our hotel and the light would just not take us up to there as 12.00 the bar closes but we could see drunk pple being send up from that useless security guy with walkie talkie. Anyway reception guys were very nice and friendly as porters and room tendents. But yeh I think is just overrated for price u pay u deserve much more it should be 3 star hotel rathern than 4. Cheers.

I stayed here for 5 nights with my husband and 7 month old baby. We loved everything about this hotel. The chocolates in the room at night and the wine & cheese and cookies in the lobby are all nice touches. The hotel staff and the manager are all so amazing and helpful. The rooms are very nicely decorated as is the hotel lobby. I like that is hip but not overly trendy. I also threw my husband a birthday party on the roof at Jimmy and everyone had a great time. The drinks at Jimmy are pricy ($17 each) so my bill was very high but this is no different then any other NYC hotel bar. We also went to David Burke for dinner and breakfast and enjoyed the restaurant.The location is beyond perfect as we love visiting the stores and restaurants in Soho. We will be coming back to this hotel again soon as it has been one of our favorites in NYC.

My stay here was paid for by my employer. Room was small (typical for NYC/Europe). Didn't get a chance to try restaurant/room service, but other fellow travellers did and had only good things to say (ditto for the pool/work out rooms on site). In room mini bar was great -- local offerings of food and booze. Pillows/bedding were incredibly comfortable -- wish I had the same at home. Very nice location near unique shopping opps and Metro/subway stations. Had trouble a couple times getting a taxi back to the location -- because traffic in the area at rush hours can be *bad.* Nice people work here ;-)

In March I had a trip to NYC that was 80% scarred by my hotel choice. The other 20% was caused by missing my flight thanks to being in the longest US Customs queue in history so I made sure that my next stay in NYC would be in a decent hotel. The James more than delivered.The service - from the moment I was greeted by Christopher and Eric at the door, to the speedy response to accomodate a last minute restaurant reservation, to the super fast room service, the nice surprise chocolates at each turndown service, never was ever interrupted rudely by the housekeeping staff, the amazing amenties from the triple filtered water topped up every day, complimentary coffee & danishes in the lobby every morning, wine & cheese in the afternoon, and super convenient location to Soho, it's worth coughing up the extra bucks to stay at this place. Will definitely be back for my next trip to NYC!My only complaint is that the aircon was noisy at times in my room (309) from time to time there would be intermittent taps in the air con system whenever the automatic system switched itself off. After my horrendous experience at The Best Western President Hotel (thermostat wouldn't work, leaked into the carpet, hot water wouldn't work one night, zero noise proofing, and this was after 2 room changes) I was willing to put in the earplugs and just overlook it. Advice - I noticed that on my up to Jimmy, the rooftop bar that the DJ music was very audible from the 9th floor in the elevator. Not sure if it was just because the noise came through the elevator shaft but I would advise to stay on the lower floors, I couldn't hear any traffic besides a very distant siren early in the morning.
Great views in SoHo, excellent roof top bar/pool. Near a metro line, many restaurants and bars near by. When you stay here, bring out your designer labels.

The James Hotel was such a wonderful find. The rooms are modern and give more of an apartment feel than hotel room. We had amazing views and a large window line. I can't say enough about the service at the James. Everyone I came across was so friendly and helpful. You were greeted EVERYTIME you come and go. The staff is so accomodating and you can tell they love what they do. The manager, Mark was very gracious and kind. When I arrived there had been a problem with my room, but they already had it resolved before I arrived and took great care of me throughout my stay. The girls at the front desk (Amy and Jessica) were delightful and fun. I really wish I could remember everyone's names, because each and every staff member deserves to be recognized for their wonderful service. The hotel is close to so many wondeful retail stores, restaurants and bars, as well as one stop on the Subway from the Downtown scene. There's a roof top pool and bar offering a relaxing yet hip environment with amazing views. Don't miss out on this gem of a hotel.

A boutiquish, cute hotel in a great location. The bar next to the pool on the roof with a great view of the downtown, midtown and NJ.The service is friendly and helpful. I could not memorize where the lobby vs the restaurant vs exit were, otherwise a great place in SoHo.

Spent the weekend here and it was without a doubt the perfect location. Outside there are many restaurants and bars and it's a neighbourhood you can see yourself living in. It's close to the shops and right next to the subway. It's also just a short walk from Tribeca, Nolita and Little Italy. The hotel itself is beautiful, loved the art and the boutiquey feel. Rooms were small but really well put together with great finishing. Loved the bed, the most comfortable bed during my 2 week stay there, also offers a pillow menu. The rain shower and the products were amazing, also loved the mini-bar and the slippers. It's the little touches that make the difference. The hotel food and drinks were great and it's without a doubt a place you'd want to hangout and people watch. The only negative was that the pool was packed with non-guests and the lifts take ages to come.

We were at the New Yorker and being treated like dirt (that's for another review), so I whipped out my smartphone and did a quick search hoping to find another hotel with immediate availability on a Friday evening. The Karma gods were on our side and we locked onto the James Hotel. The fabulous experience began at the door with the fastest most welcoming doormen on the planet. Check-in was immediate (we waited over an hour in line at the New Yorker, no lie) and during the check in process we heard words like wine, cheese, fresh baked, chocolate chip, pool, and I felt the stress slip from my day. The security is well maintained at this establishment, Thanks for that. Our corner room was modern with a large bathroom with rainshower/handheld combo and all amenities and ice cold A/C; really needed on the 90 degree day. On the 6th floor there was no street noise. We visited the pool area at different times of day and night but enjoyed it best in the morning before it was open to "Jimmys" bar -- that scene was strange by our standards. Very difficult to get a drink yet everyone seemed intoxicated. We headed up at sunset in the hopes of drinks with a view but couldn't get near the bar or find a space on the roof. The pool was filthy from who knows what happened since the morning. The general public takes this space over and this puts the hotel guests on the sidelines. No big deal, we just left the pool area to the riff-raff. The staff is all around wonderful.The neighborhood has deli, shopping, art, and so much more within walking distance and there is a subway stop about 20 steps from the southeast corner. We have made this our destination hotel for the next trip. Also, they operate on a eco philosophy which makes this hotel a total package.

What's not to love about the James? FIrst the location . Walk outside the door and you have so many choices of very good restaurants, great shopping and art galleries. The staff at the hotel is very welcoming from the moment you arrive . Just let it be said that the attention to detail is impeccable! From the staff uniforms, the intimate, casual atmosphere in the lobby where you can enjoy a glass of lovely wine and cheese to the modern, stylized room. Treat yourself to the shampoo and conditioner. You'll definitely experience the Best at the James, isn't they what it should be like when you leave home,

Traveled to NYC for a wedding, stayed two nights!! As soon as we entered the hotel you felt so special, the staff was so nice and cared for all our needs. The staff even put my big wedding hat in the office so nothing would happen to it while waiting to check in. We arrived early and the staff did everything they could to get us in the room faster, they took our cell phone number and called as soon as the room was ready. And guess what??? It was hours before check in and we were in our room GREAT JOB!!! The room was so very very clean, neat and decorated so nice, the bed and pillows soooo comfortable. The view in the room was great, big windows that opened for fresh air. The roof top pool was great enjoyed for approx. 4 hours great view and service. I want to thank everyone at The James for a wonderful stay!!! Todd and Angela

Pro's: great rooftop pool area with a nice vibe and almost Ibiza style eclectic crowd, airy rooms with great NYC views through big windows, great art and design throughout making for a relaxed atmosphere once you step through the doors, smallish but well equipped gym. Con's: price and lack of breakfast bar (but then the hotel is steps away from a large choice of excellent restaurants in the Soho area).

Having been to NY a number of times this is my favorite location to base yourself. The local area is full of cafes, casual dining, good bars, art galleries and decent shops. The hotel itself is a great modern, boutique style hotel. The rooms are comfortable, avoid corner rooms though we went with friends and they had one which is much smaller than the other rooms. Hotel rooftop bar is fab, they serve mean cocktails! Our friends ate in the restaurant and said it was amazing. The staff were friendly and helpful. The gym is small but did the job for a small workout. Great spot for friends or couples to stay when exploring the city. The only criticism I would have was housekeeping, the room wasn't cleaned as well as it should have been for this star of hotel. I would however still recommend it and stay again.

The hotel was placed very central in SoHo and we had a nice stay.The rooms are quite small - the breakfast that was included in the room rate we diden't receive papers from one day (so we diden't get any breakfast the next day!)One morning there was plastic in my breakfast ..The gym was good - great view!The rooftop bar was super cool, but the service there was rude!

Located at Grand and 6th av. Plenty of opportunity to explore soho from hotel. Rooms a bit small but nice views and comfortable; minimalist decor with wood floors, appointments just a little bit worn. Bed/pillows were great. Relatively large bathroom with full exposure to living space. Privacy blind if you wish. Complimentary wine, cheese, coffee, sweet rolls, cookies in lobby are nice touch. Roof top pool w great views. Way too small to swim but ok for cool off dip. Roof top bar/ pool party pretty wild. Mostly 20-30s.

Just returned from a 3-night stay with my husband for my 40th birthday. The James is the perfect summer hotel, light and airy with great outdoor spaces. The room (Deluxe King) was typical NYC size, but the bathroom was a good size, with an excellent shower (rainfall and regular version too), and the bed was fantastically comfortable.The pool area is lovely in the daytime, although a little crowded, but the atmosphere is nice and if you want a few hours guaranteed on a sun lounger then it’s probably best to get there by 9.30 a.m.The only criticism would be that their room service is not very efficient. Twice in two days an order (or part order) was forgotten. To be fair, they were very apologetic and offered the food on the house, but I did hear one of the staff explaining to a guest who was requesting a special order at the poolside that it was best to keep it simple as the communication wasn’t always the best, so it sounds as though there is an ongoing issue. I’m not sure why this is, as the service in the garden and the main restaurant is spot on. We also ate at the David Burke Kitchen one night; the food was very good and the service efficient and charming.It was, all round, a lovely stay, and would definitely recommend the hotel.

While the hotel is great, don't expect to find a towel or seat at the pool, especially on the weekend. Only locals at the pool who don't pay a cent to get in. When you are paying a lot to stay at a hotel, this is very disappointing. If you don't go upstairs to the rooftop on the weekend, you will probably enjoy your experience. Hotel clean and has all the standard facilities but I won't be back.

The views of the city are spectacular from this hotel - from my room, the exercise facility, or the roof top bar. It's really a very lively hotel, stylishly designed, and very comfortable. It's a great spot for just wondering around Soho, shopping, and very close to numerous restaurants. I found the location more convenient than midtown particularly if you don't mind taking the subway, and with much more charm. I had a room with a king size bed.

Great new hotel.Rooms are good, not huge but adequate. We stayed in a deluxe King room which was clean, comfortable and had a good view of the new World Trade Centre buildings. Staff are very helpful and personal. Rooftop pool is amazing as is the bar. Only negative is the hotel does not have views of Midtown NY (I.e Empire State or Chrysler buildings) however everything else is great. Great location!

In some ways this might appear a NYC modern hotel. But a couple of standouts (warm service, great rooftop deck, good location) make it worth a visit.I was greeted by Eddie at check-in, who was a really pleasant. Set a tone for good service throughout my stay. Room was nice, nothing mind-blowing. Pretty good view. Reasonably typical modern NYC hotel in terms of decor. Rooftop is really cool. Great views and fun scene. A standout part of hotel and reason to stay.If you are going to take advantage of the pool/roof, note that you want to make sure you do some advance planning. During the weekdays the roof is nice and chill. Not crowded. Weekends get really crowded late afternoon, but it's a great day party. Arrive early and get seats. Lounge chairs need to somehow be reserved.The roof is sometimes closed for private events, and even when it isn't, there can be hassle at the door at night, esp if you are with a group. If there is a night you want to go, get the concierge to get you on the list.Overall I'd stay there again.

My wife and myself stayed at The James for just under a week earlier this month. I'd read a lot of the reviews here and was sceptical as to whether the staff could be as helpful as everyone said they were. Having experienced them first hand ....the are really great, very helpful and made us feel at home.Other than that, really enjoyed The James. Fantastic location, near some great restaurants and the subway. Room was nice and quiet so both of us slept very well. Would definitely stay there again.

Just returned from the James for a little anniversary getaway (19 years!), and was completely satisfied -- Of the myriad NYC options, we wanted something downtowny without "trying too hard" -- The James was all that. Incredibly comfortable bed, stunning views (corner room facing south east on the 14th floor), friendly but laid back service, with a Zen aesthetic. But with more liquor -- nice in-room bar. The roof bar Jimmy swings more to the trendy, but as old fogeys we were still comfortable, and the pool is a great asset in the right weather -- also, try to grab one of the complementary orange bicycles to tool around the streets of Soho -- the bike lane starts right outside the door!

Once again a choice found on tripadvisor and as usual it lived up to expectations.A warm welcome by the widely praised Christopher set the tone for the excellent customer service we received throughout our stay.This was a trip with my daughter to celebrate a 18th and 50th birthday respectively and we received an upgrade to a corner king room on check in. 'Wow ' was my daughters reaction on entering the room and viewing the skyline. The pleasant surprise continued when we saw a welcome note and a plate of chocolate goodies! The room is well designed, with the most comfortable bed and pillows I have ever encountered in a Hotel. An impressive tray of goodies but all for purchase.We also had lunch one day in the Garden - fantastic value for money and delicious food.Great to have late check out and the location was perfect for us.Why not 5 stars :Even if it was free the breakfast and evening food selection lacked imagination and substance.Jimmy's is too cool for school and meant we couldn't use the rooftop area without feeling uncomfortable.However if I was to rate the staff we met it would be 5 star all the way - thanks to you all but especially Christopher and Krystal :)

The 'boutique' hotel experience in New York is always a bit frustrating: the rooms are tiny, the prices exorbitant and the staff too often aloof and cooler than thou.The James isn't like that at all. We found the staff to be cheerful and down to earth and genuinely keen to help. The hotel itself is smartly designed and still feels new. Our room was indeed tiny, but thoughtful designed. We particularly appreciated the wall of windows looking east across Soho and the full length bathroom window. Despite choosing one of the cheaper rooms, we were placed on the 15th floor, the better to enjoy the light and views. We didn't eat at David Burke but the outdoor garden and roof were fun. Two of the best touches were free wi-fi and a standard 2pm checkout. These small details made all the difference.

This was my second time staying at the James in New York and I was definitely remembered. Because I was a repeat guest, they got me in over tight dates and then, when I arrived, the doorman greeted me by name and welcomed me back! This was a great beginning to quick one night visit. David Burke's Kitchen was great as always. I will return to this hotel.
Perfectly placed for shopping in Soho, the restaurants excellent. Best of all the beds and pillows superb. The rooms don't have a huge amount of space for clothes but the view makes up for it.

Just arrived back from our stay at the James Hotel in SoHo. The majority of the staff at the James are terrific: courteous, friendly and knowledgable. Michael Daniels on breakfast service was particularly professional and took the time to engage with us about our trip. He clearly has a thorough knowledge of New York City and its best venues and locations. The James would possibly make better use of his skills as a concierge (this position seemed to be hot-desked and was hit-and-miss in its quality). This wasn't a major issue for us, though.The big issue we had with the James was that when it was good it was excellent, but when it was bad, it was diabolical. I have honestly never experienced such a resentful attitude from hotel staff. There were only one or two bad staff members on the James team, but they completely nullify the best efforts of their colleagues. The rest of the James staff have every right to feel cheated and betrayed by this ruinous minority.The cleaning and room service was shocking. Dirty cups left to pile up, consumables not replenished and the worst possible attitudes. We had to call downstairs EVERY DAY of our stay to tell them things were dirty, missing, not replenished, unfinished etc.On one occasion, guest services brought two clean cups after we informed the hotel that we had no clean ones as the dirty ones had not been cleared.When they arrived, we had this little conversation at the door:Us: "Can you take these two dirty cups for us?"James Staff (already walking away): "No. You have to call room service for that, I’m a houseman".The tone of this member of staff’s voice was unnecessarily forceful and resentful.We made a complaint to the manager of the hotel about this, and she was very apologetic about the shortcomings and the rudeness of her staff. She promised us that all of our needs would be catered for the rest of our stay. Unfortunately, the lack of care and attention to detail continued to the point where we became bored of ringing for a breakfast order form and telling them that they hadn’t cleared away our breakfast cups and replenished the tea and coffee.This, in addition to the shower knob missing from our shower and a blocked sink when we arrived (which were quickly and efficiently rectified) only highlighted that more attention should be spent on the housekeeping.The view from Jimmy's bar is terrific and it's worth going up there before 9pm (before the crowds arrive). But it's not enough to justify a stay at the James.So, we can’t recommend the James and we won’t be going back because it’s just not worth the risk. Lots of terrific staff (as I stated earlier) like Felix, Christopher, Nicole, Michael Daniels and others. I just feel bad for these people that they have colleagues that are severely jeopardising their hotel’s reputation. Finally, charging $40 for a rollaway bed for one of our five nights, that we never requested may have just been an honest mistake. Check your bill at the end of your stay, just like we checked ours, so you don’t pay extra.It’s OK trying to be the coolest hotel in town, but they really need to get the basics right first.

This was our first visit to NYC and after researching and talking to friends we decided to stay in Soho - right choice! The next question was whether to rent an apartment or stay in a hotel. Although I travel a lot I'm not a fan of corporate and chain hotels and usually prefer to look for an apartment or boutique hotel in the place that we are visiting. We settled for The James as the choice in Soho seemed to be limited. What a good decision! The hotel itself is light and bright making up for the rooms being quite small. The bedrooms are comfortable. The restaurant and rooftop bar are spectacular. The interior styling is modern, natural and chic. The staff are the friendliest I have ever experienced - anywhere! Christopher, our doorman deserves a special mention. This gentle giant of a man was a feature of our NY experience. Hands down - highly recommended.
user_name:
cello377
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: Despite the small - really small - disappointment in the cleanliness of the room, our stay was just amazing. The staff is very very friendly and helpful. The room and the view were really wonderful. And what a great location to explore Soho and its chic boutiques and beautiful people, also walking distance from The Village and Meatpacking. The place to be if you are interested in the south of Manhattan. Free coffee in the morning / wine & cheese in the evening in the hotel lobby are a clear plus vs. other hotels. Had fun at Jimmy's , James' roof top bar, where cocktails are great as well as breath-taking views on Hudson, WTC, Empire...Overall great, unforgettable experience !
Had a great time. The staff went out of their way to be helpful. The concierge, Morgan is a standout! She is extremely helpful, knowledgable, and willing to make your stay the best it can be.

Some friends and I went to The Jimmy, the rooftop bar at The James Hotel, for drinks at sunset. What an amazing view! The drinks were pricey but delicious and we figured we were paying for the ambiance. Try the cucumber vodka, it is a special treat. The outside area has a small pool, and I had to wonder how many drunk people had fallen into it over the years. The place is small and it got pretty packed, but it was a nice spot for a couple of drinks. Don't expect to hang out there all night unless you want to drop a lot of dough.

We loved our stay at the James for Valentine's Day Weekend. We were happy that they accept small dogs, and delighted with the dog's bed they provided and a welcome goodie bag that included gourmet truffles for the puppy. The hotel and room design is lovely - clean, simple and modern. Perfectly outfitted mini bar with some of our favorite gourmet drinks and foods. Great selection from artisan, organic to common favorites. Was surprised to find lots of dust in the food tray as I'm all about cleanliness and details, but that was the only unclean aspect of our entire trip. Bathroom amenities were great, although I would have loved a bath tub. Loved the shower gel - wish it was available for purchase. We had a wonderful view from our top floor suite. The room was comfortable and modern enough to entertain a few friends. Favorite spot was the rooftop bar. Perfect for cold weather, as you don't have to go outside to be in one of the coolest spaces in town with delicious food, drinks and 360 views of the city. Perfect place to have your friends visit with you while you're in town. My NYC friends enjoyed the space and I enjoyed not needing to get out into the freezing weather. Food in the hotel overall was pretty good. I loved the late night spaghetti, while our breakfast in bed was just good. Juices at the restaurant were delicious. I highly recommend going to the Soho Grand for brunch - delicious arugula salad and lovely space. The only bad experience with the James was our cab driver telling us how the door boy demanded a payment from him in order to tell us that he is available, if the driver didn't pay him he would have lied to us that the driver was busy - really uncool as on top of that we tipped the door boy, so he ended up with extra $30 for being shady... Other than that, I will definitely stay at the James on my next NYC trip. Perfect location, close to great restaurants, shopping, galleries, etc. Love the modern, urban feel of it.

The hotel is beautiful. Customer service could not be better. Michael, the doorman, was helpful in every way.....he gave us great restaurant recommendations, fast and friendly service in every way. He made us feel like the James was our home away from home.
user_name:
Diane L
West Palm Beach, Florida

review_body: I stayed in a two sided floor to ceiling glass panelled room with a fantastic views of the river!The room and bathroom(shower only) were comfortably sized with coffee\tea facilities, classy toiletries,comfy beds and linen. I preordered room service breakfast which arrived on time , high quality food beautifully presented! The David Burke restaurant is amazing and packed for lunch and dinner in their indoor and lovely outdoor spaces! The rooftop bar and pool have terrific views and are rocking in the evenings!the lobby lounge is a great place to meet friends,browse ,sip wine and have a bite (complimentary).The staff are charming and extremely friendly! The doormen enthusiastic and will hail a taxi at any time.forget pre booking a cab for the airport,they can be found easily in the area for half the price! Newark is just 25 mins away on a good day! Fashionable shopping and restaurants within walkable distance and Subway access is close by.The local crowd that uses the hotel is trendy but the guests themselves are very eclectic! A very non intimidating yet sophisticated and contemporary hotel with tons of light and energy!

As this was our 1st trip to NYC for 25yrs we researched NYC hotels very well and it all boiled down to the area, Soho was our 1st choice and The James had great reviews. So we booked a 4night stay corner mini suite double , which included breakfast. Upon arrival we were greeted by the friendly staff in reception. Our room was really very nice with great corner views and although only on the 3rd floor we could see out as far as the WTC. The bathroom had a walkin rain shower, fast hairdryer and other details as you would expect from this class of hotel. Our breakfast was delivered on time , great choice both hot and continental and good coffee! Down in the reception area there are 2 internet stations with printing facilities ,in the evening they serve free house wines and a little cheese. Soho is right outside, we felt very safe and there are loads of bars,cafes, restaurants, pubs etc. The shopping areas are all around and all within walking distance. One day we even walked the whole way to Macy`s, took it nice and easy stopping off for coffee and taking pictures, took about 1+1/2 hours though but it was a great way to see some of NYC buildings and shops!. The pool wasnt open on the roof floor so we didnt see that. we sat in the urban garden and had a G + T 33$ inc tax (bit pricy). We both agreed that the double bed and the pillows were the best we have slept in so top marks for that. We have to mention that ALL the staff were extremly polite , friendly and really did go that extra mile to help us and make us feel welcome, special mention to "Big Chris" a really nice chap always happy ! The hotel is really well situated if flying via EWR but there is an extra tax to pay in the taxi for the "out of state " run. All in all we feel we picked the " BEST" hotel and are only too pleased to recomend it,and it would be our number 1 choice when we return to NYC.

We stayed at the James last month while visiting NY. and we experienced the total package. Our room was upgraded, the service was wonderful, and the location perfect! The staff was devoted to making our stay memorable and the room was exceptional in size and comfort. We almost stayed at the Mondrian, but I am glad I went with my gut and chose the James...a little oasis in Soho. I am looking forward to our next trip at our home away from home.
