We had to go to New York for work the only thing is we had a 7 month old.The James were amazing the staff very very friendly especially after flying all the way in to NYC from Sydney Australia.They have good baby amenities, good food for room service and the bed was super, super comfortable. We stayed in a deluxe king with amazing views. The garden area was great to use during the day with our little one as well.All in all the clean modern room was great. Good storage, and extras. The Free coffee in the mornings and cookies at night are a great touch as well.And good fast wifi.I would highly recommend this hotel.

This was the best place I have ever stayed in NYC! The staff was so warm and welcoming, they accommodated our every little need, with a smile! We even received a free room upgrade without requesting one and were offered the free parking out front for the duration of our stay. The location is very convenient with many restaurant options in walking distance. We stayed the entire weekend and didn't take a cab once, all of our destinations were walkable. The rooms are immaculate and very contemporary, the bathrooms are very sleek with great upgrades. The little details such as organic shampoo and comfy cotton bathrobes are a plus! They thought of everything and more. We will be going back very soon, especially since we received a voucher for our next stay! I have nothing but great things to say about The James!

Loved every second of our stay here. The staff were impeccable from start to finish. Such a lovely place. THANK YOU for coming to New York and giving me somewhere to want to come back to every time I come to New York - for business or pleasure.
This was an exceptional hotel for or business trip to NYC. The staff was incredible, the rooms were very nice, the view from the gym was terrific and lastly the restaurant was exceptional.
user_name:
Jerry A
Scottsdale, Arizona, United States

review_body: We stayed at the James for two nights recently and decided that we had finally found "our hotel" in New York. Our stay was a pleasure. The staff was courteous and helpful without fail. From the doorman to the front desk to the maid, these folks had been impeccably trained to be polite and friendly.Our room was a corner king on the 9th floor, typically New York-sized, but with a nice view and no noise at all to disturb us. The bed was comfortable and pillows/sheets were top quality. The designer thoughtfully included a privacy shade to cover the bathroom's cool glass wall. The Wi-fi was fast and, best of all, free. They set out wine and cheese in the lobby in the evenings and cookies at night.We enjoyed drinks at the Jimmy (the hotel's popular rooftop lounge) one night and were so glad that The James had no problem adding hotel guests to the VIP list to get in after 9pm. In that respect and many others, we found The James to be the "un-Standard", every bit as cool, but with wonderful service and so much more class.My only minor complaint about The James was the in-room dining. Our booking included breakfast and we didn't particularly enjoy it: soggy, limp bacon, soggy toast, ok eggs. I expected much more since the in-room dining is provided by the David Burke restaurant downstairs and would skip this option next time.Otherwise it's a great place to stay. Try it. You won't want to stay anywhere else in New York.

I spend a lot of time in NYC for business, and this was the best hotel experience I have had. The hotel is in a great location, rooms were great, with spectacular views of the city. What made the hotel experience over the top was the staff. From the time I checked in until the time I checked out, the staff did everything they could to make my trip an incredible experience. A special thank you to Melissa Gonzalez at the Front Desk who was super helpful!

Just checked into the James. Room is tiny and smells of cigarette smoke and that includes the bathrobe I'm currently wearing. Complained but they are fully booked and can't move me. To be fair they offered to refund $150 for the inconvenience. Still...

The new kid on the block is showing how to do it! Great location in Soho, with some great shopping nearby. The staff is superb, nothing is too much and all with a smile. The corner rooms are bright, airy and well appointed. There are some lovely touches with complimentary drinks and food available throughout the day. The David Burke restaurant downstairs serves excellent modern cuisine with great service.

Having lived in NYC for a few years and now having to have moved my husband and I to Long Island for work, it is our occasional treat to spend a weekend in the city. We use to stay all over the city in various hotels but since getting the recommendation to try out The James, we no longer look anywhere else. We have celebrated my 30th and my husbands 32nd birthday at the James and have had such a perfect experience. The hotel is located in a perfect location for my favorite city activities... We walk out the front door, shop up Broadway in Soho and end up eating in the West Village. The hotel is a wonderful change from normal, somtimes "upitty" Manhattan luxery- The staff could not be more friendly while never being pushy. The rooms are elegant with simplicity and environmental consideration. We have gotten into the mornign habbit of waking up and visiting the lower level for complimentary coffe and delicious Dean and Deluca treats :) and then returning to our room for some more relaxation before beginning our day. Check out being at 2pm gives us the opportunity to feel relaxed and not rushed at any point. All in all, we have stayed throughout the city, and not will not stay elsewhere. Thanks James for giving us our Home away from Home phenomenal experience, time after time. Cant wait to see you again!!
user_name:
DrNadia16
New York City, New York

review_body: We spent the weekend in this hotel in January. Great proximity to theaters, shopping etc. From the valet to checking out was top notch. It is a non smoking hotel and someone was smoking on our floor. The front desk immediately addressed the situation. Great continental breakfast and sitting area with a great view of the city. The bar also is a super spot to have a cocktail and look over the city. Also reasonably priced.

From the moment we were greeted by the Bellman, I knew The James was top notch - as he got our bags from the cab and politely introduced himself by name, he checked the backseat to make sure we didn't leave anything. What a great first impression! The room was small (to be expected) but very cool with fabulous windows and even a huge glass wall in the bathroom. Loved it! There were always snacks and drinks in the lobby. My only complaint is that one evening, one of the two elevators was out of service, so it was quite a wait for us to get upstairs. The neighborhood is fine but not very exciting. It was a 6 block walk to the nearest coffee shop and in NYC, you expect everything to be right around the corner. That said, it was a fabulous hotel and thoroughly enjoyed the stay.

Hotel is ideally situated to be able to get to all main sights in downtown on foot and is just a short walk to centre of Greenwich Village and the Meatpacking area. Thus an ideal spot for the holiday traveller wanting to be in the real heart of NYC. Central to great designer shopping, restaurants and cafes. Local streets are quiet enough so not overwhelming as some areas could be in the city. Great transport links too.Rooms are good sized and designer chic without being over poweringly design centric and huge windows result in great vistas. Public spaces keep up the same clever mix and the rooftop bar is to die for with brilliant views to North to Empire State Building, East across Downtown, South towards Financial District and lastly West for sunsets and Hudson River. So a visit to Jimmys the roof top bar is a must and try to be up there for sunset.Staff across whole spectrum of jobs are very friendly and professional so you feel welcomed at all times. I was utterly delighted to have picked The James for my vacation stay in the Big Apple.

We stayed at The James last week during one of Many business trips My Husband makes into the city. I decided to go with him this time and I am very happy I did. From the second we checked in we felt at home. The doorman was very helpful although he spoke a little to much to us about the area. The restaurant downstairs was nice but our Room Service experience was much better. Erica the room service server was very funny and made us feel like we have been friends for years. She remembered our order and was quick to delivery. I would recommand this hotel to anyone looking for a home away from home in NYC.

Recently stayed at the James and my experience mirrored many of those here. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel has minimalist style and rooms are decent size (for NYC). Location is 3-4 block walk from heart of SoHo. Several great restaurants nearby (try La Pescadeux for a nice French meal at a reasonable price w/ great atmosphere). Also walked to Little Italy and great shopping with ease. I travel frequently to NYC for work and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for any traveler who prefers to stay outside of the main tourist area and enjoy SoHo area instead.

We took our son, Jimmy, to the city last weekend. We were greeted by a friendly bellman and spectacular front desk staff. Jimmy is 4 and he was treated like royalty. Amy was particularly helpful with suggestions, directions and information. The James always has a treat in the lobby ie coffee / pastry, cheese /wine and fresh fruit. It is more than possible to spend the weekend in SoHo and never step into a car. Our room had a great veiw and the fitness center was more than adequate. The James is a great choice for a trip to NYC!

We recently let go of our apartment in NY, and returned for a work/visit for the first time two weeks ago. We stayed at the James. We had a great experience and ironically felt much like we were staying in a great building with a doorman. The lobby is casual and unobtrusive - actually a very comfortable lounge. Services and people at the hotel were also unobtrusively perfect and very friendly. We love the design of the rooms and had a quiet, high floor room with a great city view. It didn't hurt as much as I thought it would...not to be returning to our great little apartment. We'll be back...

Upon arrival we discovered that the hotel had booked us into a deluxe king room and not the corner king suite, we had reserved and paid for. They did not have a corner king suite availaable so we stayed in the reg room. It was ok but not what we booked. They offered a small credit. It will be a one time experience there.

We checked into The James as for a weekend getaway-it was my birthday. The front desk staff couldn't have been friendlier. We were celebrating and had booked a King Corner Studio but gor upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite with breakfast. After check in the I got treated to a birthday card and cookies!The room is modern-which is what we wanted- but not over the top. One quibble: there was no dresser or drawers for small things. Otherwise the room was great and the bathroom had a heated floor!We had a great experience all around, even in the roof bar which we heard could be exclusive.

We stayed in The James in March and had a FABULOUS time. The staff were so friendly, our room was amazing and the location is perfect for a city break in NY, shops and wonderful restaurants right at your feet. The hotel itself was astonishly beautifully designed, you can really appreciate the architect of The James.What really made it even more truly special was the little things. That made the difference to us - their was free coffee and pastries in the lobby in the morning and free wine and cheese in the evening as well as free wifi throughout. The hotel bar Jimmy's on the roof is great. I was a little worried this might be a too cool hotel for is but it wasn't the case. All the staff were top of their game and made our stay that extra Speical I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

The common areas of the hotel are lovely. You definitely know you are in Manhattan...there are windows from floor to ceiling. The rooms as well have windows floor to ceiling. Heated bathroom floors are details that are not overlooked. Our every request was quickly delivered. The morning pastries were delicious and coffee was delicious.truly a lovely homeland staff.

The hotel location is great - right in Soho and close to all the action. Very close to the subway as well (just down the street). The rooftop patio is very cool with great views of the city. The staff is very friendly and professional - Erica in room service was great!I would highly recommend this hotel for business as it's only one subway stop away from the financial district, and you get the cool nightlife vibe of Soho after work.Great place - will certainly stay here again next time I'm in NYC.

Simply put, there is no better stay in Soho than the James hotel!!! Perfectly located, Great food, Incredible views from every room I've tried (almost all)! Clean, New, Beautifully furnished rooms with great showers and bathrooms!! Warm and friendly staff waiting to help at any chance they get and did I mention PERFECTLY LOCATED!!!

We had an absolutely gorgeous PH suite on the 16th floor with amazing views. The bathroom is to die for. With open showers and a soaker tub in the middle of the room with sweeping views of the city!!! Bed was so comfortable, did not want to get up in the morning. Location of the hotel is great. Easy parking on the week-end and tons of good places to eat and hang out, not that you have to leave the hotel. The restaurant on the lower level (David Burke's Kitchen) was great: delicious food, wonderful service. The roof-top bar (Jimmy's) was awesome. Really cool place, gorgeous views and great drinks. We had a great stay. The staff was really friendly and attentive and made us feel welcome. There were tons of complimentary snacks and beverages offered throughout the day in the sky lobby- a rarity in any hotel. You can get anything from pastries and coffee to wine and chocolates- great touch and very much appreciated. This was our second stay and we were not disapointed, definitely looking forward to coming back soon.
user_name:
TRAVGIRL01
New York City, New York

review_body: Fantastic rooms, amenities, location and service. Enough said. Didn't try the restaurant but hope to do so next time.

The staff at the James was great from the greeting at the door to the reception where they informed that my request for a higher floor would have put us right under the disco. Upon the suggestion we took a corner roon on the 6th floor instead of the higher floor and it was perfect, great view nice and quiet and great location.

I never write reviews, but was compelled to after I was a guest at The James hotel NYC this past weekend. The hotel itself is fresh, vibrant and beautifully designed. The friendly staff were always there to consistently go above and beyond to fulfil any request. The SoHo location is great, and the rooftop bar and pool area is a great place to go for a drink and take in the stunning views of the city and river. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York. I also visited The James in Chicago a few years back, and they also share in the same great service and beautiful hotel.

Me and my husband stayed at The James for a few nights and could not stop talking about our trip when we came back home to Miami. Upon arrival, Amy the young lady at check in was so quick witted and funny. Our room had incredible views of the city. Subway was right around the corner to Hop around Manhattan. There was a charming young man who delivered a late night snack and again delivered our breakfast. When he delivered our fancy eggs, and newspaper, poured some coffee and said it's a beautiful day out may I open your curtains. Superb staff. Chocolate treats in the lobby and by bedside. For a small hotel it seemed very New York busy. Can't wait for another getaway.

I have stayed at a number of hotels in new york from the major chains to boutiques - downtown, midtown, etc., but this hotel understand what it means to be a 5 star property. The room was fantastic, with nice views of soho, nice use of space, and with focus on green initiatives (glass water bottle filled every evening - economical to me and the hotel - I was just as Swissotel in Chicago - $8 for a bottle of water). The biggest reason I will look stay at this property again is the Service, from the reception desk, concierge, room service, cleaning team, etc - they were courteous and friendly. I felt like i would meet any one of them at a lounge in new york. Morgan took the cake for helping us with restaurants, making recommendations, and helping us. It is well worth spending a few dollars more at St. James - you get a lot more.
user_name:
Anil P
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: I have been to NYC a few times now but nowhere near enough - just love it! We have stayed in some really very good NYC hotels before so The James had a lot to live up to but it did and more. We booked a flight and hotel package through Virgin whereas normally we choose fights and hotel independently. So despite reading many positive and some other less so, reviews of the hotel, we were a little apprehensive about what we would find. We wanted to base ourselves in SoHo and The James looked in a good position. We flew in and out of Newark and this meant we were dropped off first and collected last on the optional shared hotel shuttle offered by Virgin. That was great as there was no wasted tinme travelling or waiting around either way. OK so what can you expect? Well when you approach The James from the road it isn't very preposessing. On first impressions it looks like an office building but hotel staff doormen were very welcoming in their understated stylish urban (as opposed to military type) unifoms. The ground floor lobby lift goes up to the main reception area a couple of floors above and as you rise you see the raised hotel garden which would look inviting anytime except mid-winter. In the main area there is good lighting and interesting modern furniture and a nice feel to the place. Lots of art books and daily papers provided - a couple of Apple workstations and so on - a comfortable place to while away time on the sofas there. Tip - the leather chairs are great to look at but not so good to sit on. We had paid for an upgrade to a standard king room and emerging from the lift a pleasant corridor with the room doors backlit and walls lined with work by an individual artist on the walls greeted us. The room we had was spot on - we loved it - really the best room we have stayed in, in NYC. It is all dark wood floor and wardrobes etc with light soft furnishings. Really comfortable bed & linens with hip hoorah good stylish and practical wall-hung reading lights and lots of different lighting options in the room. The bathroom was stylish and large and lie everything else in the room well planned and equipped. There's a very spacious walk in shower with both hand held and rainhead options. Good mirrors and excellent lighting - even the option of dimming the lights. A real feature is the full length clear glass partition between the bedroom and the bathroom with a motorised modesty blind (they call it a peekaboo blind!) covered in a lovely tree print. We were I think on something like the 7th floor and this means you get a good view of the bustle below and the traffic heading in and out of the Holland Tunnel. We couldn't have been more comfortable and in the main hotel reception there was morning coffee and buns and early evening, wine was provided. Very pleasant to spend time in the hotel. Not only that but it has a marvellous cocktail bar high at The James right at the top - Jimmy's - which as a guest you get some priority access to. It has great views and excellent music, in good weather there is a small pool outside and rooftop terrace. High at The James is a great place to be! Beneath the hotel is the David Burke Kitchen - a celebrity chef's restaurant and very good unfussy & fun food and excellent service. The James has great room service 24hrs too if you want to eat in. We found all the hotel staff unfailingly polite without being fussy. They were straightforward, friendly and helpful and best of all seemed to genuinely like where they worked. If minor things went wrong or we had any small problems, these were quickly put right and followed up with a call to check our satisfaction. We felt really comfortable and well looked after throughout our 7 day stay. Great location too right by the subway A,C & E lines on Canal St and Spring Street so you can zip pretty much anywhere you want to very easily. The delights of Soho are there right on your doorstep. Would we stay there again? You bet! The James exceeded our expectations and we really enjoyed staying there. Can I find anything to grumble about? No - but I did hear another guest complaining loudly one morning about the heating system being noisey at night....but hey why didn't she say so earlier? Oh yes and joy of joy there was no problem whatsoever about checking out late from The James - our flight back was an evening one. We had the room until about 2.00p.m. on day of departure (on arrival rooms may not be available until after that time). Our cases were looked after at The James whilst we spend a last full day looking around Soho. We are all different but The James really fitted us exactly and we felt it was good value.

Whenever possible I stay at The James hotel in NY. They also have a property in Chicago and both are fantastic places to stay for business or leisure. I was at the Soho location for my birthday and they made sure it was a wonderful time. A lovely gift was in my room on my BD. The staff wished me Happy Birthday which was very nice. The David Burke restaurant is fantastic, so good I ate there two nights on a 4 night visit! Rooms are well appointed, and the lobby has fruit, coffee and pastries in the morning, fruit and tea and coffee throughout the day and wine and cheese in the evening. The rooftop bar has a stunning view of NY. The hotel is close to great restaurants and shops in Soho and a 2 minute walk to the subway. All in all a great NY location.

I spend 3 nights together with my 15-year-old daughter. Staff, working at the lobby, is very friendly and are willing to help you find the best restaurants in Soho. (Aurora!) We also liked the fact that we could walk from restaurants to the hotel. The lobby is very nicely decorated and we liked to sit there for a while, especially from 6 to 8 pm, then you can have a drink (good wine) and a snack. Also coffee in the mornings.There was only one thing that was disappointing. We had our room on the 17th floor. There you can also find the gym, open 24 hours. So this floor is kind of noisy during the night/morning. People talking, staff talking through their phones, doors slamming. So I would strongly advice to avoid the 17th/highest floor. That is the only reason not giving our stay 5 points. Knowing this I would really like to stay there again, especially during spring or summer because of their terrace and pool.
50th Birthday and they did not disappoint upgraded every thing was perfect from start to finish best stay in SoHo ever Corner Suite

Our stay at the James hotel in SoHo was phenomenal!! My boyfriend and I booked our valentines weekend get-away through their concierge, Morgan Cohen. She was fantastic! Morgan provided us with information about the hotel and the area so that we had many different options to choose from for our romantic weekend. She also sent us an amenity for valentines day which was a very nice surprise! I would highly suggest staying at this hotel. The room was clean and modern and the view was fantastic. Next time we stay in Manhattan we will certainly be returning to The James in Soho. KUDOS TO THE STAFF!
user_name:
Michele L
Hicksville, New York, United States

review_body: Over the weekend I proposed to my girlfriend in New York and surprised her with a stay at the James Hotel. I was familiar with the prime location in SoHo but had never stayed at the James. My only knowledge of the hotel was based on the reviews here on TripAdvisor and some photos. Needless to say, they don't do justice for how great this hotel was. The service was spectacular. From before our stay even began, Morgan the head concierge, was so incredibly helpful with all the details from upgrading us to an apartment suite to arranging for our luggage to be delivered to our room to a complimentary bottle of champagne and macarons to celebrate the occasion. She made our stay even more perfect and memorable with all the nice touches. The doormen, the bellboys, the receptionists and even the cleaning lady were all really friendly and helpful. The room itself was phenomenal. From the views to the comfort of the bed to the heated floors in the bathroom, we really loved it all. The chocolates by the bed, the free bottles of filtered water, and so many other little details made all the difference. I couldn't have made a better choice for our special weekend.
Our stay at the James Hotel was exceptional. We loved our accommodations so much we barely left the room. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be looking to return.
user_name:
KimGillespie
Yonkers, New York, United States

review_body: I booked the James for a one night stay since we were headed to dinner around the corner and I just wanted to be able to do a quick walk to the Lani Kai bar. The James offers California style comforts in the middle of NYC. There is a rooftop pool bar with a view that is stunning, even complete with Burning man photography decorating the walls. The lobby area is gorgeous with stocked drinks and food at all times of the day. We even had breakfast at Burke's Kitchen the next morning and it was delish. I would stay here again anytime, also worth noting are the cool glass wall in the bathroom with a moving art screen.

After growing up in and around New York City, I now live at the beach in North Carolina. Every year I travel North to see friends and family and to get a bit of urban culture. The past few times I have been in NYC, I stayed at the James and have finally decided to write a review. The hotel and its staff are terrific. The location is outside of the crush of tourist areas but still firmly part of the city. Subways, cabs, busses are all close by for travel to major museums and Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall, Bway etc. But there's so much to do in the immediate area, you may find you needn't bother. Fabulous shopping and many fine restaurants with delicious food are within walking distance...we ate at the Little Owl, Mas and the Dutch, which i think was named this year's best restaurant by the NY Times. All easy walking distance...the Dutch is just around the corner. Staff is great - friendly and highly competent. Rooms are small on a national standard but nice size for NYC nice bathroom and floor to ceiling windows. Our view was toward downtown and you could see the new Gehry building and the new WTC tower under construction. All in all - a perfect place to stay - highly recommend.

We stayed 2 nights at the James and it was wonderful. Very comfortable bed! We opted for the corner king which had nice views of downtown and the shower was great. Their chocolate chip cookies are the best I ever had and you must go to their sky bar - Jimmy. Really cool lounge with awesome views of the city. We tried their sliders which were delicious. Perfect location to walk around and go shopping downtown. Highly recommend dinner at Kittichai annd brunch at Baltazar.

My husband and stayed here for a kid-free weekend in NYC. We LOVED the James from the minute we entered. The minimal design is full of texture and subtle details. From the computer key art installation at the entrance level to the wood & succulent planters to the linen and wool pillows in the sky lobby. We felt welcomed by the staff, and were thrilled with the hospitality of coffee & pastries, fresh fruit, and wine & cheese throughout the day- not to mention a drink vouched for each of us to enjoy the roof lounge Jimmy's. I noticed a commitment to the environment throughout the hotel including the triple filtered water presented daily in a glass carafe in each room to the full-size Intelligent Nutrients beauty products. We opted for a higher floor and our full wall of windows offered a beautiful city view. The bed was so comfy, that we decided to take an impromptu nap mid-day. The location was perfect to enjoy the downtown areas of Soho, Nolita, the Village. We even took a trek across the Brooklyn bridge. We look forward to escaping to the James again soon!
user_name:
Melody A
Princeton, New Jersey, United States

review_body: Very interesting,well located, very clean -- in all, an excellent hotel.I was in town for just 1 night for business; needed a place that was easy to get to and from in SoHo, and picked The James primarily because of location. I was impressed with the facility (minimalist design; original art by different artists displayed in the hallway of each floor; compact but very well-equipped exercise room), the staff and the guest rooms. Of course, the rooms were small, because of the location, but I have never been in a hotel room that was more well-designed (and I travel regularly for business and leisure in the USA and Europe). Room (including bathroom) was VERY clean. Did not eat there, but went to the roof-top bar "Jimmy's" (which I understand is owned by a separate group -- not the hotel). Unlike the hotel, it was pretentious and unimpressive. The bartender was rather full of himself and more interested in schmoozing the women at the bar than in providing good service. A weak selection of appetizers & spirits, in what should have been a much higher-end bar. The view, however, was spectacular. I suspect the Jimmy's experience would improve with good friends, and in the Spring-Fall (I was there 1/30-31) when you could use the roof-top deck. I would highly recommend The James; the Jimmy, not so much.

The James was more than I expected. I arrived later in the evening and was immediately greeted at the entrance and the check in area. They brought complimentary wine out to everyone in our party and assisted us with our luggage. The hotel staff was friendly, engaging and helpful. Their uniforms are very cute. The entry is a little funky. But I attribute it to the building, and they made it interesting. My room was on the smaller side but they made it feel fun and open. It was on the 6th floor with a decent view of the city and close to the elevator. I immediately expected to be troubled all night with elevator noise but gratefully was not. The majority of the noise came from the room above me, I suspect due to the hardwood floors in the rooms. Housekeeping did not knock at the crack of dawn! The room was clean, and i did inspect thoroughly. I personally hate the overhead shower heads that give the "rain" effect, so I am glad they had two options. The bathroom has a funky shade that can be raised to allow you to see through the entire glass wall into the bedroom. No worries, you are completely protected when it is down. The mini bar selection is awesome. There is free wifi and an ipod docking station. It is within walking distance to great restaurants, shopping and bars in Soho. Not sure the rooms are always worth the high price, but on a good rate night it is perfect.
user_name:
Kashay
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I really enjoyed my stay in The James primarily because of the great staff and great location. Its perfectly located on the border of Tribeca and Soho and has the friendliest staff I have encountered in the City. Everyone from the bell boy to the concierge staff was polite, friendly and accomodating. My wife lost her wedding ring and some other jewelry and when we contacted them they made arrangement's to have it shipped to us which we recieved within a day of our return to South Carolina. We ventured to Jimmy's rooftop bar and really enjoyed the view of the city and some great cocktails. As for the rooms themselves they were spacious and I really enjoyed the views and the bathrooms were great with the heated floors and the rain shower. The James Hotel is officially my destination to stay when visiting the City.

The staff, service, and chic of this hotel make it an exceptional find in SoHo. Everyone is super attentive. The rooms are excellent/functional, and the beds are really comfortable. As someone who travels over 300 nights a year, this is outstanding.

My wife and I were given the opportunity to spend a weekend in the city without the kids, and we are so glad that we chose the James Soho. From the doorman’s greeting and attention, to the warm welcome at reception from Luis and Amy, to the awesome shower (and refreshing body wash/shampoo), to the a delicious dinner at David Burke’s Kitchen, we were beyond pleased. It’s too bad we missed the stunning views from JIMMY; but we did have some amazing views from our room and from a fully equipped fitness center on the 17th floor.Everyone we encountered was extremely pleasant and accommodating and made us feel like there wasn’t anything they would not do for us. The lobby area was very comfortable and allowed us for some relaxation time prior to dinner. The ambiance was great and the treats provided were perfect.The room had everything you needed and more. The amazing shower head, heated floors, and comfortable bed were just right. We recommend this hotel to everyone (dogs/pets included – they are greeted in the ground level with a treat). If you’re looking for a hotel that would meet all your expectations, The James Soho is where you want to go. We had a blast! Kudos to the management team!!

The James is one of those hotels that has it just right. I travel frequently and stay in both corporate and boutique hotels, and I'm hard to please. But The James gets a 5 out of 5. A trendy but unpretentious and welcoming hotel, very friendly and helpful staff, stylish and tasteful decor, spacious and comfortable rooms for NY, quality toiletries and good hotel facilities including the complimentary wi-fi, cheese & wine and morning coffee & pastries (all nice touches!). If you want a boutique hotel experience - The James hotel delivers. It shan't disappoint. p.s. a special thank you to Christopher.

i live near the james and chose it for good friends visiting me from out of town. the hotel is close to several subway stations, but it is in a neighborhood that has lots to offer without traveling. their trip was short. we focused on eating (there are many good restaurants nearby), shopping and visiting a few art galleries. the james was the perfect starting point. what i particularly like is that the james offers you the services of a hotel but the space feels like a contemporary apartment building. thus, when you stay there, you feel as if you live in new york rather than that you are just visiting. perfect for travelers, particularly those who want to feel part of an urban environment. separately, i have eaten there and enjoyed the outdoor bar in the warmer weather. highly recommend.karen, nyc
user_name:
Karen K
New York City, New York

review_body: My girlfriend booked this hotel and i have to admit, I'm used to staying mid-town and i wasn't familiar with many of the newer spots in Soho. I have to tell you though, we had a great time. The rooms (deluxe king) were on the small side for me...but they make the greatest use of the space. The staff was very friendly, very knowledgable and more than eager to answer questions or satisfy requests. The hotel was clean, the bed was very comfortable...the pillows probably the best I've ever slept on too. The bathroom had a rainfall shower and a unique shade system for privacy from the main living space. We had the occasion to go to the top floor to *jimmy's* which has a great vibe and an incredible view of the skyline...of both NY and NJ. Every morning we walked a few blocks to numerous spots for breakfast...and shopping around the hotel was plentiful. Above all, for what we received, the price was extremely reasonable and we would definitely stay at The James again.

Our stay at the James was magnificent. If you like smaller hotels with a lower profile but yet very chic, this should be it. The staff are very friendly and I loved that they do their job almost invisibly; you never see chaos going on, or people running around. We had a deluxe king with a fantastic view on the skyline and the river. The bed was very comfortable. We loved the mini-bar selection and its adequate prices. I loved the lobby, as it really was an oasis of peace in a busy city. They serve free cookies, fruit and wine, which is a very nice touch. The location is probably the best thing, as you are in Soho, but in a quieter area, but nevertheless close to all the action. There are a couple of places to have brunch very close. It's a pity it wasn't summer, because their rooftop pool looked very inviting! Can't wait to go back.

My husband and I travel quite a bit, specially to NYC. We like to stay at boutique hotels, and usually like to try a new one when we go to the same city more than once. This will not be the case with the James in NYC. We visit NYC at least every couple of months, and out of all of the hotels we've stayed at the James offers the best service, quality and value combo! The place is very hip, cool decor throughout and a happening beautiful rooftop bar (with amazing cocktails!!). The rooms are a good size, modern yet cozy, great bed and comfy pillows (very important) impeccably clean and full of free goodies (sweet treats, wifi, wine, water... what more could you want?!) The staff is super friendly.. none of this "too cool for you" NY attitude that some of the other "hip" places have. From the doorman to the driver, the waitress and the bar tender to the bus boy!! I have never seen so many nice New Yorkers in one place!! (lol -no offense, I am a former New Yorker). David Burke's kitchen was great, the service was spectacular and the food was delicious!! It was overall a great experience. We will definitely find our way back to the James!

This was our second stay at the James NYC (I have previously stayed at their Chicago hotel) and it was as welcoming and comfortable as I remember.The rooms are so comfortable in every sense - size, linen, bathroom etc. We were in a King Guestroom on the 11th floor. The room was immaculately cleaned every morning and turned down every evening. The cleaning staff do a great job.I must say the free wifi is great, it is a service that ALL hotels should offer for free but for some reason do not. We were welcomed with a box of macaroons which was sweet and yummy chocolates were left with every turn down.There is no attitude that comes with this stylish hotel which is one of the main reasons why we returned. They seem to have the combination right.Please do not change James Hotel. Stay grounded, stylish and cool in every way.

My wife and I stayed during Christmas week. The rooms are stellar, the employees are very helpful and friendly, the views fo downtown NYC are unparalleled. I have heard of free coffee, but I have NEVER heard of FREE wine in the afternoon in a hotel lobby! The rooftop deck and bar are very hip and the views again, are breathtaking.
user_name:
Paul O
Denver, Colorado, United States

review_body: We prefer boutique hotels and love trying the new offerings in NYC. This vibe is more friendly than others catering to wanabe beautiful people. Nice touches: free wifi, coffee & danish in the morning, wine & cheese at dusk, and fresh cookies in the evenings. The alarm has a docking station for cell phones, comfy bed and captivating city views from our king corner room. The bed doesn't reach the headboard so the soft down pillows seep down in the crevice - a bolster would fix that. The engineer couldn't fix the bathroom floor heater, which would have been welcome as the room seems to lack its own heat source. Love the rain shower (unless you want to keep your hair dry...where are the shower caps?!) and the "green" containers for shampoo and conditioner. No wasteful bottles. Art displays throughout the floors were well chosen and add to the unique decor. Nearby shops can fill just about any fantasy you seek and beat same old same old on 5th Ave. Our lunch at David Burke's restaurant located on the lower level was excellent - comfort food expertly crafted with whimsy. The bar scene is lively and noise carries so if you are the sensitive sort, ask for a quiet room but even so, with all the glass and 2nd floor plus rooftop action, not sure if this is realistic in nice weather. PS. Why didn't the interior designer install drapes that could be controlled with a remote?

My husband and I chose the James Hotel for an anniversary getaway in NYC. We had previously stayed at the James in Chicago and thought it was great. It was a perfect stay. The hotel is very chic, filled with interesting art. The staff was incredibly friendly, especially Amy, the adorable desk attendant. When they heard it was our anniversary, they upgraded us to a higher floor with a beautiful sunny view all the way to the Hudson River. The room was cozy and very modern and high tech. Extremely clean as well. Brunch in the attached David Burke restaurant was delicious. I would definitely come back.
I have stayed there several times over the last year and continue to be amazed at the people, quality and feeling of this hotel.
user_name:
Ken M
Fair Haven, New Jersey

review_body: This was my first time to stay in Lower Manhattan and we loved it. This is a very hip hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. It is in a great part of town and away from all the hustle and bustle. Great shopping and restaurants in the area that are easy to walk to and the hotel is very accessible to the subway--so museums, Time Square, and Central Park are an easy train ride. The breakfast room service and food was fantastic--a definite must to enjoy the views of Lower Manhattan from the comfort of your room. We stayed in a corner King Suite--it was so nice to have lots of windows in the room to enjoy skyline views. The beds are very comfortable and they have various choices of pillows!!! One of our favorite things was the heated floor in the bathroom and the huge rainshower--we definitely felt spoiled. The rooms are very clean with great amenities and you will love the chocolates they put in your room for 'turn down' service. This was a great find and you will not be disappointed.

Loved The James Hotel! The concierge was fabulous and the vibe was young, cool and ultra hip. Superb suggestions on places to go, things to see and directions on how to get there. Great decor in the lobby, bars and rooms. The Jimmy (upstairs bar) was great and the rooftop pool while small had plenty of room. Definitely a 'pretty people' place. LOVED the decor of the room and the lobby. The bathroom was gorgeous with glass walls that had automated curtains to allow privacy (or not). Soaps and toiletries were great quality - I ordered some online after I got home. The uniforms were sassy and fun and *so* Soho! New Macs in the lobby allowed for browsing or checking in for flights. Room service was delightful (and available late night) from David Burke's kitchen-and, not a truffle fry was left behind. The Treehouse was packed at night and looked like 'the' place to hang out. Not to be left out - super comfy bed - I even called to find out if they had a brand mattress like some places do that could be purchased. Location was phenom! An easy walk to Cipriani's for bellinis, Balthazar for delightful brunch and a perfect home base for Soho shopping. I think I'll try the one in Chicago after such a pleasant experience in Soho!

I have to give credit to the James. Compared to other 'hip' hotels in New York the service really is first class. The staff were always friendly and helpful, with none of the too-cool-for-school nonchalance you can get in some other places. The rooms were comfortable, stylish and well kept. The basics were all taken care of (like wifi, because as far as I am concerned, when you pay USD 350+ a night for a hotel, you should never have to pay for it..!) and the extras like bedtime cookies and a computer area where you can print out documents for free really make you feel like the management care about your stay. When my fiancee left his iPod touch in the room, the hotel posted it back to Switzerland to us with no fuss at all. All in all impressive attention to their guests.

a rare combination of chic, simplicity and comfort. A high end boutique hotel that feels warm, homey and charges extremely reasonable. The rooms are typical in size but very smart in design and fun to stay in. The staff is very professional yet personal and friendly. In a great SoHo location, on a train station - a perfect location.

We stayed here for three nights last week. We usually stay at Union Square W Hotel in New York but decided to try something new this time. We were not disappointed. This hotel is great and is not pretentious. Great location in SoHo and within walking distance of stores, restaurants, etc. There's also a subway station about a block away. The staff is friendly, professional, and attentive but not overbearing. The cleaning few even left us a thank you note for the tip we had left for them one morning! The rooms are great, very comfortable, very quiet, and with amazing views of the city (we had a corner room). We also had drinks at Jimmy's one night - the bar is great and has wonderful views of the entire city. The free wine and cheese in the afternoons and the free wi-fi throughout the hotel are nice touches. We loved this hotel and and it has become our favorite new place to stay in New York!

The James New York is a great place to stay. Stayed here for 4 nights. It is located in the heart of SoHo and all the shopping. It is literally a block from the Holland Tunnel so if you are travelling - take the Holland and you'll end up seeing The James as soon as you emerge from the tunnel. My experience with The James was memorable. Upon arrival, there was no parking of course, so the guys let me park my car in the limited valet spot for some time until I checked-in and got comfortable. They were very informative telling me about all the amenities that are included with the hotel, places to see and even where to find parking. Besides being my own personal tour guide (even though I was raised in NY), they had something that I've never experienced before. Complimentary food events daily. In the morning from 7AM-11AM, they had free coffee and pastries (which are the best I've tasted). Then later in the afternoon, they offer snacks like fruits. And at night, they offer gourmet chocolate chip cookies (which were also amazing) made by their on-site restaurant called David Burke's Kitchen. The sky lobby is very cool and gives off a lounge feeling for people to in the hotel to mingle. The staff was very friendly and informative. The rooms are VERY small, but that is expected of a New York hotel, but believe me the detail that went into the rooms is phenomenal. The bathroom is crazy and the automatic rolling curtain for the bathroom is the coolest feature I've ever seen. Also, like any high class hotel, they did offer a Lexus RX Hybrid car which I utilized (first-come first take basis).So those were the pros. The reason I gave this hotel a "Very Good" rating was because it wasn't perfect. First, there are only 2 true elevators. The glass elevator when you enter the hotel (ground level) only goes up to the sky lobby (which is where you check-in). Then in order to go up to your room you have to take the elevators in the sky lobby to the rooms. The room elevators are accessible from the ground level but you have to walk up some steps and go down the hall to get to them (inconvenient if you have heavy bags or are checking out and have to change elevators in order to bring them down - of course they do offer help in bringing up and down your luggage). Second, the elevators are really slow. At one point I waited 4-5 minutes for the elevators to come. Because there are only 2 elevators, and the hotel was basically sold out, it took forever for elevators to come.Third, the vent in my room was very loud when I turned on the A/C or Heat. I don't know if it was just my room, 706, or if it's like that everwhere. So this only applies to room 706. Fourth, and this was most likely one of those once in a blue moon situation, their service request response was very slow. I requested a fork during my last day of stay and no one came. After 20 minutes, I went downstairs to the sky lobby and asked again. After I went to my room, about 5 minutes later, I got my fork. Then 5 minutes after that, I got another fork. So the intiial request and second request basically came back to back.Fifth, the pillows were not comfortable. The long pillows were too long and too soft to be used. The sleeping pillows were again too soft. I am used to TempurPedic pillows so I again may be baised but the pillows were too soft. I basically felt that I was putting my head on the mattress. I do think they need to get the type of pillows that Marriott uses which are much more comfortable.Overall, the hotel was amazing and I had a great stay. If I come back to NY, I would definitely stay here again.

I was flying in on a Redeye from LA with my two older kids and I decided that staying in the city was a good idea before we went to visit friends for Xmas. We arrived and they quickly checked us in and took our bags up to our blacked out room so we could immediately get some sleep. When we woke up several hours later we didn't want to leave the room and hung out for most of the day because it was so comfortable. It has the greatest shopping SOHO location and it's a lot nicer than the Soho Grand. They also have a nice perk which is the use of a car service. We zipped around the city and took a trip to Brooklyn using the car service. It made our day so easy. Also, the doormen wear beautiful coats.

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in December. We had a king room which was very comfortable. The hotel is within walking distance to all the shopping and restaurants in SOHO. We had breakfast one morning in the hotel restaurant and although a little pricy it was well worth it. The staff were friendly and mostly helpful. The gym in the hotel was nice and more than i expected for a boutique hotel. It looks like there were lots of great outdoor spaces to lounge if the weather is nice. I would certainly stay here again. The price was great , the rooms were clean and comfortable and quiet. It is a great boutique hotel.

My Fiance' and I checked in over the holidays over 2 different stays (we checked out to spend xmas eve with friends in NJ). This hotel is beyond great. I travel a great deal for business and am a loyal SPG customer and typically stay at W hotels. From the moment we entered this beautiful property, we were treated with kindness and respect from the door/bell staff, through check-in, and even the bar staff at Jimmy. We typically do not book hotels we have not had a direct recommendation for or have not stayed in before but decided to take a chance on this property. We are certainly glad we did. This is by far our new favorite hotel in NYC. The art on the walls is quite beautiful, the rooms are well appointed. The rooms are small, as are most in NYC, but The James makes great use of the space and rain shower is amazing. Stay at this hotel soon!! We cannot wait to come back!!

I make it a habit to stay in various boutique properties when I visit New York and the moment I stepped into the James Soho, I knew that I had found a very special place. The front desk experience defined what hospitality should be with an impeccably warm welcome at my arrival, ready to assist in any capacity needed. After learning that I had been "double upgraded" (and not even at my request which was a wonderful surprise) I was invited to share in complimentary wine in the lobby (James Club), an contemporary urban collection of beautiful artful decor that is comfortable and chicEntering my spacious room, I found the view unparalleled as they gave me a corner unit where the vistas of New York from all angles could be seen. The decor of the room was warm, well appointed with most every detail thought of including the temperature controlled bathroom floor, a motorized shade providing the option of privacy or not fronting the glass window partition that divides the bath from the room and the bed very comfortable.With the superb location, the attentive staff, the wonderfully appointed room with great amenities, this will be the place I will return to again and again.

My husband and I stayed at The James last week and had a wonderful stay. This hotel has somehow managed to perfect the combination of chic and luxurious combined with a warm and welcoming vibe. The staff is friendly, efficient and each staff member went out of their way to ensure that our stay was fantastic. We had a corner room on the eleventh floor which was stylish and spacious and provided an incredible view of the city. The hotel with its trendy décor boosts many features including complimentary wine and cheese served throughout the day, The Jimmy (a trendy rooftop bar), the David Burke Kitchen and a gym for the exercise enthusiasts. However what truly impressed us was the friendly, efficient and competent staff, all of whom went out of their way to ensure that our stay exceeded all of our expectations. This hotel is really something special and we will definitely be back.

The James is very 'on trend' but manages to keep things friendly as well. Everything about my stay went smoothly, staff were helpful and the room was just right for relaxing after a long flight. (Well, after I'd found the switch to work the blind that covered up the totally glass bathroom which would have exposed the room and its occupants to the whole of lower Manhattan!)The David Burke restaurant is great - fun atmosphere and excellent food. The only disappointment was that the rooftop bar was closed for a private function. Other small touches really make you feel a proper guest - free wi-fi throughout the hotel and complimentary wine and cheese in the evening, served in the hotel lobby. And a special mention to the team of doormen who sprinted, carrying my bags, at impressive speed to get me a taxi when I left.

Best hotel staff I've ever encountered - super helpful and personable! Love the rooms - even have space to do my kickboxing exercises! - and the bathrooms are the best I've found in Manhattan. Location is awesome and car service during business hours is super helpful! Rooftop bar is great for celeb-spotting, and room service is excellent! You really can't go wrong with The James!

My wife and I stayed here while we where in NYC to get married and find an appartment (we are moving there from EU in jan.)The staff was the best, so friendly and nice. I have stayed with 3 different top hotels during the last year in NYC, and the staff here is so much more friendly then any other I have meet in NYC. There was a real "anything is possible" respons to any request. They even let us shoot pictures at the roof top bar for weeding photo.We had a corner studio, which had a great view and was very nicely decorated. I would recommed this to all people below 40 who are looking for a top hotel. Not sure it would be right for my parents, but younger or single, then no one beats this.

The rooms are absolutely gorgeous and the location could not be better. Everything about the place is luxurious. But the best thing of all was the service - from making our reservations through checking out, the staff was impeccably professional and helpful, not to mention extremely warm and friendly. I would absolutely come back to the James for business or pleasure!

Beautiful room, very clean, complimentary snacks, wines and cheese at lobby, less than a minute walk from Canal subway station with perfect link to center and very close to Holland tunnel for those traveling to and from Newark airport.

Great staff, friendly helpful, couln't do enough for us. The accommodations were unbelievable, we had a suite with corner windows that gave us spectacular views of the city. We had dinner at David Burke Kitchen and that was also fabtastic with excellent service. I would reccomend this as one of the best places to stay when vuisting the city. You deserve to treat yourself to something really special.
user_location: Little Falls, New Jersey, United States
user_name:
dmg489
Little Falls, New Jersey, United States

review_body: Great, friendly and extremely helpful staff. Spacious and stylish rooms with all amenities possible. Trendy rooftop bar as well as a great restaurant (David Burke's) Loved the "real" 24 hour stay unlike most other hotels that won't let you check in until 4 and push you out at 11am. Tranquil, wonderful ambiance made the experience so relaxing. Highly recommend staying there.

The staff are very friendly and helpful! Love their hip uniforms. The rooms and housekeeping is amazing. The rooftop lounge has amazing views. 1st time in Soho. One of the best hotels I've stayed at! Young, hip and very chic! Would come back and definitely recommend!

First off, this place is swank, and it is fairly modern. Don't be fooled by the name, to most something like "The James" sounds like an old grand hotel. This is pretty much the opposite. It is a modernist boutique hotel, but quite posh and comfortable. Rooms are decent size for NYC, but small by other standards. Bathrooms are all glass and are visible from the main room, so be aware of that. Beds are very comfortable with nice linens. Complimentary pastries, coffee, wine and cheese are available at different times of the day. You will pay for all of this though. The hotel is quite expensive, but I've stayed in far worse for far more in NYC.

We stayed for 8 nights over thanksgiving for our first visit to NYC after being recommended SOHO by some fellow Aussies! This hotel is fabulous! From the arrival and the great sky elevator to the included pastries/coffee in the Morning and wine and cheese in the evening! An the wifi! My only criticism would be the wifi occasionally blocks at night due to too many people using it-presumably due to those in the awesome rooftop bar JIMMY. You get what you pay for at the James-it is worth every cent!

The staff at every level was accommodating, from the doorman to the manager! Chris, Claudia, Christina and Michael to name a few. They are so attentive that within a day we were on name basis! We had two rooms for 3 nights on the 14th floor with amazing views! We traveled with 2 teens and an 11 uear old. The neighborhood is teeming with restaurants and shops. The subway is close by and taxis are easy! The rooms are compact and no problemFor us. It is a new and clean place to stay with trendy style and comfy beds!

After a horror trip from London and an awful night at The Standard, The James was a wonderful relief. We had stayed at The James in Chicago years ago, and were very happy there. But The James NYC was even better. A beautiful low-key environment with staff that could not have been more helpful (without being intrusive). Our room had everything we needed for a relaxing stay, plus great views. Can't recommend the hotel highly enough. And what a location! Perfect for anyone holidaying in the city.

i went to the city with a friend to visit my niece and this was the second time i had stayed at the james. to make a really long story short - love the hotel, love the rooms, but especially love their customer service. i checked out on sunday - checked luggage w front desk to do some shopping. since its an amazing location, we walked to starbucks and we are standing in line. i happen to look at my hands and notice my rings are missing. i literally stopped breathing, i thought i was going to pass out - one of the rings happened to be my moms who has been gone - needless to say, its priceless. i called the hotel thinking 1. room has been cleaned and rings are gone and 2. what are the chances i will really get them back. i spoke to a great woman ( i wish i got her name, maybe it was michelle ) and i told her my situation, she called me back in 5 minutes and told me she had my rings and would put them in the safe in the managers office. i was in complete shock - the story could have been way worse. i will only stay there when i go to nyc. there is not one negative i could say about the hotel - and i am so picky. its the best and i love it there - highly recommend it. seriously, im such a stickler on service and this is hands down the best on customer service.

Just stayed at The James. The staff were always very helpful and the rooms were fantastic. We has a corner suite with amazing views. Go as high as possible. The location was excellent with great bars & shops all within a short walk. Jimmys bar was cool with views of the ESB, we had a special view of a firework display over New Jersey . It is not cheap but if you can afford to stay do it. Free wine in the evening in reception and we had la lovely filling breakfast included. If you get the chance go to Lucky Strike just down the road on Grand Street and get on the guest list for Jimmys. Started saving to go again. Love it. Pack your walking shoes.

The James Hotel is one wonderful surprise after another. Behind its unassuming facade is a hotel dedicated to art and the edge of its SoHo neighborhood. During my all too brief stay at the hotel, I was met with the friendliest and helpful staff, who were willing to go above and beyond to help with anything that I needed. It was also apparent that the hotel takes pride in delivering a consistent experience that is based in art, from the decor of the lobby and hallways to the overall details in the structure the hotel and furniture in the rooms.If you are looking for a unique New York experience, do yourself a favor and stay at The James.

We booked the James as a base for our Wedding and how pleased we are. The hotel is fantastic. Great location, fabulous rooms and staff that are so warm, friendly and full of enthusiasm that I never want to stay anywhere else in New York.The location right in the heart of trendy lower east side is fantastic for bars, restaurants and shopping, it's close to a metro to get you further up or down town too - but why leave when the achingly trendy lower east side has everything you need.We stayed in the king studio high up with great views. The room compared to others in NY is well thought out and offers the hints of modernity with iPhone docking stations and environmentally friendly toiletries.Every morning you can grab free coffee and pastry to go and every evening you can hang out and drink the free wine and cheese while you plan your night.The David Burke Kitchen is a great restaurant - whether for room service or eating in and Jimmy's the roof top bar with pool has the most spectacular roof top views. Our Wedding Pictures are sensational!But the biggests pull of the hotel is the staff without a doubt. They treated us like royalty, upgrading us and bringing us chocolate and champagne on our wedding day. When I couldn't find a florist for my bouquet they stepped in to help. It was my partners birthday while we were away and they even decorated the room on my request. And my personal favourite after a day of organising weddings and feeling exhausted they even ordered us chinese takeout so we could have a quiet movie night in. They really show what great service is.Loved every minute of it and was extremely sad to leave, especially the big comfy bed!

As soon as I arrived at the beautiful James Hotel, I got stuck in the glass elevator that you have to ride to get to the lobby on the second floor. The engineers were able to get me out within 20 minutes, but as a result of my experience, the front desk manager upgraded my room to a suite. I think it could have been the most beautifully appointed room I've ever stayed in -- in New York City or anywhere. I enjoyed everything from the spacious bedroom and lounge, to the 180 degree view of Soho and TriBeCa from my room, to the heated bathroom floors. My friends and I enjoyed the trendy rooftop pool on Saturday afternoon, which was quite crowded and seem to be occupied by New Yorkers just somehow being able to use the pool vs. hotel guests. I would love to stay here again and highly recommend it to others.

We loved the location of The James. It sits right on the edge of SOHO and Tribeca. Great shopping, restaurants, coffee shops, services all around. Not the craziness of Times Square and Mid-town. We walked almost everywhere. The James has real potential. It's cozy and personable. The rooms have delicious glass walls of windows. Our room was small, but that's standard for NYC. Making it feel not-so-small was a very cool glass wall between the bathroom and bedroom. High ceilings help too. Bed was comfie. But what other reviewers describe with the HVAC system is true - or else they have a serious poltergeist issue! It sounded like someone was dragging steel cabinets across the floor for two minutes at a time every 10 minutes or so. All night. We're good sleepers, so it didn't really impact us too severely, but it gives the place a weird vibe. I'm assuming the issue was the HVAC...

The hotel is really nice as regards facilities. Rooms are very well appointed, the small pool on the top floor is a plus, the bikes available for clients very cool and the restaurants of a good quality; too bad the service verges more on the carless kind of attitude.

We go to NYC at least once a year in the fall and each time we try a new hotel. This time I have to say was one of the worst hotels. It took us over 20 minutes to check in and then when we checked in the rooms were not available. The rooms are very small but to their credit at least the bathrooms are big. However, our sink was clogged and did not drain. the have a very cool rooftop bar, but being a hotel guest does not give you any privilege to the rooftop bar. You would think for what you pay, you would have some preference. Other hotels in NYC where we have stayed - The Empire, Soho Grand Hotel etc, give preference to their guest. The location is great, but I would not stay here again - there are too many other options.

Maybe it was the rain and gloomy sky, maybe it's my increasingly grey hair, but I found my first experience with the James to be a bit too tragically hip...I was looking for someplace close to downtown for morning meetings, but not in the deserted canyon that area becomes at night. SoHo/Tribeca seemed a good choice. The James in Chicago has a great reputation, so I figured the sister hotel would fit right in. The architecture of the building is new and industrially not welcoming. Orientation is definitely vertical, reinforced by having to take an open view elevator from the dismal street entrance up several stories to the lobby, sandwiched into an elongated rectangular footprint which is constricted by the main elevator shafts. My room space was also squeezed into a tiny space with high ceilings and full windows; unfortunately, they looked out, over some horrific open urban concrete plazas, upon the cars exiting and entering the Holland Tunnel entrance, with their associated honking and commotion. Good thing I was high up or the noise might have been an issue. I'm not sure I would rave about the neighborhood setting, but it made down or uptown walkable.I also experienced some of the bipolar service issues described in prior reviews. Everyone in the house is immensely friendly and cheerful. I did, however, run into several instances when a poor staff member was overwhelmed by the multi-tasking being demanded of him/her. Being asked simultaneously to retrieve stored bags for two guests, park a car outside the door, arrange for the courtesy car to drop another off, give directions to an entourage of filmmakers rolling tons of equipment across the floor (creating even less open space), and print duplicate room bills is a bit more than should be expected. Frantically requesting assistance from the ether through a bluetooth microphone emphasized the absurdity of that tough situation.Hopefully all will work itself out from the human element as the hotel enters its second year of operation. It will have to create a constant welcoming service presence to overcome a very cold building skeleton.

I wasn't going to write a review because I wasn't sure what I could add to those who had written before. Maybe the fact that my experience was quite similar to others might help someone make a choice. I agree that this hotel is in a fabulous location. We loved the neighborhood and all the great food and shopping you can easily access by foot. The lobby is very hip and lovely, the staff were all very friendly, the room was small, modern and quite nice. There were some interesting NYC books to read in the bed side table and I appreciated the fresh water set out every day. We did receive our turn down service all 3 nights with little chocolates The bathroom is roomy but doesn't really have a lot of place to put your "stuff" (and I know a lot of women have more stuff that I do!). The view of the Hudson was lovely, we loved it in all different kids of light. The bar was awersome at night and we had a great lunch at the restaurant.So, it sounds great and it was, but I stil have some small hesitiation about going back. Our room was an hour late past check in being ready, I can accept this, I guess but so many places seem to be able to get you in early that it was a big of a pain. The staff was very helpful storing luggage etc... so that it minimized the inconvenience. The bathroom could have been a little cleaner, there was clearly a couple of hair pins on the floor in the corner, that kind of bothered me, although it seemed quite clean in a general way.If I could get a good rate, I think I would give them another try because there are so many positives. They do charge high end rates though, and I think I would expect a little bit more next time to make me keep coming back.
Modern hotel, professional staff make for a great stay

The James is a spectacular place to stay. The staff is beyond helpful and will become your friends immediately. They always check on your well-being and are never bothered by any request you may have. The rooms are contemporary and comfortable with all the amenities including the most important thing. Bed and Pillows. You will sleep like a baby. Pastries await you in the morning and cookies at night. Take what you want. Food is terrific and they even supply bicycles for a nice ride around Soho and Tribeca. Subway is just steps away and a taxi is always waiting. What else do you need. This is my home away from home. Thank you James and staff.

Stayed here twice in April (not long after they opnened) as part of a nine night US trip (3 nights James NY / 3 nights Sarasota / 3 nights James NY). Arrived on the first evening at 21:30 after JFK traffic delays. Greeted at reception with 'would you like the good new or the bad news'. Went for bad news which resulted in 'oh, no-one asks for the bad news first' - you can imagine this game now becoming quire irritiating. So the bad news was 'we don't have a room for you but we have found you one at the Mondrian' (see separate review). Am less than impressed that having arrived, had all my luggage hauled to reception and tipped the dorrman, I am promptly being asked to leave. Ask to see the hotel manager and a chap arrives. His way of dealing with this is to say that this type of thing happens all the time and we are actually very lucky because they have bothered to find us a room elsewhere (which apparently is above and beyond normal practice and they didn't need to do so even though we had a confirmed and fully paid reservation). His manner was arrogant, unhelpful and simply rude. Funnily enough we didn't feel like being very grateful and as it was by now 22:15 we gave up and went to the Mondrian. Back the next day to drop off our luggage and were promised a room would be ready by our return at 17:00. It was and they had given us a corner room (upgrade) which was very nice (not huge but spacious enough). Didn't have a view of the Hudson though,which when we booked the website, it stated all rooms had views of the river (more of that later). The rooms are fine although the bathrooms (being all brown tiles) can be rather dark but full size bottles of toiletries great. Never quite sure that the room was throughly cleaned each day because there were oftens 'bits' on the floor - suspect the dark wood flooring shows up everything. Jimmys Bar is great for views but my Bloody Mary was the worst I have ever had. Hotel is in great SoHo location and after our 3 days we checked out. Naturally with what happended when we arrived, we spoke to reception who assured us they were very sorry for our inconvenience and when we returned again they would have a great room for us. Three nights later back we came (this time we arrived at about 20:30) and were given the key. Off we went and guess what the room was right opposite the lifts, not only that but on the bed was the outline of a person. Suspect that someone had been shown the room lay on the bed and then realised that you could hear the lifts and the noise of people standing chatting whilst they were waiting. We got on the phone and reception insisted there was nowhere to move us to. My husband went down and insisted he speak to someone else and eventually a nice chap came and 'miraculously' found us a room further down the corridor away from the lift. What is really annoying is when you book, you are asked to specify all sorts of requirements e.g. 'do you want to be away from the lift' and when you arrive (especially if you get there late) you just get given any old room. Next day we opended the curtains and had a view of a tower block - no Hudson. Having by now had our fill we asked again to speak to the hotel manager. This time we saw a very nice woman who actually was the manager (title was hotel director but basically she is in charge). She was great and apologised for all our issues and the staff (even for the guy who on our first night had incorrectly claimed to be the manager). She was also going to get the website updated to remove the incorrect messages about the views (they have now done so but it has taken some months). So we loved the location but found the staff (in most cases) to be inept, sometimes even rude and more interested in prancing about in their designer uniforms chatting to each other than looking after guests. I still can't decide if I would return - I only hope they have improved their customer service.

AS with Londoner016, I feel that The James needs to improve quickly in order to even stay in business. Yes, the bar has a great view. And yes, the location is excellent. But the staff is most unprofessional ( Save Michael who is a real gem ) and our room not only leaked during a rain storm, but seemed never quite clean. It was also SO noisy that we moved once ( the first day) to what they said was a quieter room, but it was very loud with noise from other rooms/door slamming, etc. Also, there was such a lack of attention to detail - only turn-down service one night of our 5 night stay, and no real knowledge from the concierge staff about the cool new restaurants in town. They pride themselves as being a luxury hotel, with luxury prices to boot, but don't follow through.
I like the style of these hotels...good value for a N.Y. hotel. Have stayed at Chicago one too. Similar.

I wasn't going to write a review as I was upset with the hotel because of some staff miscommunications and service issues. But to be fair to the hotel, it did seek to rectify my grievance - which is a good sign and I thought I would share my thoughts. The James has some excellent plus points - the rooftop bar is stunning (and I have stayed at Mandarin Oriental which also has a spectacular bar and Library Hotel). What is cool about it is that you see Soho in all its glory - at night, the view is electric. I checked out quite a few roof top bars in NYC and the view from Jimmy's exceeds them all. What needs addressing is the synergy between the rooftop and the other aspects of the hotel, updating customers when appropriate and providing a consistent level of service. It is also a very small space which can get crowded.The location of the hotel is excellent. After considering Crosby Street and Trump Soho in quite a lot of detail, I was glad with my choice. While I am sure Crosby and Trump have far superior and more polished service, I liked that the James was halfway between Soho and the very cool area of Tribeca. The James has some really excellent staff members on reception and especially on the door - these guys are excellent and deserve credit. Unfortunately, staff communication needs to be improved and also informing guests properly, rather than just emailing them and expecting them to understand. Jimmy's also contains some surprisingly unfriendly staff that do the rest of the hotel an injustice. One of the bar men is a bit too cool for his own good and could do with coming down a peg or two (you are not a barman at the Top of the Standard, mate).The lobby area is a nice area for guests to hang out in - free coffee, tea and wine is served there. Some cool artworks are arranged throughout the hotel, from established and up and coming artists. I wish the service was a bit more even and polished, then as I say this would be one of the best hotels in New York. Although it is on the Conde Nast Gold List 2011, I believe it is resting on its laurels and needs to improve - fast.

This is one of the top times of my life when I feel so disgusted and violated. I came her for my fortieth birthday, after a grueling, horrible flight where they lost my luggage.My boyfriend reimburses me money for my flight, expenses, taxi, etc. and we put it in the safe. We were laughing and got distracted and forgot to lock it. We went down to the hotel's restaurant for lunch and when I got back, the maid had made the bed, tidied up etc., the closet door where the safe was was closed (and we had left it open upon leaving). I remembered I hadn't locked it and ran to the safe. The envelope was gone.We are positive we put it in there and did our due diligence to verify this. This is the most horrible feeling you can have while traveling. I was then detained in the room waiting for the evidence collector and spending one precious vacation day miserable, violated. I had to stay and talk to the police, wait for the sergeant to dust off the safe and basically be treated like a prisoner after been burglarized by one of the staff.What a nightmare. How ironic is this that I'm the victim but I'm treated like a criminal.My time is precious. I'm a designer and I bill hundreds of dollars and hour. I was to go out and research for my client. So I'm lost those hours too not to mention the extreme duress.
